title: Adam Collis
text: Adam Collis is an American filmmaker and actor.

title: Adam Collis
text: He attended the Duke University from 1986 to 1990 and the University of California, Los Angeles from 2007 to 2010.

title: Adam Collis
text: He also studied cinema at the University of Southern California from 1991 to 1997.

title: Adam Collis
text: Collis first work was the assistant director for the Scott Derrickson's short "Love in the Ruins" (1995).

title: Adam Collis
text: In 1998, he played "Crankshaft" in Eric Koyanagi's "Hundred Percent".

title: Ed Wood (film)
text: Ed Wood is a 1994 American biographical period comedy-drama film directed and produced by Tim Burton, and starring Johnny Depp as cult filmmaker Ed Wood.

title: Ed Wood (film)
text: The film concerns the period in Wood's life when he made his best-known films as well as his relationship with actor Bela Lugosi, played by Martin Landau.

title: Ed Wood (film)
text: Sarah Jessica Parker, Patricia Arquette, Jeffrey Jones, Lisa Marie, and Bill Murray are among the supporting cast.

title: Tyler Bates
text: Tyler Bates (born June 5, 1965) is an American musician, music producer, and composer for films, television, and video games.

title: Tyler Bates
text: Much of his work is in the action and horror film genres, with films like "Dawn of the Dead, 300, Sucker Punch," and "John Wick."

title: Tyler Bates
text: He has collaborated with directors like Zack Snyder, Rob Zombie, Neil Marshall, William Friedkin, Scott Derrickson, and James Gunn.

title: Tyler Bates
text: With Gunn, he has scored every one of the director's films; including "Guardians of the Galaxy", which became one of the highest grossing domestic movies of 2014, and its 2017 sequel.

title: Tyler Bates
text: In addition, he is also the lead guitarist of the American rock band Marilyn Manson, and produced its albums "The Pale Emperor" and "Heaven Upside Down".

title: Doctor Strange (2016 film)
text: Doctor Strange is a 2016 American superhero film based on the Marvel Comics character of the same name, produced by Marvel Studios and distributed by Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures.

title: Doctor Strange (2016 film)
text: It is the fourteenth film of the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU).

title: Doctor Strange (2016 film)
text: The film was directed by Scott Derrickson, who wrote it with Jon Spaihts and C. Robert Cargill, and stars Benedict Cumberbatch as Stephen Strange, along with Chiwetel Ejiofor, Rachel McAdams, Benedict Wong, Michael Stuhlbarg, Benjamin Bratt, Scott Adkins, Mads Mikkelsen, and Tilda Swinton.

title: Doctor Strange (2016 film)
text: In "Doctor Strange", surgeon Strange learns the mystic arts after a career-ending car accident.

title: Hellraiser: Inferno
text: Hellraiser: Inferno (also known as Hellraiser V: Inferno) is a 2000 American horror film.

title: Hellraiser: Inferno
text: It is the fifth installment in the "Hellraiser" series and the first "Hellraiser" film to go straight-to-DVD.

title: Hellraiser: Inferno
text: It was directed by Scott Derrickson and released on October 3, 2000.

title: Hellraiser: Inferno
text: The film concerns a corrupt detective who discovers Lemarchand's box at a crime scene.

title: Hellraiser: Inferno
text: The film's reviews were mixed.

title: Sinister (film)
text: Sinister is a 2012 supernatural horror film directed by Scott Derrickson and written by Derrickson and C. Robert Cargill.

title: Sinister (film)
text: It stars Ethan Hawke as fictional true-crime writer Ellison Oswalt who discovers a box of home movies in his attic that puts his family in danger.

title: Deliver Us from Evil (2014 film)
text: Deliver Us from Evil is a 2014 American supernatural horror film directed by Scott Derrickson and produced by Jerry Bruckheimer.

title: Deliver Us from Evil (2014 film)
text: The film is officially based on a 2001 non-fiction book entitled "Beware the Night" by Ralph Sarchie and Lisa Collier Cool, and its marketing campaign highlighted that it was "inspired by actual accounts".

title: Deliver Us from Evil (2014 film)
text: The film stars Eric Bana, Édgar Ramírez, Sean Harris, Olivia Munn, and Joel McHale in the main roles and was released on July 2, 2014.

title: Woodson, Arkansas
text: Woodson is a census-designated place (CDP) in Pulaski County, Arkansas, in the United States.

title: Woodson, Arkansas
text: Its population was 403 at the 2010 census.

title: Woodson, Arkansas
text: It is part of the Little Rock–North Little Rock–Conway Metropolitan Statistical Area.

title: Woodson, Arkansas
text: Woodson and its accompanying Woodson Lake and Wood Hollow are the namesake for Ed Wood Sr., a prominent plantation owner, trader, and businessman at the turn of the 20th century.

title: Woodson, Arkansas
text: Woodson is adjacent to the Wood Plantation, the largest of the plantations own by Ed Wood Sr.

title: Conrad Brooks
text: Conrad Brooks (born Conrad Biedrzycki on January 3, 1931 in Baltimore, Maryland) is an American actor.

title: Conrad Brooks
text: He moved to Hollywood, California in 1948 to pursue a career in acting.

title: Conrad Brooks
text: He got his start in movies appearing in Ed Wood films such as "Plan 9 from Outer Space", "Glen or Glenda", and "Jail Bait."

title: Conrad Brooks
text: He took a break from acting during the 1960s and 1970s but due to the ongoing interest in the films of Ed Wood, he reemerged in the 1980s and has become a prolific actor.

title: Conrad Brooks
text: He also has since gone on to write, produce and direct several films.

title: The Exorcism of Emily Rose
text: The Exorcism of Emily Rose is a 2005 American legal drama horror film directed by Scott Derrickson and starring Laura Linney and Tom Wilkinson.

title: The Exorcism of Emily Rose
text: The film is loosely based on the story of Anneliese Michel and follows a self-proclaimed agnostic who acts as defense counsel (Linney) representing a parish priest (Wilkinson), accused by the state of negligent homicide after he performed an exorcism.

title: A Kiss for Corliss
text: A Kiss for Corliss is a 1949 American comedy film directed by Richard Wallace and written by Howard Dimsdale.

title: A Kiss for Corliss
text: It stars Shirley Temple in her final starring role as well as her final film appearance.

title: A Kiss for Corliss
text: It is a sequel to the 1945 film "Kiss and Tell".

title: A Kiss for Corliss
text: "A Kiss for Corliss" was retitled "Almost a Bride" before release and this title appears in the title sequence.

title: A Kiss for Corliss
text: The film was released on November 25, 1949, by United Artists.

title: Lord High Treasurer
text: The post of Lord High Treasurer or Lord Treasurer was an English government position and has been a British government position since the Acts of Union of 1707.

title: Lord High Treasurer
text: A holder of the post would be the third-highest-ranked Great Officer of State, below the Lord High Steward and the Lord High Chancellor.

title: Meet Corliss Archer (TV series)
text: Meet Corliss Archer is an American television sitcom that aired on CBS (July 13, 1951 - August 10, 1951) and in syndication via the Ziv Company from April to December 1954.

title: Meet Corliss Archer (TV series)
text: The program was an adaptation of the radio series of the same name, which was based on a series of short stories by F. Hugh Herbert.

title: Village accountant
text: The Village Accountant (variously known as "Patwari", "Talati", "Patel", "Karnam", "Adhikari", "Shanbogaru","Patnaik" etc.) is an administrative government position found in rural parts of the Indian sub-continent.

title: Village accountant
text: The office and the officeholder are called the "patwari" in Telangana, Bengal, North India and in Pakistan while in Sindh it is called "tapedar".

title: Village accountant
text: The position is known as the "karnam" in Andhra Pradesh, "patnaik" in Orissa or "adhikari" in Tamil Nadu, while it is commonly known as the "talati" in Karnataka, Gujarat and Maharashtra.

title: Village accountant
text: The position was known as the "kulkarni" in Northern Karnataka and Maharashtra.

title: Village accountant
text: The position was known as the "shanbogaru" in South Karnataka.

title: Joseph Kalite
text: Joseph Kalite (died 24 January 2014) was a Central African politician.

title: Joseph Kalite
text: As a government minister he either held the housing or health portfolio.

title: Joseph Kalite
text: Kalite, a Muslim, was reported to be killed by anti-balaka outside the Central Mosque in the capital Bangui during the Central African Republic conflict.

title: Joseph Kalite
text: He was killed with machetes on the day in Bangui after interim president Catherine Samba-Panza took power.

title: Joseph Kalite
text: At the time of the attack Kalite held no government position, nor did he under the Séléka rule.

title: Joseph Kalite
text: He was reported to have supported the rule of Séléka leader Michel Djotodia.

title: Charles Craft
text: Charles Craft (May 9, 1902 – September 19, 1968) was an English-born American film and television editor.

title: Charles Craft
text: Born in the county of Hampshire in England on May 9, 1902, Craft would enter the film industry in Hollywood in 1927.

title: Charles Craft
text: The first film he edited was the Universal Pictures silent film, "Painting the Town".

title: Charles Craft
text: Over the next 25 years, Craft would edit 90 feature-length films.

title: Charles Craft
text: In the early 1950s he would switch his focus to the small screen, his first show being "Racket Squad", from 1951–53, for which he was the main editor, editing 93 of the 98 episodes.

title: Charles Craft
text: He would work on several other series during the 1950s, including "Meet Corliss Archer" (1954), "Science Fiction Theatre" (1955–56), and "Highway Patrol" (1955–57).

title: Charles Craft
text: In the late 1950s and early 1960s he was one of the main editors on "Sea Hunt", starring Lloyd Bridges, editing over half of the episodes.

title: Charles Craft
text: His final film work would be editing "Flipper's New Adventure" (1964, the sequel to 1963's "Flipper".

title: Charles Craft
text: When the film was made into a television series, Craft would begin the editing duties on that show, editing the first 28 episodes before he retired in 1966.

title: Charles Craft
text: Craft died on September 19, 1968 in Los Angeles, California.

title: Meet Corliss Archer
text: Meet Corliss Archer, a program from radio's Golden Age, ran from January 7, 1943 to September 30, 1956.

title: Meet Corliss Archer
text: Although it was CBS's answer to NBC's popular "A Date with Judy", it was also broadcast by NBC in 1948 as a summer replacement for "The Bob Hope Show".

title: Meet Corliss Archer
text: From October 3, 1952 to June 26, 1953, it aired on ABC, finally returning to CBS.

title: Meet Corliss Archer
text: Despite the program's long run, fewer than 24 episodes are known to exist.

title: Janet Waldo
text: Janet Marie Waldo (February 4, 1920 – June 12, 2016) was an American radio and voice actress.

title: Janet Waldo
text: She is best known in animation for voicing Judy Jetson, Nancy in "Shazzan", Penelope Pitstop, and Josie in "Josie and the Pussycats", and on radio as the title character in "Meet Corliss Archer".

title: Kiss and Tell (1945 film)
text: Kiss and Tell is a 1945 American comedy film starring then 17-year-old Shirley Temple as Corliss Archer.

title: Kiss and Tell (1945 film)
text: In the film, two teenage girls cause their respective parents much concern when they start to become interested in boys.

title: Kiss and Tell (1945 film)
text: The parents' bickering about which girl is the worse influence causes more problems than it solves.

title: Secretary of State for Constitutional Affairs
text: The office of Secretary of State for Constitutional Affairs was a British Government position, created in 2003.

title: Secretary of State for Constitutional Affairs
text: Certain functions of the Lord Chancellor which related to the Lord Chancellor's Department were transferred to the Secretary of State.

title: Secretary of State for Constitutional Affairs
text: At a later date further functions were also transferred to the Secretary of State for Constitutional Affairs from the First Secretary of State, a position within the government held by the Deputy Prime Minister.

title: Animorphs
text: Animorphs is a science fantasy series of young adult books written by Katherine Applegate and her husband Michael Grant, writing together under the name K. A. Applegate, and published by Scholastic.

title: Animorphs
text: It is told in first person, with all six main characters taking turns narrating the books through their own perspectives.

title: Animorphs
text: Horror, war, dehumanization, sanity, morality, innocence, leadership, freedom and growing up are the core themes of the series.

title: Science Fantasy (magazine)
text: Science Fantasy, which also appeared under the titles Impulse and SF Impulse, was a British fantasy and science fiction magazine, launched in 1950 by Nova Publications as a companion to Nova's "New Worlds".

title: Science Fantasy (magazine)
text: Walter Gillings was editor for the first two issues, and was then replaced by John Carnell, the editor of "New Worlds", as a cost-saving measure.

title: Science Fantasy (magazine)
text: Carnell edited both magazines until Nova went out of business in early 1964.

title: Science Fantasy (magazine)
text: The titles were acquired by Roberts & Vinter, who hired Kyril Bonfiglioli to edit "Science Fantasy"; Bonfiglioli changed the title to "Impulse" in early 1966, but the new title led to confusion with the distributors and sales fell, though the magazine remained profitable.

title: Science Fantasy (magazine)
text: The title was changed again to "SF Impulse" for the last few issues.

title: Science Fantasy (magazine)
text: "Science Fantasy" ceased publication the following year, when Roberts & Vinter came under financial pressure after their printer went bankrupt.

title: The Divide trilogy
text: The Divide trilogy is a fantasy young adult novel trilogy by Elizabeth Kay, which takes place in an alternate universe.

title: The Divide trilogy
text: The three books are "The Divide" (2002), "Back to The Divide" (2005), and "Jinx on The Divide" (2006).

title: The Divide trilogy
text: The first novel was originally published by the small press publisher Chicken House (now a division of Scholastic), with subsequent volumes published by Scholastic, which also reprinted the first novel.

title: The Divide trilogy
text: The books have been translated into French, German, Spanish, Finnish, Chinese, Japanese, Portuguese, Italian, Romanian and Dutch.

title: The Divide trilogy
text: Interior illustrations are by Ted Dewan.

title: Kazon
text: The Kazon are a fictional alien race in the "Star Trek" franchise.

title: Kazon
text: Developed by "" series' co-creators Rick Berman, Michael Piller, and Jeri Taylor, the Kazon serve as the primary antagonists during the show's first two seasons.

title: Kazon
text: They are represented as a nomadic species divided into eighteen separate sects, and characterized by their reliance on violence.

title: Kazon
text: A patriarchal society, the Kazon have a low opinion of women, and place pride in men becoming warriors and proving themselves in battle.

title: Kazon
text: The Kazon storylines frequently revolve around the attempts of Jal Culluh and his Kazon sect to steal technology from the USS "Voyager", with the assistance of former "Voyager" ensign Seska.

title: Kazon
text: During the second season, the "Voyager" crew uncover more about the alien species' history and culture through a temporary truce.

title: Kazon
text: In their final appearance, the Kazon successfully commandeer "Voyager", but are eventually forced to surrender and retreat.

title: Kazon
text: The alien species have minor cameo appearances and references in the show's subsequent seasons, and have also been included in "Star Trek Online" and novels set in the "Star Trek" universe.

title: Victoria Hanley
text: Victoria Hanley is an American young adult fantasy novelist.

title: Victoria Hanley
text: Her first three books, "The Seer And The Sword", "The Healer's Keep" and "The Light Of The Oracle" are companion books to one another.

title: Victoria Hanley
text: Her newest book (released March 2012) is the sequel of a series, called "Indigo Magic", published by Egmont USA.

title: Victoria Hanley
text: She's also published two non-fiction books through Cotton Wood Press; called "Seize the Story: A Handbook For Teens Who Like To Write", and "Wild Ink: A Grownups Guide To Writing Fiction For Teens".

title: Shadowshaper
text: Shadowshaper is a 2015 American urban fantasy young adult novel written by Daniel José Older.

title: Shadowshaper
text: It follows Sierra Santiago, an Afro-Boricua teenager living in Brooklyn.

title: Shadowshaper
text: She is the granddaughter of a "shadowshaper", or a person who infuses art with ancestral spirits.

title: Shadowshaper
text: As forces of gentrification invade their community and a mysterious being who appropriates their magic begins to hunt the aging shadowshapers, Sierra must learn about her artistic and spiritual heritage to foil the killer.

title: Andre Norton Award
text: The Andre Norton Award for Young Adult Science Fiction and Fantasy is an annual award presented by the Science Fiction and Fantasy Writers of America (SFWA) to the author of the best young adult or middle grade science fiction or fantasy book published in the United States in the preceding year.

title: Andre Norton Award
text: It is named to honor prolific science fiction and fantasy author Andre Norton (1912–2005), and it was established by then SFWA president Catherine Asaro and the SFWA Young Adult Fiction committee and announced on February 20, 2005.

title: Andre Norton Award
text: Any published young adult or middle grade science fiction or fantasy novel is eligible for the prize, including graphic novels.

title: Andre Norton Award
text: There is no limit on word count.

title: Andre Norton Award
text: The award is presented along with the Nebula Awards and follows the same rules for nominations and voting; as the awards are separate, works may be simultaneously nominated for both the Andre Norton award and a Nebula Award.

title: Etiquette & Espionage
text: Etiquette & Espionage is a young adult steampunk novel by Gail Carriger.

title: Etiquette & Espionage
text: It is her first young adult novel, and is set in the same universe as her bestselling Parasol Protectorate adult series.

title: List of Square Enix companion books
text: Dozens of Square Enix companion books have been produced since 1998, when video game developer Square began to produce books that focused on artwork, developer interviews, and background information on the fictional worlds and characters in its games rather than on gameplay details.

title: List of Square Enix companion books
text: The first series of these books was the "Perfect Works" series, written and published by Square subsidiary DigiCube.

title: List of Square Enix companion books
text: They produced three books between 1998 and 1999 before the line was stopped in favor of the "Ultimania" (アルティマニア , Arutimania ) series, a portmanteau of ultimate and mania.

title: List of Square Enix companion books
text: This series of books is written by Studio BentStuff, which had previously written game guides for Square for "Final Fantasy VII".

title: List of Square Enix companion books
text: They were published by DigiCube until the company was dissolved in 2003.

title: List of Square Enix companion books
text: Square merged with video game publisher Enix on April 1, 2003 to form Square Enix, which resumed publication of the companion books.

title: Left Behind: The Kids
text: "Left Behind: The Kids (stylized as LEFT BEHIND >THE KIDS<)" is a series written by Jerry B. Jenkins, Tim LaHaye, and Chris Fabry.

title: Left Behind: The Kids
text: The series consists of 40 short novels aimed primarily at the young adult market based on the adult series Left Behind also written by Jerry B. Jenkins.

title: Left Behind: The Kids
text: It follows a core group of teenagers as they experience the rapture and tribulation, based on scriptures found in the Bible, and background plots introduced in the adult novels.

title: Left Behind: The Kids
text: Like the adult series, the books were published by Tyndale House Publishing, and released over the 7 year period of 1997-2004.

title: Left Behind: The Kids
text: The series has sold over 11 million copies worldwide.

title: Esma Sultan
text: Esma Sultan is the name of three daughters of three Ottoman Sultans:

title: Esma Sultan (daughter of Abdul Hamid I)
text: Esma Sultan (17 July 1778 – 4 June 1848) was an Ottoman princess, daughter of Sultan Abdul Hamid I, sister of Sultan Mustafa IV and Sultan Mahmud II.

title: Esma Sultan (daughter of Abdul Hamid I)
text: She was the adoptive mother of Bezmiâlem Sultan and Rahime Perestu Sultan.

title: Laleli Mosque
text: The Laleli Mosque (Turkish: "Laleli Camii, or Tulip Mosque" ) is an 18th-century Ottoman imperial mosque located in Laleli, Fatih, Istanbul, Turkey.

title: Gevheri Kadın
text: Gevheri Kadın (8 July 1856 – 6 September 1884) was the fifth wife of 32nd Ottoman Sultan Abdülaziz.

title: Gevheri Kadın
text: She was the mother of Şehzade Mehmed Seyfeddin and Esma Sultan of the Ottoman Empire.

title: Esma Sultan (daughter of Ahmed III)
text: Esma Sultan (14 March 1726 – 13 August 1788) was an Ottoman princess, daughter of Sultan Ahmed III and his consort Zeynep Kadın.

title: Esma Sultan (daughter of Ahmed III)
text: She was the half-sister of Sultan Mustafa III and Abdul Hamid I.

title: Djamaâ el Kebir
text: The Great Mosque of Algiers (Arabic: الجامع الكبير‎ ‎ , "Jemaa Kebir") or “Djama’a al-Kebir” (meaning Great Mosque) is a mosque in Algiers, Algeria, located very close to Algiers Harbor.

title: Djamaâ el Kebir
text: An inscription on the minbar (منبر) or the pulpit testifies to fact that the mosque was built in 1097.

title: Djamaâ el Kebir
text: It is also known by several other names such as Grand Mosque d'Alger, Djamaa al-Kebir, El Kebir Mosque and Jami Masjid.

title: Djamaâ el Kebir
text: It is one of the few remaining examples of Almoravid architecture.

title: Djamaâ el Kebir
text: It is the oldest mosque in Algiers and is said to be the oldest mosque in Algeria after Sidi Okba Mosque.

title: Djamaâ el Kebir
text: It was built under sultan Ali ibn Yusuf.

title: Djamaâ el Kebir
text: Its minaret dates from 1332 (1324 in some sources) and was built by the Ziyyanid Sultan of Tlemcen.

title: Djamaâ el Kebir
text: The gallery at the outside of the mosque was built in 1840.

title: Djamaâ el Kebir
text: Its construction was a consequence of a complete reconstruction of the street by the French.

title: Sultan Ahmed Mosque
text: The Sultan Ahmed Mosque or Sultan Ahmet Mosque (Turkish: "Sultan Ahmet Camii" ) is a historic mosque located in Istanbul, Turkey.

title: Sultan Ahmed Mosque
text: A popular tourist site, the Sultan Ahmed Mosque continues to function as a mosque today; men still kneel in prayer on the mosque's lush red carpet after the call to prayer.

title: Sultan Ahmed Mosque
text: The Blue Mosque, as it is popularly known, was constructed between 1609 and 1616 during the rule of Ahmed I.

title: Sultan Ahmed Mosque
text: Its Külliye contains Ahmed's tomb, a madrasah and a hospice.

title: Sultan Ahmed Mosque
text: Hand-painted blue tiles adorn the mosque’s interior walls, and at night the mosque is bathed in blue as lights frame the mosque’s five main domes, six minarets and eight secondary domes.

title: Sultan Ahmed Mosque
text: It sits next to the Hagia Sophia, another popular tourist site.

title: Esma Sultan (daughter of Abdülaziz)
text: Esma Sultan (21 March 1873 – 7 May 1899) was an Ottoman princess, the daughter of Sultan Abdülaziz and his wife Gevheri Kadın, herself the daughter of Salih Bey Svatnba.

title: Esma Sultan (daughter of Abdülaziz)
text: She was the half-sister of Abdülmecid II, the last Caliph of the Muslim world.

title: Küçük Hüseyin Pasha
text: Küçük Hüseyin Pasha (1757 – 7 December 1803), also known as Tayazade Damat Küçük Hüseyin Pasha, was an Ottoman statesman and admiral who was Kapudan Pasha (Grand Admiral of the Ottoman Navy) from 11 March 1792 to 7 December 1803.

title: Küçük Hüseyin Pasha
text: He was a "damat" ("bridegroom") to the Ottoman dynasty after he married an Ottoman princess, Esma Sultan.

title: Esma Sultan Mansion
text: The Esma Sultan Mansion (Turkish: "Esma Sultan Yalısı" ), a historical yalı (English: waterside mansion ) located at Bosphorus in Ortaköy neighborhood of Istanbul, Turkey and named after its original owner Esma Sultan, is used today as a cultural center after being redeveloped.

title: Great Eastern Conventions
text: Great Eastern Conventions, Inc. was an entertainment company which produced comic book conventions, most actively during the years 1987-1996.

title: Great Eastern Conventions
text: In New York City, the Great Eastern shows filled the gap between the mid-1980s demise of the annual Comic Art Convention and Creation Conventions, and the establishment of promoter Michael Carbonaro's annual Big Apple Comic Con in 1996.

title: Great Eastern Conventions
text: From 1993–1995, Great Eastern hosted two New York City shows annually at the Jacob K. Javits Convention Center.

title: Great Eastern Conventions
text: Great Eastern also ran shows in New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Massachusetts, Oregon, Minnesota, and Texas.

title: Big Stone Gap (film)
text: Big Stone Gap is a 2014 American drama romantic comedy film written and directed by Adriana Trigiani and produced by Donna Gigliotti for Altar Identity Studios, a subsidiary of Media Society.

title: Big Stone Gap (film)
text: Based on Trigiani's 2000 best-selling novel of the same name, the story is set in the actual Virginia town of Big Stone Gap circa 1970s.

title: Big Stone Gap (film)
text: The film had its world premiere at the Virginia Film Festival on November 6, 2014.

title: I Love NY (2015 film)
text: I Love NY, also known as I Love New Year, is an Indian romantic comedy film directed by Radhika Rao and Vinay Sapru starring Sunny Deol and Kangana Ranaut in lead roles.

title: I Love NY (2015 film)
text: The film is produced by Bhushan Kumar and Krishan Kumar under the banner of Super Cassettes Industries Ltd.

title: I Love NY (2015 film)
text: The film was extensively shot in Mumbai, New York City and Bangkok.

title: I Love NY (2015 film)
text: The main plot was taken from the Russian romantic comedy "The Irony of Fate" (1976).

title: I Love NY (2015 film)
text: After numerous delays, the film released on 10 July 2015.

title: Just Another Romantic Wrestling Comedy
text: Just Another Romantic Wrestling Comedy is a 2006 film starring April Hunter and Joanie Laurer.

title: Just Another Romantic Wrestling Comedy
text: This Romantic comedy film was premiered at New Jersey and New York City on December 1, 2006 and was released on DVD in the United States and the United Kingdom on April 17, 2007.

title: Just Another Romantic Wrestling Comedy
text: After the film's DVD release "Just Another Romantic Wrestling Comedy" won an "Honorable Mention" award at the New Jersey International Festival awards.

title: Just Another Romantic Wrestling Comedy
text: The release is being handled by "Victory Multimedia".

title: Hamish and Andy's Gap Year
text: Hamish & Andy's Gap Year is a Logie Award winning comedy series following Hamish Blake and Andy Lee, a pair of Australian comedians, on their trips to various international locations.

title: Hamish and Andy's Gap Year
text: The first season saw the boys visiting America for ten episodes and broadcast their show weekly from New York City.

title: Hamish and Andy's Gap Year
text: In its second season in 2012, the show was titled "Hamish & Andy's Euro Gap Year" and seven episodes were broadcast from The Lord Stanley, a disused pub in East London, England.

title: Hamish and Andy's Gap Year
text: The third season known as "Hamish and Andy's Gap Year Asia" in 2013 was broadcast from a bar in Bangkok, Thailand, called 'The Raintree'.

title: Sex and the City (film)
text: Sex and the City (advertised as Sex and the City: The Movie) is a 2008 American romantic comedy film written and directed by Michael Patrick King in his feature film directorial debut, and a sequel to the 1998-2004 HBO comedy series of the same name (itself based on the book of the same name by Candace Bushnell) about four female friends: Carrie Bradshaw (Sarah Jessica Parker), Samantha Jones (Kim Cattrall), Charlotte York Goldenblatt (Kristin Davis), and Miranda Hobbes (Cynthia Nixon), dealing with their lives as single women in New York City.

title: Sex and the City (film)
text: The series often portrayed frank discussions about romance and sexuality.

title: Nola (film)
text: Nola is a 2003 American romantic comedy film written and directed by Alan Hruska.

title: Nola (film)
text: It depicts the struggle of a young woman trying to survive in New York City while looking for her birth father.

title: Nola (film)
text: It premiered in New York City on July 23, 2004.

title: Kingston Morning
text: Kingston Morning is Dave Eggar's 4th solo release recorded in Brooklyn, New York; Kingston, Jamaica; and Big Stone Gap, Virginia; and released by Domo Records.

title: Kingston Morning
text: "Itsbynne Reel" was nominated at the 53rd Grammy Awards for "Best Instrumental Arrangement".

title: Clinton, Minnesota
text: Clinton is a city in Big Stone County, Minnesota, United States.

title: Clinton, Minnesota
text: The city was named for New York Governor DeWitt Clinton.

title: Clinton, Minnesota
text: The population was 449 at the 2010 census.

title: New York Society of Model Engineers
text: The New York Society of Model Engineers (NYSME) was originally incorporated in 1926 in New York City.

title: New York Society of Model Engineers
text: There are published records that show the Society existed as early as 1905.

title: New York Society of Model Engineers
text: In its early years, the organization moved to and from various locations throughout Manhattan.

title: New York Society of Model Engineers
text: AT that time it was basically a gentlemen's club of members who were interested in all types of model building.

title: New York Society of Model Engineers
text: In 1926 the Society was formalized and incorporated under the laws of the State of New York.

title: New York Society of Model Engineers
text: This was done so that the Society could obtain a permit to use a lake in New York City's Central Park for model motor boat races.

title: New York Society of Model Engineers
text: It was also at this time that the Society began construction of its first Model Railroad " The Union Connecting".

title: New York Society of Model Engineers
text: Over the next twenty years, the Society moved from its original location to two other locations.

title: New York Society of Model Engineers
text: Each move doubling the size of the previous location and of course doubling the size of the model train layout.

title: New York Society of Model Engineers
text: During WW2 many Society members were called to service in the Armed Forces.

title: New York Society of Model Engineers
text: Regrettably, the largest of the layouts had to be dismantled.

title: New York Society of Model Engineers
text: The location of the layout in the basement of the Astor Building was requested for the war effort.

title: New York Society of Model Engineers
text: The dismantling was done with care, with salvaged usable materials going into scrap drives for the War effort.

title: New York Society of Model Engineers
text: As members returned after the War a new location was searched for.

title: New York Society of Model Engineers
text: This led to an invitation from the Lackawanna Railroad to move into their Passenger Terminal in Hoboken,NJ.

title: New York Society of Model Engineers
text: They had the space for what would become the largest model railroad in the world at that time.

title: New York Society of Model Engineers
text: The space?

title: New York Society of Model Engineers
text: Only the ornate waiting room for the recently discontinued ferry boats to 23rd Street in New York City.

title: New York Society of Model Engineers
text: Here the layout was built.

title: New York Society of Model Engineers
text: It was based on the Lackawanna Railroad from Hoboken to Scranton, Pa.

title: New York Society of Model Engineers
text: It was magnificent; from the scale model of the Hoboken Terminal to the soaring Delaware Water Gap.

title: New York Society of Model Engineers
text: During the early-1950s the organization moved to its current location in Carlstadt, New Jersey.

title: SF9 (band)
text: SF9 (Korean: 에스에프나인 ; shortened from Sensational Feeling 9) is a South Korean boy group formed by FNC Entertainment.

title: SF9 (band)

title: Baro (singer)
text: Cha Sun-woo (born September 5, 1992), better known by his stage name Baro, is a South Korean singer, rapper, and actor.

text: He is the main rapper of South Korean boy group B1A4 and debuted alongside with the group on the stage of MBC "Show!

title: Baro (singer)

title: List of awards and nominations received by Shinee
text: South Korean boy group Shinee have received several awards and nominations for their music work.

title: List of awards and nominations received by Shinee
text: The group was formed by S.M. Entertainment in 2008 and released their first full-length album, "The Shinee World", on August 28, 2008, which won the Newcomer Album of the Year at the 23rd Golden Disk Awards.

title: List of awards and nominations received by Shinee
text: The first single released from the album was "Sanso Gateun Neo (Love Like Oxygen)" and won first place on "M Countdown" on September 18, 2008 making it the group's first win on Korean music shows since debut.

title: List of awards and nominations received by Shinee
text: Their second album "Lucifer" (2010) produced two singles, "Lucifer" and "Hello".

title: List of awards and nominations received by Shinee
text: For their outstanding choreography the group was nominated for the Best Dance Performance Award at the Mnet Asian Music Awards in 2010. "

title: List of awards and nominations received by Shinee
text: Lucifer" also won the Disk Bonsang Award at the 25th Golden Disk Awards as well as the Popularity Award.

title: List of awards and nominations received by Shinee
text: On March 21, 2012 the group released their fourth EP "Sherlock" for which the group was awarded another Disk Bonsang Award at the 27th Golden Disc Awards and the Bonsang Award at the 22nd Seoul Music Award.

title: List of awards and nominations received by Shinee
text: Also following the success of the lead single it was also nominated for Song of the Year at the 2012 Mnet Asian Music Awards.

title: Warrior (B.A.P song)
text: "Warrior" (Korean: 워리어) is a song recorded by South Korean boy group B.A.P.

text: It is released as a digital single on January 26, 2012 through TS Entertainment.

title: Warrior (B.A.P song)
text: The song served as B.A.P's debut single, the first from their self-titled debut album.

text: Cho Kyu-hyun (born February 3, 1988), better known mononymously as Kyuhyun, is a South Korean singer and musical theatre actor.

title: Madtown
text: Madtown (Hangul: 매드타운 ), often stylized as MADTOWN, is a South Korean boy group formed in 2014 by J. Tune Camp.

title: Madtown

title: List of songs written by Ravi
text: Ravi is a South Korean rapper, songwriter and producer, signed under Jellyfish Entertainment.

title: List of songs written by Ravi
text: He began his career as a rapper in 2012 in the South Korean boy group VIXX, and later formed VIXX's first sub-unit VIXX LR with band mate Leo in 2015.

title: List of songs written by Ravi

title: Lil Ru
text: Sylvester Samuels better known by his stage name Lil Ru, is an American rapper from Ridgeway, South Carolina currently signed to Def Jam Recordings.

title: Lil Ru
text: His debut album, 21 & Up was released on August 25, 2009.

title: Lil Ru
text: The Ridgeway native was 16 when he made his professional foray into the music business.

title: Lil Ru
text: Inspired by New Orleans’ innovative Cash Money Crew, Ru began making a name for himself on his local music scene, doing live shows and pressing up his own CDs.

title: Lil Ru
text: His hard-hitting lyrics and entrepreneurial spirit caught the attention of fellow South Carolinian Angie Stone.

title: Lil Ru
text: Shortly after the neo-soul songstress helped him secure a deal with Elektra Records, Ru found himself unsigned again, among the artists lost in the shuffle after the label merged with Atlantic Records.

title: Lil Ru
text: Music fans first heard him on his 2001 debut single Will Destroy.

title: Lil Ru
text: He then released his 2002 follow up, Shawty What You Doin’.

title: Lil Ru
text: Both songs reached the Billboard R&B/Hip-Hop charts and helped land him at his next label home, Capitol Records.

title: James P. Comer
text: James P. Comer (born James Pierpont Comer, September 25, 1934 in East Chicago, Indiana) is currently the Maurice Falk Professor of Child Psychiatry at the Yale Child Study Center and has been since 1976.

title: James P. Comer
text: He is also an associate dean at the Yale School of Medicine.

title: James P. Comer
text: As one of the world's leading child psychiatrists, he is best known for his efforts to improve the scholastic performance of children from lower-income and minority backgrounds which led to the founding of the Comer School Development Program in 1968.

title: James P. Comer
text: His program has been used in more than 600 schools in eighty-two school districts.

title: James P. Comer
text: He is the author of ten books, including the autobiographical "Maggie’s American Dream: The Life and Times of a Black Family", 1988; "Leave No Child Behind: Preparing Today's Youth for Tomorrow's World", 2004; and his most recent book, "What I Learned in School: Reflections on Race, Child Development, and School Reform", 2009.

title: James P. Comer
text: He has also written more than 150 articles for Parents (magazine) and more than 300 articles on children's health and development and race relations.

title: James P. Comer
text: Dr. Comer has also served as a consultant to the Children's Television Workshop (Sesame Workshop) which produces Sesame Street and The Electric Company (1971 TV series).

title: James P. Comer
text: He is a co-founder and past president of the Black Psychiatrists of America and has served on the board of several universities, foundations, and corporations.

title: James P. Comer
text: He has also lectured and consulted widely not only across the United States at different universities, medical schools, and scientific associations, but also around the world in places such as London, Paris, Tokyo, Dakar, Senegal and Sydney, Australia.

title: James P. Comer
text: For his work and scholarship, Dr. Comer has been awarded 47 honorary degrees and has been recognized by numerous organizations.

title: Tragedy Khadafi
text: Percy Chapman (born August 13, 1971, in Queens, New York, United States), known by his stage name Tragedy Khadafi, and formerly known as Intelligent Hoodlum, is an American rapper and producer who hails from the Queensbridge Housing Projects in Queens, New York, who helped spawn other hip hop artists such as Cormega, Mobb Deep, Capone-N-Noreaga, Nas and many others both through production and influence.

title: Tragedy Khadafi
text: His name is a reference to the former leader of Libya, Muammar Gaddafi.

title: Amaruk Kayshapanta
text: Amaruk Caizapanta Anchapacxi (Quito, January 30, 1970), whose stage name is Amaruk Kayshapanta.

title: Amaruk Kayshapanta

title: Amaruk Kayshapanta

title: Amaruk Kayshapanta

title: Amaruk Kayshapanta
text: Known for his role in the TV series "Hospital Central" in which he gave life to the character "Edgar".

title: Amaruk Kayshapanta
text: His Philosophy "Amawtica Amarukiana Desestructuration" brings to the contemporary world the Philosophical study of the Andean Worldview, a spiritual legacy of transformation and balance for the awakening of a collective conscience.

title: Method Man
text: Clifford Smith (born April 1, 1971), better known by his stage name Method Man, is an American rapper, record producer, and actor.

title: Method Man

title: Eenasul Fateh
text: Eenasul Fateh (Bengali: ঈনাসুল ফাতেহ ; born 3 April 1959), also known by his stage name Aladin, is a Bangladeshi-British cultural practitioner, magician, live artist and former international management consultant.

title: Criss Angel
text: Christopher Nicholas Sarantakos (born December 19, 1967), known by the stage name Criss Angel, is an American magician, illusionist and musician.

title: Criss Angel
text: Angel began his career in New York City, before moving his base of operations to the Las Vegas Valley.

title: Criss Angel
text: He is known for starring in the television and stage show "Criss Angel Mindfreak" and his previous live performance illusion show "Criss Angel Believe" in collaboration with "Cirque du Soleil" at the Luxor casino in Las Vegas.

title: Criss Angel
text: The show generated $150 million in tourist revenue to Las Vegas in 2010, but has since been replaced by "Mindfreak LIVE" on 11 May 2016 (the show is partly produced by Cirque, however the directive rights are entirely with Criss Angel).

title: Criss Angel
text: He also starred in the television series "Criss Angel BeLIEve" on Spike TV, the reality-competition television show "Phenomenon" on NBC, and the 2014 stage show "Criss Angel Magicjam".

title: Indriati Iskak
text: Indriati Gerald Bernardina (born 9 June 1942), also known by her stage name Indriati Iskak and after marriage as Indri Makki, is an Indonesian actress turned psychologist and marketer.

title: Indriati Iskak
text: Born in Surabaya, she entered the Indonesian film industry and soared to popularity with Usmar Ismail's commercially successful "Tiga Dara" (1957).

title: Indriati Iskak
text: She appeared in eight further films and established her own girl group before retiring from cinema in 1963.

title: Indriati Iskak
text: She graduated from the University of Indonesia with a degree in psychology in 1968, and has taught the subject at the .

title: Indriati Iskak
text: For twenty-six years she worked with Unilever, and since 1994 she has been a marketing consultant with Makki Makki.
