text: His stage repertoire included Belmonte in Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart's "Die Entführung aus dem Serail", Chapelou in Adolphe Adam's "Le postillon de Lonjumeau", Count Almaviva in Gioachino Rossini's "The Barber of Seville", Daniel in Franz Lehár's "The Merry Widow", the Duke of Mantua in Giuseppe Verdi's "Rigoletto", Gabriel von Eisenstein in Johann Strauss II's "Die Fledermaus", Indigo in Strauss' "Indigo und die vierzig Räuber", Jeník in Bedřich Smetana's "The Bartered Bride", Paolino in Domenico Cimarosa's "Il matrimonio segreto", Pâris in Jacques Offenbach's "La belle Hélène", Pietro in Franz von Suppé's "Boccaccio", and Wilhelm Meister in Ambroise Thomas' "Mignon".

title: List of major opera composers
text: This list provides a guide to opera composers, as determined by their presence on a majority of compiled lists of significant opera composers.

title: List of major opera composers
text: (See the "Lists Consulted" section for full details.)

title: List of major opera composers
text: The composers run from Jacopo Peri, who wrote the first ever opera in late 16th century Italy, to John Adams, one of the leading figures in the contemporary operatic world.

title: List of major opera composers
text: The brief accompanying notes offer an explanation as to why each composer has been considered major.

title: List of major opera composers
text: Also included is a section about major women opera composers, compiled from the same lists.

title: List of major opera composers
text: For an introduction to operatic history, see opera.

title: List of major opera composers
text: The organisation of the list is by birthdate.

title: Douglas J. Bennet
text: Douglas Joseph “Doug” Bennet, Jr. (born June 23, 1938) is a former national political official and college president.

title: Douglas J. Bennet
text: He was the fifteenth president of Wesleyan University, in Middletown, Connecticut, from 1995 to 2007.

title: Douglas J. Bennet
text: Before that, he served as Assistant Secretary of State for International Organization Affairs in the Clinton Administration (1993–95) and Assistant Secretary of State for Legislative Affairs in the Carter administration (1977–79), was the President and CEO of National Public Radio (1983–93), and ran the U.S. Agency for International Development under President Carter (1979–81).

title: Robert R. Hood
text: Robert R. Hood is an American government official who currently serves as Assistant Secretary of Defense for Legislative Affairs.

title: Robert R. Hood
text: Hood was previously vice president for government affairs for CH2M.

title: Robert R. Hood
text: Past roles with the federal government include a role at the White House as Special Assistant to the President in the Office of Legislative Affairs and posts at the United States Department of Defense as principal deputy assistant secretary for legislative affairs and as deputy under secretary of defense for budget and appropriations affairs.

title: Robert R. Hood
text: Hood was also the director of congressional affairs at the National Nuclear Security Administration.

title: United States Assistant Secretary of State
text: Assistant Secretary of State (A/S) is a title used for many executive positions in the United States Department of State, ranking below the Under Secretaries.

title: United States Assistant Secretary of State
text: A set of six Assistant Secretaries reporting to the Under Secretary for Political Affairs manage diplomatic missions within their designated geographic regions, plus one Assistant Secretary dealing with international organizations.

title: United States Assistant Secretary of State
text: Assistant Secretaries usually manage individual bureaus of the Department of State.

title: United States Assistant Secretary of State
text: When the manager of a bureau or another agency holds a title other than Assistant Secretary, such as "Director," it can be said to be of "Assistant Secretary equivalent rank."

title: United States Assistant Secretary of State
text: Assistant Secretaries typically have a set of deputies, referred to as Deputy Assistant Secretaries (DAS).

title: Robert Hormats
text: Robert D. "Bob" Hormats (born April 13, 1943, in Baltimore, Maryland) is Vice Chairman of Kissinger Associates.

title: Robert Hormats
text: Immediately prior he served as Under Secretary of State for Economic Growth, Energy, and the Environment (at the time, entitled Under Secretary of State for Economic, Business, and Agricultural Affairs) from 2009 to 2013.

title: Robert Hormats
text: Hormats was formerly Vice Chairman of Goldman Sachs (International), which he joined in 1982.

title: Robert Hormats
text: He served as Senior Deputy Assistant Secretary, from 1977 to 1979, and Assistant Secretary of State, from 1981 to 1982, at the Bureau of Economic and Business Affairs (formerly Bureau of Economic, Energy, and Business Affairs).

title: Robert Hormats
text: He was Ambassador and Deputy U.S. Trade Representative from 1979 to 1981.

title: Robert Hormats
text: He served as a senior staff member for International Economic Affairs on the United States National Security Council from 1969 to 1977, where he was senior economic adviser to Henry Kissinger, General Brent Scowcroft and Zbigniew Brzezinski.

title: Robert Hormats
text: He helped to manage the Nixon administration's opening of diplomatic relations with China's communist government.

title: Robert Hormats
text: He was a recipient of the French Legion of Honor in 1982 and the Arthur S. Flemming Award in 1974.

title: Roger O. Egeberg
text: Roger Olaf Egeberg, M.D. (13 November 1902 – 13 September 1997 Washington, D.C.) was an American medical educator, administrator and advocate of public health.

title: Roger O. Egeberg
text: He was General Douglas MacArthur's personal physician during World War II in the Pacific theater.

title: Roger O. Egeberg
text: His other roles included Assistant Secretary for Health and Scientific Affairs in the Department of Health, Education, and Welfare (now the United States Department of Health and Human Services) during the Nixon administration and Dean of the University of Southern California's medical school.

title: Edward D. Martin
text: Rear Admiral Edward Dana Martin (MD) is the former Acting Assistant Secretary of Defense (Health Affairs).

title: Edward D. Martin
text: He was appointed to two terms, originally in 1993 and once again in 1997.

title: Edward D. Martin
text: Martin served as the Secretary's principal advisor on matters related to the military health system, health.mil.

title: Edward D. Martin
text: The Military Health System (MHS) mission is to provide optimal Health Services in support of the United States' military mission.

title: Edward D. Martin
text: The MHS is a unique partnership of medical educators, medical researchers, and healthcare providers and their support personnel worldwide.

title: Edward D. Martin
text: This DoD enterprise consists of the Office of the Assistant Secretary of Defense (Health Affairs); the medical departments of the Army, Navy, Marine Corps, Air Force, Coast Guard, and Joint Chiefs of Staff; the Combatant Command surgeons; and TRICARE providers (including private sector healthcare providers, hospitals and pharmacies).

title: Steven K. Galson
text: Steven Kenneth Galson (born 1956) is an American public health physician.

title: Steven K. Galson
text: He is currently Senior Vice President for Global Regulatory Affairs at Amgen, the S. California-based innovative global biopharmaceutical company.

title: Steven K. Galson
text: He is also Professor-at-Large at the Keck Graduate Institute for Applied Life Sciences in Clarmont, California.

title: Steven K. Galson
text: He is a retired rear admiral in the United States Public Health Service Commissioned Corps and public health administrator who served as the acting Surgeon General of the United States from October 1, 2007 – October 1, 2009.

title: Steven K. Galson
text: He served concurrently as acting Assistant Secretary for Health from January 22, 2009 to June 25, 2009, and as the Deputy Director and Director of the Center for Drug Evaluation and Research (CDER) at the Food and Drug Administration from 2001 to 2007.

title: Steven K. Galson
text: As the Acting Surgeon General, he was the commander of the United States Public Health Service Commissioned Corps and, while serving as the Assistant Secretary for Health, was the operational head of the Public Health Service.

title: George P. Taylor
text: Lieutenant General George Peach Taylor Jr.

title: George P. Taylor
text: USAF (Ret.)

title: George P. Taylor
text: (born 1953) was the 18th Surgeon General of the United States Air Force, Headquarters U.S. Air Force, Washington, D.C. General Taylor served as the senior Air Force officer responsible for comprehensive management of the Air Force Medical Service.

title: George P. Taylor
text: In this capacity, he advises the Secretary of the Air Force and Air Force Chief of Staff, as well as the Assistant Secretary of Defense for Health Affairs, on matters pertaining to the medical aspects of the air expeditionary force and the health care of 2.6 million Air Force beneficiaries.

title: George P. Taylor
text: The Surgeon General has authority to commit resources for the Air Force Medical Service, to make decisions affecting the delivery of medical services, and to develop plans, programs and procedures to support worldwide medical service missions.

title: George P. Taylor
text: The Surgeon General exercises direction, guidance and technical management of more than 42,000 people assigned to 74 medical treatment facilities worldwide.

title: George P. Taylor
text: From September 7, 2010 - December 22, 2010 he served as the acting Assistant Secretary of Defense for Health Affairs

title: Bradford P. Campbell
text: Bradford P. Campbell was the Assistant Secretary for Employee Benefits Security of the United States Department of Labor (DOL), the official in charge of the Employee Benefits Security Administration (EBSA).

title: Bradford P. Campbell
text: Mr. Campbell was nominated by President George W. Bush as Assistant Secretary on May 3, 2007, and was unanimously confirmed by the United States Senate on August 3, 2007.

title: Bradford P. Campbell
text: He held the position until January 20, 2009.

title: Bradford P. Campbell
text: Prior to his confirmation as Assistant Secretary, Mr. Campbell had served as Acting Assistant Secretary since October 30, 2006 and as EBSA's Deputy Assistant Secretary for Policy since March 5, 2004.

title: Office of Population Affairs
text: The Office of Population Affairs (OPA), a part of the United States Department of Health and Human Services within the Office of Public Health and Science, serves as the focal point to advise the Secretary and the Assistant Secretary for Health on a wide range of reproductive health topics, including adolescent pregnancy, family planning, and sterilization, as well as other population issues.

title: Office of Population Affairs
text: Created by an Act of Congress in 1970 (Public Law 91-572, 84 Stat.

title: Office of Population Affairs
text: 1970), the Office of Population Affairs, under the direction of the Deputy Assistant Secretary of Population Affairs (DASPA), has three component offices responsible for the oversight of program functions: Office of Family Planning, Office of Adolescent Pregnancy Programs, and Office of Research and Evaluation.

title: Gretchen Osgood Warren
text: Gretchen Osgood Warren (19 March 1868 – September 1961), the wife of Fiske Warren, was an actress, singer and poet.

title: Gretchen Osgood Warren
text: The daughter of Dr. Hamilton Osgood and Margaret Cushing Osgood of Beacon Hill, Boston, Massachusetts, her younger sister was Mary Alden Childers, the wife of writer and Irish nationalist Robert Erskine Childers.

title: Gretchen Osgood Warren
text: Her nephew Erskine Hamilton Childers served as the fourth President of Ireland from 1973-74.

title: R509 road (Ireland)
text: The R509 road, following part of the Childers Road (named after Erskine Childers), is a regional road in Ireland, running through the southeastern side of Limerick City.

title: R509 road (Ireland)
text: It forms what is somewhat akin to an inner ring road (albeit mostly two-lane only).

title: Erskine Barton Childers
text: Erskine Barton Childers (11 March 1929 – 25 August 1996) was an Irish writer, BBC correspondent and United Nations senior civil servant.

title: Erskine Barton Childers
text: He was the eldest son of Erskine Hamilton Childers (Ireland's fourth President) and Ruth Ellen Dow Childers.

title: Erskine Barton Childers
text: His grandparents Mary Alden Childers and Robert Erskine Childers and the latter's double first cousin Robert Barton were all Irish nationalists involved heavily with the negotiation of Irish independence; which ultimately led to his grandfather's execution during the Irish Civil War.

title: Erskine Barton Childers
text: His great aunt was Gretchen Osgood Warren.

title: Robert Caesar Childers
text: Robert Caesar Childers (1838 – 25 July 1876) was a British Orientalist scholar, compiler of the first Pāli-English dictionary.

title: Robert Caesar Childers
text: Childers was the husband of Anna Barton of Ireland.

title: Robert Caesar Childers
text: He was the father of Irish nationalist Robert Erskine Childers and grandfather to the fourth President of Ireland, Erskine Hamilton Childers.

title: Robert Erskine Childers
text: Robert Erskine Childers DSC (25 June 1870 – 24 November 1922), universally known as Erskine Childers, was a British writer, whose works included the influential novel "The Riddle of the Sands", and a Fenian revolutionary who smuggled guns to Ireland in his sailing yacht "Asgard".

title: Robert Erskine Childers
text: He was executed by the authorities of the nascent Irish Free State during the Irish Civil War.

title: Robert Erskine Childers
text: He was the son of British Orientalist scholar Robert Caesar Childers; the cousin of Hugh Childers and Robert Barton; and the father of the fourth President of Ireland, Erskine Hamilton Childers.

title: Asgard (yacht)
text: Asgard is a 51 ft gaff rigged yacht.

title: Asgard (yacht)
text: She was owned by the English-born writer and Irish nationalist Erskine Childers and his wife Molly Childers.

title: Asgard (yacht)
text: She is most noted for her use in the Howth gun-running of 1914.

title: Robert Barton
text: Robert Childers Barton (4 March 1881 – 10 August 1975) was an Irish nationalist, politician and farmer who participated in the negotiations leading up to the signature of the Anglo-Irish Treaty.

title: Robert Barton
text: His father was Charles William Barton and his mother was Agnes Childers.

title: Robert Barton
text: His wife was Rachel Warren of Boston, daughter of Fiske Warren.

title: Robert Barton
text: His double first cousin and close friend was Robert Erskine Childers.

title: The Riddle of the Sands (film)
text: The Riddle of the Sands is a 1979 English spy thriller cinema film based upon the novel of the same name written by Erskine Childers.

title: The Riddle of the Sands (film)
text: Set in 1901, and starring Michael York and Simon MacCorkindale, it concerns the efforts of two English yachtsmen to avert a plot by the II Reich to launch a military seaborne invasion of England.

title: Irish Bulletin
text: The Irish Bulletin was the official gazette of the government of the Irish Republic.

title: Irish Bulletin
text: It was produced by the Department of Propaganda during the Irish War of Independence.

title: Irish Bulletin
text: and its offices were originally located at No. 6 Harcourt Street, Dublin.

title: Irish Bulletin
text: The paper's first editor was Desmond FitzGerald, until his arrest and replacement by Robert Erskine Childers.

title: Irish Bulletin
text: "The Bulletin" appeared in weekly editions from 11 November 1919 to 11 July 1921.

title: Molly Childers
text: Mary Alden Osgood Childers, MBE (14 December 1875 – 1 January 1964) was an American-born Irish writer and Irish nationalist.

title: Molly Childers
text: She was the daughter of Dr Hamilton Osgood and Margaret Cushing Osgood of Beacon Hill, Boston, Massachusetts.

title: Molly Childers
text: Her older sister was Gretchen Osgood Warren.

title: Molly Childers
text: Molly married the writer and Irish nationalist, Robert Erskine Childers.

title: Molly Childers
text: Their son, Erskine Hamilton Childers, became the fourth President of Ireland.

title: Catharina Felser
text: Catharina Felser (born October 2, 1982) is a German race car driver born in Siegburg, North Rhine-Westphalia.

title: Catharina Felser
text: Catharina started her career in karting during 1997, moving up to Austrian Formula Ford in 2000.

title: Catharina Felser
text: Her performances there resulted in one race in German Formula Ford, also during 2000.

title: Catharina Felser
text: In 2001, she competed in German Formula BMW.

title: Tony Ave
text: Tony Ave (born November 10, 1968) is a championship race car driver born in Hurley, Wisconsin, U.S..

title: Tony Ave
text: He competed in the Grand-Am Series from 2000 until 2002, in Formula Atlantic from 1996 until 2001, and in the Trans-Am in 2002.

title: Tony Ave
text: He also made three Indy Lights starts in 1993 and one Indy Pro Series start in 2003.

title: Tony Ave
text: In 2004, Ave raced one race in the NASCAR Nextel Cup Series at Watkins Glen finishing 31st.

title: Force India VJM04
text: The Force India VJM04 is a Formula One racing car developed by Force India for the 2011 Formula One season, the fourth car the team has made since entering the sport in 2008.

title: Force India VJM04
text: The car was driven by long-time Force India driver Adrian Sutil and 2010 Deutsche Tourenwagen Masters champion Paul di Resta.

title: Force India VJM04
text: The car was launched online on 8 February 2011.

title: Michael James Lewis
text: Michael James Lewis is an American race car driver born on December 24, 1990 in Laguna Beach, California to parents Steve Lewis (Owner of the famed Nine Racing Midget Team & former owner of Performance Racing Industry) and Loretta Lewis.

title: Michael James Lewis
text: As a young, up-and-coming Race Car Driver, Michael has competed in a diverse number of racing vehicles including Formula 3, Formula BMW, Ford Focus Midgets, Touring Cars, Late Model Stock Cars, Quarter Midgets, & Go-Karts.

title: Michael James Lewis
text: Michael also officially tested a Formula One car for Scuderia Ferrari F1 in the F60 chassis on November 15, 2011 (as a result from his accomplishments in Formula 3 Italia).

title: Michael James Lewis
text: Michael's passion for racing is paramount and he enjoys every aspect of his racing career.

title: Michael James Lewis
text: The Laguna Beach, California native is known for his professionalism, work ethic, and he lives every day for motorsport.

title: Andrea Bacci
text: Andrea Bacci is a race car driver born in Florence, Italy on 14 April 1972.

title: Andrea Bacci
text: He was the 2000 Italian Production Car Championship winner and the 1995 and 1999 Italian CIVT Series champion.

title: Andrea Bacci
text: He also raced in the 1997 Renault Mégane Cup and in one race of the 2001 European Touring Car Championship.

title: 2009 Singapore Grand Prix
text: The 2009 Singapore Grand Prix (formally the 2009 Formula 1 SingTel Singapore Grand Prix) was a Formula One motor race held at the Marina Bay Street Circuit in Singapore on 27 September 2009.

title: 2009 Singapore Grand Prix
text: The 61-lap race was the fourteenth round of the 2009 Formula One season.

title: 2009 Singapore Grand Prix
text: It was the second Singapore Grand Prix to be part of a Formula One Championship and the tenth Singapore Grand Prix overall.

title: 2009 Singapore Grand Prix
text: It was also the second Formula One race to be held at night.

title: 2009 Singapore Grand Prix
text: The race was won by McLaren-Mercedes driver and reigning World Champion Lewis Hamilton.

title: 2009 Singapore Grand Prix
text: Toyota's Timo Glock finished second and 2008 race winner Fernando Alonso took third position, making this the only race of the season with neither a Brawn nor a Red Bull driver on the podium.

title: 2009 Singapore Grand Prix
text: This was also the last race of 2009 for Glock, as he was injured during qualifying for the Japanese Grand Prix and was replaced by test driver Kamui Kobayashi.

title: 2009 Singapore Grand Prix
text: Heikki Kovalainen scored his last ever World Championship points at this race.

title: 2014 Bahrain Grand Prix
text: The 2014 Bahrain Grand Prix (formally the 2014 Formula 1 Gulf Air Bahrain Grand Prix) was a Formula One motor race held on 6 April at the Bahrain International Circuit in Sakhir, Bahrain.

title: 2014 Bahrain Grand Prix
text: It was the third round of the 2014 Formula One season, the 900th Formula One World Championship event, and the eleventh running of the race.

title: 2014 Bahrain Grand Prix
text: The 57-lap race was won by Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton who started from second position.

title: 2014 Bahrain Grand Prix
text: His teammate Nico Rosberg finished second and Force India driver Sergio Pérez came in third.

title: 2014 Bahrain Grand Prix
text: It was Hamilton's second victory of the season, his first in Bahrain, and the 24th of his Formula One career.

title: Force India VJM05
text: The Force India VJM05 is a Formula One racing car designed by Sahara Force India F1 Team for use in the 2012 Formula One season.

title: Force India VJM05
text: The car was launched on 3 February at Silverstone.

title: Force India VJM05
text: It was driven by Paul di Resta, and Nico Hülkenberg who returned to the sport after spending one year as Force India's test and reserve driver.

title: Eduardo Troconis
text: Eduardo Troconis (born in Veracruz, Veracruz) is a Mexican race car driver.

title: Eduardo Troconis
text: He is a two-time Mexican Formula Three International champion and a Rookie of the Year Award winner in the Indy Lights de las Americas and Formula Vee Series.

title: Eduardo Troconis
text: Troconis has also competed in the NASCAR Toyota Series and Desafío Corona Series.

title: Mike Shank
text: Mike Shank (born September 22, 1966) is an American race car team owner and former race car driver born in Columbus, Ohio.

title: Mike Shank
text: Before leaving driving to concentrate on car ownership, he ran one race in the 1996–97 Indy Racing League season, the 1997 Las Vegas 500K at Las Vegas Motor Speedway.

title: Mike Shank
text: He started racing in 1989, winning SCCA Ohio Valley Region's Novice Driver of the Year.

title: Mike Shank
text: He also won the 1996 Player’s/Toyota Atlantic C2 championship.

title: Little Black Rain Cloud
text: "Little Black Rain Cloud" is a song from the 1966 musical film featurette "Winnie the Pooh and the Honey Tree".

title: Little Black Rain Cloud
text: An instrumental version is played in the next featurette "Winnie the Pooh and the Blustery Day".

title: Little Black Rain Cloud
text: The song was also subsequently incorporated into the 1977 musical film, "The Many Adventures of Winnie the Pooh" which is an amalgamation of the three previous Winnie-the-Pooh featurettes including "Honey Tree".

title: Little Black Rain Cloud
text: In the song Winnie the Pooh comments about the on-screen actions where he is pretending to be a "Little Black Rain Cloud", as the title implies.

title: Little Black Rain Cloud
text: It's Pooh's hope that the Honey Bees will not notice him as he approaches their coveted honey.

title: Hip Hip Pooh-Ray!
text: "Hip Hip Pooh-Ray!"

title: Hip Hip Pooh-Ray!
text: is a song from the 1968 musical film featurette "Winnie the Pooh and the Blustery Day".

title: Hip Hip Pooh-Ray!
text: It is sung by the cast as a release from the dramatic tension of the story.

title: Hip Hip Pooh-Ray!
text: The song is also incorporated into (and used as the promotional tagline for) the 1977 musical film "The Many Adventures of Winnie the Pooh" which is an amalgamation of three Winnie-the-Pooh featurettes including "Blustery Day".

title: Hip Hip Pooh-Ray!
text: In the song, Pooh and Piglet are hailed as heroes (Pooh for saving Piglet's life, and Piglet for giving Owl his grand home in the beech tree).

title: Heffalumps and Woozles
text: "Heffalumps and Woozles" is a song from the 1968 Walt Disney musical film featurette "Winnie the Pooh and the Blustery Day".

title: Heffalumps and Woozles
text: It was written by the Sherman Brothers, and performed by The Mellomen.

title: Heffalumps and Woozles
text: It is also in the 1977 full-length feature film "The Many Adventures of Winnie the Pooh".

title: Winnie the Pooh and the Blustery Day
text: Winnie the Pooh and the Blustery Day is a 1968 animated featurette based on the third, fifth, ninth, and tenth chapters from "Winnie-the-Pooh" and the second, eighth, and ninth chapters from "The House at Pooh Corner" by A. A. Milne.

title: Winnie the Pooh and the Blustery Day
text: The featurette was produced by Walt Disney Productions and released by Buena Vista Distribution Company on December 20, 1968 as a double feature with "The Horse in the Gray Flannel Suit".

title: Winnie the Pooh and the Blustery Day
text: This was the second of the studio's Winnie the Pooh shorts.

title: Winnie the Pooh and the Blustery Day
text: It was later added as a segment to the 1977 film "The Many Adventures of Winnie the Pooh".

title: Winnie the Pooh and the Blustery Day
text: The music was written by Richard M. Sherman and Robert B. Sherman.

title: Winnie the Pooh and the Blustery Day
text: It was notable for being the last animated short produced by Walt Disney, who died during its production.

title: Brianne Siddall
text: Brianne Siddall (born August 25, 1963 in Encino, California), also known under her stage names of Ian Hawk and Brianne Brozey, is an American voice actress.

title: Brianne Siddall
text: She is known for voicing Tommy Himi and Calumon in over a hundred episodes of the popular anime "Digimon" and its video games, as well as for voicing Tsukasa and Elk in the anime ".

title: Brianne Siddall
text: hack//Sign" and the ".

title: Brianne Siddall
text: hack" games.

title: Brianne Siddall
text: In the late 1990s Siddall, under the stage name Ian Hawk, was hired to perform as the voice of Myōjin Yahiko for the Sony dub of the "Ruroni Kenshin" anime and OAV, which premiered in the United States under the title "Samurai X." This initial attempt to market the series proved unsuccessful and the series was later re-dubbed by Media Blasters, who chose to hire Bang Zoom!

title: Brianne Siddall
text: Entertainment to redub the series.

title: Brianne Siddall
text: She also voiced characters for Pioneer and Bang Zoom!

title: Brianne Siddall
text: including Kunikida in "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya", Ruby and Rina in "Saint Tail".

title: Brianne Siddall
text: In live-action voice-over, she voiced Impus, the infant version of the character Prince Olympius, in "Power Rangers Lightspeed Rescue", and Circuit the robotic owl in "Power Rangers Time Force".

title: Brianne Siddall
text: She voiced Jim Hawking, the kid crew member in "Outlaw Star", which had a run on Cartoon Network's Toonami and Adult Swim programming blocks, She also voiced main character Al Izuruha in the "Mobile Suit Gundam" OAV, "".

title: Kate Higgins
text: Catherine Davis "Kate" Higgins (born August 16, 1969 in Charlottesville, Virginia, U.S.), also known as Kate Davis, is an American voice actress, singer and jazz pianist.

title: Kate Higgins
text: Her major voice roles have been in English-language adaptations of Japanese anime, and is best known as the voice of Sakura Haruno in "Naruto".

title: Kate Higgins
text: She has also voiced C.C. in "Code Geass" and Saber in the original "Fate/stay Night".

title: Kate Higgins
text: In 2010, she voiced Miles "Tails" Prower in the video game series "Sonic the Hedgehog".

title: Kate Higgins
text: She also voices Kate, Stinky and Lilly in the "Alpha and Omega" sequels.

title: Kate Higgins
text: In 2014, She became the voice of Ami Mizuno / Sailor Mercury in the Viz English dub of "Sailor Moon".

title: The Rain Rain Rain Came Down Down Down
text: "The Rain Rain Rain Came Down Down Down" is a narrative song from the Walt Disney musical film featurette, "Winnie the Pooh and the Blustery Day".

title: The Rain Rain Rain Came Down Down Down
text: The song is also incorporated into the 1977 musical film "The Many Adventures of Winnie the Pooh" which is an amalgamation of three Winnie-the-Pooh featurettes including "Blustery Day".

title: The Rain Rain Rain Came Down Down Down
text: The song was written by the Sherman Brothers who have written most of the music for the Winnie-the-Pooh franchise over the many years.

title: The Rain Rain Rain Came Down Down Down
text: It was sung by an unidentified off-screen chorus with occasional lines sung by veteran character actor Sterling Holloway who provided the voice of Pooh.

title: A Rather Blustery Day
text: "A Rather Blustery Day" is a whimsical song from the Walt Disney musical film featurette, "Winnie the Pooh and the Blustery Day".

title: A Rather Blustery Day
text: It was written by Robert & Richard Sherman and sung by Jim Cummings as "Pooh".

title: The House That Jack Built (1967 film)
text: The House That Jack Built is a 1967 National Film Board of Canada animated short based on the nursery rhyme "This Is the House That Jack Built."

title: The House That Jack Built (1967 film)
text: Directed by Ron Tunis, written by and produced by Wolf Koenig, the eight-minute film was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Animated Short Film, losing to "Winnie the Pooh and the Blustery Day" at the 41st Academy Awards.

title: The House That Jack Built (1967 film)
text: Jack is desperate to escape his nine-to-five life.

title: The House That Jack Built (1967 film)
text: Mirroring the fairy tale, he trades his car for a handful of beans.

title: The Wonderful Thing About Tiggers
text: "The Wonderful Thing About Tiggers" is the theme song and personal anthem of Tigger, a fictional tiger from the children's book series Winnie-the-Pooh.

title: The Wonderful Thing About Tiggers
text: Although Tigger's birthday is believed to be in October 1928, the year that "The House at Pooh Corner" was first published, on Tigger-related merchandise, Disney often indicates Tigger's birth year as 1968, a reference to the first year that Tigger appeared in a Disney production, "Winnie the Pooh and the Blustery Day".

title: The Wonderful Thing About Tiggers
text: That was also the same instance when Tigger first sang this song.

title: The Wonderful Thing About Tiggers
text: The song is repeated in Disney's 1974 release "Winnie the Pooh and Tigger Too!

title: The Wonderful Thing About Tiggers
text: ", The Many Adventures of Winnie the Pooh ride and then again in the 1977 release "The Many Adventures of Winnie the Pooh".

title: The Wonderful Thing About Tiggers
text: "The Wonderful Thing About Tiggers" opens up the 2000 release of "The Tigger Movie".

title: The Wonderful Thing About Tiggers
text: In 1974, Paul Winchell earned a Grammy for his rendition of the song.

title: Siri Remote
text: The Siri Remote is a remote control device released in tandem with the 4th Generation Apple TV at an Apple Keynote Address by CEO Tim Cook on October 26, 2015 by Apple Inc. The Remote is designed specifically to work with the always-on Siri capable Apple TV.

title: Siri Remote
text: The device is a successor of the original Apple Remote.

title: Siri Remote
text: It is also compatible with the Apple TV 4K.

title: Apple Remote
text: The Apple Remote is a remote control device released in or after October 2005 by Apple Inc. for use with a number of its products which use infrared capabilities.

title: Apple Remote
text: The device was originally designed to interact with the Front Row media program on the iSight iMac G5 and is compatible with some later desktop and portable Macintosh computers.

title: Apple Remote
text: The first three generations of Apple TV used the Apple Remote as their primary control mechanism.

title: Apple Remote
text: It has now been replaced with the Siri Remote in the fourth generation.

title: Apple Remote
text: Prior to the Apple Remote, Apple produced several nameless IR remotes for products such as the Macintosh TV, TV tuner expansion boards, and the PowerCD drive.

title: NetSupport Manager
text: NetSupport Manager is a Windows-centric cross-platform remote control software, allowing remote screen control and systems management from a Windows or Windows Mobile device of Windows, Mac, Linux, Solaris and Mobile devices.

title: NetSupport Manager
text: It was first released for DOS only networks in 1989.

title: NetSupport Manager
text: It supports thumbnail display of unlimited remote systems (since version 10), and allows navigation between remote systems in a manner similar to a KVM switch.

title: NetSupport Manager
text: Functionality includes file transfers, chat, and hardware/software inventory including software updates. Fewer features are supported for Linux and Mac clients.

title: NetSupport Manager
text: In 2012 NetSupport introduced new software versions allowing Remote Control from iOS and Android tablets and smartphones as well as a new Mac OS Control.

title: NetSupport Manager
text: Version 12 was released in October 2013, which extended platform support to include ChromeOS clients.

title: NetSupport Manager
text: Mobile Remote Control from iOS and Android was also extended with additional capabilities.

title: NetSupport Manager
text: All versions of NetSupport Manager require the pre-installation of the software on both the local (Control) and remote (Client) computers/devices prior to use.

title: Remote control
text: In electronics, a remote control is a component of an electronic device used to operate the device wirelessly from a distance.

title: Remote control
text: For example, in consumer electronics, a remote control can be used to operate devices such as a television set, DVD player, or other home appliance, from a short distance.

title: Remote control
text: A remote control is primarily a convenience feature for the user, and can allow operation of devices that are out of convenient reach for direct operation of controls.

title: Remote control
text: In some cases, remote controls allow a person to operate a device that they otherwise would not be able to reach, as when a garage door opener is triggered from outside or when a Digital Light Processing projector that is mounted on a high ceiling is controlled by a person from the floor level.

title: Front Row (software)
text: Front Row is a discontinued media center software application for Apple's Macintosh computers and Apple TV for navigating and viewing video, photos, podcasts, and music from a computer, optical disc, or the Internet through a 10-foot user interface (similar to Windows Media Center and Kodi).

title: Front Row (software)
text: The software relies on iTunes and iPhoto and is controlled by an Apple Remote or the keyboard function keys.

title: Front Row (software)
text: The first version was released October 2005, with two major revisions since.

title: Front Row (software)
text: Front Row was removed and discontinued in Mac OS X 10.7.

title: Universal remote
text: A universal remote is a remote control that can be programmed to operate various brands of one or more types of consumer electronics devices.

title: Universal remote
text: Low-end universal remotes can only control a set number of devices determined by their manufacturer, while mid- and high-end universal remotes allow the user to program in new control codes to the remote.

title: Universal remote
text: Many remotes sold with various electronic include universal remote capabilities for other types of devices, which allow the remote to control other devices beyond the device it came with.

title: Universal remote
text: For example, a VCR remote may be programmed to operate various brands of televisions.

title: MacScan
text: MacScan is an anti-malware utility for Apple's Mac OS X developed by SecureMac.

title: MacScan
text: It is aimed at removing malware (including spyware, Trojan horses, keystroke loggers, and tracking cookies).

title: MacScan
text: It was the first anti-spyware program released for Mac OS X.

title: MacScan
text: In addition, the application scans for remote administration programs, like Apple Remote Desktop, allowing users to verify that such programs are installed only with their authorization.

title: Apple Remote Desktop
text: Apple Remote Desktop (ARD) is a Macintosh application produced by Apple Inc., first released on March 14, 2002, that replaced a similar product called "Apple Network Assistant".

title: Apple Remote Desktop
text: Aimed at computer administrators responsible for large numbers of computers and teachers who need to assist individuals or perform group demonstrations, Apple Remote Desktop allows users to remotely control or monitor other computers over a network.

title: Apple Watch
text: Apple Watch (stylized as WATCH) is a line of smartwatches developed, designed, and marketed by Apple Inc. It incorporates fitness tracking and health-oriented capabilities with integration with iOS and other Apple products and services.

title: Apple Watch
text: The original generation of the device was available in four variants: Apple Watch Sport, Apple Watch, Apple Watch Hermès, and Apple Watch Edition; each distinguished by different combinations of cases and first- or third-party interchangeable bands.

title: Apple Watch
text: Apple Watch relies on a wirelessly connected iPhone to perform many of its default functions such as calling and texting.

title: Apple Watch
text: It is compatible with the iPhone 5 or later models running iOS 8.2 or later, through the use of Wi-Fi or Bluetooth.

title: Apple Watch
text: Announced by Apple CEO Tim Cook in September 2014, the device was released in April 24, 2015.

title: Apple Watch
text: The Apple Watch quickly became the best-selling wearable device with the supply of 4.2 million smartwatches in the second quarter of the 2015 fiscal year.

title: Apple Watch
text: The second generation of Apple Watch, released in September 2016, includes two tiers: Apple Watch Series 2 and Apple Watch Series 1, which includes the S1P chip, but is otherwise identical to the original.

title: Apple Watch
text: The Series 3 was announced at a presentation at Apple Park on September 12, 2017 and was released on September 22, 2017.

title: Trainmaster Command Control
text: Trainmaster Command (TMCC) is Lionel's electronic control system for O scale 3-rail model trains and toy trains that mainly ran from 1994 to 2006.

title: Trainmaster Command Control
text: Conceptually it is similar to Digital Command Control (DCC), the industry's open standard used by HO scale and other 2-rail DC trains.

title: Trainmaster Command Control
text: It has one advantage over DCC, in that TMCC-equipped locomotives can run simultaneously with non-TMCC locomotives and Lionel Legacy engines as well as LionChief and LionChief Plus equipped locomotives.

title: Trainmaster Command Control
text: The latter require a dedicated remote controller.

title: Trainmaster Command Control
text: MTH Corporation's DCS controller can be configured to control TMCC locomotives, and all four systems (TMCC, Legacy, LionChief/LionChief+ and DCS) can be operated on the same track simultaneously.

title: Trainmaster Command Control
text: Each simply requires a constant track voltage (18 volts).

title: Trainmaster Command Control
text: TMCC/Legacy "broadcasts" it's signal to the antenna on the locomotives which listen for signals that first identify the particular locomotive by number and then it issues given commands as to speed, direction, sounds, lighting and other features.

title: Trainmaster Command Control
text: DCS performs similar functions but transmits a carrier over the rails which are picked up through the locomotive's electrical pickup contacts.

title: Trainmaster Command Control
text: While TMCC/Legacy and DCS remote controls relay operator commands to a device that transmits them to the train (Command Base or Track Interface Unit), LionChief/LionChief+ also issue remote control commands but the remote and locomotive are married and each locomotive requires a separate remote control.

title: Trainmaster Command Control
text: This system requires no additional wiring as the control is directly "narrowcast" to the locomotive in the same way as a television remote control or garage door opener functions.

title: Trainmaster Command Control
text: In 2017, Lionel released a universal remote for LionChief+ that will learn addresses for up to three locos at a time, simplifying the operation of multiple trains.

title: Badly Drawn Boy discography
text: The discography of English alternative music singer/songwriter Badly Drawn Boy (real name Damon Gough) includes eight studio albums (including two soundtracks), one compilation, six extended plays and twenty-one singles.

title: Badly Drawn Boy discography
text: The first EP and several singles were released on Gough's own label "Twisted Nerve", which he started with like-minded Manchester musician Andy Votel.

title: Badly Drawn Boy discography
text: Badly Drawn Boy rose in popularity in 1997 when he joined the likes of Thom Yorke, Richard Ashcroft, and Mike D on the celebrity-filled UNKLE album "Psyence Fiction".

title: Badly Drawn Boy discography
text: Due to the mild UK chart success of the 1999 single "Once Around the Block", XL Recordings signed up Badly Drawn Boy to release the debut album "The Hour of Bewilderbeast" in 2000.

title: Badly Drawn Boy discography
text: The album won critical praise and Britain's acclaimed Mercury Prize for Best Album.

title: Badly Drawn Boy discography
text: The album caught the attention of author Nick Hornby who then asked Gough to score the film being made for his book "About a Boy".

title: Soulfire (Tom Hingley album)
text: Soulfire came at a time when Tom Hingley (ex-frontman of Inspiral Carpets) was at an all-time low contemplating his career, the future and having doubts that he was good enough to make a stab at a solo career.

title: Soulfire (Tom Hingley album)
text: Damon Gough (aka Badly Drawn Boy) persuaded Tom that you've just got to follow that gut instinct and go for what you believe in.

title: Soulfire (Tom Hingley album)
text: After the release of the critically acclaimed solo acoustic 2000 album, Keep Britain Untidy, this return to a full band rock album allowed a base to build on and showed off the voice that had been hidden amongst the Inspiral's trademark organ sound.

title: Something to Talk About (Badly Drawn Boy song)
text: "Something to Talk About" is a song by British musical artist Badly Drawn Boy from About a Boy.

title: Something to Talk About (Badly Drawn Boy song)
text: It was released as a single on 30 July 2002.

title: Something to Talk About (Badly Drawn Boy song)
text: It peaked at number 28 on the UK Singles Chart.

title: Under an Hour
text: Under an Hour is the second full-length album from Portland-based experimental pop/rock group Menomena.

title: Under an Hour
text: The album was originally composed and performed as accompaniment for a performance by Portland dance company Monster Squad.

title: Under an Hour
text: Consisting of three instrumental tracks, the album is considered to be an experimental soundtrack along the lines of Peter Gabriel's or Badly Drawn Boy's soundtrack for "About a Boy".

title: Craig Davies (musician)
text: Craig Davies is an English singer/songwriter from Manchester, who was active from 1988 to 1990 and release two albums on the Rough Trade music label.

title: Craig Davies (musician)
text: He was at one point vocalist for the band Easterhouse but left after signing a solo deal with Rough Trade.

title: Craig Davies (musician)
text: He has also collaborated with Vini Reilly, Ben Watt and Badly Drawn Boy.

title: Silent Sigh
text: "Silent Sigh" is a single by British musical artist Badly Drawn Boy from the soundtrack to the film "About a Boy".

title: Silent Sigh
text: It reached number 16 in the UK Singles Chart.

title: About a Boy (soundtrack)
text: About a Boy is the second album by English singer-songwriter Badly Drawn Boy, released in 2002 under Twisted Nerve Records and XL Recordings, and in America under the short-lived ARTISTdirect Records, as the soundtrack to the film "About a Boy".

title: About a Boy (soundtrack)
text: Gough was chosen to compose and perform the entire soundtrack.

title: The Hour of Bewilderbeast
text: The Hour of Bewilderbeast is the debut studio album by British musician Badly Drawn Boy, released on 26 June 2000.

title: The Hour of Bewilderbeast
text: Damon Gough, who performs as Badly Drawn Boy, wrote, produced, and played several instruments on the album's eighteen tracks, several of which also feature accompaniment by members of the British indie rock bands Alfie and Doves.

title: The Hour of Bewilderbeast
text: "The Hour of Bewilderbeast" was released to great critical acclaim and went on to win the 2000 Mercury Prize, and has sold 455,000 copies in the United Kingdom as of September 2011.

title: About a Boy (film)
text: About a Boy is a 2002 British-American-French comedy-drama film produced by Jane Rosenthal, Robert De Niro, Brad Epstein, Tim Bevan and Eric Fellner, co-written and directed by brothers Chris Weitz and Paul Weitz with music by Badly Drawn Boy and written by Peter Hedges.

title: About a Boy (film)
text: It is an adaptation of the 1998 novel of the same name by Nick Hornby.

title: About a Boy (film)
text: The film stars are Hugh Grant, Nicholas Hoult, Toni Collette, and Rachel Weisz.

title: About a Boy (film)
text: The film at times uses double voice-over narration, when the audience hears both Will's and Marcus's thoughts.

title: Tom Rothrock
text: Tom Rothrock is an international record producer, composer, musician and owner of Bong Load Records.

title: Tom Rothrock
text: Tom Rothrock has worked with James Blunt, Foo Fighters, Moby, Beck, Badly Drawn Boy, R. L. Burnside, Athlete, Sloan, Gwen Stefani, Motörhead, Elbow, Stevie Nicks, Poison, Elliott Smith, Richard Thompson, Yonder Mountain String Band.

title: Tom Rothrock
text: Rothrock has also composed or contributed to soundtracks for notable motion pictures such as "About A Boy", "Good Will Hunting", "Collateral" and "The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie".

title: Sommeren '92
text: Summer of '92 (Sommeren '92) is a Danish film directed by Kasper Barfoed.

title: Sommeren '92
text: The film is based on the 1992 UEFA European Football Championship, Denmark's greatest ever football triumph.

title: Sommeren '92
text: The team had qualified only after Yugoslavia was disqualified as a result of the breakup and warfare in that country.

title: Sommeren '92
text: The film examines the often difficult relationship between the team's coach Richard Møller Nielsen, and the Danish Football Association and leading players that nonetheless led to triumph in 1992.

title: Pelé
text: Edson Arantes do Nascimento (] ; born 23 October 1940), known as Pelé (] ), is a retired Brazilian professional footballer who played as a forward.

title: Pelé
text: He is widely regarded as the greatest football player of all time.

title: Pelé
text: In 1999, he was voted World Player of the Century by the International Federation of Football History & Statistics (IFFHS).

title: Pelé
text: That same year, Pelé was elected Athlete of the Century by the International Olympic Committee.

title: Pelé
text: According to the IFFHS, Pelé is the most successful league goal-scorer in the world, scoring 1281 goals in 1363 games, which included unofficial friendlies and tour games.

title: Pelé
text: During his playing days, Pelé was for a period the best-paid athlete in the world.

title: IFFHS World's Best Club Coach
text: The IFFHS World's Best Club Coach is an association football award given annually, since 1996, to the most outstanding club coach as voted by the International Federation of Football History & Statistics (IFFHS).

title: IFFHS World's Best Club Coach
text: The votes, in 1996, were cast by IFFHS's editorial staff as well as experts from 89 countries spanning six different continents.

title: IFFHS World's Best Club Coach
text: Since then, the votes are now awarded by 81 experts and selected editorial offices from all of the continents.

title: IFFHS World's Best Goalkeeper
text: The IFFHS World's Best Goalkeeper is a football award given annually since 1987 to the most outstanding goalkeeper of the year as voted by the International Federation of Football History & Statistics (IFFHS).

title: IFFHS World's Best Goalkeeper
text: The votes are cast by IFFHS's editorial staff as well as experts from different continents.

title: IFFHS World's Best Goalkeeper
text: currently the worlds best goalkeeper from 2013-2016 is Manuel Neuer.

title: Isaak Hassler
text: Isaak Hassler (c. 1530, St. Joachimsthal – 14 July 1591, Nuremberg) was a German Lutheran organist and music teacher, mainly active in Nuremberg.

title: Isaak Hassler
text: He is also notable as the father of the musicians Jakob Hassler, Hans Leo Hassler and Kasper Hassler.

title: Goštautai
text: Goštautai (Lithuanian plural form), masculine Goštautas and feminine form Goštautaitė ("Polish" original, after Kasper Niesiecki - Gastoldowie, later transformed into Gasztołdowie) were a Lithuanian noble family, one of the most influential magnate families during the 15th and early 16th centuries.

title: Goštautai
text: Their only serious rivals were the Kęsgailos, and from the end of the 15th century the fast rising in power and influence Radziwiłł family clan.

title: Goštautai
text: It appears from the Latin original spelling of their name Gastoldus which is a variation of "castaldius" that they had been close to the Grand Dukes and that their function was to oversee ducal demesne.

title: Goštautai
text: Most power family gained during the reign of Casimir Jagiellon.

title: Goštautai
text: The castaldius of Vytautas, Andrius Goštautas might have been a voivode of Vilnius and Kreva, and father of Jonas, appears to have been the precursor of the family growth.

title: Goštautai
text: The majority of the family's possessions (lands) were in the western part of the Duchy and eastern ethnic Lithuania.

title: Goštautai
text: After the death of the last scion of the family, Stanislovas Goštautas, the Polish King and Grand Duke of Lithuania Sigismund II Augustus inherited his possessions as a matter of right, per Grand Duchy of Lithuania law.

title: Kasper Hvidt
text: Kasper Hvidt (born 6 February 1976 in Copenhagen) is a Danish retired handball goalkeeper, who lastly played for KIF Kolding and previous Danish national team.

title: Kasper Hvidt
text: He was selected as the best keeper for the 2008 European Men's Handball Championship.

title: Kasper Hvidt
text: Hvidt was also voted as Goalkeeper of the Year March 20, 2009, second place was Thierry Omeyer from France.

title: Kasper Schmeichel
text: Kasper Peter Schmeichel (] ; born 5 November 1986) is a Danish professional footballer who plays as a goalkeeper for Premier League club Leicester City and the Denmark national team.

title: Kasper Schmeichel
text: He is the son of former Manchester United and Danish international goalkeeper Peter Schmeichel.

title: Gus Williams (musician)
text: Kasper Gus Ntjalka Williams OAM, known as Gus Williams (20 June 1937 – 13 September 2010) was a country singer from Hermannsburg in Central Australia.

title: Gus Williams (musician)
text: He was an Arrernte man, who was born in Alice Springs.

title: Gus Williams (musician)
text: He was the father of country star Warren H Williams.

title: Peter Schmeichel
text: Peter Bolesław Schmeichel MBE (] ; born 18 November 1963) is a Danish former professional footballer who played as a goalkeeper, and was voted the IFFHS World's Best Goalkeeper in 1992 and 1993.

title: Peter Schmeichel
text: He is best remembered for his most successful years at English club Manchester United, whom he captained to the 1999 UEFA Champions League to complete the Treble, and for winning UEFA Euro 1992 with Denmark.

title: Puss N' Boots/These Boots Are Made for Walkin'
text: "Puss N' Boots/These Boots (Are Made for Walkin')" is a song by Canadian synthpop band Kon Kan, released as the third single from their 1989 album "Move to Move".

title: Puss N' Boots/These Boots Are Made for Walkin'
text: The song peaked at #61 in their native Canada, and at #58 on the U.S. "Billboard" Hot 100.

title: Puss N' Boots/These Boots Are Made for Walkin'
text: In October 1989, the song peaked at #11 in New Zealand.

title: These Boots Are Made for Walkin'
text: "These Boots Are Made for Walkin' is a hit song written by Lee Hazlewood and recorded by Nancy Sinatra.

title: These Boots Are Made for Walkin'
text: It charted January 22, 1966 and reached No. 1 in the United States "Billboard" Hot 100 and in the UK Singles Chart.

title: Boots (EP)
text: Boots is an EP by KMFDM, featuring a cover of the Nancy Sinatra song "These Boots Are Made for Walkin'".

title: Boots (EP)
text: It was the first release by the band after their three-year hiatus.

title: Kon Kan
text: Kon Kan is a Canadian synthpop project conceived and formed in 1988 by Barry Harris in Toronto, Ontario.

title: Kon Kan
text: Kon Kan were awarded a 1990 Juno for the song "I Beg Your Pardon" and nominated for a 1991 Juno Award for the single "Puss N' Boots/These Boots Are Made for Walkin'".

title: Murong Yong
text: Murong Yong (; died 394), courtesy name Shuming (叔明), was the last emperor of the Xianbei state Western Yan.

title: Murong Yong
text: He was the grandson of Murong Yun (慕容運), the uncle of Former Yan's founder Murong Huang.

title: Murong Yong
text: As a member of Former Yan's imperial clan, he was moved to Guanzhong, Former Qin's capital region, when Former Qin destroyed Former Yan in 370.

title: Murong Yong
text: He was described as poor, and he and his wife made their living by selling boots.

title: Nancy Sinatra
text: Nancy Sandra Sinatra (born June 8, 1940) is an American singer and actress.

title: Nancy Sinatra
text: She is the elder daughter of Frank Sinatra and Nancy (Barbato) Sinatra, and is widely known for her 1966 signature hit "These Boots Are Made for Walkin'".

title: Boots (album)
text: Boots is a 1966 debut studio album by Nancy Sinatra.

title: Boots (album)
text: The album was produced by Lee Hazlewood.

title: Boots (album)
text: Billy Strange was the arranger and conductor.

title: Boots (album)
text: The album is titled after the song on the album "These Boots Are Made for Walkin'", which became a #1 hit for Sinatra.

title: Boots (album)
text: Most of the other songs on the album are covers of then-recent hits.

title: Jim Shoulders
text: James A. Shoulders (May 13, 1928 – June 20, 2007) was an American professional rodeo cowboy and rancher.

title: Jim Shoulders
text: He is commemorated at the ProRodeo Hall of Fame and at the time of his death, was the most successful contestant in the Professional Rodeo Cowboys Association (PRCA).

title: Jim Shoulders
text: Known as the 'Babe Ruth of rodeo', Shoulders was a spokesperson for a number of commercial products such as Miller Lite, Justin Boots and Wrangler Jeans.

title: Jim Shoulders
text: He was born in Tulsa, Oklahoma and died in Henryetta, Oklahoma.

title: Jim Shoulders
text: He was of English descent.

title: Death of Abdul Wali
text: Abdul Wali was an Afghan man who died in US custody on June 21, 2003 at the age of 28.

title: Death of Abdul Wali
text: At the time of his death, he had been held for three days at the US base 10 miles south of Asadabad, in Kunar Province, Afghanistan, on suspicion of involvement in a rocket attack on the same base.

title: Death of Abdul Wali
text: The cause of his death was at first reported to be a heart attack, but this came into question when three members of the U.S. 82nd Airborne Division came forward to testify that CIA contractor David Passaro assaulted Wali.

title: Death of Abdul Wali
text: Passaro, a former U.S. Army Ranger, allegedly beat Wali for two consecutive nights, causing grievous injuries including a fractured pelvis.

title: Death of Abdul Wali
text: Prosecutors would charge that Passaro ordered soldiers not to allow Wali to sleep, limited his access to food and water and subjected him to two consecutive nights of interrogation and beatings.

title: Death of Abdul Wali
text: Among other injuries, Wali suffered a suspected fractured pelvis that would have made it impossible for him to urinate.

title: Death of Abdul Wali
text: Witnesses testified that during one session Passaro, while wearing combat boots, kicked Wali in the groin hard enough to lift him off the ground, threw Wali to the ground, beat Wali on the arms and legs with a heavy Maglite flashlight, and that Passaro also vigorously thrust a flashlight into Wali's abdomen.

title: Death of Abdul Wali
text: After the second night of beatings, Wali begged the soldiers to kill him and moaned a phrase that meant, "I'm dying."

title: Death of Abdul Wali
text: Wali died on his fourth day in custody.

title: Death of Abdul Wali
text: He repeatedly denied any involvement in the rocket attacks.

title: The Twenty-fifth Anniversary Anthology
text: The Twenty-fifth Anniversary Anthology is a compilation album released by The Fixx in 2006 in celebration of their 25th anniversary.

title: The Twenty-fifth Anniversary Anthology
text: It contains singles, album and live tracks from their previous albums, together with a cover version of Nancy Sinatra's "These Boots Are Made for Walkin'" that was originally recorded for the multi-artist album "When Pigs Fly: Songs You Thought You'd Never Hear".

title: The Twenty-fifth Anniversary Anthology
text: The eight page booklet contains an essay by Josh Norek.

title: 2010–11 VCU Rams men's basketball team
text: The 2010–11 VCU Rams men's basketball team represented Virginia Commonwealth University in the Colonial Athletic Association conference during the 2010–11 NCAA Division I men's basketball season.

title: 2010–11 VCU Rams men's basketball team
text: The Rams, led by second year head coach Shaka Smart, played their home games at the Stuart C. Siegel Center.

title: 2010–11 VCU Rams men's basketball team
text: They finished the season 28–12, 12–6 in CAA play and lost in the championship game of the 2011 CAA Men's Basketball Tournament to Old Dominion.

title: 2010–11 VCU Rams men's basketball team
text: They received an at-large bid in the 2011 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament where they played in the new "First Four" round, defeating Southern California.

title: 2010–11 VCU Rams men's basketball team
text: They defeated Georgetown and Purdue in the second and third rounds, respectively, to advance to the "Sweet Sixteen".

title: 2010–11 VCU Rams men's basketball team
text: The defeated Florida State to advance to the "Elite Eight" where they defeated Kansas.

title: 2010–11 VCU Rams men's basketball team
text: They advanced to the school's first ever "Final Four", being just the third 11 seed in Tournament history to advance to the "Final Four", where they were defeated by Butler.

title: 2010–11 VCU Rams men's basketball team
text: The VCU Rams finished 6th in the ESPN/USA Today Coaches Poll at the end of the season.

title: 2010–11 VCU Rams men's basketball team
text: This was the highest ranking in VCU's history and the highest ranking of any team from the CAA.

title: 2010–11 VCU Rams men's basketball team
text: The 2011 NCAA tournament run by VCU is regarded as one of the best Cinderella runs of all time.

title: 2010–11 VCU Rams men's basketball team
text: To date, they are the only men's Division I basketball team whose NCAA tournament journey ran from The First Four to the Final Four.

title: 2010–11 VCU Rams men's basketball team
text: They are also the only team in the tournament to win five games, and not qualify for the national championship game.

title: 2004–05 VCU Rams men's basketball team
text: The 2004–05 VCU Rams men's basketball team represented Virginia Commonwealth University during the 2004–05 NCAA Division I men's basketball season.

title: 2004–05 VCU Rams men's basketball team
text: It was the 37th season of the University fielding a men's basketball program.

title: 2004–05 VCU Rams men's basketball team
text: Led by third-year head coach Jeff Capel III, they continued to play their home games at the Stuart C. Siegel Center.

title: 2004–05 VCU Rams men's basketball team
text: They were a member of the Atlantic 10 Conference.

title: 2004–05 VCU Rams men's basketball team
text: They finished the season 19–13, 13–5 in CAA play to finish in a tie for second place.

title: 2004–05 VCU Rams men's basketball team
text: The Rams defeated Delaware and UNC Wilmington in the CAA Tournmanet, before losing to Old Dominion in the final.

title: 2004–05 VCU Rams men's basketball team
text: They received an at-large bid to the NIT where they lost in the opening round to Davidson.

text: Led by sixth-year head coach Shaka Smart, they continued to play their home games at the Stuart C. Siegel Center.

title: 2011–12 VCU Rams men's basketball team

title: Huernia
text: The genus Huernia (family Apocynaceae, subfamily Asclepiadoideae) consists of stem succulents from Eastern and Southern Africa, first described as a genus in 1810.

title: Huernia
text: The flowers are five-lobed, usually somewhat more funnel- or bell-shaped than in the closely related genus "Stapelia", and often striped vividly in contrasting colours or tones, some glossy, others matt and wrinkled depending on the species concerned.

title: Huernia
text: To pollinate, the flowers attract flies by emitting a scent similar to that of carrion.

title: Huernia
text: The genus is considered close to the genera "Stapelia" and "Hoodia".

title: Huernia
text: The name is in honour of Justin Heurnius (1587–1652) a Dutch missionary who is reputed to have been the first collector of South African Cape plants.

title: Huernia
text: His name was actually mis-spelt by the collector.

title: New York Shipbuilding Corporation
text: The New York Shipbuilding Corporation (or New York Ship for short) was an American shipbuilding company that operated from 1899 to 1968, ultimately completing more than 500 vessels for the U.S. Navy, the United States Merchant Marine, the United States Coast Guard, and other maritime concerns.

title: New York Shipbuilding Corporation
text: At its peak during World War II, NYSB was the largest and most productive shipyard in the world.

title: New York Shipbuilding Corporation
text: Its best-known vessels include the destroyer , the cruiser , the aircraft carrier , the nuclear-powered cargo ship NS "Savannah", and a quartet of cargo-passenger liners nicknamed the "Four Aces".

title: Kaiser Shipyards
text: The Kaiser Shipyards were seven major shipbuilding yards located on the United States west coast during World War II.

title: Kaiser Shipyards
text: Kaiser ranked 20th among U.S. corporations in the value of wartime production contracts.

title: Kaiser Shipyards
text: The shipyards were owned by the Kaiser Shipbuilding Company, a creation of American industrialist Henry J. Kaiser, (1882-1967), who established the shipbuilding company around 1939 in order to help meet the construction goals set by the United States Maritime Commission for merchant shipping.

title: Eagle Mountain Railroad
text: The Eagle Mountain Railroad (EMRR) was a private railroad in California, owned by the Kaiser Steel Corporation, and is owned today by Kaiser Steel's successor, Kaiser Ventures, Inc. of Ontario, California.

title: Nutri Ventures – The Quest for the 7 Kingdoms
text: Nutri Ventures (also known as Nutri Ventures – The Quest for the 7 Kingdoms) (Portuguese: Nutri Ventures - Em Busca dos 7 Reinos) is a Portuguese TV series produced by the Nutri Ventures Corporation that is distributed through Hulu Kids.

title: Edgar Kaiser Sr.
text: Edgar Fosburgh Kaiser Sr. (July 29, 1908 – December 7, 1981) was an American industrialist, who was Chairman of Kaiser Aluminum and Chemical Corporation, the Kaiser Cement Corporation and the Kaiser Steel Corporation.

title: Kaiser Ventures
text: Kaiser Ventures (formerly Kaiser Steel) corporation, headquartered in Ontario, California.

title: Kaiser Ventures
text: It was founded by Henry J. Kaiser to provide steel plate for the Pacific Coast shipbuilding industry, which expanded during World War II, then shrank, then expanded again during the Korean War.

title: Kaiser Ventures
text: California Shipbuilding Corporation on Terminal Island, California, was one of these shipyards which built hundreds of Liberty ships and Victory ships in World War II, and was also a project of Henry Kaiser.

title: Kaiser Ventures
text: Kaiser Steel was noted for making the most of its costly steelmaking inputs, and it captured, along with the U.S. Steel plant in Utah, much of the Pacific Coast steel market by the late 1950s.

title: Kaiser Ventures
text: Its assets included steelmaking plants in Napa, California (that it acquired from Basalt Rock Company in 1955) and Fontana, California (now operated by California Steel Industries), and a former open-pit iron ore mine at Eagle Mountain, California.

title: Kaiser Ventures
text: Steel manufactured was also used in Kaiser Motors.

title: John Roach & Sons
text: John Roach & Sons was a major 19th-century American shipbuilding and manufacturing firm founded in 1864 by Irish-American immigrant John Roach.

title: John Roach & Sons
text: Between 1871 and 1885, the company was the largest shipbuilding firm in the United States, building more iron ships than its next two major competitors combined.

title: John Roach & Sons
text: It was also by far the largest contractor to the U.S. Navy during this period, and at its peak is said to have been the nation's largest employer behind the railroads.

title: Neafie & Levy
text: Neafie, Levy & Co., commonly known as Neafie & Levy, was a Philadelphia shipbuilding and engineering firm that existed from the middle of the 19th to the beginning of the 20th century.

title: Neafie & Levy
text: Described as America's "first specialist marine engineers", Neafie & Levy was probably the first company in the United States to combine the building of iron ships with the manufacture of steam engines to power them.

title: Neafie & Levy
text: The company was also the largest supplier of screw propellers to other North American shipbuilding firms in its early years, and at its peak in the early 1870s was Philadelphia's busiest and most heavily capitalized shipbuilder.

title: Edgar Kaiser Jr.
text: Edgar Fosburgh Kaiser Jr. (July 5, 1942 – January 11, 2012) was an American-Canadian financier and a former owner of the Denver Broncos American football team.

title: Edgar Kaiser Jr.
text: He was born in Portland, Oregon on July 5, 1942 and is the grandson of shipbuilding industrialist Henry J. Kaiser.

title: Edgar Kaiser Jr.
text: He earned a BA degree from Stanford University and an MBA degree from Harvard University.

title: Edgar Kaiser Jr.
text: Kaiser served as a White House Fellow and as a Special Assistant to President Lyndon B. Johnson, President Richard M. Nixon, and as a Special Assistant to U.S. Secretary of the Interior Walter J. Hickel.

title: Edgar Kaiser Jr.
text: He became a Canadian citizen in 1980.

title: Edgar Kaiser Jr.
text: He died on January 11, 2012.

title: Henry J. Kaiser
text: Henry John Kaiser (May 9, 1882 – August 24, 1967) was an American industrialist who became known as the father of modern American shipbuilding.

title: Henry J. Kaiser
text: He established the Kaiser Shipyards, which built Liberty ships during World War II, after which he formed Kaiser Aluminum and Kaiser Steel.

title: Henry J. Kaiser
text: Kaiser organized Kaiser Permanente health care for his workers and their families.

title: Henry J. Kaiser
text: He led Kaiser-Frazer followed by Kaiser Motors, automobile companies known for the safety of their designs.

title: Henry J. Kaiser
text: Kaiser was involved in large construction projects such as civic centers and dams, and invested in real estate.

title: Henry J. Kaiser
text: With his wealth, he established the Kaiser Family Foundation, a nonprofit, non-partisan, charitable organization.

title: Tunnels & Trolls
text: Tunnels & Trolls (abbreviated "T&T") is a fantasy role-playing game designed by Ken St. Andre and first published in 1975 by Flying Buffalo.

title: Tunnels & Trolls
text: The second modern role-playing game published, it was written by Ken St. Andre to be a more accessible alternative to "Dungeons & Dragons" and is suitable for solitaire, group, and play-by-mail gameplay.

title: Mercenaries, Spies and Private Eyes
text: Mercenaries, Spies and Private Eyes ("MSPE") is a tabletop role-playing game designed and written by Michael A. Stackpole and first published in April 1983 by Blade, a division of Flying Buffalo, Inc.

title: Mercenaries, Spies and Private Eyes
text: A second edition was later published by Sleuth Publications, but Flying Buffalo continues to distribute the game.

title: Mercenaries, Spies and Private Eyes
text: "MSPE"'s mechanics are based on those of "Tunnels and Trolls", with the addition of a skill system for characters.

title: Mercenaries, Spies and Private Eyes
text: A few adventure modules were also released for "MSPE".

title: Mercenaries, Spies and Private Eyes
text: The ruleset of 1987 video game "Wasteland", on which Michael A. Stackpole worked, is based on "MSPE"; as the upcoming 2013 sequel "Wasteland 2" will use similar mechanics, so it too can be seen as based on MSPE.

title: Crank Caverns
text: Crank Caverns is the common name of the remains of the Rainford Delph Quarry near Crank in St. Helens, Merseyside.

title: Crank Caverns
text: It is a network of underground tunnels and caverns, as well as an extensive woodland.

title: Crank Caverns
text: Information in the St. Helens local history archives states that sandstone quarrying began here as early as 1730.

title: Crank Caverns
text: As the quarry expanded, the cost of purchasing land to open cast mine it increased, so it was decided to opt for a different method.

title: Crank Caverns
text: Instead of quarrying out the stone, they would mine it out, following a seam of stone until it ran out.

title: Crank Caverns
text: This resulted in the network of caves, tunnels and shafts we see today.

title: Crank Caverns
text: Rainford Delph is listed as a Colliery by 1854, under the ownership of Charles Howarth or Yorkshire Charlie as he was known locally by 1880.

title: Crank Caverns
text: Mining finally ceased and the woods and caverns were used as a game reserve by the Earl of Derby until 1939, when they became a storage facility for ammunition for the anti-aircraft position at Crank.

title: Crank Caverns
text: After the war, the caverns ceased use as a game reserve.

title: Crank Caverns
text: Today, Crank Caverns are not officially open to the public and due to their increasing instability, attempts have been made to close access to the caverns and tunnels themselves.

title: Crank Caverns
text: Despite this, the site is still physically accessible from a nearby public footpath and is still a draw for generations of curious locals who wish to explore, many having heard the numerous local myths and legends from an early age.

title: Jon St. Andre
text: Jon St. Andre (born December 8, 1939 in Ishpeming, Michigan) is an American former ski jumper who competed in the 1960 Winter Olympics.

title: St. Andre (Goa Assembly constituency)
text: St. Andre Vidhan Sabha Constituency is one of the 40 Goa Legislative Assembly constituencies of the state of Goa in southern India.

title: St. Andre (Goa Assembly constituency)
text: St. Andre is also one of the 20 constituencies falling under the North Goa Lok Sabha constituency.

title: Tunnels & Trolls: Crusaders of Khazan
text: Crusaders of Khazan is a computer adaptation of the tabletop role-playing game "Tunnels and Trolls", developed and published by New World Computing in 1990 for the PC, FM Towns, PC-88 and PC-98.

title: Tunnels & Trolls: Crusaders of Khazan
text: The game is available from Flying Buffalo and in Fiery Dragon's "Tunnels and Trolls 30th Anniversary Edition".

title: Jim St. Andre
text: Jim St. Andre is a retired U.S. soccer goalkeeper.

title: Jim St. Andre
text: He played professionally in the American Professional Soccer League, National Professional Soccer League and Major League Soccer.

title: Starfaring
text: Starfaring is a science fiction role-playing game created by Ken St. Andre and published by Flying Buffalo in August 1976.

title: St. Andre's Parish
text: St. Andre's Parish is a former parish of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Portland, located Biddeford, Maine.

title: St. Andre's Parish
text: The parish was founded in 1860 to serve the city's large French-Canadian and French-American communities.

title: St. Andre's Parish
text: On July 1, 2008, St. Andres was merged into the newly formed Good Shepherd Parish, made up of Saint Joseph's Church in Biddeford, Saint Mary's Church in Biddeford, Most Holy Trinity Church in Saco, Notre Dame Church in Saco, Saint Margaret's Church in Old Orchard Beach, Saint Lukes in Old Orchard Beach, Saint Brendan's in Biddeford Pool,and St. Phillip's Church in Lyman.

title: St. Andre's Parish
text: Of those 8 Churches, only Saint Joseph, Most Holy Trinity, Saint Margaret, and Saint Philip remain open.

title: St. Andre's Parish
text: (St. Brendan's has always, and continues to serve as a summer chapel.)

title: St. Andre's Parish
text: The parish complex of four buildings, including the church, rectory, convent, and school, was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2015, at which time most of it stood vacant.

title: Ken St. Andre
text: Kenneth Eugene St. Andre (born on April 28, 1947 in Ogden, Utah) is an American fantasy author and game designer, best known for his work with "Tunnels & Trolls" and "Wasteland".

title: Ken St. Andre
text: He has been an active member of "The Science Fiction and Fantasy Writers of America" since 1989.

title: Greatest Hits (Dan Fogelberg album)
text: Greatest Hits is a compilation album by American recording artist Dan Fogelberg.

title: Greatest Hits (Dan Fogelberg album)
text: It included two previously unreleased tracks, "Missing You" and "Make Love Stay", both of which were released as singles and peaked at chart positions #23 and #29 on the "Billboard" Hot 100 chart, respectively.

title: Greatest Hits (Dan Fogelberg album)
text: Both of the new songs made the Top 10 on the adult contemporary chart, with "Missing You" rising to #6 and "Make Love Stay" becoming the singer's third #1 on the AC chart.

title: Make Love Not War (album)
text: Make Love Not War is the 2004 debut album by Australian alternative rock band Cosmic Nomads recorded in Sydney, New South Wales at Damien Gerard Studios.

title: Make Love Not War (album)
text: Cosmic Nomads worked with renowned engineer Russell Pilling who, with 25 years experience, has recorded The Vines, The Church (band), The Cruel Sea (band) and Jon Stevens.

title: Make Love Not War (album)
text: A single and music video of the same name were released and distributed by MGM Sydney prior to the album release.

title: Make Love Not War (album)
text: Pilling said "Make Love Not War" "is a grower, once you listen to it a few times you begin to appreciate what it means".

title: Make Love
text: "Make Love" is a song performed by American recording artist and songwriter Keri Hilson.

title: Make Love
text: It was written by Jamal "Polow da Don" Jones, Ester Dean and Jason Perry, and produced by Polow da Don and Perry for Hilson's debut studio album, "In a Perfect World..." (2009).

title: Make Love
text: The song was sent for urban adult contemporary airplay on June 23, 2009 as the fifth single from the album.

title: Make Love
text: Musically, "Make Love" is a downtempo R&B ballad.

title: Make Love
text: The song received mixed reviews from music critics; some of them criticized its long length and Hilson's vocals, while others named it one of the album's standouts.

title: I Just Want to Make Love to You
text: "I Just Want to Make Love to You" is a 1954 blues song written by Willie Dixon, first recorded by Muddy Waters, and released as "Just Make Love to Me" (Chess 1571).

title: I Just Want to Make Love to You
text: The song reached number four on "Billboard" magazine's R&B Best Sellers chart.

title: Mind If We Make Love to You
text: Mind If We Make Love to You is an album by the American power pop group Wondermints.

title: Mind If We Make Love to You
text: It was released in 2002 on record label Smile Records.

title: Mind If We Make Love to You
text: The unusual album title, with its intentional lack of punctuation, is a take-off of "Mind If I Make Love to You", an album of 1950s cocktail instrumentals in Darian Sahanaja's record collection.

title: Chuck Berry on Stage
text: Chuck Berry on Stage is an album by Chuck Berry, released in 1963 by Chess Records.

title: Chuck Berry on Stage
text: Although promoted as a live album, it is a collection of previously released studio recordings (except for 5 songs..."All Aboard", "Trick or Treat", "I Just Want To Make Love To You", "Still Got The Blues", and a previously unreleased alternate take of "Brown-Eyed Handsome Man") with overdubbed audience sounds to simulate a live recording.

title: Chuck Berry on Stage
text: One track on the album labelled "Surfin' USA", is "Sweet Little Sixteen", originally released in 1958, the melody of which was used in The Beach Boys' 1963 hit "Surfin' USA".

title: Chuck Berry on Stage
text: Chuck's cover of Willie Dixon's "I Just Want To Make Love To You" was later re-recorded and released on the very rare Chess LP CH60032 "Chuck Berry" in 1975.

title: All I Wanna Do Is Make Love to You
text: "All I Wanna Do Is Make Love to You" is a song by the rock band Heart.

title: All I Wanna Do Is Make Love to You
text: It was composed by veteran songwriter and producer Robert John "Mutt" Lange and released as the lead single from the band's tenth studio album, "Brigade", as well as their first hit single of the 1990s.

title: All I Wanna Do Is Make Love to You
text: The song was first recorded as "All I Want to Do Is Make Love to You" by Dobie Gray in 1979, though with different lyrics.

title: Be the One (Poison song)
text: "Be the One" is a power ballad by American rock band Poison.

title: Be the One (Poison song)
text: The song was released as the second single from their 2000 "Crack a Smile...and More!

title: Be the One (Poison song)
text: " album.

title: Be the One (Poison song)
text: The single/sampler was released in February 2000 and featured five b-sides including the first single from the album "Shut Up, Make Love" and the four unplugged bonus tracks from the album: "Every Rose Has Its Thorn", "Talk Dirty to Me", "Your Mama Don't Dance" and "Something to Believe In".

title: The Longer We Make Love
text: "The Longer We Make Love" is a song recorded by American singer Barry White for his 1999 album, "Staying Power".

title: The Longer We Make Love
