text: Silver Spoon (Japanese: 銀の匙 , Hepburn: Gin no Saji ) is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by Hiromu Arakawa, set in the fictional Ooezo Agricultural High School in Hokkaido.

title: Silver Spoon (manga)
text: It depicts the daily life of Yuugo Hachiken, a high school student from Sapporo who enrolled at Ezo fleeing from the demands of his strict father.

title: Silver Spoon (manga)
text: However, he soon learns that life on an agricultural school is not as easy as he initially believed.

title: Silver Spoon (manga)
text: Unlike his new classmates, he has no intention of following an agricultural career after graduating, although he envies them for already having set goals for their lives and the pursuit of their dreams.

title: Manga Bible (series)
text: Manga Bible (新約聖書 , Shinyaku Seisho ) is a five-volume manga series based on the Christian Bible created under the direction of the non-profit organization Next, a group formed by people from the manga industry.

title: Manga Bible (series)
text: Though first published in English, the books are originally written in Japanese and each volume is illustrated by a Japanese manga artist.

title: Manga Bible (series)
text: Each book is adapted from the Bible by Hidenori Kumai.

title: Manga Bible (series)
text: The first two books were illustrated by manga artist Kozumi Shinozawa, while the remaining three will be illustrated by a different artist.

title: Manga Bible (series)
text: The first book in the series, "Manga Messiah" was published in 2006 and covered the four gospels of the Bible: Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John.

title: Manga Bible (series)
text: "Manga Metamorphosis" (2008) covers the events in Acts and several of Paul's letters.

title: Manga Bible (series)
text: "Manga Mutiny" (2008, 2009) begins in Genesis and ends in Exodus.

title: Manga Bible (series)
text: "Manga Melech" (2010) picks up where "Manga Mutiny" left off and continues into the reign of David.

title: Manga Bible (series)
text: The fifth, and currently final book, "Manga Messengers" (2011) addresses events starting with the reign of King Solomon and takes stories from several of the major and minor prophets, and the Book of Esther and concludes with anticipation of a messiah.

title: Murder of Serena McKay
text: Serena Chelsea McKay (September 30, 1997-April 22/23,2016) was a Canadian girl that was brutally murdered and her murder was posted online.

title: Murder of Serena McKay
text: The accused suspects are two teenage girls aged 16 and 17.

title: Murder of Serena McKay
text: The murder happened on the Sagkeeng First Nation 100 kilometers northeast of Winnipeg, Manitoba.

title: Murder of Serena McKay
text: Her murder was filmed and posted online causing great outrage across Canada.

title: Murder of Serena McKay
text: The video came in a short version and long version and the short version was posted on Facebook.

title: Murder of Serena McKay
text: The long version was available for 4 hours but later deleted from the public.

title: Murder of Serena McKay
text: Sagkeeng's Grand Chief Derrick Henderson had requested to Facebook to remove the short video from the public.

title: Murder of Serena McKay
text: It is not exactly known whether she died on April 22 or April 23 as she was last seen on the evening of April 22, 2017, confirmed missing at 6:pm on April 23, 2017, and a dead body later confirmed to be Serena McKay was found at 8:pm on April 23, 2017.

title: Murder of Serena McKay
text: Two teenage were arrested.

title: Murder of Serena McKay
text: Their names can't be named publicly because of a Canadian law that prohibits releasing names of youth-criminals or accused youth-criminals.

title: Murder of Serena McKay
text: It is known that the 2 girls accused in the murder did go to school with Serena McKay.

title: Murder of Serena McKay
text: Prosecutors are trying to seek adult sentences for the 2 accused teenage girls if they are found guilty.

title: Murder of Serena McKay
text: On May 26, 2017, the 17 year old suspect has had her first trial at a Winnipeg provincial court where both the defence lawyers and prosecutors ordered a psychological test.

title: Murder of Serena McKay
text: She is being held at the Manitoba Youth Centre (a prison for youth which has both remand, post remand, and convict units) since her arrest shortly after the murder.

title: Murder of Serena McKay
text: The 16 year old has also been ordered to go a psychological assessment.

title: Murder of Serena McKay
text: A vigil was held in Winnipeg on April 29, 2017 with hundreds marching.

title: Murder of Serena McKay
text: McKay was set to graduate in 2017.

title: Murder of Serena McKay
text: McKay's funeral was held at Westwood Church in Winnipeg on May 1, 2017.

title: Murder of Serena McKay
text: She was also buried in Winnipeg.

title: Murder of Serena McKay
text: At McKay's high school's graduation on June 23, 2017 what would have been her seat was left empty and marked with a red graduation gown and diploma.

title: Murder of Serena McKay
text: All this was done in honour and memory of Serena McKay.

title: I"s
text: I"s (アイズ , Aizu ) is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by Masakazu Katsura.

title: I"s
text: The story's main character is 16-year-old high school student Ichitaka Seto who is in love with his classmate Iori Yoshizuki, but too shy to tell her.

title: I"s
text: Again and again he plans to tell her his true feelings, but each time something (usually a misunderstanding of some kind) gets in the way.

title: I"s
text: Things become even more complicated when Itsuki Akiba returns to Japan; she is a girl Ichitaka was friends with in their childhood before she moved to the United States, and who had a huge crush on him.

title: Clear Skies!
text: Clear Skies!

title: Clear Skies!
text: (Japanese: 毎日晴天!

title: Clear Skies!
text: , Hepburn: Mainichi Seiten! )

title: Clear Skies!
text: is a Japanese manga series written by Akira Sugano and illustrated by Etsumi Ninomiya.

title: Clear Skies!
text: The manga is licensed in North America by Digital Manga Publishing under its Juné imprint, which released the first volume on 28 August 2008.

title: Clear Skies!
text: It's about four brothers living together, when one of the brother's old high school flame turns up and claims that he's married to the brothers' wild older sister, who is nowhere to be found, bringing his adopted son.

title: Haven't You Heard? I'm Sakamoto
text: Haven't You Heard?

title: Haven't You Heard? I'm Sakamoto
text: I'm Sakamoto (坂本ですが?

title: Haven't You Heard? I'm Sakamoto
text: , Sakamoto desu ga?

title: Haven't You Heard? I'm Sakamoto
text: , lit.

title: Haven't You Heard? I'm Sakamoto
text: "I'm Sakamoto, You Know?")

title: Haven't You Heard? I'm Sakamoto
text: is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by Nami Sano.

title: Haven't You Heard? I'm Sakamoto
text: The manga follows a high school student named Sakamoto, who has a reputation for being the "coolest" person among the entire student body.

title: Haven't You Heard? I'm Sakamoto
text: The series has been licensed for an English release by Seven Seas Entertainment.

title: Haven't You Heard? I'm Sakamoto
text: An anime television adaptation by Studio Deen aired between April 8, 2016 and July 1, 2016.

title: My Bride is a Mermaid
text: My Bride Is a Mermaid (Japanese: 瀬戸の花嫁 , Hepburn: Seto no Hanayome , lit.

title: My Bride is a Mermaid
text: "The Inland Sea Bride") is a Japanese manga series written by Tahiko Kimura.

title: My Bride is a Mermaid
text: The manga was serialized between the September 2002 and May 2009 issues of "Monthly Gangan Wing", and the June and December 2010 issues of "Monthly Gangan Joker", both published by Square Enix.

title: My Bride is a Mermaid
text: In 2004, a drama CD based on the series was released by Frontier Works.

title: My Bride is a Mermaid
text: A 26-episode anime television series adaptation animated by Gonzo and directed by Seiji Kishi aired in Japan on TV Tokyo between April and September 2007.

title: My Bride is a Mermaid
text: Two original video animation episodes were released in November 2008 and January 2009.

title: My Bride is a Mermaid
text: Odex, a Singaporean distributor, released it in English in Singapore as "Seto No Hana Yome".

title: My Bride is a Mermaid
text: The anime was licensed for a North American distribution by Funimation Entertainment and was released in 2010 under the title "My Bride Is a Mermaid!"

title: The Kindaichi Case Files
text: The Kindaichi Case Files (Japanese: 金田一少年の事件簿 , Hepburn: Kindaichi Shōnen no Jikenbo ) is a Japanese mystery manga series based on the crime solving adventures of a high school student, Hajime Kindaichi, the supposed grandson of the famous (fictional) private detective Kosuke Kindaichi.

title: The Kindaichi Case Files
text: They are written by Yōzaburō Kanari or Seimaru Amagi (depending on series) and illustrated by Fumiya Satō.

title: The Kindaichi Case Files
text: The "Kindaichi series", which started serialization in "Weekly Shōnen Magazine" in 1992, is one of the earliest works in the mystery manga genre.

title: The Kindaichi Case Files
text: In 1995, the manga won the Kodansha Manga Award for shōnen.

title: The Prince of Tennis
text: The Prince Of Tennis (Japanese: テニスの王子様 , Hepburn: Tenisu no Ōjisama ) is a Japanese manga series about a tennis prodigy written and illustrated by Takeshi Konomi.

title: The Prince of Tennis
text: The title is often shortened to Tenni-Pri (テニプリ ) , a portmanteau of the words "Tennis Prince".

title: The Prince of Tennis
text: The manga was first published in Japan in Shueisha's "Weekly Shōnen Jump" in July 1999, and ended publication on March 3, 2008.

title: The Prince of Tennis
text: A total of 379 chapters were serialized, spanning 42 volumes.

title: The Prince of Tennis
text: As of volume 40, the manga has sold over 40 million copies in Japan.

title: The Prince of Tennis
text: News that a sequel to the manga series was going to be developed was announced in the December issue of the Japanese manga magazine "Jump Square".

title: The Prince of Tennis
text: The new manga series, entitled "New Prince of Tennis", began serialization in the "Jump Square" magazine on March 4, 2009, with the story taking place several months after the end of the original manga.

title: The Prince of Tennis
text: Viz Media acquired the license to distribute the series in English in North America.

title: Neuro: Supernatural Detective
text: Neuro: Supernatural Detective, known in Japan as Majin Tantei Nōgami Neuro (Japanese: 魔人探偵 脳噛ネウロ , lit.

title: Neuro: Supernatural Detective
text: "Demon Detective Neuro Nōgami") , is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by Yūsei Matsui.

title: Neuro: Supernatural Detective
text: The series follows Neuro Nōgami, a demon who depends on mysteries for sustenance.

title: Neuro: Supernatural Detective
text: Having consumed all the mysteries in the demon world, Neuro travels to the human world in search of more.

title: Neuro: Supernatural Detective
text: There, Neuro recruits high school student Yako Katsuragi as a facade for a detective agency.

title: Neuro: Supernatural Detective
text: The supernatural-themed manga was created because Matsui considered himself unable to draw humans.

title: Outline of Ethiopia
text: Ethiopia is a landlocked sovereign country located in the Horn of Africa.

title: Outline of Ethiopia
text: Ethiopia is bordered by Eritrea to the north, Sudan to the west, South Sudan to the south-west, Kenya to the south, Somalia to the east and Djibouti to the north-east.

title: Outline of Ethiopia
text: Ethiopia is one of the oldest countries in the world and Africa's second-most populous nation.

title: Outline of Ethiopia
text: Ethiopia has yielded some of humanity's oldest traces, making the area important in the history of human evolution.

title: Outline of Ethiopia
text: Recent studies claim that the vicinity of present-day Addis Ababa was the point from which human beings migrated around the world.

title: Outline of Ethiopia
text: Ethiopian dynastic history traditionally began with the reign of Emperor Menelik I in 1000 BC.

title: Outline of Ethiopia
text: The roots of the Ethiopian state are similarly deep, dating with unbroken continuity to at least the Aksumite Empire (which adopted the name "Ethiopia" in the 4th century) and its predecessor state, D`mt (with early 1st millennium BC roots).

title: Outline of Ethiopia
text: After a period of decentralized power in the 18th and early 19th centuries known as the Zemene Mesafint ("Era of the Judges/Princes"), the country was reunited in 1855 by Kassa Hailu, who became Emperor Tewodros II, beginning Ethiopia's modern history.

title: Outline of Ethiopia
text: Ethiopia's borders underwent significant territorial expansion to its modern borders for the rest of the century, especially by Emperor Menelik II and Ras Gobena, culminating in its victory over the Italians at the Battle of Adwa in 1896 with the military leadership of Ras Makonnen, and ensuring its sovereignty and freedom from colonization.

title: Outline of Ethiopia
text: It was brutally occupied by Benito Mussolini's Fascist Italy from 1936 to 1941, ending with its liberation by British Empire and Ethiopian Patriot forces.

title: P'ent'ay
text: P'ent'ay (from Amharic: , also transliterated as Pentay or Pente) is an Amharic and Tigrinya language term for a Christian of a Protestant denomination, widely used in Ethiopia and among Ethiopians and Eritreans living abroad.

title: P'ent'ay
text: The term was coined in the late 1960s and was used as a pejorative for churches that believed in the Pentecostal experience.

title: P'ent'ay
text: Today, it is used to describe local Protestant Christians who are not members of the Ethiopian Orthodox Tewahedo and Eritrean Orthodox Tewahedo churches.

title: P'ent'ay
text: The term "P'ent'ay" is a shortening of the word "Pentecostal"; however, it is widely used when referring to all Protestant Christians whether they are actual Pentecostals or not.

title: P'ent'ay
text: Some Orthodox will also apply the term to the small Catholic population of Ethiopia.

title: P'ent'ay
text: The equivalent rendition in many other languages is Evangelicals.

title: P'ent'ay
text: The four major Evangelical denominations in Ethiopia are: the Kale Heywet (Word of Life); Mekane Yesus (Place of Jesus), Lutheran; Mulu Wongel (Full Gospel) and Meserete Kristos (meaning "Christ foundation") or Mennonite.

title: P'ent'ay
text: Some P'ent'ay communities - especially Mekane Yesus - have been influenced by the Orthodox Tewahedo Church, which represents mainstream, traditional Ethiopian Christianity.

title: P'ent'ay
text: But for the most part they are very Pentecostal in their worship and theology.

title: Herbert S. Lewis
text: Herbert S. Lewis (born May 8, 1934) is Professor Emeritus of Anthropology at the University of Wisconsin-Madison, where he taught from 1963 to 1998.

title: Herbert S. Lewis
text: He has conducted extensive field research.

title: Herbert S. Lewis
text: In Ethiopia, Lewis studied both the history of the Oromo (Galla) Kingdom of Jimma Abba Jifar and the lives of contemporary Oromos from 1958–60 and in 1965–66.

title: Herbert S. Lewis
text: (Many of his ethnographic photographs are visible in the University of Wisconsin's Digital Library.

title: Herbert S. Lewis
text: See the link to Africa Focus below).

title: Herbert S. Lewis
text: His work in Ethiopia was concerned above all with political leadership and community organization as well as ethnohistory and culture history.

title: Herbert S. Lewis
text: The book, originally titled A Galla Monarchy: Jimma Abba Jifar, Ethiopia, 1830-1932, is a study of the nature of the monarchy, the sources of the ruler's power, as well as its origins.

title: Herbert S. Lewis
text: The study in 1965-66 centered on community life and the leadership of spirit mediums, k'allu, who effectively organized religious life and conflict resolution, and provided a degree of political leadership for rural districts.

title: Second Battle of Agordat
text: The Second Battle of Agordat was fought in late December 1893, between Italian colonial troops and Mahdists from the Sudan.

title: Second Battle of Agordat
text: Emir Ahmed Ali campaigned against the Italian forces in eastern Sudan and led about 10–12,000 men east from Kassala.

title: Second Battle of Agordat
text: This force encountered 2,400 Italians and their Eritrean askaris at Agordat, west of Asmara, commanded by Colonel Arimondi.

title: Second Battle of Agordat
text: Over 1,000 Dervishes, including the Emir, were killed in severe fighting.

title: Second Battle of Agordat
text: The outcome of the battle constituted:

title: Treaty of Addis Ababa
text: The Treaty of Addis Ababa, signed 23 October 1896, formally ended the First Italo–Ethiopian War on terms mostly favorable to Ethiopia.

title: Treaty of Addis Ababa
text: This treaty superseded a secret agreement between Ethiopia and Italy negotiated days after the decisive Battle of Adwa in March of the same year, in which Ethiopian forces commanded by Menelik II defeated the Italians.

title: Treaty of Addis Ababa
text: The most important concession the Italians made was the abrogation of the Treaty of Wuchale and recognizing Ethiopia as an independent country.

title: Ethiopia–Japan relations
text: Ethiopia–Japan relations are the international relations between Ethiopia and Japan.

title: Ethiopia–Japan relations
text: Both were nations with an ancient history which successfully repulsed European military advances to dominate them, Ethiopia at the Battle of Adwa, and Japan at the Battle of Tsushima, and as a result both nations considered each other potential allies prior to World War II.

title: First Italo-Ethiopian War
text: The First Italo-Ethiopian War was fought between Italy and Ethiopia from 1895 to 1896.

title: First Italo-Ethiopian War
text: It originated from a disputed treaty which, the Italians claimed, turned the country into an Italian protectorate.

title: First Italo-Ethiopian War
text: Italy was supported by the two other triple alliance members Germany and Austria.

title: First Italo-Ethiopian War
text: Much to their surprise, they found that Ethiopian ruler Menelik II, rather than being opposed by some of his traditional enemies, was supported by them, so the Italian army, invading Ethiopia from Italian Eritrea in 1893, faced a more united front than they expected.

title: First Italo-Ethiopian War
text: In addition, Ethiopia was supported by Russia, an Orthodox Christian nation like Ethiopia with military advisers, army training, and the sale of weapons for Ethiopian forces during the war.

title: First Italo-Ethiopian War
text: Ethiopia was also supported diplomatically by the United Kingdom and France in order to prevent Italy from becoming a colonial competitor.

title: First Italo-Ethiopian War
text: Full-scale war broke out in 1895, with Italian troops having initial success until Ethiopian troops counterattacked Italian positions and besieged the Italian fort of Meqele, forcing its surrender.

title: First Italo-Ethiopian War
text: Italian defeat came about after the Battle of Adwa, where the Ethiopian army dealt the heavily outnumbered Italians a decisive blow and forced their retreat back into Eritrea.

title: Battle of Adwa
text: The Battle of Adwa (Amharic: አድዋ; Amharic translated: Adowa, or sometimes by the Italian name "Adua") was fought on 2 March 1896/Yekatit 23, 1889 according to Ethiopian calendar between the Ethiopian Empire and the Kingdom of Italy near the town of Adwa, Ethiopia, in Tigray.

title: Battle of Adwa
text: This climactic battle of the First Italo-Ethiopian War, was a decisive defeat for Italy and secured Ethiopian sovereignty.

title: Giuseppe Arimondi
text: Giuseppe Edoardo Arimondi, OSML, OMS, OCI (Savigliano, 26 April 1846 – Adwa, 1 March 1896) was an Italian general, mostly known for his role during the First Italo-Ethiopian War.

title: Giuseppe Arimondi
text: He was one of the few European commanders who gained a victory over the Mahdists before Kitchener's Expedition, soundly defeating them at Agordat in 1893.

title: Giuseppe Arimondi
text: After a long and successfull colonial service, he died in combat at Adwa, and was posthumously awarded the Gold Medal of Military Valor.

title: Ephigenia of Ethiopia
text: Saint Ephigenia of Ethiopia or Iphigenia of Ethiopia (Spanish: "Efigênia" ; Portuguese: "Ifigênia" ; French: "Iphigénie" ; ), also called Iphigenia of Abyssinia (1st century), is a folk saint whose life is told in the "Golden Legend" as a virgin converted to Christianity and then consecrated to God by St. Matthew the Apostle, who was spreading the Gospel to the region of "Ethiopia", which in this case is understood to be located in the regions south of the Caspian Sea, either in one of the provinces of Mesopotamia (Assyria and Babylon), or in Ancient Armenia (Colchis).

title: Gordon Johndroe
text: Gordon Johndroe (born 1974) is vice president of Government Operations Communications at The Boeing Company.

title: Gordon Johndroe
text: He was named to this position in November 2014 and is responsible for developing and implementing communications strategies associated with advocacy for the company’s products and businesses, as well as issues management and outreach to the Washington, D.C. news media and related constituencies.

title: Gordon Johndroe
text: Johndroe previously worked at Lockheed Martin from 2013-2014 as Vice President for Worldwide Media Relations.

title: Gordon Johndroe
text: He served as chief spokesperson for the corporation, counsels senior leaders on media engagements and oversees Lockheed Martin’s media relations campaigns and strategies.

title: Gordon Johndroe
text: Prior to joining Lockheed Martin, he served as Deputy Assistant to President George W. Bush, Deputy Press Secretary and a spokesman for the United States National Security Council

title: President pro tempore of the United States Senate
text: The president pro tempore of the United States Senate ( or ), also president pro tem, is the second-highest-ranking official of the United States Senate.

title: President pro tempore of the United States Senate
text: of the United States Constitution provides that the Vice President of the United States is, despite not being a senator, the President of the Senate, and mandates that the Senate must choose a president "pro tempore" to act in the Vice President's absence.

title: President pro tempore of the United States Senate
text: Unlike the vice president, the president pro tempore is an elected member of the Senate, able to speak or vote on any issue.

title: President pro tempore of the United States Senate
text: Selected by the Senate at large, the president pro tempore has enjoyed many privileges and some limited powers.

title: President pro tempore of the United States Senate
text: During the vice president's absence, the president pro tempore is empowered to preside over Senate sessions.

title: President pro tempore of the United States Senate
text: In practice, neither the vice president nor the president pro tempore usually presides; instead, the duty of presiding officer is rotated among junior senators of the majority party to give them experience in parliamentary procedure.

title: Robert Nyce
text: Robert E. Nyce is a former Republican member of the Pennsylvania House of Representatives.

title: Robert Nyce
text: A graduate of Northampton Area Senior High School, Northampton, PA and Moravian College, Bethlehem, PA for over twenty years he was a tax professional working at Lehigh Portland Cement Company, Allentown, PA from 1970 to 1973, Manager, Credit Taxes, Insurance and Payroll at Frick Company, Waynesboro, PA from 1973 to 1975, Senior Tax Accountant for Bethlehem Steel Corporation from 1975 to 1985 and Asst. Vice President, Taxes for Chrysler First, Inc., Allentown, PA from 1985 to 1990.

title: Robert Nyce
text: He was a member of the Tax Executives Institute including Chairman of the State Tax Committee in the 1980s.

title: Robert Nyce
text: During his private sector employment, Mr. Nyce was active in his community of East Allen Township.

title: Robert Nyce
text: From 1979 to 1984 he served as a member and Chairman of the East Allen Township Municipal Authority and again from 2007 to 2013 as a member and Treasurer.

title: Robert Nyce
text: From 2011 to 2013 Mr. Nyce negotiated and helped close the sale of the East Allen Township Municipal Authority's assets to The City of Bethlehem and the Bath Borough Municipal Authority thereby ensuring high quality service of water and sewer for the future for all residents of East Allen Township.

title: Robert Nyce
text: From 1984 to 1990, Mr. Nyce served on the Northampton Area School District Board of Directors as member, Vice Chairman and Chairman.

title: Robert Nyce
text: He also served on the Bethlehem Area Vocational Technical School Joint Operating Committee as member, Vice Chairman and Chairman.

title: Robert Nyce
text: In both capacities, he was responsible for normal business operations and participated in union contract negotiations with staff.

title: Robert Nyce
text: In 1990, Mr. Nyce ran for and was elected State Representative for the 138th PA House District encompassing parts of Northampton and Monroe Counties.

title: Robert Nyce
text: During his three terms in the House of Representatives he served on several important committees: Education, Local Government, Fish and Game, Finance to name a few.

title: Robert Nyce
text: In 1996 he ran for PA Auditor General in an unsuccessful bid to represent the people of PA as their financial watchdog.

title: Robert Nyce
text: Following the campaign, he was hired as the Executive Director of the Pennsylvania Independent Regulatory Review Commission (IRRC).

title: Robert Nyce
text: Mr. Nyce served for eight years in that capacity overseeing two major revisions to the Regulatory Review Act and many significant regulatory issues facing the residents of Pennsylvania.

title: Robert Nyce
text: The PA IRRC reviews all regulations promulgated in PA and provides citizens an opportunity to comment on and affect those regulations prior to their promulgation by the state agency that authored the regulation.

title: Robert Nyce
text: The two exceptions are the PA Fish and Boat Commission and the PA Game Commission which remain outside the regulatory review process.

title: Robert Nyce
text: In 2005, Mr. Nyce retired from state government and now resides in Northampton County.

title: Robert Nyce
text: He has been a member of the Free and Accepted Masons of PA since 1971 and the Rajah Shrine, Reading, PA since the mid-ninety's.

title: Robert Nyce
text: Mr. Nyce is a past member of the Northampton Exchange Club.

title: Robert Nyce
text: Mr. Nyce served in the U.S. Army from 1966 to 1969.

title: Robert Nyce
text: Having completed his basic training at Fort Knox, Kentucky and Advanced Individual Training at Fort Lewis, Washington he was assigned to the 1st Battalion, 3rd Infantry Unit, "The Old Guard" at Arlington National Cemetery where he served for about two and one half years attaining the rank of Staff Sergeant, E-6 before taking an early release to return to Moravian College in September 1969.

title: Robert Nyce
text: While serving at Arlington, SSG Nyce participated in former President Dwight D. Eisenhower's funeral, President Nixon's Inauguration and Robert F. Kennedy's Funeral.

title: Executive Order 10925
text: Executive Order 10925, signed by President John F. Kennedy on March 6, 1961, required government contractors to "take affirmative action to ensure that applicants are employed and that employees are treated during employment without regard to their race, creed, color, or national origin."

title: Executive Order 10925
text: It established the President's Committee on Equal Employment Opportunity (PCEEO), which was chaired by then Vice President Lyndon Johnson.

title: Executive Order 10925
text: Vice Chair and Secretary of Labor Arthur Goldberg was in charge of the Committee's operations.

title: Executive Order 10925
text: This first implementation of Affirmative Action was meant to give equal opportunities in the workforce to all U.S. citizens, not to give special treatment to those discriminated against.

title: Gore-Chernomyrdin Commission
text: The Gore-Chernomyrdin Commission, or U.S.-Russian Joint Commission on Economic and Technological Cooperation, was a United States and Russian Joint Commission developed to increase cooperation between the two countries in several different areas.

title: Gore-Chernomyrdin Commission
text: The Commission was developed by the United States’ President Bill Clinton and Russian President Boris Yeltsin at a summit in Vancouver in April 1993.

title: Gore-Chernomyrdin Commission
text: Al Gore, the United States Vice President, and Victor Chernomyrdin, the Russian Prime Minister, were appointed as co-chairmen, and the committee derives its name from those two individuals.

title: Gore-Chernomyrdin Commission
text: Before his appointment to the Commission, Chernomyrdin oversaw the Soviet national oil industry as minister from 1985-1989.

title: Gore-Chernomyrdin Commission
text: After the fall of the Soviet Union, Chernomyrdin organized the Soviet oil industry into the Gazprom corporation.

title: Alfred Balk
text: Alfred Balk (July 24, 1930 – November 25, 2010) was an American reporter, nonfiction author and magazine editor who wrote groundbreaking articles about housing segregation, the Nation of Islam, the environment and Illinois politics.

title: Alfred Balk
text: His refusal to identify a confidential source led to a landmark court case.

title: Alfred Balk
text: During a career-long emphasis on media improvement, he served on the Twentieth Century Fund's task force that established a National News Council, consulted for several foundations, served as secretary of New York Governor Nelson Rockefeller's Committee on the Employment of Minority Groups in the News Media, and produced a film, "That the People Shall Know: The Challenge of Journalism", narrated by Walter Cronkite.

title: Alfred Balk
text: He wrote and co-authored books on a variety of topics, ranging from the tax exempt status of religious organizations to globalization to the history of radio.

title: Gerald Ford
text: Gerald Rudolph Ford Jr. (born Leslie Lynch King Jr.; July 14, 1913 – December 26, 2006) was an American politician who served as the 38th President of the United States from August 1974 to January 1977, following the resignation of Richard Nixon.

title: Gerald Ford
text: Prior to this he served eight months as the 40th Vice President of the United States, following the resignation of Spiro Agnew.

title: Gerald Ford
text: He was the first person appointed to the vice presidency under the terms of the 25th Amendment, and consequently the only person to have served as both Vice President and President of the United States without being elected to executive office.

title: Gerald Ford
text: Before his appointment to the vice presidency, Ford served 25 years as U.S. Representative from Michigan's 5th congressional district, the final nine of them as the House Minority Leader.

title: Jim Lentz
text: Jim Lentz is the chief executive officer for Toyota North America; president and chief operating officer of Toyota Motor North America, Inc. (TMA); and a senior managing officer of the parent company Toyota Motor Corporation (TMC) which is located in Japan.

title: Jim Lentz
text: In that role Lentz manages all of Toyota’s North American affiliate companies which include TMA, Toyota Motor Sales, U.S.A., Inc. (TMS), and Toyota Motor Engineering & Manufacturing, North America, Inc. (TEMA), which includes responsibilities for Toyota Motor Manufacturing Canada Inc. (TMMC), and oversight for Toyota Canada, Inc. (TCI).

title: Jim Lentz
text: Lentz also serves as the chairman of the North American Executive Committee.

title: Jim Lentz
text: This is composed of the top leaders from the affiliate companies.

title: Jim Lentz
text: Most recently Lentz was the president and chief executive officer of TMS and senior vice president of TMA and served in a global advisory capacity as the managing officer for TMC.

title: Jim Lentz
text: Before that he served as president and chief operating officer and executive vice president of TMS.

title: Jim Lentz
text: Lentz previously held several executive positions including Toyota division group vice president and general manager where he oversaw all sales, logistics and marketing activities for Toyota and Scion regional sales offices and distributors.

title: Jim Lentz
text: He also served as the group vice president of marketing for the Toyota division and vice president of Scion, and was responsible for the initial launch of a new line of vehicles.

title: Jim Lentz
text: Lentz spent several years in the field as vice president and general manager of the Los Angeles region and before that general manager of the San Francisco region.

title: Jim Lentz
text: Prior to his role as general manager Lentz was vice president of marketing services for CAT in Maryland.

title: Jim Lentz
text: He has also held several other TMS positions, including field training manager, sales administration manager and truck sales team member.

title: Jim Lentz
text: Lentz joined Toyota in 1982 as the merchandising manager for its Portland, Oregon region where he later became the distribution manager and field operations manager.

title: Jim Lentz
text: He serves as chairman on the board of directors of The Global Automakers and is also a member of the executive advisory board for Daniels College of Business at the University of Denver (DU), his alma mater.

title: Jim Lentz
text: He was named “Marketer of the Year” by Advertising Age in 2006, an Automotive News “All Star” in 2007 and honored at Industry Leader of the year.

title: Dragan Crnogorac (politician)
text: Dragan Crnogorac is president of Joint Council of Municipalities, a "sui generis" body that aligns interests of Serb ethnic community in Osijek-Baranja and Vukovar-Syrmia County.

title: Dragan Crnogorac (politician)
text: Since October 2012 he is also a member of the Croatian Parliament.

title: Dragan Crnogorac (politician)
text: Over and above, he is also member of Independent Democratic Serb Party, Serbia-Croatia Intergovernmental Mixed Committee for Minorities, Assembly of Serb National Council, Croatian Radiotelevision program committee, Secretary of the Municipal Council of the Serbian national minority in Stari Jankovci municipality, president of local branch of Independent Democratic Serb Party in Stari Jankovci, Vice President of City Council of the City of Vukovar and member of County Council of the Serbian national minority of Vukovar-Syrmia County.

title: Cynthia Hogan
text: Cynthia C. Hogan (born Cincinnati, Ohio about 1958) is the Vice President for Public Policy and Government Affairs at Apple.

title: Cynthia Hogan
text: Previously Hogan served as Senior Vice President of Public Policy and Government Affairs for the National Football League, and prior to that as the Counsel to the Vice President of the United States, Joe Biden, under President Barack Obama.

title: Cynthia Hogan
text: Hogan previously worked as Chief Counsel to Vice President Biden during his time in the United States Senate and served as Staff Director of the Senate Judiciary Committee.

title: Scottish Borders
text: The Scottish Borders (Scots: "The Mairches" , "The Marches") is one of 32 council areas of Scotland.

title: Scottish Borders
text: It borders the City of Edinburgh, Dumfries and Galloway, East Lothian, Midlothian, South Lanarkshire, West Lothian and, to the south and east, Northumberland in England.

title: Scottish Borders
text: The administrative centre of the area is Newtown St Boswells.

title: Haddington, East Lothian
text: The Royal Burgh of Haddington (Scots: "Haidintoun" ) is a town in East Lothian, Scotland.

title: Haddington, East Lothian
text: It is the main administrative, cultural and geographical centre for East Lothian, which as a result of late-nineteenth century Scottish local government reforms, actually took the form of the county of Haddingtonshire for the period from 1889-1921.

title: Haddington, East Lothian
text: It lies about 20 mi east of Edinburgh.

title: Haddington, East Lothian
text: The name Haddington is Anglo-Saxon, dating from the sixth or seventh century AD when the area was incorporated into the kingdom of Bernicia.

title: Haddington, East Lothian
text: The town, like the rest of the Lothian region, was ceded by King Edgar of England and became part of Scotland in the tenth century.

title: Haddington, East Lothian
text: Haddington received burghal status, one of the earliest to do so, during the reign of David I (1124–1153), giving it trading rights which encouraged its growth into a market town.

title: Dirleton Kirk
text: Dirleton Kirk is situated to the north of the village green in Dirleton, in East Lothian, Scotland.

title: Dirleton Kirk
text: Dirleton village lies on the south shore of the Firth of Forth 21 miles east of Edinburgh and two miles west of North Berwick on the A198 road.

title: Dirleton Kirk
text: The church is at grid reference  .

title: Lothian and Borders
text: Lothian and Borders is an area in south-east Scotland consisting of the East Lothian, City of Edinburgh, Midlothian, West Lothian areas (collectively known as Lothian) along with the Scottish Borders.

title: Dirleton
text: Dirleton (Scottish Gaelic 'Duighreach') is a village and parish in East Lothian, Scotland approximately 20 mi east of Edinburgh on the A198.

title: Dirleton
text: It contains 7500 acre .

title: Dirleton
text: Dirleton lies between North Berwick (east), Gullane (west), Fenton Barns (south) and the Yellowcraigs nature reserve, Archerfield Estate and the Firth of Forth (north).

title: Dirleton
text: Gullane parish was joined to Dirleton parish in 1612 by an Act of Parliament because "Golyn (as it was anciently spelt) is ane decaying toun, and Dirleton is ane thriven place."

title: Yellowcraigs
text: Yellowcraig, less commonly known as Broad Sands Bay, is a coastal area of forest, beach and grassland in East Lothian, south-east Scotland.

title: Yellowcraigs
text: Yellowcraig is partly within the Firth of Forth Site of Special Scientific Interest (SSSI).

title: Yellowcraigs
text: It is bordered to the north by the Firth of Forth, to the south by the village of Dirleton and Dirleton Castle, to the east by the North Berwick West Links golf course, and to the west by the Archerfield Estate and Links golf courses.

title: Lord Haliburton of Dirleton
text: Lord Haliburton of Dirleton (or "Dirletoun") was a Scottish Lordship of Parliament created "circa."

title: Lord Haliburton of Dirleton
text: 1450 for Sir Walter de Haliburton, Lord High Treasurer of Scotland.

title: Lord Haliburton of Dirleton
text: The seat of Lord Haliburton was at Dirleton Castle in present-day East Lothian.

title: John Home Robertson
text: John David Home Robertson (born 5 December 1948) is a Labour politician in Scotland.

title: John Home Robertson
text: He was a Member of Parliament (MP) for Berwick and East Lothian and East Lothian from 1978 to 2001 and a Member of the Scottish Parliament (MSP) for East Lothian from 1999 until 2007.

title: Dirleton Castle
text: Dirleton Castle is a medieval fortress in the village of Dirleton, East Lothian, Scotland.

title: Dirleton Castle
text: It lies around 2 mi west of North Berwick, and around 19 mi east of Edinburgh.

title: Dirleton Castle
text: The oldest parts of the castle date to the 13th century, and it was abandoned by the end of the 17th century.

title: St. Mary's Priory (Lothian)
text: St. Mary's Priory, North Berwick, was a monastery of nuns in medieval East Lothian, Scotland.

title: St. Mary's Priory (Lothian)
text: Founded by Donnchad I, Earl of Fife (owner of much of northern East Lothian) around 1150, the priory lasted for more than four centuries, declining and disappearing after the Scottish Reformation.

title: St. Mary's Priory (Lothian)
text: It had been endowed by the Earls of Carrick as well as the Earls of Fife, but over time lost its dependence on these and came to be controlled by the more locally based Home (or Hume) family, who eventually acquired the priory's lands as a free barony.

title: Radiohead Box Set
text: Radiohead Box Set is a box set of the first six studio albums and one live album by the English rock band Radiohead, released on 10 December 2007.

title: Radiohead Box Set
text: The box set is available as a seven CD box set, a digital download and a 4GB USB Stick.

title: Radiohead Box Set
text: The box set peaked at #95 in Canada's album charts.

title: Start Together
text: Start Together is compilation box set containing the entire remastered discography of the American rock band Sleater-Kinney.

title: Start Together
text: A digital version of the remastered box set was released on September 2, 2014.

title: Start Together
text: 3,000 limited edition physical copies of the box set were released on colored vinyl with a 44-page companion book on October 21, 2014.

title: Start Together
text: The box set also included a 7" single of the song "Bury Our Friends" from their 2015 album "No Cities to Love".

title: Nashville Rebel (box set)
text: Nashville Rebel is a box set by Waylon Jennings, released on RCA Records through Legacy Recordings in 2006.

title: Nashville Rebel (box set)
text: According to Allmusic's Stephen Thomas Erlewine, it is ""the first comprehensive, multi-label Waylon Jennings retrospective ever assembled", comprising ninety-two songs recorded between 1958 and 1994, with selections from the majority of the singer's recording career.

title: Nashville Rebel (box set)
text: The first track of the box set is the Buddy Holly-produced "Jole Blon," released in 1958, while the last is "I Do Believe," a song produced by Don Was that was included on The Highwaymen's 1995 release, "The Road Goes on Forever".

title: Nashville Rebel (box set)
text: The other material on the box set covers Jennings' career chronologically, with songs ranging from his years on RCA's roster to later compositions from his short-lived stay at Epic Records; it ignores, however, the tracks from Jennings albums released on independent labels.

title: Nashville Rebel (box set)
text: The majority of the singer's charting singles are included in the package, as are collaborations such as "Mamas Don't Let Your Babies Grow Up to Be Cowboys" with Willie Nelson and "Highwayman" with The Highwaymen.

title: Nashville Rebel (box set)
text: A notable addition is the previously unreleased "The Greatest Cowboy of Them All," a 1978 duet with Johnny Cash which was later recorded by Cash alone for "A Believer Sings the Truth" (1979) and "The Mystery of Life" (1991); two others, "It's Sure Been Fun" and "People in Dallas Got Hair," had never been released in the United States.

title: Nashville Rebel (box set)
text: "Nashville Rebel" was released on four CDs, with a 140-page booklet and liner notes by Rich Keinzle and Lenny Kaye.

title: Led Zeppelin Boxed Set 2
text: Led Zeppelin Boxed Set 2 is a double album released by Atlantic Records on 21 September 1993.

title: Led Zeppelin Boxed Set 2
text: This box set features the rest of the English rock band Led Zeppelin's catalogue not included in the 1990 4-CD box set "Led Zeppelin", all digitally remastered, including the previously unreleased studio track "Baby Come On Home".

title: Led Zeppelin Boxed Set 2
text: A 54-page booklet was also included with the release.

title: Led Zeppelin Boxed Set 2
text: Between this box set and the 4-CD box set every track from the band's nine studio albums are featured along with two BBC live recordings; the band's only non-LP b-side; and one studio outtake.

title: The Doors: Vinyl Box Set
text: The Doors: Vinyl Box Set is the seventh box set for the rock band The Doors.

title: The Doors: Vinyl Box Set
text: It is a 7 record set of the original 6 Doors albums, remastered in stereo from the original analogue tapes with a mono version of the debut album.

title: The Doors: Vinyl Box Set
text: Artwork, packaging, and inner sleeves are replicas of the originals from 1967-1971.

title: The Doors: Vinyl Box Set
text: The box set was originally planned to be released in October 2007, but was delayed due to a problem with the vinyl, as well as other problems in the production of the box set.

title: The Doors: Vinyl Box Set
text: The delay ran until February 2008.

title: The Doors: Vinyl Box Set
text: Reasons for the delay included faulty test pressings, inferiority of the L.A. Woman artwork, and bad compounds in the vinyl that was used first, which caused a search for a new source of virgin vinyl.

title: Live in Japan (John Coltrane album)
text: Live in Japan is a four-disc box set by American saxophonist John Coltrane and his last group, featuring the quintet of Coltrane, his wife/pianist Alice, saxophonist/bass clarinetist Pharoah Sanders, bassist Jimmy Garrison and drummer Rashied Ali.

title: Live in Japan (John Coltrane album)
text: The 4-CD set compiles all the music issued as three albums in the seventies by Impulse!

title: Live in Japan (John Coltrane album)
text: ; "Concert In Japan" (1973, US 2-LP, electronically processed for compatible quadrophonic/stereo), "Coltrane In Japan" (1974, Japan 3-LP (side six is blank), mono) and "Second Night In Tokyo" (1976, Japan 3-LP (side six contains an interview, mono).

title: Live in Japan (John Coltrane album)
text: (Some of this material was also reissued as two 2-LP sets in 1980 by MCA under the titles "Coltrane In Tokyo Vol.

title: Live in Japan (John Coltrane album)
text: 1" and "Coltrane In Tokyo Vol.

title: Live in Japan (John Coltrane album)
text: 2") The first CD issues were by Impulse!

title: Live in Japan (John Coltrane album)
text: Japan as two 2-CD sets: "Live In Japan Vol.

title: Live in Japan (John Coltrane album)
text: 1" (same as "Coltrane In Japan") and "Live In Japan Vol.

title: Live in Japan (John Coltrane album)
text: 2" (same as "Second Night In Tokyo").

title: Live in Japan (John Coltrane album)
text: The US 4-CD edition includes both of these volumes, with identical mastering from the original mono tapes.

title: Live in Japan (John Coltrane album)
text: The side six interview from "Second Night In Tokyo" has never been reissued on any CD edition.

title: Chrome, Smoke & BBQ
text: Chrome, Smoke & BBQ is a box set by American blues-rock band ZZ Top, released in 2003.

title: Chrome, Smoke & BBQ
text: At the time of release, this box set was notable for using the original mixes for all of the tracks from the band's first five albums for the first time on the CD format.

title: Chrome, Smoke & BBQ
text: This box set, and the companion release "Rancho Texicano", were the only two CD releases which featured original mixes from "ZZ Top's First Album", "Rio Grande Mud", and "Tejas", aside from 1977's "The Best of ZZ Top" which features two tracks from "Rio Grande Mud" and one track from "First Album". "

title: Chrome, Smoke & BBQ
text: Tres Hombres" and "Fandango!

title: Chrome, Smoke & BBQ
text: " were reissued in their original mixes in 2006, and in 2013, Warner Brothers released the CD box set 'The Complete Studio Albums 1970-1990' which includes the first ten ZZ Top studio albums, all with the original mixes.

title: Back to Mono (1958–1969)
text: Back to Mono (1958–1969) is a box set (4 compact discs or 5 vinyl LPs) compilation of the recorded work of record producer Phil Spector, through the 1960s, released in 1991 by ABKCO as #7118-2.

title: Back to Mono (1958–1969)
text: The first track, "To Know Him Is to Love Him," released in 1958, features Spector performing as part of the group the Teddy Bears.

title: Back to Mono (1958–1969)
text: Initially a vinyl album-sized package, the box contained a booklet with photographs, complete song lyrics, discographical information, and a reproduction of the essay on Spector by Tom Wolfe, "The First Tycoon of Teen."

title: Back to Mono (1958–1969)
text: The package also contained a small, round, red "Back to Mono" pin.

title: Trash Box
text: Trash Box is a 5-CD box set of mid-1960s garage rock and psychedelic rock recordings, primarily by American bands.

title: Trash Box
text: This box set is similar to the earlier "Pebbles Box" (a 5-LP box set) and includes almost all of the same recordings in that box set (and in the same order), along with numerous bonus tracks at the end of each disc.

title: Trash Box
text: Supposedly, "the Trash Box" collects the first five volumes of the CDs in the Pebbles series (i.e., those released by AIP Records, not to be confused with the 4 earlier CDs that were issued by ESD Records).

title: Trash Box
text: However, as is generally true of the CD reissues of these five volumes (though not nearly to the same extent), the tracks differ significantly on all five discs as compared to both the original Pebbles LPs and the later Pebbles CDs in the corresponding volumes; and the surf rock rarities on "Pebbles, Volume 4" have been eschewed entirely.

title: Trash Box
text: Overall, there are 109 tracks in the box set (excluding the introduction and ending cuts) as compared to 101 songs on the individual CDs and 72 tracks in the "Pebbles Box".

title: Trash Box
text: Although most of the recordings on "the Trash Box" were released at some point on one of the individual Pebbles albums, several of the songs have not appeared elsewhere in the Pebbles series.

title: Trash Box
text: Inexplicably, one of these songs is the well-known hit "I Fought the Law (but the Law Won)" by the Bobby Fuller Four (on Disc Four) – which is also included in the "Pebbles Box" – in place of the much rarer "Wine Wine Wine" by Bobby Fuller that appears on "Pebbles, Volume 2".

title: Mono Masters
text: Mono Masters is a compilation album by the Beatles, and is an alternate, all-mono version of the album "Past Masters".

title: Mono Masters
text: "Mono Masters" was originally a two-CD set included as part of "The Beatles in Mono" box set.

title: Mono Masters
text: The premise of this box set was to compile only Beatles material which was released or prepared for release with a dedicated mono mix (the set excludes later material mixed and released only in stereo, and material whose mono version was simply created as an equal mix of the two channels of the stereo version).

title: Mono Masters
text: As a result, the track listing for "Mono Masters" differs from "Past Masters" on the second half of disc two, omitting some later songs that never had a mono mix ("Old Brown Shoe", "The Ballad of John and Yoko" and "Let It Be"), and adding several songs released on stereo-only albums that had unreleased mono mixes.

title: Mono Masters
text: Tracks 9–12 and 15 were prepared in March 1969 for release as a 7" mono "Yellow Submarine" EP, two months after the release of the similarly titled soundtrack album, but the project was scrapped, although the EP was mastered.

title: Mono Masters
text: Subsequently, the tracks were only released in stereo (and in an electronically produced mono mixdown, or "fold-down", of the stereo mix), while the true mono mixes remained unreleased.

title: Mono Masters
text: "Get Back" (with B-side "Don't Let Me Down") was the final Beatles single mixed for mono format.

title: Mono Masters
text: It was released in the UK in mono, though the US release was in stereo.

title: Mono Masters
text: Thus, the songs that were originally released on stereo singles in the UK are omitted on this release.

title: Ephraim Sklyansky
text: Ephraim Markovich Sklyansky (Russian: Эфраим Маркович Склянский ) (August 12  1892 - August 27, 1925) was a Soviet statesman.

title: Ephraim Sklyansky
text: He joined the Bolsheviks during his years as a student in the medical faculty of Kiev University, from which he graduated in 1916; he was immediately drafted into the army, where he served as a doctor and became prominent in the clandestine military organizations of the Bolsheviks.

title: Ephraim Sklyansky
text: At the time of the October Revolution he was a member of the Military Revolutionary Committee of the Petrograd Soviet; on meeting him in November, Leon Trotsky was so impressed with his "great creative "élan" combined with concentrated attention to detail" that he appointed him his deputy on the Revolutionary Military Council, where he served with distinction during the Russian Civil War (1918-1920) and helped improve the fighting condition of the Red Army—Trotsky called him the Carnot of the Russian Revolution.

title: Ephraim Sklyansky
text: In 1924 his position as Trotsky's deputy was taken over by Grigory Zinoviev's ally Mikhail Frunze.

title: Ephraim Sklyansky
text: Instead, he was made chairman of the Mossukno state textile trust, and the following May he left on a tour of Germany, France, and the United States to acquire technical information.

title: Ephraim Sklyansky
text: On August 27, 1925 he died in a boating accident on Long Lake (New York) along with , the first head of Amtorg Trading Corporation.

title: Ephraim Sklyansky
text: The high-ranking Soviet defector Boris Bazhanov was convinced that Sklyansky had been drowned on Stalin's orders, and the alleged accident had been organized by and Genrikh Yagoda.

title: Mikhail Gorbachev
text: Mikhail Sergeyevich Gorbachev, ( ; Russian: Михаи́л Серге́евич Горбачёв ; ] ; born 2 March 1931) is a former Soviet statesman.

title: Mikhail Gorbachev
text: He was the eighth and last leader of the Soviet Union, having been General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union from 1985 until 1991.

title: Mikhail Gorbachev
text: He was the country's head of state from 1988 until 1991 (titled as Chairman of the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet from 1988 to 1989, as Chairman of the from 1989 to 1990, and as Soviet Union]] from 1990 to 1991).

title: Nikolai Podgorny
text: Nikolai Viktorovich Podgorny (Russian: Никола́й Ви́кторович Подго́рный ; ] , Ukrainian: Микола Вікторович Підгорний ; 18 February  1903 – 11 January 1983) was a Soviet statesman during the Cold War.

title: Nikolai Podgorny
text: He served as First Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Ukraine from 1957 to 1963 and as Chairman of the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet from 1965 to 1977.

title: Nikolai Podgorny
text: He was replaced as Chairman of the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet in 1977 by General Secretary Leonid Brezhnev.

title: Nikolai Podgorny
text: That same year he lost his seat in the Political Bureau (Politburo) and was forced to resign from active politics.

title: David Waksberg
text: David Jonathan Waksberg, born December 14, 1956 in New York City, was a leading activist in the Soviet Jewry Movement during the 1980s and early 1990s.

title: David Waksberg
text: In the 1970s he became involved in the Student Struggle for Soviet Jewry.

title: David Waksberg
text: In the early 1980s he moved to California and began working for the Bay Area Council for Soviet Jews, first as Assistant Director, and later as Executive Director.

title: David Waksberg
text: He initiated public and political activities on behalf of Soviet Jewry, supervised research and monitoring of their welfare and coordinated financial, medical and legal aid to Refuseniks and Prisoners of Conscience trapped in the Soviet Union.

title: David Waksberg
text: He organized numerous protest demonstrations and vigils to raise public awareness of the plight of Jews in the USSR.

title: David Waksberg
text: In 1985 Waksberg became National Vice-President of BACSJ's umbrella organization, the Union of Councils for Soviet Jews.

title: David Waksberg
text: Waksberg frequently visited Jewish communities the Soviet Union and the Former Soviet states and coordinated briefings of the American travelers interested in visiting those communities.

title: David Waksberg
text: In 1990 Waksberg took on the role of Director of the Center for Jewish Renewal, newly established by UCSJ.

title: David Waksberg
text: The mission of the CJR was to promote the renewal and development of Jewish life in the USSR and the emigration rights, human rights and resettlement needs of Jews in the Former Soviet Union.

title: David Waksberg
text: The CJR established a network of human rights and emigration bureaus in major cities of the former Soviet Union.

title: David Waksberg
text: In mid-1990s Waksberg was a member of Bay Area Council's Board of Directors and served as Director of Development and Communication of the UCSJ.

title: David Waksberg
text: Since 2007 Waksberg serves as Executive Director of the Bureau of Jewish Education of San Francisco.

title: Feliks Dzerzhinskiy (ship)
text: The Feliks Dzerzhinskiy (Russian: Феликс Дзержинский ) is a "Valerian Kuybyshev"-class (92-016, OL400) Soviet/Russian river cruise ship, cruising in the Volga basin.

title: Feliks Dzerzhinskiy (ship)
text: The ship was built by Slovenské Lodenice at their shipyard in Komárno, Czechoslovakia, and entered service in 1978.

title: Feliks Dzerzhinskiy (ship)
text: She was named after the Soviet statesman Felix Dzerzhinsky alias Iron Felix.

title: Feliks Dzerzhinskiy (ship)
text: At 3,935 tonnes, "Feliks Dzerzhinskiy" is one of the world's biggest river cruise ships.

title: Feliks Dzerzhinskiy (ship)
text: Her sister ships are "Valerian Kuybyshev", "Mikhail Frunze", "Fyodor Shalyapin", "Sergey Kuchkin", "Mstislav Rostropovich", "Aleksandr Suvorov", "Semyon Budyonnyy" and "Georgiy Zhukov".

title: Feliks Dzerzhinskiy (ship)
text: "Feliks Dzerzhinskiy" is currently operated by "Vodohod", a Russian river cruise line.

title: Feliks Dzerzhinskiy (ship)
text: Her home port is currently Nizhny Novgorod.

title: Andrei Kirilenko (politician)
text: Andrei Pavlovich Kirilenko (Russian: Андре́й Па́влович Кириле́нко ; ] ; 8 September  1906 – 12 May 1990) was a Soviet statesman from the start to the end of the Cold War.

title: Andrei Kirilenko (politician)
text: In 1906, Kirilenko was born at Alexeyevka in Belgorod Oblast to a Ukrainian working-class family.

title: Andrei Kirilenko (politician)
text: He graduated in the 1920s from a local vocational school, and again in the mid-to-late 1930s from the Rybinsk Aviation Technology Institute.

title: Andrei Kirilenko (politician)
text: He became a member of the All-Union Communist Party (bolsheviks) in 1930.

title: Andrei Kirilenko (politician)
text: As many like him, Kirilenko climbed up the Soviet hierarchy through the "industrial ladder"; by the 1960s, he was Vice-Chairman of the Bureau of the Central Committee of the Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic (RSFSR).

title: Andrei Kirilenko (politician)
text: After Nikita Khrushchev's forced resignation, Kirilenko became Leonid Brezhnev's "chief lieutenant" within the Central Committee.

title: Anastas Mikoyan
text: Anastas Ivanovich Mikoyan ; 25 November 1895 – 21 October 1978) was an Old Bolshevik and Soviet statesman during the mandates of Lenin, Stalin, Khrushchev, and Brezhnev.

title: Anastas Mikoyan
text: He was the only Soviet politician who managed to remain at the highest levels of power within the Communist Party of the Soviet Union, as that power oscillated between the Central Committee and the Politburo, from the latter days of Lenin's rule, throughout the eras of Stalin and Khrushchev, until his peaceful retirement after the first months of Brezhnev's rule.

title: MS Excelsior Neptune
text: MS "Excelsior Neptune" (originally, the "Feliks Dzerzhinskiy") was an ocean liner owned by the Soviet Union's Black Sea Shipping Company.

title: MS Excelsior Neptune
text: She was built in 1958 by VEB Mathias-Thesen Werft, Wismar, East Germany, as one of the Mikhail Kalinin series of ships.

title: MS Excelsior Neptune
text: It was named after Felix Dzerzhinsky, a Soviet statesman and founder of the Soviet secret police (Cheka).

title: Sergo Mikoyan
text: Sergo Anastasi Mikoyan (Armenian: Սերգո Անաստասի Միկոյան ; Russian: Сергo Анаста́сович Микоян ; June 5, 1929 – March 7, 2010) was one of the Soviet Union's leading historians who specialized on the foreign policies of the Soviet Union and the United States in Latin America.

title: Sergo Mikoyan
text: He was the son of Anastas Mikoyan, an Old Bolshevik and high level Soviet statesman and adviser to Soviet leader Nikita Khrushchev.

title: Mikhail Suslov
text: Mikhail Andreyevich Suslov (Russian: Михаи́л Андре́евич Су́слов ; 21 November  1902 25 January 1982) was a Soviet statesman during the Cold War.

title: Mikhail Suslov
text: He served as Second Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union from 1965, and as unofficial Chief Ideologue of the Party until his death in 1982.

title: Mikhail Suslov
text: Suslov was responsible for party democracy and the power separation within the Communist Party.

title: Mikhail Suslov
text: His hardline attitude toward change made him one of the foremost anti-reformist Soviet leaders.

title: Silene menziesii
text: Silene menziesii is a species of flowering plant in the pink family known by the common names Menzies' campion and Menzies' catchfly.

title: Silene menziesii
text: It is native to western North America from Alaska through the western half of Canada to the southwestern United States.

title: Silene menziesii
text: It can be found in many types of habitat and it is quite common in much of its range.

title: Silene menziesii
text: It is variable in morphology and there are a number of varied subtaxa.

title: Silene menziesii
text: In general, it is a perennial herb growing from a caudex, appearing matlike, decumbent, or erect, with stems a few centimeters to over half a meter long.

title: Silene menziesii
text: It is usually hairy in texture, with upper parts bearing sticky glandular hairs.

title: Silene menziesii
text: The leaves are lance-shaped, oppositely arranged in pairs, and a few centimeters in length, upper leaves usually smaller than lower.

title: Silene menziesii
text: Flowers may occur in a cyme at the top of the stem, or in leaf axils, or both.

title: Silene menziesii
text: Each is encapsulated in a hairy, veined calyx of fused sepals.

title: Silene menziesii
text: The petals are white with two lobes at the tips.

title: Silene menziesii
text: The plant is dioecious with male and female plants producing different flowers.

title: Silene menziesii
text: The male and female flower types look the same externally; the stamens are reduced in female plants and the stigmas are reduced in the male.

title: Silene stenophylla
text: Silene stenophylla is a species of flowering plant in the family Caryophyllaceae.

title: Silene stenophylla
text: Commonly called narrow-leafed campion, it is a species in the genus "Silene".

title: Silene stenophylla
text: It grows in the Arctic tundra of far eastern Siberia and the mountains of Northern Japan.

title: Silene stenophylla
text: Frozen samples, estimated via radiocarbon dating to be around 32,000 years old, were discovered in the same area as current living specimens, and in 2012 a team of scientists successfully regenerated a plant from the samples.

title: Silene tomentosa
text: Silene tomentosa, the Gibraltar campion, is a very rare flowering plant of the genus "Silene" and the family Caryophyllaceae.

title: Silene tomentosa
text: It is a woody-based perennial about 40cm high, with bilobed flowers ranging from pink to pale violet and is endemic to Gibraltar.

title: Silene oregana
text: Silene oregana is a species of flowering plant in the pink family known by the common names Oregon silene, Oregon campion and Oregon catchfly.

title: Silene oregana
text: It is native to the western United States, including the Great Basin, where it grows in habitat such as sagebrush and forests.

title: Silene oregana
text: It is a perennial herb growing from a woody caudex and taproot, sending up an erect, mostly unbranched stem which may be 70 centimeters tall.

title: Silene oregana
text: The lance-shaped leaves are up to 8 centimeters long around the caudex, and shorter farther up the stem.

title: Silene oregana
text: Flowers occur in a terminal cyme and sometimes in leaf axils.

title: Silene oregana
text: Each flower is encapsulated in a hairy, glandular calyx of fused sepals.

title: Silene oregana
text: The five petals are creamy white or pink-tinged in color and each has four to six long, fringelike lobes at the tip.

title: Silene noctiflora
text: Silene noctiflora is a species of flowering plant in the pink family known by the common names night-flowering catchfly, nightflowering silene and clammy cockle.

title: Silene noctiflora
text: It is native to Eurasia, but it is known on other continents as an introduced species and sometimes a weed.

title: Silene noctiflora
text: In North America, it is a common weed of grain crops in the Canadian prairie provinces and in much of the United States.

title: Silene noctiflora
text: It grows in fields and in other disturbed habitat.

title: Sex determination in Silene
text: "Silene" are a flowering plant that evolved a dioecious reproductive system.

title: Sex determination in Silene
text: This is made possible through heteromorphic sex chromosomes expressed as XY.

title: Sex determination in Silene
text: "Silene" recently evolved sex chromosomes 5-10 million years ago and are widely used by geneticists and biologists to study the mechanisms of sex determination since they are one of only 39 species across 14 families of angiosperm that possess sex-determining genes.

title: Sex determination in Silene
text: "Silene" are studied because of their ability to produce offspring with a plethora of reproductive systems.

title: Sex determination in Silene
text: The common inference drawn from such studies is that the sex of the offspring is determined by the Y chromosome.

title: Silene conoidea
text: Silene conoidea is a species of flowering plant in the pink family known by the common names weed silene and large sand catchfly.

title: Silene conoidea
text: It is native to Eurasia, and it is known in other parts of the world, such as western North America, as a weed.

title: Silene conoidea
text: It is an annual herb growing up to a meter in height with a hairy, partially glandular stem.

title: Silene conoidea
text: The lance-shaped leaves are up to 12 centimeters long near the base of the plant and smaller farther up.

title: Silene conoidea
text: The flower is enclosed in an inflated, hairy, glandular calyx of fused sepals which is ridged with many veins.

title: Silene conoidea
text: It is open at the top, revealing five bright pink petals.

title: Silene antirrhina
text: Silene antirrhina is a species of flowering plant in the pink family known by the common names sleepy silene and sleepy catchfly.

title: Silene antirrhina
text: It is native to the Americas, where it is widespread throughout North America and parts of South America.

title: Silene antirrhina
text: It is known in Europe as an introduced species.

title: Silene suksdorfii
text: Silene suksdorfii is a species of flowering plant in the pink family known by the common names Suksdorf's silene, Suksdorf's catchfly and Cascade alpine campion.

title: Silene suksdorfii
text: It is native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States, where it occurs from Washington and Idaho to northern California.

title: Silene suksdorfii
text: It is mainly an alpine species, growing in the talus of high mountain slopes.

title: Silene suksdorfii
text: It can also be found below the tree line in forested subalpine habitat.

title: Silene suksdorfii
text: It is a squat perennial herb producing several erect stems from a leafy, woody caudex.

title: Silene suksdorfii
text: It generally takes a clumpy form.

title: Silene suksdorfii
text: The stems grow up to 10 or 15 centimeters tall and are hairy in texture, with glandular, sticky areas on the upper parts.

title: Silene suksdorfii
text: The leaves occur in tufts around the caudex.

title: Silene suksdorfii
text: They are fleshy and coated in soft hairs.

title: Silene suksdorfii
text: Solitary flowers arise on erect peduncles.

title: Silene suksdorfii
text: Each is encapsulated in an inflated calyx of fused sepals, which is starkly purple-veined and has purplish glandular hairs.

title: Silene suksdorfii
text: The petals are white or purple-tinged and have two lobes at their tips and appendages at their bases.

title: Silene latifolia
text: Silene latifolia (formerly "Melandrium album"), the white campion is a dioecious flowering plant in the family Caryophyllaceae, native to most of Europe, Western Asia and Northern Africa.

title: Silene latifolia
text: It is a herbaceous annual, occasionally biennial or a short-lived perennial plant, growing to between 40-80 centimetres tall.

title: Silene latifolia
text: It is also known in the USA as bladder campion but should not be confused with "Silene vulgaris", which is more generally called Bladder Campion.

title: Savoia-Marchetti SM.79
text: The Savoia-Marchetti SM.79 "Sparviero" (Italian for sparrowhawk) was a three-engined Italian medium bomber with a wood-and-metal structure.

title: Savoia-Marchetti SM.79
text: Originally designed as a fast passenger aircraft, between 1937 and 1939 this low-wing monoplane set 26 world records, qualifying it for some time as the fastest medium bomber in the world.

title: Savoia-Marchetti SM.79
text: It first saw action during the Spanish Civil War and flew on all fronts in which Italy was involved during World War II.

title: Savoia-Marchetti SM.79
text: It achieved success as a torpedo bomber in the Mediterranean theater, and became the best-known Italian aeroplane of the war.

title: Savoia-Marchetti SM.79
text: It was easily recognizable due to its distinctive fuselage dorsal "hump", and was well liked by its crews, who nicknamed it "il gobbo maledetto" ("damned hunchback").

title: Tupolev Tu-12
text: The Tupolev Tu-12 (development designation Tu-77) was an experimental Soviet jet-powered medium bomber developed from the successful piston-engined Tupolev Tu-2 bomber after the end of World War II.

title: Tupolev Tu-12
text: It was designed as a transitional aircraft to familiarize Tupolev and the VVS with the issues involved with jet-engined bombers.

title: South West Pacific Area (command)
text: South West Pacific Area (SWPA) was the name given to the Allied supreme military command in the South West Pacific Theatre of World War II.

title: South West Pacific Area (command)
text: It was one of four major Allied commands in the Pacific War.

title: South West Pacific Area (command)
text: SWPA included the Philippines, Borneo, the Dutch East Indies (excluding Sumatra), East Timor, Australia, the Territories of Papua and New Guinea, and the western part of the Solomon Islands.

title: South West Pacific Area (command)
text: It primarily consisted of United States and Australian forces, although Dutch, Filipino, British and other Allied forces also served in the SWPA.

title: Asiatic-Pacific Theater
text: The Asiatic-Pacific Theater, was the theater of operations of U.S. forces during World War II in the Pacific War during 1941-45.

title: Asiatic-Pacific Theater
text: From mid-1942 until the end of the war in 1945, there were two U.S. operational commands in the Pacific.

title: Asiatic-Pacific Theater
text: The Pacific Ocean Areas (POA), divided into the Central Pacific Area, the North Pacific Area and the South Pacific Area, were commanded by Admiral Chester W. Nimitz, Commander-in-Chief Pacific Ocean Areas.

title: Asiatic-Pacific Theater
text: The South West Pacific Area (SWPA) was commanded by General Douglas MacArthur, Supreme Allied Commander South West Pacific Area.

title: Asiatic-Pacific Theater
text: During 1945, the United States added the United States Strategic Air Forces in the Pacific, commanded by General Carl A. Spaatz.

title: Coastwatchers
text: The Coastwatchers, also known as the Coast Watch Organisation, Combined Field Intelligence Service or Section C, Allied Intelligence Bureau, were Allied military intelligence operatives stationed on remote Pacific islands during World War II to observe enemy movements and rescue stranded Allied personnel.

title: Coastwatchers
text: They played a significant role in the Pacific Ocean theatre and South West Pacific theatre, particularly as an early warning network during the Guadalcanal campaign.

title: Edwin A. Doss
text: Edwin A. Doss (September 14, 1914January 7, 1996) was an American fighter pilot and commander in the U.S. Air Force during World War II and Korean War.

title: Edwin A. Doss
text: Logging more than 4,500 flying hours, Doss flew 573 combat hours and accrued 280 combat missions during his leadership in the South West Pacific Theatre and Korean War.

title: Edwin A. Doss
text: For his two-year service as commander of the 35th Fighter Group during World War II, Doss was awarded the Distinguished Flying Cross, Legion of Merit, and the Air Medal.

title: Edwin A. Doss
text: He received his second Legion of Merit and the Korean Ulchi medal with a Silver Star for his assignments as commander of the 49th Fighter Bomber Wing and the 3rd Bomber Wing at Kunsan, Korea.

title: Edwin A. Doss
text: Colonel Doss’s service has been cited as integral to the development of long-range fighter tactics in the South West Pacific Theater.

title: No. 12 Squadron RAAF
text: No. 12 Squadron was a Royal Australian Air Force (RAAF) general purpose, bomber and transport squadron.

title: No. 12 Squadron RAAF
text: The squadron was formed in 1939 and saw combat in the South West Pacific theatre of World War II.

title: No. 12 Squadron RAAF
text: From 1941 to 1943, it mainly conducted maritime patrols off northern Australia.

title: No. 12 Squadron RAAF
text: The squadron was based at Merauke in western New Guinea from November 1943 to July 1944, when it was withdrawn from operations.

title: No. 12 Squadron RAAF
text: After being re-equipped, it operated as a heavy bomber unit from February 1945 until the end of the war.

title: No. 12 Squadron RAAF
text: The squadron continued in this role until it was redesignated No. 1 Squadron RAAF in February 1948.

title: No. 12 Squadron RAAF
text: The squadron was reformed in 1973 to operate transport helicopters but was again disbanded in 1989.

title: South West Pacific theatre of World War II
text: The South West Pacific theatre, during World War II, was a major theatre of the war between the Allies and Japan.

title: South West Pacific theatre of World War II
text: It included the Philippines, the Dutch East Indies (except for Sumatra), Borneo, Australia and its mandate Territory of New Guinea (including the Bismarck Archipelago) and the western part of the Solomon Islands.

title: South West Pacific theatre of World War II
text: This area was defined by the Allied powers' South West Pacific Area (SWPA) command.

title: English Electric Canberra
text: The English Electric Canberra is a British first-generation jet-powered medium bomber that was manufactured during the 1950s.

title: English Electric Canberra
text: It was developed by English Electric during the mid-to-late 1940s in response to a 1944 Air Ministry requirement for a successor to the wartime de Havilland Mosquito fast-bomber.

title: English Electric Canberra
text: Amongst the performance requirements for the type was the demand for an outstanding high altitude bombing capability in addition to flying at high speeds.

title: English Electric Canberra
text: These were partly accomplished by making use of newly developed jet propulsion technology.

title: English Electric Canberra
text: When the Canberra was introduced to service with the Royal Air Force (RAF), the type's first operator, in May 1951, it became the service's first jet-powered bomber aircraft.

title: No. 2 Squadron RAAF
text: No. 2 Squadron is a Royal Australian Air Force (RAAF) squadron that operates from RAAF Base Williamtown, near Newcastle, New South Wales.

title: No. 2 Squadron RAAF
text: From its formation in 1916 as part of the Australian Flying Corps, it has flown a variety of aircraft types including fighters, bombers, and Airborne Early Warning & Control (AEW&C).

title: No. 2 Squadron RAAF
text: During World War I, the squadron operated on the Western Front conducting fighter sweeps and ground-attack missions.

title: No. 2 Squadron RAAF
text: It was disbanded in mid-1919, following the end of hostilities.

title: No. 2 Squadron RAAF
text: The squadron was briefly re-raised in 1922 as part of the newly independent RAAF, but was disbanded after only a couple of months and not reformed until 1937.

title: No. 2 Squadron RAAF
text: It saw action as a bomber unit in the South West Pacific theatre of World War II and, equipped with English Electric Canberra jets, in the Malayan Emergency and the Vietnam War.

title: No. 2 Squadron RAAF
text: The squadron was again disbanded in 1982, following the retirement of the Canberra.

title: No. 2 Squadron RAAF
text: It was re-formed in 2000 to operate the Boeing 737 AEW&C "Wedgetail".

title: No. 2 Squadron RAAF
text: One of the six Boeing 737s was deployed to the Middle East in September 2014, as part of Australia's contribution to the military coalition against ISIS.

title: 2012 Colorado Buffaloes football team
text: The 2012 Colorado Buffaloes football team represented the University of Colorado Boulder during the 2012 NCAA Division I FBS football season.

title: 2012 Colorado Buffaloes football team
text: Led by second-year head coach and alumnus Jon Embree, the Buffaloes played their home games on-campus at Folsom Field in Boulder and were members of the Pac-12 Conference.

title: 2012 Colorado Buffaloes football team
text: On November 25, 2012, head coach Jon Embree was fired after compiling a 4–21 record including 1–11 in his final year, the worst year in the history of Colorado Buffaloes football.

title: 2016–17 Colorado Buffaloes men's basketball team
text: The 2016–17 Colorado Buffaloes men's basketball team represented the University of Colorado in the 2016–17 NCAA Division I men's basketball season.

title: 2016–17 Colorado Buffaloes men's basketball team
text: They were led by head coach Tad Boyle in his seventh season at Colorado.

title: 2016–17 Colorado Buffaloes men's basketball team
text: The Buffaloes played their home games at Coors Events Center in Boulder, Colorado as members of the Pac-12 Conference.

title: 2016–17 Colorado Buffaloes men's basketball team
text: They finished the season 19–15, 8–10 in Pac-12 play to finish in seventh place.

title: 2016–17 Colorado Buffaloes men's basketball team
text: They defeated Washington State in the first round of the Pac-12 Tournament to advance to the quarterfinals where they lost to Arizona.

title: 2016–17 Colorado Buffaloes men's basketball team
text: They were invited to the National Invitation Tournament where the lost in the first round to UCF.

title: 2015–16 Colorado Buffaloes men's basketball team
text: The 2015–16 Colorado Buffaloes men's basketball team represented the University of Colorado in the 2015–16 NCAA Division I men's basketball season.

title: 2015–16 Colorado Buffaloes men's basketball team
text: This was Tad Boyle's sixth season as head coach at Colorado.

title: 2015–16 Colorado Buffaloes men's basketball team
