title: Donald Trump (Last Week Tonight)
text: "Donald Trump" is a segment of the HBO news satire television series "Last Week Tonight with John Oliver" devoted to Donald Trump, who later became the President of the United States.

title: Donald Trump (Last Week Tonight)
text: It first aired on February 28, 2016, as part of the third episode of "Last Week Tonight"'s third season, when Trump was the frontrunner for the Republican Party nomination for the presidency.

title: Donald Trump (Last Week Tonight)
text: During the 22-minute segment, comedian John Oliver discusses Trump's 2016 presidential campaign and his career in business, outlining his campaign rhetoric, varying political positions and failed business ventures.

title: Donald Trump (Last Week Tonight)
text: He also says the Trump family name was changed at one point from the ancestral name "Drumpf".

title: Quando Eu Era Vivo
text: Quando Eu Era Vivo (English: When I Was Alive ) is a 2014 Brazilian drama-thriller film directed by Marco Dutra, based on the novel "A Arte de Produzir Efeito Sem Causa" by Lourenço Mutarelli.

title: 4 a.m. (novel)
text: 4 a.m. is the debut novel of Scottish author Nina de la Mer.

title: 4 a.m. (novel)
text: It was first published in the UK on 26 August 2011 by Brighton-based publishing house Myriad Editions.

title: 4 a.m. (novel)
text: The novel draws on the author's personal experiences and research, covering rave culture of the 90s and peacetime life in the British Army.

title: Before We Say Goodbye
text: Before We Say Goodbye, first published as Prima di Lasciarsi, is a 2004 novel by Gabriella Ambrosio.

title: Before We Say Goodbye
text: The work is based on the 2002 Kiryat HaYovel supermarket bombing and narrates the final hours in the lives of the suicide bomber and her victims.

title: Before We Say Goodbye
text: It was first published in Italy in 2004 through Nutrimenti, and was later published in English on 2 August 2010 through Walker Books.

title: Before We Say Goodbye
text: The novel has been published in multiple languages, including Arabic and Hebrew, and has been endorsed by Amnesty International.

title: The Witch's Daughter
text: The Witch's Daughter is a children's novel by Nina Bawden, first published in 1966.

title: The Witch's Daughter
text: It has been dramatised for television twice, with Fiona Kennedy (1971) and Sammy Glenn (1996) in the title role.

title: Drained
text: Drained, (Portuguese: O Cheiro do Ralo_ is a 2006 Brazilian dark comedy film based on a novel by Lourenço Mutarelli.

title: Drained
text: It was directed by Heitor Dhalia, and stars Selton Mello.

title: Drained
text: The film was produced by Geração Conteúdo, Primo Filmes & RT Features.

title: Buckskin Brigades
text: Buckskin Brigades is a Western novel written by L. Ron Hubbard, first published July 30, 1937.

title: Buckskin Brigades
text: The work was Hubbard's first hard-covered book, and his first published novel.

title: Buckskin Brigades
text: The next year he became a contributor to "Astounding Science Fiction".

title: Buckskin Brigades
text: Winfred Blevins wrote the introduction to the book.

title: Buckskin Brigades
text: Some sources state that as a young man, Hubbard became a blood brother to the Piegan Blackfeet Native American tribe while living in Montana, though this claim is disputed.

title: Buckskin Brigades
text: Hubbard incorporates historical background from the Blackfeet tribe into the book.

title: The Birds on the Trees
text: The Birds on the Trees is a novel by Nina Bawden first published in 1970 about a middle-class English family whose 19-year-old son does not live up to his parents' expectations.

title: Three Comrades (novel)
text: Three Comrades (German: "Drei Kameraden" ) is a novel first published in 1936 by the German author Erich Maria Remarque.

title: Three Comrades (novel)
text: It is written in first person by the main character Robert Lohkamp, whose somewhat disillusioned outlook on life is due to his horrifying experiences in the trenches of the First World War's French-German front.

title: Three Comrades (novel)
text: He shares these experiences with Otto Köster and Gottfried Lenz, his two comrades with whom he runs an auto-repair shop in late 1920s Berlin (probably).

title: Three Comrades (novel)
text: Remarque wrote the novel in exile and it was first published in Dutch translation as "Drie kameraden", with English translation following soon in "Good Housekeeping" from January to March 1937 and in the book form in the same year.

title: Three Comrades (novel)
text: First German language edition was published in 1938 by exile publisher "Querido" in Amsterdam, but the novel was published in Germany only in 1951.

title: The Golden Hour (novel)
text: The Golden Hour is a children's novel by Maiya Williams.

title: The Golden Hour (novel)
text: It was first published in 2004 and is the first of the Golden Hour time travel series.

title: The Golden Hour (novel)
text: It tells the story of Rowan Popplewell and his sister, Nina, who, while emotionally disturbed by the death of their mother, travel back in time to the French Revolution.

title: Spirit of the Border
text: Spirit of the Border is an historical novel written by Zane Grey, first published in 1906.

title: Spirit of the Border
text: The novel is based on events occurring in the Ohio River Valley in the late eighteenth century.

title: Spirit of the Border
text: It features the exploits of Lewis Wetzel, a historical personage who had dedicated his life to the destruction of Native Americans and to the protection of nascent white settlements in that region.

title: Spirit of the Border
text: The story deals with the attempt by Moravian Church missionaries to Christianize Indians and how two brothers' lives take different paths upon their arrival on the border.

title: Spirit of the Border
text: A highly romanticized account, the novel is the second in a trilogy, the first of which is "Betty Zane", Grey's first published work, and "The Last Trail", which focuses on the life of Jonathan Zane, Grey's ancestor.

title: Garajonay National Park
text: Garajonay National Park (Spanish: "Parque nacional de Garajonay" , ] ) is located in the center and north of the island of La Gomera, one of the Canary Islands (Spain).

title: Garajonay National Park
text: It was declared a national park in 1981 and a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 1986.

title: Garajonay National Park
text: It occupies 40 km (15 sq mi) and it extends into each of the six municipalities on the island.

title: North Cascades National Park
text: North Cascades National Park is a U.S. National Park located in the state of Washington.

title: North Cascades National Park
text: The park is the largest of the three National Park Service units that comprise the North Cascades National Park Service Complex.

title: North Cascades National Park
text: Several national wilderness areas and British Columbia parkland adjoin the National Park.

title: North Cascades National Park
text: The park features rugged mountain peaks and protects portions of the North Cascades range.

title: Roque Cinchado
text: The Roque Cinchado is a rock formation, regarded as emblematic of the island of Tenerife (Canary Islands, Spain).

title: Roque Cinchado
text: It lies within the Teide National Park (a World Heritage Site) in the municipality of La Orotava, near the volcano of the same name, in the heart of the island.

title: Roque Cinchado
text: The Roque Cinchado is one of the largest in the world by altitude, for the entire park totals more than 2000 metres.

title: Adenocarpus viscosus
text: Adenocarpus viscosus is a shrubby species of flowering plant in the legume family Fabaceae, subfamily Faboideae.

title: Adenocarpus viscosus
text: It is endemic to the Canary Islands where it is known locally as Codeso del Pico.

title: Adenocarpus viscosus
text: It can be found above 1800 m on two of the islands, La Palma in Caldera de Tabouriente and Tenerife where it is a dominant shrub in Teide National Park and occurs in parts of Corona Forestal Nature Park and Reserva Especial de las Palomas.

title: Training centre for release of the Atma-energy
text: Training centre for release of the Atma-energy (German: "Trainingszentrum zur Freisetzung der Atmaenergie"), also known as "Atman Foundation", was a new religious movement active mainly on the island of Tenerife and in Germany.

title: Training centre for release of the Atma-energy
text: This sect was originally a splinter group of the Brahma Kumaris and is known for a police and media scare in which an alleged attempt to commit ritual suicide took place in Teide National Park in Tenerife.

title: Training centre for release of the Atma-energy
text: The group believed in the end of the world but according to the religious studies scholar Georg Schmid and the sociologist Massimo Introvigne had no intention of collective suicide.

title: Teide National Park
text: Teide National Park (Spanish: "Parque nacional del Teide" , ] ) is a national park located in Tenerife (Canary Islands, Spain).

title: Crater Lake National Park
text: Crater Lake National Park is a United States National Park located in southern Oregon.

title: Crater Lake National Park
text: Established in 1902, Crater Lake National Park is the fifth-oldest national park in the U.S. and the only national park in Oregon.

title: Crater Lake National Park
text: The park encompasses the caldera of Crater Lake, a remnant of a destroyed volcano, Mount Mazama, and the surrounding hills and forests.

title: Glacier National Park Fund
text: The Glacier National Park Fund (established in 1999), is an organization whose main goal is to raise money to support the demands of the Glacier National Park, located in West Glacier, Montana.

title: Glacier National Park Fund
text: According to the National Park Service, the Glacier National Park Fund supports park projects, programs, and services in four areas: to preserve the park experience, to provide curriculum-based instruction, to research the park ecosystem, and to prepare for the 2010 Centennial year of the park.

title: Glacier National Park Fund
text: The Glacier National Park Fund provided funds for different studies.

title: Glacier National Park Fund
text: In July 2007, The Glacier National Park Fund funded a study involving human and bear aversion techniques.

title: Glacier National Park Fund
text: Also, in 2009, The Glacier National Park Fund granted $10,000 to enable biologists to learn more about the Bighorn Sheep that inhabit Glacier National Park, along the park's boundary with the Blackfeet Indian Reservation.

title: Glacier National Park Fund
text: The Glacier National Park Fund has an official mascot named Billy Bowman.

title: Hermigua
text: Hermigua is a town and a municipality in the northeastern part of La Gomera in the province of Santa Cruz de Tenerife of the Canary Islands, Spain.

title: Hermigua
text: It is located 12 km northwest of the island's capital, San Sebastián de la Gomera.

title: Hermigua
text: The Garajonay National Park covers the southern part of the municipality.

title: Alpine National Park
text: The Alpine National Park is a national park located in the Central Highlands and Alpine regions of Victoria, Australia.

title: Alpine National Park
text: The 646000 ha national park is located northeast of Melbourne.

title: Alpine National Park
text: It is the largest National Park in Victoria, and covers much of the higher areas of the Great Dividing Range in Victoria, including Victoria's highest point, Mount Bogong at 1986 m and the associated subalpine woodland and grassland of the Bogong High Plains.

title: Alpine National Park
text: The park's north-eastern boundary is along the border with New South Wales, where it abuts the Kosciuszko National Park.

title: Alpine National Park
text: On 7 November 2008 the Alpine National Park was added to the Australian National Heritage List as one of eleven areas constituting the Australian Alps National Parks and Reserves.

title: The Collected Short Stories of Roald Dahl
text: The Collected Short Stories of Roald Dahl is a 1991 short story collection for adults by Roald Dahl.

title: The Collected Short Stories of Roald Dahl
text: The collection, containing tales of macabre malevolence, comprises many of Dahl's stories seen in the television series "Tales of the Unexpected" and previously collected in "Someone Like You" (1953), "Kiss, Kiss" (1960), "Twenty-Nine Kisses from Roald Dahl" (1969), "Ppo poo face" (1974), and "" (1989).

title: Roald Dahl's Willy Wonka (musical)
text: Roald Dahl's Willy Wonka is a musical that combines elements of both Roald Dahl's book "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory" and of the 1971 movie "Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory" with newly created material.

title: Roald Dahl's Willy Wonka (musical)
text: The musical has several versions: the original version which premiered in 2004, the Junior version, the Kids version, and the Theatre for Young Audiences version.

title: Roald Dahl's Willy Wonka (musical)
text: All are owned by Music Theatre International, the company that owns the Willy Wonka license.

title: The Roald Dahl Treasury
text: The Roald Dahl Treasury is an anthology of works of the children's author Roald Dahl.

title: The Roald Dahl Treasury
text: It was first published in the United Kingdom in 1997 by Puffin Books.

title: Roald Dahl Children's Gallery
text: The Roald Dahl Children's Gallery is in Church Street, Aylesbury, Buckinghamshire, England.

title: Roald Dahl Children's Gallery
text: A children's museum in honour of Roald Dahl, it was opened on 23 November 1996 by Terence Hardiman, an actor popular with children due to his role as the titular role in "The Demon Headmaster".

title: Roald Dahl Children's Gallery
text: The building was previously a coach-house.

title: Mrs. Bixby and the Colonel's Coat
text: "Mrs. Bixby and the Colonel's Coat" is a short story by Roald Dahl that first appeared in the 1959 issue of "Nugget".

title: Mrs. Bixby and the Colonel's Coat
text: The story is Dahl's variation on a popular anecdote dating back at least to 1939: a married woman receives a glamorous mink coat from a man with whom she had an affair.

title: Mrs. Bixby and the Colonel's Coat
text: She hopes to sneak the coat into her home without arousing her husband's suspicions, but soon discovers that her husband has plans of his own.

title: Roald Dahl: Collected Stories
text: Roald Dahl: Collected Stories is a hardcover edition of short-stories by Roald Dahl for adults.

title: Roald Dahl: Collected Stories
text: It was published in the US in October 2006 by Random House as part of the Everyman Library.

title: Roald Dahl: Collected Stories
text: The present volume includes for the first time all the stories in chronological order as established by Dahl's biographer, Jeremy Treglown, in consultation with the Dahl estate.

title: Roald Dahl: Collected Stories
text: A few of the short stories were not published chronologically in book form, but appeared later, collected in "More Tales of the Unexpected" (1980).

title: Roald Dahl: Collected Stories
text: The collection contains all of the short stories published in the following collections:

title: Roald Dahl Plass
text: Roald Dahl Plass is a public space in Cardiff Bay, Cardiff, Wales.

title: Roald Dahl Plass
text: It is named after Cardiff-born author Roald Dahl, and is located on the coast along the south of the city centre.

title: Roald Dahl Plass
text: The square is home to the Senedd (Welsh Assembly Building) and the Wales Millennium Centre, a performing arts centre.

title: Roald Dahl Plass
text: The bowl-like shape of the space has made it a popular amphitheatre for hosting open-air concerts.

title: The Best of Roald Dahl
text: The Best of Roald Dahl is a collection of 25 of Roald Dahl's short stories.

title: The Best of Roald Dahl
text: The first edition was published in 1978.

title: Tales of the Unexpected (short story collection)
text: Roald Dahl's Tales of the Unexpected is a collection of sixteen short stories written by British author Roald Dahl and first published in 1979.

title: Tales of the Unexpected (short story collection)
text: All of the stories were earlier published in various magazines, and then in the collections "Someone Like You" and "Kiss Kiss".

title: Roald Dahl short stories bibliography
text: Roald Dahl short stories bibliography is a comprehensive annotated list of short stories written by Roald Dahl.

title: CrissCross
text: CrissCross is a 1992 American drama film directed by Chris Menges and written by Scott Sommer, based on his homonymous novel.

title: CrissCross
text: It stars Goldie Hawn, Arliss Howard, Keith Carradine, Steve Buscemi, and David Arnott.

title: Made in Britain
text: Made in Britain is a 1982 British television play written by David Leland, and directed by Alan Clarke, about a 16-year-old racist skinhead named Trevor, and his constant confrontations with authority figures.

title: Made in Britain
text: It was originally broadcast on ITV on 10 July 1983 as fourth in an untitled series of works by Leland (including "Birth of a Nation"), loosely based around the British educational system, which subsequently acquired the overall title of "Tales Out of School".

title: Made in Britain
text: As with many Alan Clarke works, the director attempts to depict English working-class life realistically, without moralising or complex plots.

title: Made in Britain
text: The play features strong language, violence, racism and an anti-establishment feeling.

title: Made in Britain
text: Cinematographer Chris Menges's use of the Steadicam contributed to the fluid and gritty atmosphere of the play.

title: The Lost Son (film)
text: The Lost Son is a 1999 crime drama starring French actor Daniel Auteuil and set in London.

title: The Lost Son (film)
text: It was directed by Chris Menges.

title: Linda Mvusi
text: Linda Mvusi (c. 1955 in Bloemfontein- ) is an actress and architect.

title: Linda Mvusi
text: Mvusi took an award for best actress at the 1988 Cannes Film Festival for her role in the film "A World Apart" which was directed by Chris Menges.

title: Linda Mvusi
text: Mvusi was the first South African to get a best Actress award at Cannes.

title: Linda Mvusi
text: Mvusi also shared in an award for excellence for her architecture on the Apartheid Museum.

title: End of the Road (1970 film)
text: End of the Road is a 1970 film directed, co-written, and edited by Aram Avakian and adapted from a 1958 novel by John Barth, and stars Stacy Keach, James Earl Jones and Harris Yulin.

title: A World Apart (film)
text: A World Apart is a 1988 anti-Apartheid drama, written by Shawn Slovo and directed by Chris Menges.

title: A World Apart (film)
text: It is based on the lives of Slovo's parents, Ruth First and Joe Slovo.

title: A World Apart (film)
text: The film was a co-production between companies from the UK and Zimbabwe, where the movie was filmed.

title: A World Apart (film)
text: It features Hans Zimmer's first non-collaborative film score.

title: 11 Harrowhouse
text: 11 Harrowhouse is a 1974 British film directed by Aram Avakian.

title: 11 Harrowhouse
text: It was adapted by Charles Grodin based upon the novel by Gerald A. Browne with the screenplay by Jeffrey Bloom.

title: 11 Harrowhouse
text: It stars Charles Grodin, Candice Bergen, James Mason, Trevor Howard and John Gielgud.

title: Second Best (film)
text: Second Best is a 1994 British film produced by Sarah Radclyffe and directed by Chris Menges.

title: Second Best (film)
text: It closely follows the 1991 novel of the same name by David Cook, who also wrote the screenplay.

title: Chris Menges
text: Chris Menges BSC, ASC (born 15 September 1940) is an English cinematographer and film director.

title: Chris Menges
text: He is a member of both the American and British Societies of Cinematographers.

title: Cops and Robbers (1973 film)
text: Cops and Robbers is a 1973 crime comedy film directed by Aram Avakian with an original screenplay by Donald E. Westlake which Westlake subsequently expanded into a novel.

title: Cops and Robbers (1973 film)
text: The film stars Cliff Gorman as Tom and Joseph Bologna as Joe.

title: Advice column
text: An advice column is a column traditionally presented in a magazine or newspaper, though it can also be delivered through other news media, such as the internet and broadcast news media.

title: Advice column
text: The advice column format is question and answer: a (usually anonymous) reader writes to the media outlet with a problem in the form of a question, and the media outlet provides an answer or response.

title: Advice column
text: The responses are written by an advice columnist (colloquially known in British English as an agony aunt, or agony uncle if the columnist is male).

title: Advice column
text: The image presented was originally of an older woman dispensing comforting advice and maternal wisdom, hence the name "aunt".

title: Advice column
text: An advice columnist can also be someone who gives advice to people who send in problems to the newspaper.

title: EvidenceNetwork.ca
text: EvidenceNetwork.ca creates media content on public policy topics for publication in the mainstream media and links journalists with policy experts to provide access to non-partisan, evidence-based information.

title: EvidenceNetwork.ca
text: According to their annual reports, they have published hundreds of original articles in every major media outlet in Canada every year since 2011, reprinted over 3700 times across media outlets All of their content carries a Creative Commons license.

title: State media
text: State media or state-owned media is media for mass communication which is "controlled financially and editorially by the state."

title: State media
text: These news outlets may be the sole media outlet or may exist in competition with corporate and non-corporate media.

title: 14ymedio
text: 14ymedio is the first independent digital media outlet in Cuba.

title: 14ymedio
text: It was founded on May 21, 2014, by the Cuban blogger and activist Yoani Sánchez and the Cuban journalist Reinaldo Escobar.

title: 14ymedio
text: The project started with a group of 12 reporters, whose objective was to produce a digital media outlet with different types of news.

title: 14ymedio
text: The newspaper contains news about Cuba and the world, in topics related to national politics, international politics, economy, culture, society, science and technology, and sports.

title: 14ymedio
text: It also publishes editorials, opinion articles, and interviews.

title: The Conversation (website)
text: The Conversation is an independent, not-for-profit media outlet that uses content sourced from the academic and research community.

title: The Conversation (website)
text: Since the Australian website's launch in March 2011, it has expanded into six editions, with the addition of a United Kingdom (UK) version in 2013, United States (US) in 2014, Africa in May 2015, France in September 2015, and Global in September 2016.

title: The Conversation (website)
text: "The Conversation" publishes all content under a Creative Commons license and, as of May 2017, reports a monthly online audience of 5.2 million users onsite, and a reach of 35 million people through creative commons republication.

title: Accessible Media
text: AMI is a not-for-profit media company that entertains, informs and empowers Canadians who are blind or partially sighted.

title: Accessible Media
text: Operating three broadcast services, AMI-tv and AMI-audio in English and AMI-télé in French, AMI’s vision is to establish and support a voice for Canadians with disabilities, representing their interests, concerns and values through accessible media, reflection and portrayal.

title: Andrew Jaspan
text: Andrew Jaspan, (b. 20 April 1952) British-Australian journalist, the co-founder of "The Conversation", an independent not-for-profit website of analysis and news from the university and research sector and its Editor-in-Chief from The Conversation's launch in March 2011 until March 2017.

title: Vatican leaks scandal
text: The Vatileaks scandal is a scandal initially involving leaked Vatican documents, exposing alleged corruption; in addition, an internal Vatican investigation purportedly uncovered the blackmailing of homosexual clergy by individuals outside the Church.

title: Vatican leaks scandal
text: Italian journalist Gianluigi Nuzzi published letters from Archbishop Carlo Maria Viganò, in which he begged not to be transferred for having exposed alleged corruption that cost the Holy See millions in higher contract prices.

title: Vatican leaks scandal
text: The name "VatiLeaks" is a play on the word "WikiLeaks", a not-for-profit media organisation whose goal is to bring important news and information to the public.

title: Chicago Public Media
text: Chicago Public Media is a not-for-profit media company that operates as the primary National Public Radio member organization for Chicago.

title: Chicago Public Media
text: It owns three non-commercial educational FM broadcast stations and one FM translator, and produces the programs "Wait Wait... Don't Tell Me!

title: Chicago Public Media
text: " for NPR stations, "This American Life" which is self-distributed but uses PRX for distribution to other radio stations, and "Sound Opinions" for PRX.

title: Chicago Public Media
text: CPM is based at Navy Pier in Chicago.

title: 990WBOB
text: 990WBOB is a digital media and radio outlet based in Providence, Rhode Island.

title: 990WBOB
text: Founded in Providence, Rhode Island in 2007, 990WBOB.

title: 990WBOB
text: com is an all-encompassing digital media powerhouse in the New England market.

title: 990WBOB
text: An independent media outlet and two-time Providence Phoenix Best Blog Award winner, 990WBOB.

title: 990WBOB
text: com provides up-to-the-minute news, sports, politics and weather through its award-winning digital print and radio platform with more than 80,000 listeners in Rhode Island and availability in more than 200,000 homes nationwide.

title: Mihai Mălaimare Jr.
text: Mihai Mălaimare Jr. (born 1975) is a Romanian cinematographer.

title: Mihai Mălaimare Jr.
text: He is the son of the Romanian actor and former politician .

title: Mihai Mălaimare Jr.
text: He was a cinematographer on films directed by Francis Ford Coppola and Paul Thomas Anderson.

title: Mihai Mălaimare Jr.
text: He was nominated for Best Cinematography at the 24th Independent Spirit Awards for "Youth Without Youth" in 2008.

title: Independent Spirit Award for Best Editing
text: The Independent Spirit Award for Best Editing is one of the annual awards given by Independent Spirit Awards, a non-profit organization dedicated to independent film and independent filmmakers.

title: 32nd Independent Spirit Awards
text: The 32nd Independent Spirit Awards (2017) nominees were announced by Film Independent, the nonprofit arts organization that produces them, on November 22, 2016.

title: 32nd Independent Spirit Awards
text: The ceremony, hosted by Nick Kroll and John Mulaney, took place on Saturday, February 25, 2017, and was broadcast live on IFC at 2:00 pm PT.

title: 32nd Independent Spirit Awards
text: Online streaming service Sundance Now live-streamed the Spirit Awards concurrently with the telecast, with an on-demand version available on Sundance Now.

title: Silent Light
text: Silent Light (Plautdietsch: "Stellet Licht"; Spanish: "Luz silenciosa" ) is a 2007 film written and directed by Carlos Reygadas.

title: Silent Light
text: Filmed in a Mennonite colony close to Cuauhtémoc, Chihuahua State, Northern Mexico, "Silent Light" tells the story of a Mennonite married man who falls in love with another woman, threatening his place in the conservative community.

title: Silent Light
text: The dialogue is in Plautdietsch, the Low German dialect of the Mennonites.

title: Silent Light
text: The film was selected as the Mexican entry for the Best Foreign Language Oscar at the 80th Academy Awards, but it did not make the shortlist.

title: Silent Light
text: The film was nominated for Best Foreign Film at the 24th Independent Spirit Awards.

title: Silent Light
text: It gained nine nominations, including all major categories, in the Ariel Awards, the Mexican national awards.

title: Independent Spirit Award for Best Cinematography
text: The Independent Spirit Award for Best Cinematography is one of the annual awards given by Independent Spirit Awards, a non-profit organization dedicated to independent film and independent filmmakers.

title: Independent Spirit Award for Best Film
text: The Independent Spirit Award for Best Film (or Best Feature) is one of the annual Independent Spirit Awards.

title: 28th Independent Spirit Awards
text: The 2012 Independent Spirit Awards was the 28th annual occasion of the Film Independent Spirit Awards.

title: 28th Independent Spirit Awards
text: It announced its nominees on November 27, 2012.

title: 28th Independent Spirit Awards
text: The winners were announced on February 23, 2013 during an awards ceremony hosted by Andy Samberg.

title: Independent Spirit Award for Best First Feature
text: The Independent Spirit Award for Best First Feature is one of the annual Independent Spirit Awards.

title: Independent Spirit Award for Best First Feature
text: It is usually given to the director (or directors) and producer (or producers).

title: Independent Spirit Award for Best First Feature
text: The "first feature" designation is applied to the director not the producer(s).

title: Independent Spirit Award for Best First Feature
text: Therefore, producers have been nominated multiple times.

title: Independent Spirit Awards
text: The Film Independent Spirit Awards (abbreviated "Spirit Awards" and originally known as the FINDIE or Friends of Independents Awards), founded in 1984, are awards dedicated to independent filmmakers.

title: Independent Spirit Awards
text: Winners were typically presented with acrylic glass pyramids containing suspended shoestrings representing the paltry budgets of independent films.

title: Independent Spirit Awards
text: Since 2006, winners have received a trophy depicting a bird with its wings spread sitting atop of a pole with the shoestrings from the previous design wrapped around the pole.

title: Neil LaBute
text: Neil N. LaBute (born March 19, 1963) is an American film director, screenwriter, playwright and actor.

title: Neil LaBute
text: He is best-known for a play that he wrote and later turned into a film, "In the Company of Men" (1997), which won awards from the Sundance Film Festival, the Independent Spirit Awards, and the New York Film Critics Circle.

title: Neil LaBute
text: He wrote and directed the films "Possession" (2002) (based on the A.S. Byatt novel), "The Shape of Things" (2003) (based on his play of the same name), "The Wicker Man" (2006), "Some Velvet Morning" (2013), and "Dirty Weekend" (2015).

title: Neil LaBute
text: He directed the films "Nurse Betty" (2000), "Lakeview Terrace" (2008), and "Death at a Funeral" (2010).

title: Neil LaBute
text: LaBute created the TV series "Billy & Billie", writing and directing all of the episodes and is also creator of "Van Helsing".

title: Neil LaBute
text: He also directed several episodes for shows such as "Hell on Wheels" and "Billions".

title: Bill Cosby Is a Very Funny Fellow...Right!
text: Bill Cosby is a Very Funny Fellow...Right!

title: Bill Cosby Is a Very Funny Fellow...Right!
text: is the debut album release by Bill Cosby.

title: Bill Cosby Is a Very Funny Fellow...Right!
text: It was recorded live at the nightclub The Bitter End in New York City's Greenwich Village during early 1963.

title: Bill Cosby Is a Very Funny Fellow...Right!
text: The album includes three sketches about Noah.

title: At Last Bill Cosby Really Sings
text: At Last Bill Cosby Really Sings is an album by Bill Cosby.

title: At Last Bill Cosby Really Sings
text: It is his fifth music-based album and the only one released on the Stax Records-distributed Partee Records.

title: At Last Bill Cosby Really Sings
text: It features appearances from former Stevie Wonder band members like future R&B star Ray Parker, Jr. on guitar, and also features a second collaboration with his songwriting partner Stu Gardner, who plays organ on this set.

title: Yes, Yes, Yes
text: "Yes, Yes, Yes" is a musical comedy/parody song co-written, recorded and released as a single in 1976 by comedian Bill Cosby.

title: Yes, Yes, Yes
text: The song came from Cosby's 1976 album, "Bill Cosby Is Not Himself These Days".

title: Disco Bill
text: Disco Bill (1977) is an album by Bill Cosby.

title: Disco Bill
text: It is his fifth, and last, musical comedy/parody album.

title: Disco Bill
text: As with "Bill Cosby Is Not Himself These Days", Cosby stated he improvised much of the material on the album; as its name implies, the album spoofs the disco craze of the late 1970s.

title: Why Is There Air?
text: Why Is There Air?

title: Why Is There Air?
text: (1965) is Bill Cosby's third album.

title: Why Is There Air?
text: It was recorded at the Flamingo Hotel in Las Vegas, Nevada.

title: Why Is There Air?
text: It won the 1966 Grammy Award for Best Comedy Album.

title: Bill Cosby Talks to Kids About Drugs
text: Bill Cosby Talks to Kids About Drugs (1971) is an album by Bill Cosby.

title: Bill Cosby Talks to Kids About Drugs
text: Unlike most of his recordings, this is not a full-fledged comedy album, but rather a record intended for children to school them on the dangers of drugs through songs and dialogue.

title: Bill Cosby Talks to Kids About Drugs
text: It won the Grammy Award in 1972 for Best Recording for Children.

title: Bill's Best Friend
text: Bill's Best Friend is the 17th comedy album by Bill Cosby.

title: Bill's Best Friend
text: Much of the material was recycled in the film and accompanying album "Himself".

title: Bill's Best Friend
text: The story of the car with the airplane engine was previously attributed to Fat Albert, while on this album the owner is referred to as "Charlie Waynes".

title: Bill's Best Friend
text: The car in the Fat Albert sketch was a 1941 Mercury.

title: Bill's Best Friend
text: The car on this album is a 1942 DeSoto.

title: Bill's Best Friend
text: This album and his previous Capitol Records album were repackaged in Australia as a two-CD set in 1992 called "The Bill Cosby Collection".

title: The Original Jam Sessions 1969
text: The Original Jam Sessions 1969 is a 2004 released album by Quincy Jones and Bill Cosby recorded as backing music for "The Bill Cosby Show" in 1969.

title: Hikky Burr
text: theme song for "The Bill Cosby Show", and was also released as a well-known single in 1969.

title: Hikky Burr
text: It was written and performed by Quincy Jones and Bill Cosby.

title: Hikky Burr
text: It is known for its nonsense lyrics.

title: Hikky Burr
text: It is on the album "Smackwater Jack".

title: Hikky Burr
text: "Hikky Burr" was featured on the album "The Original Jam Sessions 1969", and on "The Best of Bill Cosby".

title: Inside the Mind of Bill Cosby
text: Inside the Mind of Bill Cosby (1972) is the 14th album of stand up comedy by Bill Cosby.

title: Inside the Mind of Bill Cosby
text: It is the fifteenth such album he released, but only the fourth on Uni Records (when that label folded, the album was distributed by its parent company, MCA).

title: Inside the Mind of Bill Cosby
text: The album is available on compact disc, but to date the other Uni albums have not been so released.

title: Energy shot
text: Energy shots are a specialized kind of energy drink that contain a dose of the stimulant caffeine in a small amount of liquid.

title: Energy shot
text: Whereas most energy drinks are sold in cans or bottles, energy shots are usually sold in 50ml bottles.

title: Energy shot
text: Energy shots can contain the same total amount of caffeine, vitamins or other functional ingredients as their larger versions, and may be considered concentrated forms of energy drinks.

title: Energy shot
text: "Micro shot" energy drinks also exist, containing only 1-5 teaspoons of liquid.

title: Soft drink
text: A soft drink (see terminology for other names) is a drink that typically contains carbonated water, a sweetener, and a natural or artificial flavoring.

title: Soft drink
text: The sweetener may be sugar, high-fructose corn syrup, fruit juice, sugar substitutes (in the case of diet drinks), or some combination of these.

title: Soft drink
text: Soft drinks may also contain caffeine, colorings, preservatives, and other ingredients.

title: Gibson (cocktail)
text: The Gibson is a mixed drink made with gin and vermouth, and often garnished with a pickled onion.

title: Gibson (cocktail)
text: The oldest published recipe for the Gibson is found in the 1908 book, "The World's Drinks And How To Mix Them" by William Boothby.

title: Tum-E Yummies
text: Tum-E Yummies is a line of fruit flavored water drinks.

title: Tum-E Yummies
text: The drinks come in a 10.1oz bottle with a resealable sport cap.

title: Tum-E Yummies
text: They have 50 calories, 13g of sugar, and contain 100% daily value of vitamins C, B6 and B12 per bottle and are available in flavors Very Berry Blue, Orange-arific, Fruitabulous Punch, Greentastic Apple, and Sour-sational Raspberry.

title: Tum-E Yummies
text: Tum-E Yummies is sold nationwide in the juice aisle or cooler in stores like Walmart & Kroger, and other grocery, convenience, value, and mass merchandiser stores.

title: Gin pennant
text: The gin pennant (sometimes gin flag or drinking pennant) is a maritime flag.

title: Gin pennant
text: When flown aboard ship, it indicates an open invitation to other ships' officers to come aboard for drinks.

title: List of soft drinks by country
text: This is a list of soft drinks in order of the brand's country of origin.

title: List of soft drinks by country
text: A soft drink is a beverage that typically contains water (often, but not always, carbonated water), usually a sweetener and usually a flavoring agent.

title: List of soft drinks by country
text: The sweetener may be sugar, high-fructose corn syrup, fruit juice, sugar substitutes (in the case of diet drinks) or some combination of these.

title: List of soft drinks by country
text: Soft drinks may also contain caffeine, colorings, preservatives and other ingredients.

title: Rubicon Drinks
text: Rubicon Drinks Ltd (formerly Rubicon Products Ltd) is a soft drink manufacturer based in Milton Keynes, UK.

title: Rubicon Drinks
text: The company specialises in exotic soft drinks, and produces a variety of different flavours of drink, many of which contain sugar or artificial sweeteners, and which come in both still and sparkling varieties.

title: Rubicon Drinks
text: In the United Kingdom, their drinks are bottled and distributed by A.G. Barr plc.

title: Flaming beverage
text: Flaming beverages include cocktails and other mixed drinks that contain flammable, high-proof alcohol, which is ignited prior to consumption.

title: Flaming beverage
text: The alcohol may be an integral part of the drink, or it may be floated as a thin layer across the top of the drink.

title: Flaming beverage
text: The flames are mostly for dramatic flair.

title: Flaming beverage
text: However, in combination with certain ingredients, the flavor of the drink is altered.

title: Flaming beverage
text: Some flavors are enhanced, and it may impart a toasted flavor to some drinks.

title: Phillips Distilling Company
text: Phillips Distilling Company (est. 1912) is a Minneapolis, Minnesota-based distillery and house brand of liquors known for its omnipresence in the bars, taverns, and private shelves of the Great Plains.

title: Phillips Distilling Company
text: Brands such as UV Vodka and Prairie Vodka are becoming popular across the nation.

title: Phillips Distilling Company
text: Phillips produces a variety of liquors such as Vodka, Gin, Rum, Canadian whisky, Brandy and many flavors of Schnapps.

title: Phillips Distilling Company
text: In recent years, Phillips has branched out beyond standard liquors with a variety of specialty drinks, such as Revel Stoke Spiced Whisky (the original spiced whisky), Gin-Ka (a combination of gin and vodka), Phillips Union Whiskey, the 100 proof series of Schnapps (Hot, Blue, and Root Beer), and vodka such as UV Vodka and the handcrafted and organic Prairie Vodka.

title: Phillips Distilling Company
text: Phillips also produced an herbal liqueur, aptly named "Black 100" for its 50% alcohol by volume content and opaque black color, similar in texture and flavor to Schwartzhog or Jakob Steiner.

title: CytoSport
text: CytoSport is an American manufacturer of sports-oriented nutritional products, or "supplements" based in Benicia, California.

title: CytoSport
text: It offers a line of protein-enhanced powders, shakes, and bars has broken into the mainstream market with a ready-to-drink form of protein supplement Muscle Milk, a non-dairy beverage which is trans-fat-free, lactose-free, contain no high fructose corn syrup and is shelf stable.

title: CytoSport
text: Muscle Milk mainly markets on taste by using familiar milkshake flavors such as banana, milk chocolate and vanilla to drive consumers to the product, along with multiple drink sizes and formats, including powders and being sold in convenience stores alongside regular energy drinks and sports drinks.

title: New Haven Documentary Film Festival
text: New Haven Documentary Film Festival (also known as NHdocs) is an annual documentary film festival held in New Haven, Connecticut, over a weekend in the month of June.

title: New Haven Documentary Film Festival
text: Screenings take place at Yale University’s Whitney Humanities Center Auditorium and the New Haven Free Public Library.

title: New Haven Documentary Film Festival
text: NHdocs is a regional festival that showcases documentaries by filmmakers from the greater New Haven area and beyond.

title: New Haven Documentary Film Festival
text: NHdocs was launched in 2014 when the film festival’s co-founders Charles Musser, Gorman Bechard, Jacob Bricca, and Lisa Molomot came together at the Big Sky Documentary Film Festival and decided to create a documentary film festival in New Haven that would “build a sense of community among documentary filmmakers from the greater New Haven area.”

title: New Haven Documentary Film Festival
text: In 2014, the four filmmakers each showed one of their recently completed documentaries, three of which had just played at the Big Sky.

title: Thomas Gordon (writer)
text: Thomas Gordon (c. 1691–1750) was a Scottish writer and Commonwealthman.

title: Thomas Gordon (writer)
text: Along with John Trenchard, he published "The Independent Whig", which was a weekly periodical.

title: Thomas Gordon (writer)
text: From 1720 to 1723, Trenchard and Gordon wrote a series of 144 essays entitled "Cato's Letters", condemning corruption and lack of morality within the British political system and warning against tyranny.

title: Thomas Gordon (writer)
text: The essays were published as "Essays on Liberty, Civil and Religious", at first in the "London Journal" and then in the "British Journal".

title: Thomas Gordon (writer)
text: These essays became a cornerstone of the Commonwealth man tradition and were influential in shaping the ideas of the Country Party.

title: Thomas Gordon (writer)
text: His ideas played an important role in shaping republicanism in Britain and especially in the American colonies leading up to the American revolution.

title: Thomas Gordon (writer)
text: Zuckert argues, "The writers who, more than any others, put together the new synthesis that is the new republicanism were John Trenchard and Thomas Gordon, writing in the early eighteenth century as "Cato."

title: Docville
text: The International Documentary Film Festival Docville is an annual documentary film festival set in Leuven, Belgium.

title: Chagrin Documentary Film Festival
text: Chagrin Documentary Film Festival is an annual documentary film festival based in Chagrin Falls, Ohio.

title: Chagrin Documentary Film Festival
text: The festival debuted in 2010, with 93 films showing in venues throughout the village.

title: Chagrin Documentary Film Festival
text: That year, the festival had an attendance of 1,800.

title: Chagrin Documentary Film Festival
text: By the 2015 festival, that number had grown to almost 7,000, while the number of films shrank to less than 70.

title: London International Documentary Festival
text: The London International Documentary Festival (or LIDF) is an annual documentary film festival that takes place in the months of March and April every year.

title: London International Documentary Festival
text: The event is presented in association with the London Review of Books.

title: Doc NYC
text: Doc NYC (stylized as DOC NYC) is an annual documentary film festival in New York City.

title: Doc NYC
text: Co-founded by Thom Powers and his wife Raphaela Neihausen, the festival is the country's largest documentary film festival with over 300 films and events and 200 special guests.

title: Doc NYC
text: The festival takes place over eight days in November at the West Village's IFC Center and Chelsea's Cinépolis and SVA Theater.

title: FreedomFilmFest
text: FreedomFilmFest, also known as The KOMAS Freedom Film Festival (FFF), is the first annual documentary film festival in Malaysia.

title: FreedomFilmFest
text: Established in 2003, it adopts the themes encompassed in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR), pioneering a documentary film competition method in Malaysia which encourages first-time film makers to turn their winning proposals into films.

title: London Review of Books
text: The London Review of Books (LRB) is a British journal of literary essays.

title: London Review of Books
text: It is published fortnightly.

title: British Journal
text: The British Journal was an English newspaper published from 22 September 1722 until 13 January 1728.

title: British Journal
text: The paper was then published as the British Journal or The Censor from 20 January 1728 until 23 November 1730, and then as the British Journal or The Traveller from 30 November 1730 until 20 March 1731.

title: British Journal of Social Psychology
text: The British Journal of Social Psychology is a peer-reviewed academic journal published by Wiley-Blackwell on behalf of the British Psychological Society.

title: British Journal of Social Psychology
text: It publishes original papers on subjects like social cognition, attitudes, group processes, social influence, intergroup relations, self and identity, nonverbal communication, and social psychological aspects of affect and emotion, and of language and discourse.

title: British Journal of Social Psychology
text: The journal was established in 1962 as the "British Journal of Social and Clinical Psychology" and obtained its current title in 1981.

title: British Journal of Social Psychology
text: According to the "Journal Citation Reports", the journal has a 2010 impact factor of 2.056.

title: West McLean, Virginia
text: West McLean is an unincorporated community in Fairfax County, Virginia, United States.

title: West McLean, Virginia
text: West McLean is located in the western part of the McLean census-designated place and includes much of the Tysons Corner area.

title: West McLean, Virginia
text: West McLean has its own post office which has ZIP code 22103, which is used primarily for the PO Boxes at that Post Office.

title: West McLean, Virginia
text: Other than the Post Office itself, West McLean uses ZIP code 22102.

title: Tysons Galleria
text: Tysons Galleria is a three-level super-regional mall owned by General Growth Properties located at 2001 International Drive, McLean, Virginia, in Tysons Corner.

title: Tysons Galleria
text: It is the second-largest mall in McLean/Tysons Corner, and one of the largest in the Washington metropolitan area.

title: Scott's Run Nature Preserve
text: Scott's Run Nature Preserve is a nature preserve in Fairfax County, Virginia, United States.

title: Scott's Run Nature Preserve
text: Located in McLean, it is bordered by Virginia State Route 193 to its south, Interstate 495 to its east and the Potomac River to its north.

title: Scott's Run Nature Preserve
text: It encompasses 336 acre of woodland with its namesake, Scott's Run, flowing through its west side.

title: Scott's Run Nature Preserve
text: Scott's Run originates in nearby Tysons Corner and enters the Potomac on the northwest side of the preserve.

title: Scott's Run Nature Preserve
text: The preserve is noted for including eastern hemlocks among its plant life, which are rare for the area.

title: Scott's Run Nature Preserve
text: It is a popular destination for recreation and hiking and is operated by the Fairfax County Park Authority.

title: Poughkeepsie Galleria
text: The Poughkeepsie Galleria (locally known as "The Galleria") is an upscale shopping center on U.S. 9 in the Town of Poughkeepsie, New York, located just north of Wappingers Falls, and is the largest shopping center in Dutchess County.

title: Poughkeepsie Galleria
text: The Galleria has an area of 1100000 sqft with two floors containing 140 shops and 14 restaurants as well as a 16-screen, stadium-seating Regal Cinemas theater.

title: Tysons, Virginia
text: Tysons, or formerly “Tysons Corner” is a census-designated place (CDP) and unincorporated community in Fairfax County, Virginia, United States.

title: Tysons, Virginia
text: Located in Northern Virginia between the community of McLean and the town of Vienna along the Capital Beltway (I-495), it lies within the Washington Metropolitan Area.

title: Tysons, Virginia
text: Tysons is home to two super-regional shopping malls—Tysons Corner Center and Tysons Galleria—and the corporate headquarters of numerous companies such as Intelsat, Gannett, Hilton Worldwide, Freddie Mac, Capital One and Booz Allen Hamilton.

title: Tysons, Virginia
text: Tysons is Fairfax County's central business district and a regional commercial center.

title: Tysons, Virginia
text: It has been characterized as a quintessential example of an edge city.

title: Tysons, Virginia
text: The population was 19,627 as of the 2010 census.

title: McLean, Virginia
text: McLean ( ) is a census-designated place (CDP) in Fairfax County in Northern Virginia.

title: McLean, Virginia
text: McLean is home to many diplomats, businessmen, members of Congress, and high-ranking government officials partially due to its proximity to Washington, D.C. and the Central Intelligence Agency.

title: McLean, Virginia
text: It is the location of Hickory Hill, the former home of Ethel Kennedy, the widow of Robert F. Kennedy.

title: McLean, Virginia
text: It is also the location of Salona, the former home of Light-Horse Harry Lee, the Revolutionary War hero.

title: McLean, Virginia
text: The community had an estimated total population of 53,673 in 2015, according to estimates prepared by the United States Census Bureau.

title: McLean, Virginia
text: It is located between the Potomac River and the town of Vienna.

title: McLean, Virginia
text: McLean is known for its luxury homes and its high-end shopping destinations: the Tysons Corner Center and the Tysons Galleria.

title: McLean, Virginia
text: The two McLean zip codes - 22101 and 22102 - are among the most expensive ZIP Codes in Virginia and the United States.

title: McLean station
text: McLean (preliminary name Tysons East, Tysons–McLean) is a Washington Metro station in Fairfax County, Virginia, on the Silver Line.

title: McLean station
text: The station is located in Tysons Corner, with a McLean postal address.

title: McLean station
text: It began operation on July 26, 2014.

title: Tysons Corner Center
text: Tysons Corner Center, located in the Tysons Corner unincorporated area in Fairfax County, Virginia, United States (between McLean and Vienna, Virginia), opened to the public in 1968, becoming one of the first fully enclosed, climate-controlled shopping malls in the Washington metropolitan area.

title: Cobb Galleria Centre
text: The Cobb Galleria Centre is a meeting and convention center and a shopping center in the Cumberland/Galleria district of Cobb County, northwest of Atlanta, Georgia, in the United States.

title: Cobb Galleria Centre
text: It is also located next to a cluster of mid-rise office buildings, the Cumberland Mall and the Cobb Energy Performing Arts Centre.

title: Cobb Galleria Centre
text: It has hosted over 15,000 events and millions of guests.

title: Cobb Galleria Centre
text: The venue operates under the direction of the Cobb-Marietta Coliseum and Exhibit Hall Authority and is located at the intersection of three major highways: Interstate 75, Interstate 285, and Cobb Parkway (U.S. 41) just northwest of the city.

title: Cobb Galleria Centre
text: The Galleria Specialty Mall, which pre-dates the convention center, is located downstairs, with meeting halls upstairs.

title: Spring Hill station
text: Spring Hill (preliminary names Tysons West, Tysons–Spring Hill Road) is a Washington Metro station in Fairfax County, Virginia, on the Silver Line.

title: Spring Hill station
text: Located in Tysons Corner, it began operation on July 26, 2014.

title: Spring Hill station
text: The station is located in the central median of Leesburg Pike (SR 7) just west of Spring Hill Road.

title: Owens & Minor
text: Owens & Minor () is a Fortune 500 company based in Mechanicsville, Virginia, just outside of Richmond.

title: Owens & Minor
text: Owens & Minor, Inc. is a healthcare logistics company specializing in contracting packages of healthcare products for hospitals.

title: Owens & Minor
text: Owens and Minor's tagline is "Connecting the World of Medical Products to the Point of Care".

title: Owens & Minor
text: The company provides supply chain services to healthcare providers and manufacturers of healthcare products, including disposable medical supplies as well as devices and implants.

title: Owens & Minor
text: Owens and Minor has logistics operations in the United States and Europe, where three quarters of global healthcare spending occurs.

title: Owens & Minor
text: Owens & Minor’s customers span the healthcare market from independent hospitals to large integrated healthcare networks, as well as group purchasing organizations, healthcare products manufacturers, and the federal government.

title: Owens & Minor
text: Owens & Minor is headquartered in Mechanicsville, Virginia, and has annualized revenues exceeding $9 billion.

title: Compass Minerals
text: Compass Minerals International, Inc is a United States listed public company that, through its subsidiaries, is a leading producer of minerals, including salt, magnesium chloride, sulfate of potash and other plant nutrition products.

title: Compass Minerals
text: Based in Kansas City, the company provides bulk treated and untreated highway deicing salt to customers in North America and the United Kingdom and plant nutrition products to growers worldwide.

title: Compass Minerals
text: Compass Minerals also produces consumer deicing and water conditioning products, consumer and commercial culinary salt, and other mineral-based products for consumer, agricultural, and industrial applications.

title: Compass Minerals
text: In addition, Compass Minerals provides records management services to businesses throughout the United Kingdom.

title: Cardinal Health
text: Cardinal Health, Inc. is a Fortune 500 health care services company based in Dublin, Ohio.

title: Cardinal Health
text: The company specializes in distribution of pharmaceuticals and medical products, serving more than 100,000 locations.

title: Cardinal Health
text: The company also manufactures medical and surgical products, including gloves, surgical apparel and fluid management products.

title: Cardinal Health
text: In addition, it operates the nation’s largest network of radiopharmacies.

title: Cardinal Health
text: Cardinal Health provides medical products to over 75 percent of hospitals in the United States.

title: Cardinal Health
text: In December 2013, it was announced that Cardinal Health would team up with CVS Caremark, which would form the largest generic drug sourcing operation in the United States.

title: Cardinal Health
text: The venture was named Red Oak Sourcing and began operations in July 2014.

title: Kingstone Companies
text: Kingstone Companies, Inc., which has its headquarters in Kingston, New York, provides property and casualty insurance products through its subsidiary, Kingstone Insurance Company.

title: Kingstone Companies
text: It places contracts with the third-party licensed premium finance company through its subsidiary Payments, Inc, a NYS licensed Insurance Premium Finance Company.

title: Kingstone Companies
text: Kingstone Insurance Company was ranked #1 of the 81 insurers rated by the Professional Insurance Agents Association in its 2010 Company Performance Survey.

title: Kingstone Companies
text: The company sells insurance products include personal lines of insurance products, general liability policies commercial automobile policies and so on through independent retail and wholesale agents and brokers.

title: Jonathan Michael Ansell
text: Jonathan M. Ansell (born August 13, 1950 in Binghamton, New York) is an American entrepreneur and CEO in the insurance and insurtech industry.

title: Jonathan Michael Ansell
text: Ansell is the founder and CEO of insurtech companies Merlinio Technologies and Merlinio Insurance Services, an online digital insurance agency and technology platform serving the millennial market.

title: Jonathan Michael Ansell
text: Before Merlinio, Ansell was a co-founder and CEO of Fusion Company, a global digital merchandising provider that specializes in ancillary products.

title: Jonathan Michael Ansell
text: Fusion was created in 2012 after being spun-out of a large international insurance company.

title: Jonathan Michael Ansell
text: Previously Ansell was the President, CEO and one of the co-founders of what is now Allianz Global Assistance USA, one of the largest travel insurance companies in the US and American specialty insurer Jefferson Insurance Company.

title: Jonathan Michael Ansell
text: He was also a member of the management board of Allianz Global Assistance, formerly Mondial Assistance, an international travel insurance and assistance company based in Paris, France.

title: Terren Peizer
text: Terren Scott Peizer dubbed the "Zelig of Wall Street" is currently the Chairman of his personal Los Angeles-based investment company, Acuitas Group Holdings (AGH), which in turn owns 100% of Crede Capital Group (CCG) which invests in public companies, and provides growth capital to small and medium-sized enterprises.

title: Terren Peizer
text: Since its inception in June 2009, CCG has provided companies with capital commitments and funding in excess of $1.2 Billion.

title: Terren Peizer
text: Besides its ownership of Crede Capital, Acuitas Group owns 72% of Catasys, Inc., a provider of proprietary big data based analytics and predictive modeling driven behavioral health management services for health plans; and owns 100% of NeurMedix, Inc., a biotech company that develops and commercializes disease modifying small molecules to treat neuro-degenerative diseases, such as Parkinson’s disease, Alzheimer’s disease, Migraine disease, Huntington’s disease, ALS, MS, Epilepsy, Traumatic Brain Injury, and Retina disease.

title: Terren Peizer
text: Peizer is Founder, Chairman of the three Acuitas companies, and is CEO of Catasys, Inc. and Crede Capital Group.

title: Terren Peizer
text: Having developed a bioscience and healthcare expertise, Peizer’s Crede Capital became the largest shareholder in 22nd Century Group, Inc., a public company that is commercializing bio-plant technology to harm-reduce tobacco, creating very low nicotine and very low tar tobacco products which affect levels of addiction and cancer causing carcinogens.

title: Terren Peizer
text: On October 1, 2015 New England Journal of Medicine published a landmark study on the company’s very low nicotine spectrum cigarettes.

title: Terren Peizer
text: In October 2014, Peizer and 22nd Century formed a JV to commercialize the company’s products in China with China National Tobacco Company, the largest tobacco company in the world and the largest monopoly in China.

title: Terren Peizer
text: China represents over 50% of the worldwide tobacco market.

title: BankUnited
text: BankUnited, Inc., with total consolidated assets of $27.9 billion at December 31, 2016, is a bank holding company with one wholly owned subsidiary, BankUnited, collectively, the Company.

title: BankUnited
text: BankUnited, a national banking association headquartered in Miami Lakes, Florida, provides a full range of banking services to individual and corporate customers through 94 banking centers located in 15 Florida counties and 6 banking centers in the New York metropolitan area.

title: BankUnited
text: The Bank also provides certain commercial lending and deposit products on a national platform.

title: BankUnited
text: The Company endeavors to provide, through experienced lending and relationship banking teams, personalized customer service and offers a full range of traditional banking products and services to both commercial and retail customers.

title: Schrödinger (company)
text: Schrödinger, LLC is an American software company that develops chemical simulation software for use in pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and materials science research.

title: Schrödinger (company)
text: The company provides products ranging from general molecular modeling programs to a full suite of chemical simulation and drug design software, including ligand- and structure-based methods.

title: Schrödinger (company)
text: It also provides products in various research areas, including small molecule modeling and simulations, macromolecular modeling and simulations, lead discovery, lead optimization, and visualization and automation.

title: Schrödinger (company)
text: The company’s software helps scientists to accelerate their research and development activities, as well as to make novel discoveries.

title: Schrödinger (company)
text: Founded in 1990, Schrödinger is headquartered in New York City, with operations in Oregon, California, Massachusetts, Germany, France, India, the United Kingdom, and Japan.

title: Clean Power Finance
text: Clean Power Finance, headquartered in San Francisco, California, is a financial services and software company for the residential solar industry.

title: Clean Power Finance
text: Clean Power Finance operates the CPF Market, an online business-to-business platform that connects institutional investors and lenders with residential solar professionals who need solar finance products to grow their businesses.

title: Clean Power Finance
text: Clean Power Finance provides the solar industry with CPF Tools, a solar sales, quoting and design software-as-a-Service (SaaS) solution: qualified residential solar channel partners access finance products through the software.

title: Clean Power Finance
text: Third-party investors create solar project finance funds; Clean Power Finance provides origination, underwriting and asset management services to the fund investors and markets investor capital to solar professionals as residential finance products, including solar leases and power purchase agreements (PPAs).

title: Bordan Tkachuk
text: Bordan Tkachuk ( ) is a British business executive, the former CEO of Viglen, also known from his appearances on the BBC-produced British version of "The Apprentice," interviewing for his boss Lord Sugar.

title: Lev Kuleshov
text: Lev Vladimirovich Kuleshov (Russian: Лев Влади́мирович Кулешо́в ; 13 January  1899 – 29 March 1970) was a Russian and Soviet filmmaker and film theorist, one of the founders of the world's first film school, the Moscow Film School.

title: Lev Kuleshov
text: He was given the title People's Artist of the RSFSR in 1969.

title: Lev Kuleshov
text: He was intimately involved in development of the style of film making known as Soviet montage, especially it's psychological underpinning, including the use of editing and the cut to emotionally influence the audience, a principle known as the Kuleshov effect.

title: Lev Kuleshov
text: He also developed the theory of creative geography, which is the use of the action around a cut to connect otherwise disparate settings into a cohesive narrative.

title: Anani ben Sason
text: Anani ben Sason (also called 'Anani, 'Inani, and 'Inyani) was a Jewish Talmudist who lived in the Land of Israel, known as an amora of the third century, a contemporary of R. Ammi.

title: Anani ben Sason
text: He rarely discussed "Halakot", and his discussions of them were not original ("Shab.

title: Anani ben Sason
text: Once he recited a "Halakah" in the patriarch's mansion, without naming its author, which provoked R. Ammi to ask: "Is it his own?

title: Anani ben Sason
text: It is what R. Eleazar had reported in the name of R. Oshaiah" (M. Ḳ.

title: Anani ben Sason
text: In the "Haggadah", he sometimes reported the sayings of others, but more often he was original.

title: Anani ben Sason
text: Thus, as a reason for the juxtaposition of the regulations regarding the sacrificial rites and the priestly vestments ("Ex.

title: Anani ben Sason
text: " xxviii-xxix), he points out that the priestly vestments were to have atoning effects as well as the sacrifices.

title: Anani ben Sason
text: He represents the miter as atoning for haughtiness, and cites R. Chanina as saying, "That which rests highest on the priest atones for one's considering himself high"; and similarly with the rest of the priestly garments ("Zeb."

title: Anani ben Sason

title: Anani ben Sason

title: Aryanto Yuniawan
text: Aryanto Yuniawan (born June 18, 1977 in Magelang; age 40) is Chief Executive Officer of PT Mataram Surya Visi Sinema, a multimedia and animation movie company located in Jogja Indonesia.

title: Aryanto Yuniawan
text: Ary (his nickname) is best known as a director of Battle of Surabaya, the first 2D animation movie in Indonesia which got some awards i.e. Gold Remi Award USA 2016, GrandPrize Winner of SICAF 2016 in South Korea, Winner of Nice International Filmmaker Festival 2017 in France, Winner of Nioda International Film Festival in India and others.

title: Aryanto Yuniawan
text: He is also acclaimed as a writer, a producer, and currently working on several articles and books related to his job and hobby.

title: Aryanto Yuniawan
text: He started his career from directing and producing independent animation films including music videos.

title: Aryanto Yuniawan
text: He was trusted to be one of the juries of several film festivals such as Festival Film Indonesia (FFI 2016), Noida International Film Festival (NIFF 2016), and Seoul International Cartoon and Animation Festival (SICAF 2017).

title: Pamela B. Green
text: Pamela B. Green is an American film producer and director known for her work in feature film titles and motion graphics.

title: Pamela B. Green
text: She is the director and producer of the documentary "Be Natural: The Untold Story of Alice Guy-Blache".

title: Pamela B. Davis
text: Pamela B. Davis, MD, PhD is a pediatric pulmonologist specializing in cystic fibrosis research.

title: Pamela B. Davis
text: She has been Dean of the School of Medicine at Case Western Reserve University since 2007.

title: Pamela B. Davis
text: She was elected to the Institute of Medicine in 2014.

title: Pamela Gilbert
text: Pamela B. Gilbert (born October 3, 1958) is an American lawyer and has been a partner of the law firm Cuneo Gilbert & LaDuca, LLP since 2003, where she heads the firm's lobbying practice.

title: Pamela Gilbert
text: Gilbert is a noted consumer rights advocate who has testified before Congress over fifty times and made dozens of appearances in the national print and electronic media.

title: Seasoned Veteran
text: Seasoned Veteran is the third studio album by American rapper Richie Rich.

title: Seasoned Veteran
text: It was released November 5, 1996 on Def Jam Recordings, and to date is the only major label release for the artist.

title: Seasoned Veteran
text: The album was produced by Ali Malik, DJ Daryl, Doug Rasheed, Jermaine Dupri, Lev Berlak, Mike Mosley, Richie Rich and Rick Rock.

title: Seasoned Veteran
text: It peaked at number 11 on the "Billboard" Top R&B/Hip-Hop Albums and at number 35 on the "Billboard" 200.

title: Seasoned Veteran
text: Two of the singles released, "Let's Ride" and "Do G's Get To Go To Heaven?

title: Seasoned Veteran
text: ", both appeared on multiple "Billboard" singles charts.

title: Seasoned Veteran
text: The album features guest performances by 2Pac, E-40, Luniz, D'wayne Wiggins, T-Boz, and Rame Royal of Rhythm & Green.

title: Total (group)
text: Total is an American contemporary R&B girl group and one of the signature acts of Sean Combs' Bad Boy Records imprint during the 1990s.

title: Total (group)
text: The group consisted of members Kima Raynor, Keisha Spivey, and Pamela Long.

title: Total (group)
text: Total is best known for their hits "What You Want" (Featuring Mase), "Kissing You", "Can't You See" (featuring The Notorious B.I.G.), and "What About Us?"

title: Total (group)
text: and "Trippin'", both featuring Missy Elliott.

title: Total (group)
text: Long was also featured on The Notorious B.I.G.'s hit song "Hypnotize", singing the chorus.

title: Eliezer ben Jacob I
text: Eliezer ben Jacob I (Hebrew: אליעזר בן יעקב) was a Tanna of the 1st century; contemporary of Eleazar b. Ḥisma and Eliezer b. Hyrcanus, and senior of Judah ben Ilai (Pes.

title: Eliezer ben Jacob I
text: 32a, 39b; Yalḳ.

title: Eliezer ben Jacob I
text: , Lev.

title: Eliezer ben Jacob I
text: Of his personal history nothing is known, except that he had seen the Temple at Jerusalem and was familiar with the specific purposes of its many apartments, a subject on which he was considered an authority (Yoma 16b).

title: Eliezer ben Jacob I
text: Some of the details, however, he eventually forgot, and was reminded of them by Abba Saul b. Baṭnit (Mid.

title: Eliezer ben Jacob I
text: ii.

title: Eliezer ben Jacob I
text: Simon b. 'Azzai, R. Akiva's contemporary, relates that he had discovered a genealogical roll wherein was stated, "The Mishnah of R. Eliezer b. Jacob is only a 'ḳab' , but clear" (משנת ראב"י קב ונקי, Yeb.

title: Eliezer ben Jacob I
text: 49b), wherefore subsequent generations generally adopted Eliezer's views as law (Yeb.

title: Eliezer ben Jacob I
text: 60a; Bek.

title: AES+F
text: AES+F is an artist collective of four Russian artists: Tatiana Arzamasova (1955), Lev Evzovich (1958), Evgeny Svyatsky (1957), and Vladimir Fridkes (1956).

title: AES+F
text: It was first formed as AES Group in 1987 by Arzamasova, Evzovich, and Svyatsky, becoming AES+F when Fridkes joined in 1995.

title: AES+F
text: The collective works in photography, video, installation, and animation, as well as more traditional media, such as painting, drawing, and sculpture.

title: AES+F
text: AES+F's early work included performance, installation, painting, and illustration.

title: AES+F
text: Well known for their monumental video-art installations that Gareth Harris describes as "monumental painting set in motion", AES+F create grand visual narratives that explore contemporary global values, vices and conflicts.

title: Liaison Office (Hong Kong)
text: The Liaison Office of the Central People's Government in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (; abbr.

title: Liaison Office (Hong Kong)
text: LOCPG or 中聯辦) is an organ of the Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China (PRC) in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (HKSAR).

title: Liaison Office (Hong Kong)
text: It replaced the New China News Agency (NCNA) as the representative of the PRC government in Hong Kong in 2000.

title: Rabat
text: Rabat (Berber: , Arabic: الرِّبَاط‎ ‎ , Moroccan Arabic: رّباط‎ ‎ ) is the capital city of Morocco and its second largest city with an urban population of approximately 580,000 (2014) and a metropolitan population of over 1.2 million.

title: Rabat
text: It is also the capital city of the Rabat-Salé-Kénitra administrative region.

title: Caraga
text: Caraga, officially known as the Caraga Administrative Region or simply Caraga Region and designated as Region XIII, is an administrative region in the Philippines occupying the northeastern section of the island of Mindanao.

title: Caraga
text: The Caraga Region was created through "Republic Act No. 7901" on February 23, 1995.

title: Caraga
text: The region comprises five provinces: Agusan del Norte, Agusan del Sur, Surigao del Norte, Surigao del Sur and Dinagat Islands; six cities: Bayugan, Bislig, Butuan, Cabadbaran, Surigao and Tandag; 67 municipalities and 1,311 barangays. Butuan is the regional administrative center.

title: Visa policy of Hong Kong
text: The visa policy of Hong Kong deals with the requirements in which a foreign national wishing to enter the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region must meet to obtain an entry permit or visa, which depending on the traveller's nationality, may be required to travel to, enter, and remain in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region.

title: Visa policy of Hong Kong
text: Visitors from over 145 countries are permitted visa-free entry for periods ranging from 7 to 180 days, to the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region for tourism or certain business-related activities.

title: Visa policy of Hong Kong
text: All visitors must hold a passport valid for more than 1 month.

title: Sinuiju Special Administrative Region
text: Sinŭiju Special Administrative Region is a special administrative region (SAR) of North Korea proclaimed in 2002 (but has not been put into "de facto" operation as of 2014), on the border with China.

title: Sinuiju Special Administrative Region
text: It was established in September 2002 in an area including parts of Sinŭiju and the surrounding area, in an attempt to introduce market economics, and is directly governed as in the case of "Directly Governed Cities".

title: Sinuiju Special Administrative Region
text: The special administrative region was modelled after China's Special Administrative Regions (SARs), Hong Kong and Macau, and, like them, has a "Basic Law" (기본법; Kibonpŏp).

title: Hong Kong Basic Law
text: The Basic Law of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People's Republic of China is the constitutional document of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region.

title: Hong Kong Basic Law
text: Being a national law of the People's Republic of China, the Basic Law was adopted on 4 April 1990 by the Seventh National People's Congress and signed by President Yang Shangkun.

title: Wolong Special Administrative Region
text: The Wolong Special Administrative Region () is an area in Sichuan, China.

title: Wolong Special Administrative Region
text: It is located in the southwest of Wenchuan County, Ngawa Tibetan and Qiang Autonomous Prefecture of Sichuan.

title: Wolong Special Administrative Region
text: It was formerly known as Wolong Special Administrative Region of Wenchuan County, Sichuan Province and was founded in March 1983 with approval of the State Council.

title: Wolong Special Administrative Region
text: It was given its current name and placed under Sichuan provincial government with administrative supervision by the provincial department of forestry.

title: Wolong Special Administrative Region
text: Its area supersedes Sichuan Wolong National Nature Reserve and its administrative office is the same as the Administrative Bureau of the State Forestry Administration for the reserve.

title: Wolong Special Administrative Region
text: It currently has a population of 5343.

title: Ilocos Region
text: The Ilocos Region (Ilocano: "Rehion/Deppaar ti Ilocos" ; Pangasinan: "Sagor na Baybay na Luzon" ; Filipino: "Rehiyon ng Ilocos" ) is an administrative region of the Philippines, designated as Region I, occupying the northwestern section of Luzon.

title: Ilocos Region
text: It is bordered by the Cordillera Administrative Region to the east, the Cagayan Valley to the northeast and southeast, and the Central Luzon to the south.

title: Ilocos Region
text: To the west lies the South China Sea.

title: 2014 NPCSC Decision on Hong Kong
text: The Decision of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress on Issues Relating to the Selection of the Chief Executive of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region by Universal Suffrage and on the Method for Forming the Legislative Council of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region in the Year 2016 (), commonly known as 31 August Decision (), is a decision made by the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress (NPCSC), the national legislative body of the People's Republic of China (PRC) on 31 August 2014 which set limits for the 2017 Chief Executive election and 2016 Legislative Council election in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (HKSAR).

title: Rocket of China (TV series)
text: Rocket of China (Chinese: 龙号机车; pinyin: Lóng Hào Jī Chē) is a Chinese historical comedy set in nineteenth century China based on the true story of the history of the construction of , the first steam locomotive made in China, with the help of an English engineer Claude W. Kinder (Jin Da) who in 1878 travelled to Qing Dynasty China in the hope of building the first railway through China.

title: Rocket of China (TV series)
text: The 30 episode comedy was directed by and written by Man Yu.

title: Rocket of China (TV series)
text: Appearing in the comedy are , , Liu Jin Shan, Ma Ling, Yu Hui Zi, Li Jian Hua, Li Qi, Na Wei, , Yan Guan, Qi Xiao Fei, Isabella Charlton (Zhou Xiaolin), Karl Robert Eislen, Jonathan Kos-Read and among others.

title: Rocket of China (TV series)
text: It was produced by Xui Ji Wei in the Production Company of Long Teng Yi Du (Beijing) Film Investment Co., Ltd.

title: Rocket of China (TV series)
text: The comedy was first aired on Public Channel on 1 February 2016.

title: Bayuquan Railway Station
text: Bayuquan Railway Station (IATA: JYQ) is a railway station of the Harbin–Dalian section of the Beijing–Harbin High-Speed Railway.

title: Bayuquan Railway Station
text: It is located in Bayuquan, in the Yingkou prefecture level city, in the Liaoning province of China.

title: Shengjing Bank
text: Shengjing Bank (in ) is a commercial bank, with its headquarters in Shenyang, Liaoning Province, China.

title: Shengjing Bank
text: It was established in 1996 as Shenyang City Commercial Bank and opened in Shenyang City only.

title: Shengjing Bank
text: It changed its name to Shengjing Bank in 2007 and has since opened a branch in Beijing, Tianjin, Dalian, Yingkou, Huludao, Shanghai, Anshan, Changchun, Benxi, Panjin, Chaoyang, Fushun, Jinzhou, Fuxin, Dandong and Liaoyang.

title: Xiapu County
text: Xiapu (; Foochow Romanized: Hà-puō) is a county in the municipal region of Ningde, Fujian, People's Republic of China, located along a stretch of East China Sea coast, with many harbours and islands.

title: Xiapu County
text: It is bordered by Fuding City and Zherong County to the north, Fu'an City and Ningde's urban area to the west, and—in Fuzhou City—Luoyuan County to the south.

title: Wafangdian
