text: In each episode, Malnati has a candid conversation with an interesting person in popular culture or leader in entertainment, hospitality and business.

title: The Drop-In (podcast)
text: Guests have included Chris Hardwick (CEO at Nerdist Industries), Sebastian Stan ("Captain America: Civil War"), and Nico Tortorella ("Younger").

title: Chris Hardwick
text: Christopher Ryan Hardwick (born November 23, 1971) is an American stand-up comedian, actor, voice actor, television host, writer, producer, podcaster, and musician.

title: Chris Hardwick
text: He is the chief executive officer of Nerdist Industries, the digital division of Legendary Entertainment.

title: Chris Hardwick
text: He currently hosts "Talking Dead", an hourly aftershow on AMC, affiliated with the network's zombie drama series "The Walking Dead" and "Fear the Walking Dead" as well as "Talking with Chris Hardwick", a show in which Hardwick interviews prominent pop culture figures; and "The Wall", a plinko-inspired gameshow on NBC.

title: Chris Hardwick
text: He was also the host of "@midnight with Chris Hardwick", a nightly comedy-game show series on Comedy Central until it ended its run on August 4th 2017.

title: Jessica Chobot
text: Jessica Chobot (born Jessica Lynn Horn; July 7, 1977) is an American on-camera host and writer.

title: Jessica Chobot
text: She has hosted the IGN shows "IGN Strategize" and "Weekly Wood", which also runs on Xbox Live; she previously worked as presenter of the IGN Daily Fix.

title: Jessica Chobot
text: Since 2013 she is the host of Nerdist News and "Nerdist News Talks Back" for Nerdist Industries.

title: Jessica Chobot
text: In 2014 she launched her own podcast titled "Bizarre States".

title: Maltin on Movies
text: Maltin on Movies is a podcast launched in 2014, on Nerdist Industries, following a 2010 to 2014 television-broadcast movie review show on the ReelzChannel hosted by film critic Leonard Maltin.

title: Randall Cunningham II
text: Randall Cunningham II, sometimes Randall Cunningham, Jr., (born January 4, 1996) is an American collegiate high jumper for the USC Trojans Men's track & field team who will be a senior during the 2017–18 school year.

title: Randall Cunningham II
text: He was a high jumper and quarterback at Bishop Gorman High School.

title: Randall Cunningham II
text: He is a five-time Nevada Interscholastic Activities Association (NIAA) state champion (three times in track and twice in football).

title: Randall Cunningham II
text: He is a NCAA Outdoor Track Champion and 2-time All-American, U.S. Junior National Champion and Pan American Junior Athletics Championships Champion.

title: Ken Rose (gridiron football)
text: Kenny Frank Rose (born June 9, 1962) is a former professional American football linebacker in the National Football League for the New York Jets, Cleveland Browns, and the Philadelphia Eagles.

title: Ken Rose (gridiron football)
text: Rose graduated from Christian Brothers High School (Sacramento, California).

title: Ken Rose (gridiron football)
text: He attended the University of Nevada, Las Vegas and played alongside Randall Cunningham, among others.

title: Ken Rose (gridiron football)
text: Undrafted by the National Football League, Ken caught on with the Saskatchewan Roughriders of the Canadian Football League.

title: Ken Rose (gridiron football)
text: Following two seasons there, he played a season with the Tampa Bay Bandits of the United States Football League.

title: Ken Rose (gridiron football)
text: However, Rose dreamed of playing in the NFL and attended several training camps in the mid-1980s, only to be rejected each time.

title: Ken Rose (gridiron football)
text: He received an opportunity with the New York Jets in 1987 during the strike by the players union, and became one of the few "scabs" to stay on the roster when the regular players returned to work.

title: Ken Rose (gridiron football)
text: Rose remained with the Jets through 1989.

title: Ken Rose (gridiron football)
text: In 1990, he split playing time with the Cleveland Browns and the Philadelphia Eagles, released by the Browns (along with head coach Bud Carson) after the seventh game and signing with the Eagles for their final 8 regular-season games.

title: Ken Rose (gridiron football)
text: Rose remained with the Eagles through the 1994 season.

title: Nevada Union High School
text: Nevada Union High School (NU) is located in the Sierra Nevada foothills northeast of California's capital, Sacramento.

title: Nevada Union High School
text: Situated between Nevada City and Grass Valley, the school serves those two incorporated cities and a large surrounding community.

title: Nevada Union High School
text: The Nevada Union High School district covers a huge geographic area, with some students bussed in from as far as 56 miles away.

title: Nevada Union High School
text: NU was named a California Distinguished School in 1997 and 2012, and in 1998 was recognized as a National Blue Ribbon High School.

title: Nevada Union High School
text: NUHS serves ninth through twelfth grade students.

title: Nevada Union High School
text: NUHS does not have an ethnically diverse student population, as 99% are Caucasian.

title: Nevada Union High School
text: It is, however, economically diverse, with 45% of families qualifying for the Free and Reduced National School Lunch Program.

title: Vashti Cunningham
text: Vashti Cunningham (born January 18, 1998) is an American track and field athlete specializing in the high jump.

title: Vashti Cunningham
text: She is the daughter of retired National Football League (NFL) quarterback Randall Cunningham, niece of retired NFL fullback Sam Cunningham, and the younger sister of Randall Cunningham II.

title: Vashti Cunningham
text: Her mother is Felicity de Jager Cunningham a former ballerina with the Dance Theatre of Harlem.

title: Vashti Cunningham
text: Vashti, like her brother two years ahead of her in school, jumped for Bishop Gorman High School in Las Vegas, Nevada until March 2016 when she signed with Nike.

title: Vashti Cunningham
text: She announced she will continue her education at a university while competing as a professional athlete.

title: Luke Urban
text: Louis John "Luke" Urban (March 22, 1898 – December 7, 1980) was an American multi-sport athlete and coach.

title: Luke Urban
text: He played four seasons of professional American football in the National Football League and two years of Major League Baseball with the Boston Braves.

title: Luke Urban
text: Urban was also a college football coach, a college and high school basketball coach, and a minor league baseball manager.

title: List of multi-sport athletes
text: A multi-sport athlete is an athlete who competes at a high level in two or more different sports.

title: List of multi-sport athletes
text: Most athletes play two or more sports from a young age – especially in high school – before deciding to concentrate on just one sport.

title: Guo Jie
text: Guo Jie (; January 16, 1912 – November 15, 2015) was a Chinese Olympic athlete who competed at the 1936 Summer Olympics in Berlin, where he was eliminated before reaching the final of the men's discus throw event.

title: Guo Jie
text: A multi-sport athlete in high school, Guo was inspired to attend the Olympics after hearing about Liu Changchun's participation at the 1932 Summer Games.

title: Guo Jie
text: He became the national discus throw champion at the 1935 Chinese National Games and set a new national record shortly before his journey to Berlin.

title: David Masur
text: Masur graduated from Columbia High School in 1980.

title: David Masur
text: He was a multi-sport athlete at Columbia, playing on the basketball and lacrosse team.

title: David Masur
text: He had his greatest success as a three-year starter on the Columbia soccer team, winning the Group IV state championship his junior and senior seasons.

title: David Masur
text: He was a Parade All-American and New Jersey State Player of the Year.

title: David Masur
text: In May 2006, Masur was elected to the Columbia High School Hall of Fame.

title: David Masur
text: In 1979, the New York Cosmos drafted Masur out of high school, but he elected to attend Rutgers University where he played on the men's soccer team from 1981 to 1984.

title: David Masur
text: He was the team's 1982 and 1983 MVP, and served as team captain from 1982 to 1984.

title: David Masur
text: Masur made the All-Regional team as a sweeper from 1982 to 1984.

title: David Masur
text: He is the only Scarlet Knight to win back-to-back All-American honors: 1983 First Team and 1984 Third Team All American.

title: David Masur
text: Masur became the third soccer player to be inducted into the Rutgers Olympic Sports Hall of Fame.

title: David Masur
text: In 1989, Rutgers retired his jersey.

title: Adam Thielen
text: Adam John Thielen (born August 22, 1990) is an American football wide receiver for the Minnesota Vikings of the National Football League (NFL).

title: Adam Thielen
text: Thielen was a multi-sport athlete in high school.

title: Adam Thielen
text: He played college football at Minnesota State University and signed with the Vikings as an undrafted free agent in 2013.

title: Randall Cunningham
text: Randall Wade Cunningham (born March 27, 1963) is a former American football quarterback in the National Football League (NFL).

title: Randall Cunningham
text: He played in the NFL for 16 seasons, primarily with the Philadelphia Eagles.

title: Randall Cunningham
text: Cunningham is also known for his tenure with the Minnesota Vikings.

title: Randall Cunningham
text: He is the younger brother of former college and professional football player Sam Cunningham and the father of Randall Cunningham II and world champion high jumper Vashti Cunningham.

title: Randall Cunningham
text: Cunningham was inducted into the College Football Hall of Fame in 2016.

title: Gem Archer
text: Colin Murray "Gem" Archer (born 7 December 1966) is an English musician, best known as a member of the English rock bands Oasis, Beady Eye and Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds.

title: Gem Archer
text: He is also known for his work with Heavy Stereo.

title: Gem Archer
text: He joined Oasis as rhythm guitarist in November 1999, and handled lead guitar for acoustic songs as well.

title: Gem Archer
text: He also contributed to the writing of some of the band's songs.

title: Gem Archer
text: Oasis broke up in August 2009, but in November 2009, Liam Gallagher announced he was writing new material with Archer as well as other ex-Oasis members minus his brother Noel, under the name Beady Eye.

title: Gem Archer
text: After two albums with Beady Eye, 2011's "Different Gear, Still Speeding" and 2013's "BE", the band officially disbanded in October 2014.

title: Gem Archer
text: In 2017, Archer joined Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds as lead guitarist, thus reuniting with former Oasis member Noel Gallagher.

title: Imagine (John Lennon song)
text: "Imagine" is a song written and performed by English musician John Lennon.

title: Imagine (John Lennon song)
text: The best-selling single of his solo career, its lyrics encourage the listener to imagine a world at peace without the barriers of borders or the divisions of religion and nationality, and to consider the possibility that the whole of humanity would live unattached to material possessions.
5:55 is the second album by French musician and actress Charlotte Gainsbourg.
It is also her first album release in twenty years.
Charlotte collaborated on the album with French duo Air, English musician Jarvis Cocker, and Irish singer-songwriter Neil Hannon, as well as Radiohead's main producer Nigel Godrich.
"The Songs That We Sing" and "5:55" were released as singles.
The album went platinum in France, selling over 500,000 copies.
In the United States, the album sold a modest 22,000 copies.
"The Songs That We Sing" was #78 on "Rolling Stone"' s list of the 100 Best Songs of 2007.

title: Sharon Gannon
text: Sharon Gannon (born July 4, 1951 in Washington, D.C.) is a yoga teacher, animal rights advocate, musician, author, dancer/choreographer and painter.

title: Sharon Gannon
text: Along with David Life, she is the co-founder of the Jivamukti Yoga Method which contributed to the exponential rise in popularity of yoga in the west during the late 20th century.

title: Sharon Gannon
text: The Jivamukti Yoga Method distinguishes itself as a path to enlightenment by promoting compassion for all beings, challenging the modern belief that enslaving and exploiting animals and the natural world is our right as the dominant species.

title: Sharon Gannon
text: The Jivamukti Yoga Method teaches its students that they must be willing to promote the happiness of all beings without exception if they wish to realize their fullest capacity for joy.

title: Sharon Gannon
text: Jivamukti students are encouraged to adopt a diet that eliminates all animal products (vegan) as this is the diet that causes the least amount of harm to the earth and other beings, humans included.

title: Sharon Gannon
text: Core to the teachings of Jivamukti Yoga is the concept of shunyata or (emptiness) which is found in the ancient yogic scriptures.

title: Sharon Gannon
text: This idea can be simply stated as: everything you see and experience in the world comes from your perception of it.

title: Sharon Gannon
text: If you want to change someone or to change the world, you start by changing yourself by changing your views.

title: Sharon Gannon
text: When you begin to embrace this concept and put it into practice then you cannot find solace in complaining or blaming others.

title: Sharon Gannon
text: You are freed from seeing yourself as a victim of others or of circumstances.

title: Sharon Gannon
text: According to Gannon: "How you treat others will determine how others treat you.

title: Sharon Gannon
text: How others treat you will determine how you see yourself.

title: Sharon Gannon
text: How you see yourself will determine who you are."

title: We Laughed
text: "We Laughed" is a three-track single by English musician Billy Bragg as part of the Rosetta Life project.

title: We Laughed
text: The single was released in 2005 in the UK and peaked at No. 11.

title: We Laughed
text: It also reached No. 38 in Ireland in 2006.

title: We Laughed
text: For the three songs on the single, Bragg collaborated with three patients of Trimar Hospice in Weymouth, who each wrote lyrics based on their illness and feelings.

title: We Laughed
text: The songs were produced by English guitarist Robbie McIntosh.

title: Love Songs: A Compilation... Old and New
text: Love Songs: A Compilation... Old and New is a compilation album by English musician Phil Collins.

title: Love Songs: A Compilation... Old and New
text: The album was released by Atlantic Recording Corporation and Rhino Entertainment on 28 September 2004.

title: Love Songs: A Compilation... Old and New
text: The album was released only a few months after the box set "The Platinum Collection", which appeared earlier in the year (see 2004 in music).

title: No Plan (EP)
text: No Plan is an extended play, comprising songs written and recorded by English musician David Bowie, released posthumously on 8 January 2017.

title: No Plan (EP)
text: The release coincided with what would have been Bowie's 70th birthday, almost a year after his death.

title: No Plan (EP)
text: "No Plan" compiles the original songs written for Bowie's Broadway musical, "Lazarus", including the titular "Lazarus", "No Plan", "Killing a Little Time", and "When I Met You".

title: No Plan (EP)
text: The songs were first recorded by the cast of the musical as part of its official soundtrack.

title: No Plan (EP)
text: The recordings featured on "No Plan" come from the sessions for Bowie's twenty-fifth and final studio album "Blackstar", with "Lazarus" appearing as the third track on the album.

title: No Plan (EP)
text: Upon release, "No Plan" debuted at #138 on the "Billboard" 200.

title: No Plan (EP)
text: The music video for the title track was also released in accompaniment with the EP.

title: No Plan (EP)
text: It was directed by Tom Hingston.

title: List of songs recorded by Syd Barrett
text: English musician Syd Barrett recorded many songs during his short career as a musician.

title: List of songs recorded by Syd Barrett
text: One of the founding members of English rock band Pink Floyd, he was the dominant force of the band in their early years, writing most of the material found on their first album, "The Piper at the Gates of Dawn", contributing to their second one, "A Saucerful of Secrets", and recording several unreleased songs with the band.

title: List of songs recorded by Syd Barrett
text: Due to increasing mental illness, Barrett was excluded from Pink Floyd in April 1968 and was subsequently replaced by guitarist David Gilmour.

title: List of songs recorded by Syd Barrett
text: After Pink Floyd, Barrett would record two solo albums, both released in 1970, before Barrett left the music business entirely in 1972.

title: Who Can See It
text: "Who Can See It" is a song by English musician George Harrison, released on his 1973 album "Living in the Material World".

title: Who Can See It
text: The lyrics reflect Harrison's uneasy feelings towards the Beatles' legacy, three years after the group's break-up, and serve as his statement of independence from expectations raised by the band's unprecedented popularity.

title: Who Can See It
text: Some music critics and biographers suggest that he wrote the song during a period of personal anguish, following the acclaim he had received as a solo artist with the 1970 triple album "All Things Must Pass" and his 1971–72 Bangladesh aid project.

title: Who Can See It
text: The revelatory nature of the lyrics has encouraged comparisons between "Living in the Material World" and John Lennon's primal therapy-inspired 1970 release, "Plastic Ono Band".

title: See Yourself
text: "See Yourself" is a song by English musician George Harrison, released on his 1976 album "Thirty Three & 1/3".

title: See Yourself
text: Harrison began writing the song in 1967, while he was a member of the Beatles, in response to the public outcry surrounding bandmate Paul McCartney's admission that he had taken the hallucinogenic drug LSD.

title: See Yourself
text: McCartney's announcement created a reaction in the press similar to that caused in 1966 by John Lennon's statement that the Beatles were more popular than Christianity.

title: See Yourself
text: In its finished form, the song's lyrics advocate self-awareness and consideration for the consequences of one's actions.

title: See Yourself
text: Musically, the composition contains unusual shifts in time signature from standard 4/4 to 9/8, while the songwords reflect the era of its genesis by recalling themes first espoused in the Beatles tracks "Within You Without You" and "All You Need Is Love".

title: Fred Doherty
text: Frederick "Doc" Doherty (June 15, 1887 – February 12, 1961) was a Canadian professional ice hockey player.

title: Fred Doherty
text: Doherty played hockey for several professional ice hockey teams from 1908 until 1916, including a stint with the Toronto Ontarios in the National Hockey Association (NHA).

title: Fred Doherty
text: He also played in the Maritime Professional Hockey League and the Ontario Professional Hockey League.

title: Fred Doherty
text: After returning from World War I duty, he played one game in the National Hockey League with the Montreal Canadiens to end his career.

title: Fred Doherty
text: He played on several league champions, leading to play in several Stanley Cup championships, but was not a member of a Stanley Cup-winning team.

title: Travis Richards
text: Travis John Richards (born March 22, 1970) is a former professional ice hockey defenseman.

title: Travis Richards
text: Richards graduated from Robbinsdale Armstrong High School in Plymouth, Minnesota in 1988.

title: Travis Richards
text: Richards was a member of the University of Minnesota Gophers hockey program before making his professional debut during the 1993-94 season.

title: Travis Richards
text: A child psychology major, Richards would spend four years at the University of Minnesota where his brother Todd was a Gopher from 1985 to 1989.

title: Travis Richards
text: Earning WCHA Second Team All-Star honors on defense in 1992 and in 1993, Richards would join the US National Team at the 1993 World Championships at the end of his senior year.

title: Travis Richards
text: Drafted by the Minnesota North Stars of the National Hockey League in the ninth round (169th overall) of the 1988 NHL Entry Draft, Richards played only three games in the NHL for the Dallas Stars .

title: Travis Richards
text: On July 26, 1996, Richards became the second player ever to sign with the Grand Rapids Griffins, then of the International Hockey League, now of the American Hockey League.

title: Travis Richards
text: Richards played in each of the team's first ten seasons and became team captain in 2001.

title: Travis Richards
text: He holds the record for most career games as a Griffin with 655.

title: Travis Richards
text: Richards's number 24 was retired by the Griffins upon his retirement, becoming the first number retired by the club .

title: Travis Richards
text: For a time he was the hockey director at The Edge Ice Arena in Holland, Michigan.

title: Travis Richards
text: He resides in Grand Rapids, MI and has 2 daughters and one son, Ellie, Melissa and Riley.

title: 20th National Hockey League All-Star Game
text: The 20th National Hockey League National Hockey League All-Star Game was played in Montreal Forum on January 18, 1967, where the host Montreal Canadiens defeated a team of all-stars from the remaining NHL teams 3–0.

title: 20th National Hockey League All-Star Game
text: It was the first, and to date, only time a shutout occurred in an All-Star Game.

title: 20th National Hockey League All-Star Game
text: It was the first All-Star Game held in mid-season.

title: 20th National Hockey League All-Star Game
text: The previous Game was held in October 1965.

title: National Hockey League All-Star Game
text: The National Hockey League All-Star Game (French: "Match des Étoiles de la Ligue Nationale de Hockey" ) is an exhibition ice hockey game that is traditionally held during the regular season of the National Hockey League (NHL), with many of the League's star players playing against each other.

title: National Hockey League All-Star Game
text: The Game's proceeds benefit the pension fund of the players.

title: 57th National Hockey League All-Star Game
text: The 57th National Hockey League All-Star Game was held at the Bell Centre in Montreal, Quebec, home of the Montreal Canadiens, in conjunction with the Montreal Canadiens centennial celebrations on Sunday evening, January 25, 2009.

title: 57th National Hockey League All-Star Game
text: The game was held between two teams, each representing a conference (Eastern and Western) of the National Hockey League (NHL).

title: 57th National Hockey League All-Star Game
text: The Eastern Conference team won the game 12–11, decided by shootout.

title: 57th National Hockey League All-Star Game
text: The next NHL All-Star Game, the 58th, was held in 2011 in Raleigh, North Carolina, instead of 2010, due to the 2010 Winter Olympics, which were held in Vancouver, an NHL city.

title: 60th National Hockey League All-Star Game
text: The 60th National Hockey League All-Star Game was an exhibition ice hockey game played on January 25, 2015.

title: 60th National Hockey League All-Star Game
text: The game was held in Columbus, Ohio, for the first time, at Nationwide Arena, home of the Columbus Blue Jackets.

title: 60th National Hockey League All-Star Game
text: The team captains were chosen by NHL Hockey Operations: Nick Foligno of the All-Star Game-hosting Blue Jackets served as captain for the home team, and Jonathan Toews of the Chicago Blackhawks served for the away team.

title: 60th National Hockey League All-Star Game
text: Team Toews won the game 17–12, as the teams and players broke a variety of All-Star Game scoring records.

title: NHL All-Star Skills Competition
text: The NHL All-Star Game SuperSkills Competition, originally known as the National Hockey League All-Star Skills Competition, is an event on the night preceding the All-Star Game.

title: NHL All-Star Skills Competition
text: Started at the 41st National Hockey League All-Star Game in Pittsburgh in 1990, the NHL uses the event to showcase the talents of its all-star participants.

title: NHL All-Star Skills Competition
text: Events include accuracy shooting, fastest skater, Skills Challenge Relay, hardest shot, Breakaway Challenge, and an Elimination Shootout.

title: NHL All-Star Skills Competition
text: The All-Star teams select representatives for each event, with points awarded to the winning team.

title: List of Stanley Cup champions
text: The Stanley Cup is a trophy awarded annually to the playoff champion club of the National Hockey League (NHL) ice hockey league.

title: List of Stanley Cup champions
text: It was donated by the Governor General of Canada Lord Stanley of Preston in 1892, and is the oldest professional sports trophy in North America.

title: List of Stanley Cup champions
text: Inscribed the "Dominion Hockey Challenge Cup", the trophy was first awarded to Canada's amateur ice hockey clubs who won the trophy as the result of challenge games and league play.

title: List of Stanley Cup champions
text: Professional clubs came to dominate the competition in the early years of the twentieth century, and in 1913 the two major professional ice hockey organizations, the National Hockey Association (NHA) (forerunner of the NHL) and the Pacific Coast Hockey Association (PCHA), reached a gentlemen's agreement in which their respective champions would face each other in an annual series for the Stanley Cup.

title: List of Stanley Cup champions
text: After a series of league mergers and folds, it became the "de facto" championship trophy of the NHL in 1926, though it was nominally still subject to external challenge.

title: List of Stanley Cup champions
text: After 1947, the Cup became the "de jure" NHL championship prize.

title: 44th National Hockey League All-Star Game
text: The 44th National Hockey League All-Star Game was the last NHL All-Star Game to take place at the Montreal Forum on February 6, 1993.

title: 44th National Hockey League All-Star Game
text: Before the start of the Game, there was a tribute to Mario Lemieux, who was in attendance but could not play due to his treatments for Hodgkin's Disease.

title: 44th National Hockey League All-Star Game
text: Mike Gartner would take Mark Messier's place in the All-Star lineup and ended up becoming the fourth player in All-Star history to score four goals in one game, earning All-Star MVP honours.

title: 44th National Hockey League All-Star Game
text: The final score was Wales Conference 16, Campbell Conference 6.

title: 44th National Hockey League All-Star Game
text: This was also the first All-Star Game in which the San Jose Sharks sent a representative.

title: Ryan Johansen
text: Ryan Johansen (born July 31, 1992) is a Canadian professional ice hockey centre, an alternate captain for the Nashville Predators of the National Hockey League (NHL).

title: Ryan Johansen
text: Growing up, he played minor hockey in the Greater Vancouver area until joining the junior ranks with the Penticton Vees of the British Columbia Hockey League (BCHL) for one season.

title: Ryan Johansen
text: In 2009–10, he moved to the major junior level with the Portland Winterhawks of the Western Hockey League (WHL).

title: Ryan Johansen
text: After his first WHL season, he was selected fourth overall by the Blue Jackets in the 2010 NHL Entry Draft.

title: Ryan Johansen
text: Internationally, he has competed for the Canadian national junior team at the 2011 World Junior Ice Hockey Championships, where he earned a silver medal and was named to the Tournament All-Star Team.

title: Ryan Johansen
text: In 2015, he participated in the 2015 NHL Skills Competition and was named the 2015 NHL All-Star Game MVP.

title: Rebel Highway
text: Rebel Highway was a short-lived revival of American International Pictures created and produced by Lou Arkoff, the son of Samuel Z. Arkoff and Debra Hill for the Showtime channel in 1994.

title: Rebel Highway
text: The concept was 10-week series of 1950s "drive-in classic" B-movies remade "with a '90s edge".

title: Rebel Highway
text: The impetus for the series, according to Arkoff was, "what it would be like if you made "Rebel Without a Cause" today.

title: Rebel Highway
text: It would be more lurid, sexier, and much more dangerous, and you definitely would have had Natalie Wood's top off".

title: Rebel Highway
text: Originally, Arkoff wanted to call the series, "Raging Hormones" but Showtime decided on "Rebel Highway" instead.

title: Rebel Highway
text: Arkoff and Hill invited several directors to pick a title from one of Samuel Arkoff's movies, hire their own writers and create a story that could resemble the original if they wanted.

title: Rebel Highway
text: In addition, they had the right to a final cut and select their own director of photography and the editor.

title: Rebel Highway
text: Each director was given a $1.3 million budget and 12 days to shoot it with a cast of young, up and coming actors and actresses.

title: Rebel Highway
text: According to Arkoff, the appeal to directors was that, "They weren't hampered by big studios saying, 'You can't do this or that.'

title: Rebel Highway
text: And all the directors paid very close attention to the detail of the era.

title: Rebel Highway
text: We want these shows to be fun for the younger generation and fun for the older generation".

title: Sal Mineo
text: Salvatore Mineo, Jr. (January 10, 1939February 12, 1976), was an American film and theatre actor, known for his performance as John "Plato" Crawford opposite James Dean in the film "Rebel Without a Cause" (1955).

title: Sal Mineo
text: He was twice nominated for the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor, for his roles in "Rebel Without a Cause" and "Exodus" (1960).

title: Rebel Without a Pause
text: "Rebel Without a Pause" is a song by hip hop group Public Enemy and the first single from their 1988 album, "It Takes a Nation of Millions to Hold Us Back".

title: Rebel Without a Pause
text: The title is a reference to the 1955 film "Rebel Without a Cause".

title: Rebel Without a Pause
text: This is also the first song to sample Funky Drummer.

title: Jim Backus
text: James Gilmore Backus (February 25, 1913 – July 3, 1989) was an American radio, television, film, and voice actor.

title: Jim Backus
text: Among his most famous roles were the voice of nearsighted cartoon character Mr. Magoo, the rich Hubert Updike III on the radio version of "The Alan Young Show", Joan Davis' character's husband (a domestic court judge) on TV's "I Married Joan", James Dean's character's father in "Rebel Without a Cause", and Thurston Howell III, on the 1960s sitcom "Gilligan's Island".

title: Jim Backus
text: He also starred in his own show of one season, "The Jim Backus Show", also known as "Hot Off the Wire".

title: Corey Allen
text: Corey Allen (June 29, 1934 – June 27, 2010) was an American film and television director, writer, producer, and actor.

title: Corey Allen
text: He began his career as an actor but eventually became a television director.

title: Corey Allen
text: He may be best known for playing the character Buzz Gunderson in Nicholas Ray's "Rebel Without a Cause" (1955).

title: My Teenage Daughter
text: My Teenage Daughter, later Teenage Bad Girl, is a 1956 British drama film directed by Herbert Wilcox and starring Anna Neagle, Sylvia Syms and Norman Wooland.

title: My Teenage Daughter
text: The screenplay concerns a mother who tries to deal with her teenage daughter's descent into delinquency.

title: My Teenage Daughter
text: It was intended as a British response to "Rebel Without a Cause".

title: My Teenage Daughter
text: It was the last commercially successful film made by Wilcox.

title: Casey Braxton
text: Casey Braxton is a fictional character from the Australian Channel Seven soap opera "Home and Away", played by Lincoln Younes.

title: Casey Braxton
text: Casey made his first on-screen appearance on 17 February 2011.

title: Casey Braxton
text: Younes was about to go travelling when he auditioned for the role of Casey.

title: Casey Braxton
text: He changed his plans upon winning the role.

title: Casey Braxton
text: In late 2010 the Seven Network began airing trailers for a new trio of characters known as "The River Boys".

title: Casey Braxton
text: The trio consist of Casey and his older half-brothers Darryl (Steve Peacocke) and Heath Braxton (Dan Ewing).

title: Casey Braxton
text: The River Boys arrive in Summer Bay from neighbouring town Mangrove River.

title: Casey Braxton
text: Casey is characterised as being a "modern day "Rebel Without a Cause""; who is intelligent and unsure about what he wants out of life.

title: Casey Braxton
text: Younes has described him as the "epitome of teenage angst".

title: Casey Braxton
text: The River Boys cause trouble in Summer Bay and producers were inspired by Koby Abberton's Bra Boys in the creation process.

title: Casey Braxton
text: Casey is portrayed as wanting to distance himself from their bad reputation; but his anger issues often mar his attempts.

title: Stewart Stern
text: Stewart Henry Stern (March 22, 1922 – February 2, 2015) was an American screenwriter.

title: Stewart Stern
text: He is best known for writing the screenplay for the film "Rebel Without a Cause" (1955), starring James Dean.

title: Jack Grinnage
text: Jack Grinnage (born January 20, 1931) is an American actor with a film and television career spanning seven decades.

title: Jack Grinnage
text: Born in Los Angeles, Grinnage made his first television appearances in 1954.

title: Jack Grinnage
text: The following year, he played as Moose – one of three teenage rebels who chase James Dean – in "Rebel Without a Cause" (1955).

title: Jack Grinnage
text: "Rebel Without a Cause" was his first movie where he received a screen credit.

title: The Cheers
text: The Cheers were an American rock and roll vocal group, that had a string of hits in the mid-1950s starting with "(Bazoom) I Need Your Lovin'."

title: The Cheers
text: which hit number three on the U.S. chart in 1954.

title: The Cheers
text: This was the first hit written by Jerry Leiber and Mike Stoller to chart on the Pop charts in the United States, and was one of the first rock and roll hits by a white group (after The Crew Cuts and Bill Haley and the Comets).

title: The Cheers
text: The following year, they followed it up with "Black Denim Trousers and Motorcycle Boots" (also written by Leiber and Stoller), a song about a wild-living leather-jacketed motorcyclist, which went to number six on the charts.

title: The Cheers
text: The Cheers members included Bert Convy (1933—1991) who would later serve as host of several daytime television game shows such as "Tattletales", "Super Password", "Win, Lose or Draw" and "3rd Degree", Sue Allen and Gil Garfield (1933—2011).

title: The Cheers
text: Leiber and Stoller wrote and produced 'Chicken' (1955) for The Cheers, parodying the central sequence from James Dean's film "Rebel Without a Cause".

title: Avatar: The Last Airbender (season 1)
text: Season one (Book One: Water) of "", an American animated television series produced by Nickelodeon Studios, aired 20 episodes from February 21, 2005 to December 2, 2005.

text: The series was created by Michael Dante DiMartino and Bryan Konietzko, and starred Zach Tyler Eisen, Mae Whitman, Jack DeSena, Dante Basco, Dee Bradley Baker, Mako Iwamatsu and Jason Isaacs as the main character voices.

text: Bolin (愽林 , Bó Lín ) is a major fictional character in Nickelodeon's animated television series "The Legend of Korra", which aired from 2012 to 2014.

title: Bolin (The Legend of Korra)
text: The character and the series, a sequel to "", were created by Michael Dante DiMartino and Bryan Konietzko.

title: Bolin (The Legend of Korra)
text: He is voiced by P. J. Byrne.

title: Bolin (The Legend of Korra)
text: Bolin is able to manipulate the classical element of earth, which is known as earthbending.

title: Bolin (The Legend of Korra)
text: It is revealed in the third season that he is also able to create and control lava, which is a very rare sub-ability called lavabending.

title: Kuvira
text: General Kuvira (古維拉 , Gǔ Wéi Lā ) is a fictional character and a character in "The Legend of Korra", created by Michael Dante DiMartino and Bryan Konietzko.

title: Kuvira
text: Introduced in the third season of the series, she becomes the main antagonist of the fourth season.

title: Kuvira
text: Kuvira was created with similar characteristics to the portrayal of protagonist Korra in prior seasons to highlight the changes she had made over the series.

title: Kuvira
text: Kuvira's character has been mostly met with positive reception.

title: Kuvira
text: Critics note her motives as being understandable, while her actions are given political analogues.

title: Zaheer
text: Zaheer is a major recurring character in Nickelodeon's animated television series "The Legend of Korra" (a sequel to "").

title: Zaheer
text: While he serves as the main antagonist of "Book Three: Change", his actions have lingering effects on Avatar Korra and the series' plot in the following book.

title: Zaheer
text: The character was created by Michael Dante DiMartino and Bryan Konietzko and is voiced by Henry Rollins.

title: The Legend of Korra
text: The Legend of Korra is an American animated television series that aired on the Nickelodeon television network from 2012 to 2014.

title: The Legend of Korra
text: It was created by Bryan Konietzko and Michael Dante DiMartino as a sequel to "", which aired from 2005 to 2008.

title: The Legend of Korra
text: Animated in a style strongly influenced by anime, the series is set in a fictional universe in which some people can manipulate, or "bend", the elements of water, earth, fire, or air.

title: The Legend of Korra
text: Only one person, the "Avatar", can bend all four elements, and is responsible for maintaining balance in the world.

title: The Legend of Korra
text: The series follows Avatar Korra, the reincarnation of Aang from the previous series, as she faces political and spiritual unrest in a modernizing world.

title: List of The Legend of Korra episodes
text: "The Legend of Korra" is an American animated television series created by Michael Dante DiMartino and Bryan Konietzko.

title: List of The Legend of Korra episodes
text: A sequel to "", the series first aired on Nickelodeon in 2012.

text: Like its predecessor, the series is set in a fictional world inspired by Asian and Inuit cultures, and inhabited by people who can manipulate the elements of water, earth, fire or air through an ability called "bending."

text: One person, the "Avatar," has the ability to bend all four elements.

title: List of The Legend of Korra episodes
text: Reincarnating in turn among the world's four nations, the Avatar is responsible for maintaining peace, harmony, and balance in the world.

title: List of The Legend of Korra episodes
text: Korra, the series' protagonist, is the next incarnation of the Avatar after Aang of "Avatar: The Last Airbender".

title: List of The Legend of Korra episodes
text: Four seasons with a total of 52 episodes have aired.

title: List of Dexter episodes
text: "Dexter" is an American television drama that was broadcast on the premium cable channel Showtime from October 1, 2006 to September 22, 2013.

title: List of Dexter episodes
text: A total of 96 episodes of "Dexter" were broadcast over eight seasons.

text: The series is based on characters created by Jeff Lindsay for his "Dexter" series of novels.

title: List of Dexter episodes
text: The series follows the life of Dexter Morgan (Michael C. Hall), a Miami Metro Police Department blood pattern analyst with a double life.

title: List of Dexter episodes
text: While investigating murders in the homicide division, Dexter hunts and kills murderers and criminals who have escaped the justice system.

title: List of Dexter episodes
text: Although the first season is based on the events of "Darkly Dreaming Dexter", the series' subsequent seasons do not follow the novels in the series.

title: List of Dexter episodes
text: Departing from the narrative of Lindsay's second Dexter novel "Dearly Devoted Dexter", the show's writer Daniel Cerone said that the writers "didn't see the opportunity in the second book" to adapt it.

title: The British Invasion (Dexter)
text: "The British Invasion" is the twelfth episode and finale of the second season, and twenty-fourth overall episode, of the American television drama series "Dexter", which first aired on 16 December 2007 on Showtime in the United States.

title: The British Invasion (Dexter)
text: The episode was written by Daniel Cerone (based on a story by Cerone and Melissa Rosenberg) and was directed by Steve Shill.

title: The British Invasion (Dexter)
text: In the episode, Lila Tournay (Jaime Murray) finds Sgt. James Doakes (Erik King) imprisoned in an Everglades cabin and learns from him that her object of affection, Dexter Morgan (Michael C. Hall), is the serial killer known as the "Bay Harbor Butcher".

title: The British Invasion (Dexter)
text: She decides to help Dexter and kills Doakes by setting the cabin on fire.

title: The British Invasion (Dexter)
text: Meanwhile, Dexter's sister Debra (Jennifer Carpenter) questions whether her career is more important than her relationship with FBI Special Agent Frank Lundy (Keith Carradine).

title: Dexter (TV series)
text: Dexter is an American television crime drama mystery series that aired on Showtime from October 1, 2006, to September 22, 2013.

title: Dexter (TV series)
text: Set in Miami, the series centers on Dexter Morgan (Michael C. Hall), a forensic technician specializing in blood spatter pattern analysis for the fictional Miami Metro Police Department, who leads a secret parallel life as a vigilante serial killer, hunting down murderers who have slipped through the cracks of the justice system.

title: Dexter (TV series)
text: The show's first season was derived from the novel "Darkly Dreaming Dexter" (2004), the first of the Dexter series novels by Jeff Lindsay.

title: Dexter (TV series)
text: It was adapted for television by screenwriter James Manos, Jr., who wrote the first episode.

title: Dexter (TV series)
text: Subsequent seasons evolved independently of Lindsay's works.

title: Michael C. Hall
text: Michael Carlyle Hall (born February 1, 1971) is an American actor, known for his roles as Dexter Morgan, a serial killer and blood spatter analyst, in the Showtime TV Network series "Dexter", and as David Fisher in the HBO drama series "Six Feet Under".

title: Michael C. Hall
text: In 2010, Hall won a Golden Globe Award and a Screen Actors Guild Award for his role in "Dexter".

text: The episode was written by Scott Buck and directed by Marcos Siega.
