title: Parás, Nuevo León
text: Parás is a rural municipal town in the state of Nuevo León, Mexico, founded on February 17, 1851.

title: Parás, Nuevo León
text: It lies southwest of the Falcón Reservoir in Tamaulipas.

title: Parás, Nuevo León
text: It was founded in what was known as "Rancho Huizachal de los Canales".

title: Parás, Nuevo León
text: The name "Parás" is derived from Jose María Parás y Ballesteros, the first constitutional governor of Nuevo León.

title: Parás, Nuevo León
text: Prior to the settlement the land was Gualeno Indian Tribe Territory and left many artifact the biggest being Piedras Pintas just a few miles northwest of the town.

title: Parás, Nuevo León
text: The town is small in size but it has many smaller settlements and ranches under municipality jurisdiction.

title: Parás, Nuevo León
text: The people of Parás live of ranching and agriculture.

title: Parás, Nuevo León
text: The population is not large at all due to the amount of people who fleeted throughout the years to the U.S. seeking employment.

title: Parás, Nuevo León
text: The town is usually at its fullest of capacity during American holidays when its residents go back home.

title: Parás, Nuevo León
text: It is well known for the increasing amount of whitetail deer, bringing in hunters from all over.

title: Parás, Nuevo León
text: It is also known for its local festivities, the biggest being on the following Saturday of its anniversary February 17.

title: Parás, Nuevo León
text: The town celebrates by making a "cabalgata" a horse trail ride from its neighboring town Agualeguas back to the town.

title: Parás, Nuevo León
text: The festival has many of the town's traditional dishes example: Pansaje, cabrito en sangre, dulce de frijol, tamales de venado, milk candies, sweet bread, etc.

title: Parás, Nuevo León
text: Then at night the day comes to an end with a dance at the Club Femenil in front of the town's plaza with live music Norteno bands like Los Rancheritos del Topo Chico or an Orchestra band like JLB y Cia.

title: Parás, Nuevo León
text: The plaza is popular being located in the center of the town surrounded by two churches, the dance hall, food marts, elementary school and the city hall.

title: List of largest pharmaceutical settlements
text: The following is a list of the 20 largest settlements reached between the United States Department of Justice and pharmaceutical companies from 1991 to 2012, ordered by the size of the total settlement.

title: List of largest pharmaceutical settlements
text: The settlement amount includes both the civil (False Claims Act) settlement and criminal fine.

title: List of largest pharmaceutical settlements
text: Glaxo's $3 billion settlement included the largest civil, False Claims Act settlement on record, and Pfizer’s $2.3 billion settlement including a record-breaking $1.3 billion criminal fine.

title: List of largest pharmaceutical settlements
text: Legal claims against the pharmaceutical industry have varied widely over the past two decades, including Medicare and Medicaid fraud, off-label promotion, and inadequate manufacturing practices.

title: List of largest pharmaceutical settlements
text: With respect to off-label promotion, specifically, a federal court recognized off-label promotion as a violation of the False Claims Act for the first time in Franklin v. Parke-Davis, leading to a $430 million settlement.

title: Tell El Sakan
text: Tell El Sakan was an important ancient Egyptian maritime settlement during the early Bronze Age, situated at the mouth of wadi Ghazzeh.

title: Tell El Sakan
text: Its geographical situation endowed it with a position of importance at the crossroads on the land based trade routes to Arabia, the Egyptian empire to the south and the Canaan region to the north.

title: Tell El Sakan
text: The site (dated between 3500-2350 BCE) appears to be the predecessor to the Tell al-'Ajjul settlement, where geomorphological dynamics of the estuary caused settlement trans-location or abandonment.

title: Tell El Sakan
text: The site dates from a period prior to the Egyptian military domination of the Levant.

title: Tell El Sakan
text: The pottery finds at Tell es-Sakan along with Tell al-'Ajjul shows a strong ancient Egyptian link to the area, while the Bronze Age settlement at Taur Ikhbeineh has revealed a more localised pottery production with Egyptian-Canaanite interaction.

title: Mana Al Otaiba
text: Mana Al Otaiba (Arabic: مانع العتيبه‎ ‎ ) was born on 15 May 1946 to Saeed Al Otaiba in Abu Dhabi in the United Arab Emirates.

title: Mana Al Otaiba
text: Little else is known about Al Otaiba's personal life.

title: Mana Al Otaiba
text: Al Otaiba is the former Minister of Petroleum and Mineral Resources of the United Arab Emirates under the Presidency of Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan.

title: Mana Al Otaiba
text: Al Otaiba then became his Personal Adviser until the president's death, after which he became the Private Advisor to Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan , as well as a member of the Royal Moroccan Academy under King Hassan II.

title: Mana Al Otaiba
text: His son is Yousef Al Otaiba.

title: 1999 Odisha cyclone
text: The 1999 Odisha cyclone (IMD designation BOB 03, JTWC designation 05B) was the strongest recorded tropical cyclone in the North Indian Ocean and among the most destructive in the region.

title: 1999 Odisha cyclone
text: The 1999 Odisha cyclone organized into a tropical depression in the Andaman Sea on 25 October, though its origins could be traced back to an area of storms in the Sulu Sea four days prior.

title: 1999 Odisha cyclone
text: The disturbance gradually strengthened as it took a west-northwesterly path, reaching cyclonic storm strength the next day.

title: 1999 Odisha cyclone
text: Taking advantage of highly favorable conditions, the storm rapidly intensified, attaining super cyclonic storm intensity on 28 October before peaking with winds of 260 km/h (160 mph) and a record-low pressure of 912 mbar (hPa; 26.93 inHg).

title: 1999 Odisha cyclone
text: The storm maintained this intensity as it made landfall on Odisha on 29 October.

title: 1999 Odisha cyclone
text: The cyclone steadily weakened due to persistent land interaction and dry air, remaining quasi-stationary for two days before slowly drifting offshore as a much weaker system; the storm dissipated on 1 November over the Bay of Bengal.

title: Cyclone Gonu
text: Super Cyclonic Storm Gonu (also simply known as Cyclone Gonu) is the strongest tropical cyclone on record in the Arabian Sea, and is also the strongest named cyclone in the northern Indian Ocean.

title: Cyclone Gonu
text: The second named tropical cyclone of the 2007 North Indian Ocean cyclone season, Gonu developed from a persistent area of convection in the eastern Arabian Sea on June 1, 2007.

title: Cyclone Gonu
text: With a favorable upper-level environment and warm sea surface temperatures, it rapidly intensified to attain peak winds of 235 km/h (145 mph) on June 4, according to the India Meteorological Department.

title: Cyclone Gonu
text: Gonu weakened after encountering dry air and cooler waters, and early on June 6, it made landfall on the easternmost tip of Oman, becoming the strongest tropical cyclone to hit the Arabian Peninsula.

title: Cyclone Gonu
text: It then turned northward into the Gulf of Oman, and dissipated on June 7 after making landfall in southern Iran, the first landfall in the country since 1898.

title: Cyclone Donna
text: Severe Tropical Cyclone Donna was the strongest off-season South Pacific tropical cyclone on record during the month of May.

title: Cyclone Donna
text: The twenty-first tropical disturbance, third named storm, and second severe tropical cyclone of the annual cyclone season, Donna formed from an area of disturbed weather that was first monitored west-northwest of Fiji on 1 May 2017.

title: Cyclone Donna
text: The disturbance drifted eastward amid an increasingly favorable environment, and it was designated Tropical Depression 21F late on 2 May.

title: Cyclone Donna
text: Twelve hours later, it intensified into a Category 1 on the Australian tropical cyclone scale and was designated Tropical Cyclone Donna as the storm's motion shifted west and then south.

title: Cyclone Donna
text: After reaching its initial peak as a Category 4 cyclone early on 6 May, the effects of wind shear and upwelling caused the storm to weaken.

title: Cyclone Donna
text: However, it reintensified into a Category 5 cyclone on 8 May.

title: Cyclone Donna
text: Soon after, Donna entered a region of strong westerly flow and began to rapidly weaken.

title: Cyclone Donna
text: Continuing to accelerate in a southerly direction, Donna eventually weakened into a tropical low on 10 May.

title: Cyclone Donna
text: By 16 May, Donna's remnants had fully dissipated.

title: Cyclone Anne
text: Severe Tropical Cyclone Anne was one of the most intense tropical cyclones within the South Pacific basin during the 1980s.

title: Cyclone Anne
text: The cyclone was first noted on January 5, 1988 as a weak tropical depression to the northeast of Tuvalu, in conjunction with the future Typhoon Roy in the North-Western Pacific basin.

title: Cyclone Anne
text: Over the next few days, the system gradually developed while moving southwestward.

title: Cyclone Anne
text: Once it became a tropical cyclone, it was named Anne on January 8.

title: Cyclone Anne
text: The next day, Anne rapidly intensified, becoming the fourth major tropical cyclone to affect Vanuatu within four years.

title: Cyclone Anne
text: On January 11, Anne peaked in intensity while it was equivalent to a Category 5 on the Saffir–Simpson hurricane wind scale, and a Category 4 on the Australian tropical cyclone intensity scale.

title: Cyclone Anne
text: After turning southward on January 12, Anne struck New Caledonia, becoming the strongest tropical cyclone to affect the French Overseas Territory.

title: Cyclone Anne
text: The system subsequently weakened as it started to interact with Tropical Cyclone Agi.

title: Cyclone Anne
text: Anne weakened into a depression and was last noted on January 14 to the south-east of New Caledonia.

title: Cyclone Esau
text: Severe Tropical Cyclone Esau became the strongest tropical cyclone to affect New Caledonia on record during February and March 1992.

title: Cyclone Esau
text: A shallow tropical depression developed within the monsoon trough during 24 February, about 370 km (230 mi) to the northeast of Port Vila, Vanuatu.

title: Cyclone Esau
text: Over the next day the system gradually developed further as it moved towards the south-west under the influence of a northerly steering flow, before it passed over Pentecost Island in northern Vanuatu during 25 February.

title: Cyclone Esau
text: After passing over Pentecost the system continued to move towards the southwest and passed near the island of Malampa, before the depression turned northwards and executed a small clockwise loop as it passed over the island of Espiritu Santo.

title: Cyclone Esau
text: The system was subsequently named Esau during 26 February, after it had developed into a tropical cyclone.

title: Cyclone Esau
text: Over the next couple of days the system moved south-westwards towards Australia and away from the islands of Vanuatu.

title: Cyclone Esau
text: Esau subsequently executed a second clockwise loop during 28 February, before it peaked as a Category 4 tropical cyclone on both the Australian tropical cyclone intensity scale and the Saffir-Simpson hurricane wind scale.

title: Cyclone Esau
text: After it had peaked the system moved south-eastwards and threatened Southern Vanuatu, before turning southwards and threatening the French overseas territory of New Caledonia.

title: Cyclone Esau
text: Esau made landfall on the French territory during 4 March, as a category 3 severe tropical cyclone before degenerating into an extratropical cyclone during 5 March.

title: Cyclone Esau
text: The systems remnants made landfall on New Zealand's North Island during 8 March, before they were last noted during the next day over the South Pacific Ocean.

title: Cyclone Kesiny
text: Tropical Cyclone Kesiny was the first recorded tropical cyclone – the equivalent of a minimal hurricane – to make landfall in the month of May 2002 in the south-west Indian Ocean.

title: Cyclone Kesiny
text: The final named storm of the busy 2001–02 South-West Indian Ocean cyclone season, Kesiny formed on May 2 from a trough near the equator.

title: Cyclone Kesiny
text: Its formation was the result of an increase in the Madden–Julian oscillation, which also contributed to a twin storm in the north Indian Ocean that hit Oman, and another set of storms in northeast and southeast Indian Ocean.

title: Cyclone Kesiny
text: Kesiny initially moved to the southeast, but later turned to the southwest due to a strengthening ridge.

title: Cyclone Kesiny
text: On May 6, it intensified into a tropical cyclone, but later weakened and was not expected to re-strengthen.

title: Cyclone Kesiny
text: However, Kesiny developed an eye and re-intensified into a tropical cyclone on May 9, reaching peak winds of 130 km/h before striking Madagascar about 60 km southeast of Antsiranana.

title: Cyclone Kesiny
text: It weakened while crossing the country, and after turning to the south it struck the country again before dissipating on May 11.

title: Cyclone Hondo
text: Intense Tropical Cyclone Hondo (JTWC designation: 16S) was the strongest and longest lived tropical cyclone to develop during the 2007–08 South-West Indian Ocean cyclone season.

title: Cyclone Hondo
text: The third tropical cyclone and first intense tropical cyclone of the season, Hondo developed out of a tropical disturbance in early February about 1,020 km (635 mi) east-southeast of Diego Garcia.

title: Cyclone Hondo
text: The disturbance quickly strengthened, becoming a moderate tropical storm on February 4 and a severe tropical storm the following day.

title: Cyclone Hondo
text: After a brief period of slower intensification, Hondo rapidly intensified into an intense tropical cyclone and reached its peak intensity with winds of 215 km/h (130 mph ) on February 7.

title: Cyclone Hondo
text: The cyclone gradually weakened over the next several days due to an increase in forward speed and a decrease in sea surface temperatures.

title: Cyclone Hondo
text: On February 12, Hondo rapidly degenerated into a remnant-low pressure area.

title: Cyclone Hondo
text: Over the following week, the remnant low traveled in a general west-northwest direction with no development.

title: Cyclone Hondo
text: On February 20, about 2,780 km (1,725 mi) northeast of where the final advisories were issued, the storm began to regenerate.

title: Cyclone Hondo
text: The next day, advisories were issued on Tropical Disturbance Ex-Hondo, which briefly strengthened into a tropical depression.

title: Cyclone Hondo
text: However, according to the Joint Typhoon Warning Center, Hondo continued to strengthen and attained winds of 95 km/h (60 mph ) before passing directly over Réunion.

title: Cyclone Hondo
text: Interaction with the island caused the storm to weaken and degenerate into a remnant low once more.

title: Cyclone Hondo
text: The storm dissipated on February 29 after executing a counterclockwise loop.

title: 2002–03 Australian region cyclone season
text: The 2002–03 Australian region cyclone season included Cyclone Inigo, which tied Cyclone Gwenda in 1999 as the most intense tropical cyclone on record in the Australian basin.

title: 2002–03 Australian region cyclone season
text: It began on 1 November 2002 and ended on 30 April 2003.

title: 2002–03 Australian region cyclone season
text: The regional tropical cyclone operational plan also defines a "tropical cyclone year" separately from a "tropical cyclone season", which runs from 1 July 2002 to 30 June 2003.

title: 2002–03 Australian region cyclone season
text: These dates conventionally delimit the period of each year when most tropical cyclones form in the Australian region, which is defined as in the southern hemisphere between 90°E and 180°E.

title: 2002–03 Australian region cyclone season
text: The season's ten tropical depressions existed within these dates, with the first, designated as Tropical Cyclone 07S, entering the basin on 27 December 2002.

title: 2002–03 Australian region cyclone season
text: The last system, Cyclone Epi, dissipated on 6 June 2003.

title: 2002–03 Australian region cyclone season
text: Tropical cyclones in this area were monitored by four Tropical Cyclone Warning Centres (TCWCs): the Australian Bureau of Meteorology (BOM) in Perth, Darwin, and Brisbane and one in Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea.

title: 2010–11 South Pacific cyclone season
text: The 2010–11 South Pacific cyclone season was a slightly below average tropical cyclone season, with seven tropical cyclones and five severe tropical cyclones developing during the season.

title: 2010–11 South Pacific cyclone season
text: The season ran from November 1, 2010 until April 30, 2011, though if any tropical cyclones had developed between July 1, 2010 and June 30, 2011, the official "tropical cyclone year", they would have been counted towards the season's total.

title: 2010–11 South Pacific cyclone season
text: Within the South Pacific basin tropical cyclones were officially monitored by the Fiji Meteorological Service's Regional Specialized Meteorological Center in Nadi, Fiji, north of 25°S, and to the south the Meteorological Service of New Zealand's Tropical Cyclone Warning Center in Wellington, New Zealand.

title: 2010–11 South Pacific cyclone season
text: Any disturbances forming in the region were designated with a sequential number suffixed by the letter F.

title: 2010–11 South Pacific cyclone season
text: In addition, the United States Military's Joint Typhoon Warning Center unofficially monitored parts of the basin during the season, where any systems judged to have achieved tropical storm strength or greater received a number suffixed with the letter P. RSMC Nadi and TCWC Wellington both use the Australian Tropical Cyclone Intensity Scale, and measure wind speeds over a period of ten minutes, while the JTWC measures sustained winds over a period of one minute which can be applied to the Saffir–Simpson Hurricane Scale.

title: 2010–11 South Pacific cyclone season
text: Seven named storms formed or moved into the South Pacific basin during the 2010–11 season, the strongest of which was Severe Tropical Cyclone Wilma in late January.

title: 2011–12 South Pacific cyclone season
text: The 2011–12 South Pacific cyclone season was one of the least active South Pacific tropical cyclone seasons on record, with only three tropical cyclones occurring during the season.

title: 2011–12 South Pacific cyclone season
text: The season ran from November 1, 2011 to April 30, 2012, however, any tropical cyclones that form before June 30, 2012 would have fallen within the 2011–12 tropical cyclone year and would have counted towards the season total.

title: 2011–12 South Pacific cyclone season
text: The strongest and only severe tropical cyclone that occurred during the season was Severe Tropical Cyclone Jasmine, which tracked in from out of the South Pacific basin.

title: 2011–12 South Pacific cyclone season
text: Within the basin, tropical cyclones are monitored by the Regional Specialized Meteorological Center (RSMC) in Nadi, Fiji, and the Tropical Cyclone Warning Center (TCWC) in Wellington, New Zealand.

title: 2011–12 South Pacific cyclone season
text: RSMC Nadi attaches an F designation to tropical disturbances that form in or move into the South Pacific.

title: 2011–12 South Pacific cyclone season
text: The United States Joint Typhoon Warning Center (JTWC) issues unofficial warnings within the South Pacific, designating tropical storm-equivalent or greater tropical cyclones with a number and a P suffix.

title: 2011–12 South Pacific cyclone season
text: RSMC Nadi and TCWC Wellington both use the Australian Tropical Cyclone Intensity Scale, and measure windspeeds over a period of ten minutes, while the JTWC measures sustained winds over a period of one minute and uses the Saffir–Simpson Hurricane Scale.

title: Swedish Dicks
text: Swedish Dicks is an American-Swedish comedy web television series created by Peter Stormare, Glenn Lund, Peter Settman, and Andrew Lowery.

title: Swedish Dicks
text: The plot follows two unlicensed Swedish private investigators trying to make a living in Los Angeles.

title: Swedish Dicks
text: It premiered on September 2, 2016 via Swedish online streaming service Viaplay as its first original production.

title: Swedish Dicks
text: In the United States, the series premiered on the Pop television network on August 9, 2017, as well as being distributed worldwide by American network Lionsgate TV.

title: Swedish Dicks
text: In October 2016, the series was renewed for a second season set to air in December 2017 in Northern Europe and January 2018 in the United States.

title: Please Twins!
text: Please Twins!

title: Please Twins!
text: (Japanese: おねがい☆ツインズ , Hepburn: Onegai Tsuinzu , Onegai ☆ Twins) , is an anime television series, scripted by Yousuke Kuroda and produced by Bandai Visual, which was later adapted into a light novel and one-volume manga series.

title: Please Twins!
text: It centers on a family of three teenagers in high school all living together who are unsure which two of them are related to each other due to a reference from an old photograph.

title: Please Twins!
text: The "Please Twins!"

title: Please Twins!
text: anime series is a spin-off sequel to "Please Teacher!

title: Please Twins!
text: It first aired in Japan on the WOWOW satellite television network on July 15, 2003 and finished with a total of 12 episodes plus a later OVA episode released on DVD.

title: Please Twins!
text: The series was later adapted into a light novel in 2004, which spanned a total of two volumes and, soon after, into a short one-"tankōbon" manga version (authored by Akikan), which was serialized in MediaWorks's "Dengeki Daioh" magazine in September 2005.

title: Orange Is the New Black
text: Orange Is the New Black (sometimes abbreviated to OITNB) is an American comedy-drama web television series created by Jenji Kohan for Netflix.

title: Orange Is the New Black
text: The series is based on Piper Kerman's memoir, "" (2010), about her experiences at FCI Danbury, a minimum-security federal prison.

title: Orange Is the New Black
text: "Orange Is the New Black" premiered on July 11, 2013 on the streaming service Netflix.

title: Orange Is the New Black
text: In February 2016, the series was renewed for a fifth, sixth, and seventh season.

title: Orange Is the New Black
text: The fifth season was released on June 9, 2017.

title: Orange Is the New Black
text: The series is produced by Tilted Productions in association with Lionsgate Television.

title: Chapter 1 (House of Cards)
text: "Chapter 1" (sometimes "Episode 101") is the pilot episode of the American political thriller drama television series "House of Cards" and is the first episode of the first season.

title: Chapter 1 (House of Cards)
text: It premiered on February 1, 2013, when it was released along with the rest of the first season on the American streaming service Netflix.

title: Chapter 1 (House of Cards)
text: This episode became the first web television webisode to earn Primetime Emmy Awards and nominations.

title: Chapter 1 (House of Cards)
text: "Chapter 1" was written by series developer Beau Willimon and directed by executive producer David Fincher.

title: Chapter 1 (House of Cards)
text: The episode also earned 3 other Emmy nominations as well as and DGA – Drama Series nominations.

title: Bajillion Dollar Propertie$
text: Bajillion Dollar Propertie$ is an American comedy series on the Seeso comedy subscription streaming service.

title: Bajillion Dollar Propertie$
text: The series, created by Kulap Vilaysack, is a semi-scripted parody of reality television series such as "Million Dollar Listing" and "Property Brothers".

title: Bajillion Dollar Propertie$
text: "Bajillion Dollar Propertie$" previewed its pilot episode on February 20, 2016 and officially premiered on March 17, 2016.

title: Bajillion Dollar Propertie$
text: It was reported on April 5, 2016 that the series' second season would premiere in the fall of 2016.

title: Bajillion Dollar Propertie$
text: On December 12, 2016, Seeso renewed the series for a third and fourth season.

title: Bajillion Dollar Propertie$
text: On August 9, 2017, Seeso announced the shutdown of its service by the end of the year, leaving "Bajillion Dollar Propertie$" without a home.

title: AXN
text: AXN is a pay television, cable and satellite television channel owned by Sony Pictures Television, which was first launched on May 22, 1997.

title: AXN
text: The network is now spread across several parts of the world, including Europe, Japan, other parts of Asia and Latin America.

title: AXN
text: Funded through advertising and subscription fees, AXN delivers 24 hours a day of action and crime TV series, movies, animations and adventure-reality and lifestyle sports programmes.

title: AXN
text: In the United States, AXN was used as a brand name for the streaming of Sony's television library on streaming service Joost before it shut down in 2012.

title: Romper Stomper (TV series)
text: Romper Stomper is an Australian television series on video streaming service Stan.

title: Romper Stomper (TV series)
text: It is created as a sequel to the 1992 film "Romper Stomper".

title: Romper Stomper (TV series)
text: The six-part series will see Jacqueline McKenzie, Dan Wyllie and John Brumpton reprise their roles in a continuation of the story, 25 years later.

title: Romper Stomper (TV series)
text: It follows a new generation of the activist Far-right, their anti-fascist counterparts and the multicultural fabric of a country each of them threatens to tear apart.

title: Snatch (film)
text: Snatch (stylised as snatch.)

title: Snatch (film)
text: is a 2000 British crime comedy film written and directed by Guy Ritchie, featuring an ensemble cast.

title: Snatch (film)
text: Set in the London criminal underworld, the film contains two intertwined plots: one dealing with the search for a stolen diamond, the other with a small-time boxing promoter (Jason Statham) who finds himself under the thumb of a ruthless gangster (Alan Ford) who is ready and willing to have his subordinates carry out severe and sadistic acts of violence.

title: Please Don't Eat the Daisies
text: Please Don't Eat the Daisies (New York: Doubleday, 1957) is a best-selling collection of humorous essays by American humorist and playwright Jean Kerr about suburban living and raising four boys.

title: Please Don't Eat the Daisies
text: The essays do not have a plot or through-storyline, but the book sold so well it was later adapted into a film starring Doris Day and David Niven.

title: Please Don't Eat the Daisies
text: The film was later adapted into a television series starring Patricia Crowley and Mark Miller.

title: Please Don't Eat the Daisies
text: Mrs. Kerr followed up this book with two later best-selling collections, "The Snake Has All the Lines" and "Penny Candy".

title: Gilmore Girls: A Year in the Life
text: Gilmore Girls: A Year in the Life is an American web television series on the streaming service Netflix.

title: Gilmore Girls: A Year in the Life
text: It is a sequel to "Gilmore Girls", an American comedy-drama television series created by Amy Sherman-Palladino and starring Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel, which ran from 2000 to 2007 on The WB and The CW.

title: National League (English football)
text: The National League is an association football league in England consisting of three divisions, the National League, National League North and National League South.

title: National League (English football)
text: It was called the Alliance Premier League from 1979 until 1986.

title: National League (English football)
text: Between 1986 and 2015, the league was known as the Football Conference.

title: National League (English football)
text: As part of a sponsorship deal with car leasing company Vanarama, the league is known as the Vanarama National League.

title: Jack Truelove
text: Jack Christopher Truelove (born 27 December 1995) is an English football player who most recently played for National League North side Hednesford Town on loan from Oldham Athletic.

title: Jack Truelove
text: He is currently registered to play for National League North side Curzon Ashton.

title: Spennymoor Town F.C.
text: Spennymoor Town Football Club is an English football club based in Spennymoor, England and are currently playing in the National League North, the sixth tier of the English football league system.

title: Spennymoor Town F.C.
text: The club began playing in the Northern League in 1931–32 as Evenwood Town, reaching the 1st round of the FA Cup in the 1956–57 season.

title: Spennymoor Town F.C.
text: In 2005, the club merged with Spennymoor United, who earlier that year folded and collectively changed their name to Spennymoor Town.

title: Curzon Ashton F.C.
text: Curzon Ashton Football Club is a semi-professional football club based in the market town of Ashton-under-Lyne, Greater Manchester, England, that competes in the National League North, the sixth-highest division overall in the English football league system, and are members of the Manchester County Football Association.

title: Curzon Ashton F.C.
text: Nicknamed "the Nash", the club was founded in 1963 and moved to its current stadium, Tameside Stadium, in 2005.

title: York City F.C.
text: York City Football Club is a professional association football club based in the city of York, North Yorkshire, England.

title: York City F.C.
text: The team compete in the National League North, the sixth tier of league football in England, as of the 2017–18 season.

title: National League North
text: The National League North, formerly Conference North (currently named the Vanarama National League North for sponsorship reasons), is a division of the National League in England, taking its place immediately below the top division National League.

title: National League North
text: Along with the National League South, it is at Step 2 of the National League System and the sixth overall tier of the English football league system.

title: National League North
text: It consists of teams located in Northern England, Norfolk, the English Midlands and North Wales.

title: National League North
text: From the start of the 2015–16 season, the league has been known as the National League North.

title: National League North
text: As part of a sponsorship deal with Vanarama, the National League North is now known as the Vanarama National League North.

title: Southport F.C.
text: Southport Football Club is a semi-professional association football club based in Blowick, Southport, Merseyside.

title: Southport F.C.
text: They are currently members of the National League North, the sixth tier of English football, .

title: Southport F.C.
text: From 1921 to 1978 they were a Football League club.

title: Southport F.C.
text: They play their home matches at Haig Avenue, which has a capacity of 6,008.

title: Southport F.C.
text: They are known by their nickname "the Sandgrounders".

title: National League South
text: The National League South, formerly Conference South (billed as The Vanarama National League South for sponsorship reasons), is one of the second divisions of the National League in England, taking its place immediately below the top division National League.

title: National League South
text: Along with National League North it is at the second level of the National League System, and at the sixth tier overall of the English football league system.

title: Gainsborough Trinity F.C.
text: Gainsborough Trinity Football Club is a football club based in Gainsborough, Lincolnshire, England.

title: Gainsborough Trinity F.C.
text: Established in 1873, the club became members of the Football League in 1893 and remained members of the Second Division until 1912, making Gainsborough one of the smallest towns in England to have had a Football League team.

title: Gainsborough Trinity F.C.
text: They are currently members of the National League North, the sixth tier of English football, and play at the Northolme.

title: Boston United F.C.
text: Boston United Football Club is an English football club based in Boston, Lincolnshire.

title: Boston United F.C.
text: The club participates in the National League North, the sixth tier of English football.

title: Boston United F.C.
text: The club is known as 'the Pilgrims' in reference to the Pilgrim Fathers, who left England and sailed to North America and founded Boston, Massachusetts.

title: Boston United F.C.
text: The club's crest, the pilgrim fathers' ship 'The Mayflower', is also a reference to them.

title: Boston United F.C.
text: The club's traditional colours are amber and black.

title: Boston United F.C.
text: Boston's neighbours include Lincoln City, Scunthorpe United and Grimsby Town.

title: Boston United F.C.
text: The club is one of only 12 in the country to run a Centre of Excellence, provides a Study Support Centre and is also the basis of the 'Boston United Football in the Community Scheme'.

title: 1991 Mr. Olympia
text: The 1991 Mr. Olympia contest was an IFBB professional bodybuilding competition held in September 1991 at the Walt Disney World Dolphin Hotel in Orlando, Florida.

title: 1975 Mr. Olympia
text: The 1975 Mr. Olympia contest was an IFBB professional bodybuilding competition held November 4–11, 1975 in Pretoria, South Africa.

title: 1975 Mr. Olympia
text: It was the 11th Mr. Olympia competition and the feature event of the 1975 IFBB International Congress.

title: 1980 Ms. Olympia
text: The 1980 Ms. Olympia contest was an IFBB professional bodybuilding competition was held in August 30, 1980, at the Sheraton Hotel in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

title: 1980 Ms. Olympia
text: It was the 1st Ms. Olympia competition held.

title: 1981 Ms. Olympia
text: The 1981 Ms. Olympia contest was an IFBB professional bodybuilding competition was held on August 22, 1981, at the Sheraton Hotel in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

title: 1981 Ms. Olympia
text: It was the 2nd Ms. Olympia competition held.

title: 2010 Ms. Olympia
text: The 2010 Ms. Olympia was an IFBB professional bodybuilding competition and part of Joe Weider's Olympia Fitness & Performance Weekend 2010 was held on September 24, 2010, at the South Hall in the Las Vegas Convention Center in Winchester, Nevada and in the Orleans Arena at The Orleans Hotel and Casino in Paradise, Nevada.

title: 2010 Ms. Olympia
text: It was the 31st Ms. Olympia competition held.

title: 2010 Ms. Olympia

title: Rising Phoenix World Championships
text: The IFBB Wings of Strength Rising Phoenix World Championships is a professional female bodybuilding competition, sponsored by Wings of Strength company founded by Jake and Kristal Wood, promoted by Tim Gardner Productions, and sanctioned by the International Federation of BodyBuilders (I.F.B.B.).

title: Rising Phoenix World Championships
text: It is the most prestigious IFBB professional female bodybuilding event around since the end of the Ms. Olympia.

title: Rising Phoenix World Championships
text: The first championship show took place in conjunction with the IFBB Texas Pro, the NPC Tim Gardner Texas Extravaganza, and the NPC National on August 22, 2015 at the Grand Hyatt, San Antonio, Texas.

title: 2017 Mr. Olympia
text: The 2017 Mr. Olympia contest was a weekend long IFBB professional bodybuilding competition that was held on September 14 to 17, 2017, in Las Vegas, Nevada.

title: 2017 Mr. Olympia
text: This was the 53rd Mr. Olympia competition celebrated.

title: 2017 Mr. Olympia
text: The weekend competition is also known as the Joe Weider's Olympia Fitness and Performance Weekend.

title: 2017 Mr. Olympia
text: While the main event was the competition for the title of Mr. Olympia, several other events were held which includes the Amateur competition and sports expo.

title: 2011 Ms. Olympia
text: The 2011 Ms. Olympia contest was an IFBB professional bodybuilding competition and part of Joe Weider's Olympia Fitness & Performance Weekend 2011 was held on September 16, 2011, at the South Hall in the Las Vegas Convention Center in Winchester, Nevada and in the Orleans Arena at The Orleans Hotel and Casino in Paradise, Nevada.

title: 2011 Ms. Olympia
text: It was the 32nd Ms. Olympia competition held.

title: 2011 Ms. Olympia
text: Other events at the exhibition included the 212 Olympia Showdown, Mr. Olympia, Fitness Olympia, Figure Olympia, and Bikini Olympia contests.

title: 2012 Ms. Olympia
text: The 2012 Ms. Olympia contest was an IFBB professional bodybuilding competition and part of Joe Weider's Olympia Fitness & Performance Weekend 2012 was held on September 28, 2012, at the South Hall in the Las Vegas Convention Center in Winchester, Nevada and in the Orleans Arena at The Orleans Hotel and Casino in Paradise, Nevada.

title: 2012 Ms. Olympia
text: It was the 33rd Ms. Olympia competition held.

title: 2012 Ms. Olympia
text: Other events at the exhibition included the 212 Olympia Showdown,

title: 1991 Ms. Olympia
text: The 1991 Ms. Olympia contest was an IFBB professional bodybuilding competition was held on October 12 and 13, 1991 at the Shrine Auditorium in Los Angeles, California.

title: 1991 Ms. Olympia
text: It was the 12th Ms. Olympia competition held.

title: 71st Golden Globe Awards
text: The 71st Golden Globe Awards, honoring the best in film and American television of 2013, was broadcast live from the Beverly Hilton Hotel in Beverly Hills, California, on January 12, 2014, by NBC, as part of the 2013-14 film awards season.

title: 71st Golden Globe Awards
text: The ceremony was produced by Dick Clark Productions in association with the Hollywood Foreign Press Association.

title: 71st Golden Globe Awards
text: Woody Allen was announced as the Cecil B. DeMille Award honoree for his lifetime achievements on September 13, 2013, and Diane Keaton accepted the award for him.

title: 71st Golden Globe Awards
text: On October 15, Tina Fey and Amy Poehler were announced as the co-hosts for the second time in a row and as the co-hosts for the 72nd Golden Globe Awards.

title: 71st Golden Globe Awards
text: The nominations were announced on December 12, 2013, by Aziz Ansari, Zoe Saldana and Olivia Wilde. "

title: 71st Golden Globe Awards
text: American Hustle", "Behind the Candelabra", "Breaking Bad", "Brooklyn Nine-Nine", and "Dallas Buyers Club" were among the films and television shows that received multiple awards.

title: Dancing on the Edge (TV series)
text: Dancing on the Edge is a British television drama written and directed by Stephen Poliakoff and produced by the BBC about a black jazz band in London in the early 1930s.

title: Dancing on the Edge (TV series)
text: The series aired on BBC Two between 4 February and 10 March 2013.

title: Dancing on the Edge (TV series)
text: It was nominated for three awards at the 71st Golden Globe Awards.

title: 61st Golden Globe Awards
text: The 61st Golden Globe Awards, honoring the best in film and television for 2003, were held on January 25, 2004 at the Beverly Hilton Hotel in Beverly Hills, California.

title: 51st Golden Globe Awards
text: The 51st Golden Globe Awards, honoring the best in film and television for 1993, were held on January 22, 1994, at the Beverly Hilton Hotel in Beverly Hills, California.

title: Scarface (soundtrack)
text: Scarface: Music from the Original Motion Picture Soundtrack is the soundtrack album featured on the 1983 American crime film, "Scarface", which was directed by Brian De Palma.

title: Scarface (soundtrack)
text: Composed by Italian record producer Giorgio Moroder, the vinyl soundtrack was released on December 9 of the same year through MCA Records.

title: Scarface (soundtrack)
text: The album features music created by Moroder, who wrote and produced all of the tracks.

title: Scarface (soundtrack)
text: "Scarface" counts with the collaboration of multiple singers, including Paul Engemann in the track "Scarface (Push It to the Limit)", Debbie Harry in "Rush Rush", and Amy Holland in "She's on Fire" and "Turn Out the Night", among other artists.

title: Scarface (soundtrack)
text: The soundtrack received a Golden Globe Award nomination for Best Original Score at the 41st Golden Globe Awards.

title: Breaking Bad
text: Breaking Bad is an American neo-western crime drama television series created and produced by Vince Gilligan.

title: Breaking Bad
text: The show originally aired on the AMC network for five seasons, from January 20, 2008 to September 29, 2013.

title: Breaking Bad
text: It tells the story of Walter White (Bryan Cranston), a struggling high school chemistry teacher diagnosed with inoperable lung cancer.

title: Breaking Bad
text: Together with his former student Jesse Pinkman (Aaron Paul), White turns to a life of crime by producing and selling crystallized methamphetamine to secure his family's financial future before he dies, while navigating the dangers of the criminal world.

title: Breaking Bad
text: The title comes from the Southern colloquialism "breaking bad", meaning to "raise hell" or turn toward crime.

title: Breaking Bad
text: "Breaking Bad" is set and was filmed in Albuquerque, New Mexico.

title: Flight of the Innocent
text: La corsa dell'innocente (internationally released as Flight of the Innocent) is a 1992 Italian drama film directed by Carlo Carlei.

title: Flight of the Innocent
text: It was nominated at 51st Golden Globe Awards for Best Foreign Language Film.

title: Flight of the Innocent
text: - Winner: Hampton Film Festival 1993: Golden Arrow Best Film, Golden Arrow Best Director - Winner: David di Donatello Awards Nomination 1992: Best First Film - Winner: N.I.C.E. New York: Best Film Audience Award - Toronto Festival of Festivals 1993: Opening Night Gala Screening.

title: Golden Globe Award for Best Animated Feature Film
text: The Golden Globe Award for Best Animated Feature Film was awarded for the first time at the 64th Golden Globe Awards in 2007.

title: Golden Globe Award for Best Animated Feature Film
text: It was the first time that the Golden Globe Awards had created a separate category for animated films since its establishment.

title: Golden Globe Award for Best Animated Feature Film
text: The nominations are announced in January and an awards ceremony is held later in the month.

title: Golden Globe Award for Best Animated Feature Film
text: Initially, only three films are nominated for best animated film, in contrast to five nominations for the majority of other awards.

title: Golden Globe Award for Best Animated Feature Film
text: The Pixar film "Cars" was the first recipient of the award.

title: Golden Globe Award for Best Animated Feature Film
text: The award for best animated film has subsequently been presented to six other Pixar films: "Ratatouille" received the award in 2008, "WALL-E" was the recipient in 2009, "Up" received the award in 2010, "Toy Story 3" won in 2011, "Brave" won in 2013, and "Inside Out" won in 2016.

title: Golden Globe Award for Best Animated Feature Film
text: In 2012, "Cars 2" lost to "The Adventures of Tintin", in 2014, "Monsters University" was the first not to be nominated and also in 2016, "The Good Dinosaur" lost to "Inside Out".

title: Golden Globe Award for Best Animated Feature Film
text: In 2017, "Finding Dory" was also not nominated.

title: Golden Globe Award for Best Animated Feature Film
text: The Hollywood Foreign Press Association has been awarding Golden Globe Awards since 1944.

title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
text: Brooklyn Nine-Nine is an American police sitcom that premiered on Fox on September 17, 2013, garnering 6.17 million viewers.

title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
text: Created by Dan Goor and Michael Schur, the series revolves around Jake Peralta (Andy Samberg), an immature but talented NYPD detective in Brooklyn's 99th Precinct, who comes into immediate conflict with his new commanding officer, the serious and stern Captain Raymond Holt (Andre Braugher).

title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
text: The ensemble and supporting cast feature Stephanie Beatriz as Rosa Diaz, Terry Crews as Terrence "Terry" Jeffords, Melissa Fumero as Amy Santiago, Joe Lo Truglio as Charles Boyle, Chelsea Peretti as Regina "Gina" Linetti, Dirk Blocker as Michael Hitchcock and Joel McKinnon Miller as Norman "Norm" Scully.

title: 31st Golden Globe Awards
text: The 31st Golden Globe Awards, honoring the best in film and television for 1973, were held on January 26, 1974.

title: List of accolades received by American Beauty
text: "American Beauty" is a 1999 American drama film directed by Sam Mendes and written by Alan Ball.

title: List of accolades received by American Beauty
text: The film stars Kevin Spacey as Lester Burnham, a middle-aged office worker who has a midlife crisis when he becomes infatuated with his teenage daughter's best friend.

title: List of accolades received by American Beauty
text: Released in North America on September 15, 1999, "American Beauty" was positively received by critics and audiences alike; it was the best-reviewed American film of the year and grossed over $350 million worldwide.

title: List of accolades received by American Beauty
text: Reviewers praised all aspects of the production, with particular emphasis on Mendes, Spacey and Ball; criticism tended to focus on the familiarity of the characters and setting.

title: List of accolades received by American Beauty
text: At the 1999 Academy Awards, the film won Best Picture, Best Director, Best Actor (for Spacey), Best Original Screenplay and Best Cinematography (for Conrad Hall).

title: List of accolades received by American Beauty
text: The film was nominated for and won numerous other awards and honors, mainly for the direction, writing, and acting.

title: Marjorie Joyner
text: Marjorie Stewart Joyner (October 24, 1896 – December 27, 1994) was an American businesswoman.

title: Marjorie Joyner
text: She was born in 1896, in Monterey, Virginia.

title: Marjorie Joyner
text: In 1912, she moved to Chicago and began studying cosmetology.

title: Marjorie Joyner
text: She graduated A.B. Molar Beauty School in Chicago in 1916, the first African American to achieve this.

title: Marjorie Joyner
text: There she met Madam C. J. Walker, an African American beauty entrepreneur, and the owner of a cosmetic empire.

title: Marjorie Joyner
text: Always a lover of women's cosmetics, Joyner went to work for her and oversaw 200 of Madame Walker's beauty schools as the national adviser.

title: Marjorie Joyner
text: A major role was sending Walker's hair stylists door-to-door, dressed in black skirts and white blouses with black satchels containing a range of beauty products that were applied in the customer's house.

title: Marjorie Joyner
text: Joyner taught some 15,000 stylists over her fifty-year career.

title: Marjorie Joyner
text: She was also a leader in developing new products, such as her permanent wave machine.

title: Marjorie Joyner
text: She helped write the first cosmetology laws for the state of Illinois, and founded a sorority and fraternity, Alpha Chi Pi Omega on October 27, 1945 as well as a national association for black beauticians.

title: Marjorie Joyner
text: Joyner was friends with Eleanor Roosevelt, and helped found the National Council of Negro Women.

title: Marjorie Joyner
text: She was an advisor to the Democratic National Committee in the 1940s, and advised several New Deal agencies trying to reach out to black women.

title: Marjorie Joyner
text: Joyner was highly visible in the Chicago black community, as head of the "Chicago Defender" Charity network, and fundraiser for various schools.

title: Marjorie Joyner
text: In 1987 the Smithsonian Institution in Washington opened an exhibit featuring Joyner's permanent wave machine and a replica of her original salon.

title: American Beauty/American Psycho Tour
text: The American Beauty/American Psycho Tour was a concert tour by American rock band Fall Out Boy.

title: American Beauty/American Psycho Tour
text: Supporting the band's sixth studio album "American Beauty/American Psycho" (2015), the tour visited North America and Europe in 2015.

title: American Beauty/American Psycho Tour
text: The North American leg was co-headlined with American rapper Wiz Khalifa under the name The Boys of Zummer.

title: American Beauty/American Psycho Tour
text: The Boys of Zummer leg with Wiz Khalifa ranked fifty-ninth for Pollstar's Year End Top 200 North American Tours of 2015, grossing $18.2 million.

title: American Beauty (1999 film)
text: American Beauty is a 1999 American drama film directed by Sam Mendes and written by Alan Ball.

title: American Beauty (1999 film)
text: Kevin Spacey stars as Lester Burnham, a 42-year-old advertising executive who has a midlife crisis when he becomes infatuated with his teenage daughter's best friend, Angela (Mena Suvari).

title: American Beauty (1999 film)
text: Annette Bening co-stars as Lester's materialistic wife, Carolyn, and Thora Birch plays their insecure daughter, Jane.

title: American Beauty (1999 film)
text: Wes Bentley, Chris Cooper, and Allison Janney also feature.

title: American Beauty (1999 film)
text: The film is described by academics as a satire of American middle-class notions of beauty and personal satisfaction; analysis has focused on the film's explorations of romantic, and paternal love, sexuality, beauty, materialism, self-liberation, and redemption.

title: American Beauty (1927 film)
text: American Beauty is a lost 1927 American silent film romantic drama produced and distributed by First National Pictures.

title: American Beauty (1927 film)
text: This film was directed by Richard Wallace and starred Billie Dove.

title: American Beauty (1927 film)
text: It was based on a short story "American Beauty" by Wallace Irwin.

title: American Beauty (1927 film)
text: She is supported by Walter McGrail and Margaret Livingston.

title: Coty, Inc.
text: Coty, Inc., is a North American beauty products manufacturer based in New York founded in Paris, France, by François Coty in 1904.

title: Coty, Inc.
text: Its main products are fragrances, colour cosmetics and skin and body care products.

title: Coty, Inc.
text: It is known for its cooperation with designers and celebrities for the creation of fragrances.

title: Coty, Inc.
text: Its biggest brands, or "power brands" as it calls them, are: Calvin Klein (fragrance and cosmetics), Chloe (fragrance), Davidoff (fragrance), y (fragrance), Marc Jacobs (fragrance), Philosophy (beauty), Adidas (fragrance and beauty), Playboy (fragrance), OPI Products (beauty), Rimmel London (make-up), Max Factor (cosmetics) and Sally Hansen (beauty).

title: La Belle Américaine
text: La Belle Américaine English: The American Beauty , is a French comedy film from 1961, directed by Robert Dhéry, written by Alfred Adam, starring Alfred Adam and Louis de Funès.

title: La Belle Américaine
text: The film was known under the titles: "La bella americana" (Italy), "The American Beauty" (English title), "Der tolle Amerikaner" (West Germany).

title: The Kids Aren't Alright (Fall Out Boy song)
text: "The Kids Aren't Alright" is a song by American rock band Fall Out Boy.

title: The Kids Aren't Alright (Fall Out Boy song)
text: It was released as the first promotional single (overall the third release) on December 15, 2014 from their sixth studio album, "American Beauty/American Psycho", as a digital download with pre-orders of the album.

title: The Kids Aren't Alright (Fall Out Boy song)
text: It coincided with the release of the second official single from the album, "American Beauty/American Psycho", along with the album artwork and track listing.

title: The Kids Aren't Alright (Fall Out Boy song)
text: When asked which "American Beauty/American Psycho" track the band was most proud of, Pete Wentz responded, "It's hard to say because it's like having kids.

title: The Kids Aren't Alright (Fall Out Boy song)
text: says The Kids Aren't Alright".

title: Christopher Greenbury
text: Christopher Greenbury, ACE (September 24, 1951 – January 4, 2007) was a British film editor with more than thirty film credits dating from 1979's "The Muppet Movie".

title: Christopher Greenbury
text: With Tariq Anwar, he won the BAFTA Award for Best Editing for "American Beauty" (1999), which he was also nominated for an Academy Award for Best Film Editing.

title: Christopher Greenbury
text: "American Beauty" is a serious drama, but in general Greenbury edited comedy films, including six directed by the Farrelly brothers commencing with 1994's "Dumb and Dumber".

title: Miss American Beauty 1963
text: This is the first edition of the Miss American Beauty pageant.

title: Miss American Beauty 1963
text: The Miss American Beauty pageant was created to select a USA representative to the Miss International.

title: Miss American Beauty 1963
text: A live pageant was held from 1963 to 1967.

title: Miss American Beauty 1963
text: After that time, there is no actual documentation that a pageant was actually held for the USA representative.

title: Miss American Beauty 1963
text: The Miss American Beauty title continued to be used for the USA representative to Miss International until approximately 2003.

title: The Apartment - Design Your Destiny
text: The Apartment - Design Your Destiny is a reality television show where 9 teams compete in an interior designing show hosted by Jamie Durie, and judged by both him and Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen.

title: The Apartment - Design Your Destiny
text: Designed as a pressure stress test, teams will design and decorate a room each week.

title: The Apartment - Design Your Destiny
text: At the end of the challenge, the winner will walk away with a brand new double-storey home at Elmina, Malaysia.

title: The Apartment - Design Your Destiny
text: This reality television show is created by Riaz Mehta and produced by Imagine Group.

title: Rewrapped
text: Rewrapped is a reality cooking television show hosted by Joey Fatone that premiered on April 21, 2014, on Food Network.

title: Rewrapped
text: Similar to short-form cooking reality shows, it features three chefs challenged to first recreate a classic snack food, then innovate a totally new dish using said snack food as the main ingredient.

title: Rewrapped
text: The show is a loose spinoff of the show "Unwrapped", whose host Marc Summers acts as "Head Judge" for each episode, alongside a representative of the company that produces the food of the day, and a third impartial judge involved in the food industry in some way (chef, critic, blogger, etc.).

title: On the Ball (ITV television show)
text: On the Ball is a British ITV Saturday lunchtime television show about football, which ran as part of "World of Sport" in the 1970s and 1980s, and as a stand-alone show from 1998 to 2004.

title: On the Ball (ITV television show)
text: There was another ITV television show called "On the Ball" which was a game show hosted by Nick Weir in 1997, shown only in the Granada region.

title: Freedom Watch with Judge Napolitano
text: Freedom Watch with Judge Napolitano is a television show hosted by Judge Andrew Napolitano, on Fox Business Network.

title: Freedom Watch with Judge Napolitano
text: The show aired from 2009 to 2012, focusing mainly on libertarian-conservative issues and perspectives.

title: The Sarah Millican Television Programme
text: The Sarah Millican Television Programme was a British comedic television show hosted by comedian Sarah Millican.

title: The Sarah Millican Television Programme
text: The show's central theme was a comical review of television programming (particularly British television).

title: The Sarah Millican Television Programme
text: Each episode featured as a topic a different genre of television; Millican would lampoon the topic genre in monologue segments that were inter-cut with jocular interviews of celebrities known for work within that genre.

title: The Sarah Millican Television Programme
text: Three series of the show were broadcast between early 2012 and late 2013.

title: The Sarah Millican Television Programme
text: An additional pilot episode was filmed on 25 May 2011, but never broadcast

title: Tómbola (TV series)
text: Tómbola is a Spanish language entertainment news show hosted by Marisa del Portillo, Tanya Charry, Carolina Sandoval, actor/model Andrés García Jr., and actress/TV host Alexandra Rodriguez.

title: Tómbola (TV series)
text: From October 10, 2011 to December 29, 2011 , Telefutura aired "Tómbola" weeknights at 6pm/5pm central, succeeded both Escandalo TV & La Tijera.

title: Tómbola (TV series)
text: From December 30, 2011 to January 17, 2012, "Tombola" aired weekdays at 5pm/4pm central, and was canceled afterwards, due to low ratings.

title: The Magic of Oil Painting
text: The Magic of Oil Painting is an American half-hour instructional television show hosted by painter Bill Alexander which ran from 1974 until 1982 on PBS.

title: The Magic of Oil Painting
text: In each episode, Alexander taught techniques for landscape oil painting, completing a painting in each session.

title: The Magic of Oil Painting
text: The show is known for inspiring "The Joy of Painting" hosted by Bob Ross.

title: Sarah Palin's Alaska
text: Sarah Palin's Alaska is an American reality television show hosted by former Alaska Governor Sarah Palin.

title: Sarah Palin's Alaska
text: According to Palin, the show's aim is to bring "the wonder and majesty of Alaska to all Americans".

title: Sarah Palin's Alaska
text: The series, which began airing on TLC in November 2010, broadcast 8 episodes and 1 clip show.

title: Sarah Palin's Alaska
text: The show was part travelogue and part documentary series, according to a story in "The Vancouver Sun", six months before the release of the series trailer.

title: Sarah Palin's Alaska
text: In reviewing the first episode, "The New York Times" said the show allows viewers to "observe Ms. Palin observing nature".

title: Sarah Palin's Alaska
text: The show was not renewed for a second season.

title: The House of Tiny Tearaways
text: The House of Tiny Tearaways is a BBC Three reality TV show hosted by Dr Tanya Byron and Claudia Winkleman and produced by Outline Productions.

title: The House of Tiny Tearaways
text: The show brings three families experiencing problems into a large, purpose-built house where they are monitored and helped for a week.

title: The House of Tiny Tearaways
text: The show is vaguely similar to programmes like "Big Brother", in that all the rooms have cameras in them and the families are frequently monitored in their activities with the audience shown highlights of a particular day.

title: Nicki Minaj
text: Onika Tanya Maraj (born December 8, 1982), known professionally as Nicki Minaj ( ), is a rapper, singer, songwriter and model.

title: Nicki Minaj
text: Born in Saint James, Trinidad and Tobago and raised in Queens, New York, Minaj gained public recognition after releasing three mixtapes between 2007 to 2009 and subsequently signed to Young Money Entertainment in 2009.

title: Volvo T6
text: The Volvo T6 was a concept car from Volvo presented in 2005 at SEMA.

title: Volvo T6
text: There was just one hand-built copy, although there was some discussion about a limited production run.

title: Volvo T6
text: It is powered by a twin-turbocharged 2.9-liter inline 6-cylinder engine from Volvo S80 giving 300 bhp and a top speed of 205 mph .

title: Volvo T6
text: The engine is located behind the driver.

title: Volvo T6
text: Its design is obviously inspired by hot rod cars.

title: Volvo T6
text: It was named the 2004 "Hot Rod of the Year" by Hot Rod Magazine.

title: Volvo T6
text: It was designed by Per Gyllenspetz from Labyrint studio and built by Leif Tufvesson.

title: Volvo T6
text: Many believe the shape and body to take inspiration from the Plymouth Prowler because much like the Prowler, the T6 was designed to be a modern take on the classic hot rod.

title: The Green Leaf
text: The Green Leaf is an experimental rock & roll band from San Diego, California led by Mark Whitney Mehran (MWM).

title: The Green Leaf
text: The Green Leaf was formed in 1992 and released its first full length original album titled Green Leaf in 1995.

title: The Green Leaf
text: MWM composes, arranges, and plays all of the instruments and vocals on The Green Leaf recordings after 1996.

title: The Green Leaf
text: In the 1990s The Green Leaf toured the independent music club scene for a number of years playing live shows as a traditional three piece rock outfit.

title: The Green Leaf
text: In 2007 Mark Whitney Mehran teamed up with Harley Davidson of Deadbolt (band) to record original instrumental music for the HOT ROD SURF How To Service Your Hot Rod!

title: The Green Leaf
text: movie.

title: The Green Leaf
text: The Green Leaf music is published by HOT ROD SURF Publishing (ASCAP).

title: Rodimus
text: Rodimus Prime is the name of several fictional characters from the Transformers franchise.

title: Rodimus
text: He was formerly known as Hot Rod and was first seen in "" but was reformatted into Rodimus Prime when he received the Autobot Matrix of Leadership from his mentor Optimus Prime, and assumed the role of the movie's protagonist.

title: Rodimus
text: Hasbro has used the names Autobot Hot Rod, Rodimus, Rodimus Major, and Hot Shot as replacements for later characters, due to trademark issues with the name Hot Rod.

title: Rodimus
text: His alternate mode varies between depictions, but usually possesses a red and yellow paint job.

title: Rat rod
text: A rat rod is a style of hot rod or custom car that, in most cases, imitates (or exaggerates) the early hot rods of the 1940s, 1950s, and early-1960s.

title: Rat rod
text: The style is not to be confused with the somewhat closely related "traditional" hot rod, which is an accurate re-creation or period-correct restoration of a hot rod from the same era.

title: California Hot Rod Reunion
text: California Hot Rod Reunion is a gathering of drag racers, hot rod enthusiasts and street rodders held in Bakersfield, California.

title: California Hot Rod Reunion
text: The event was created by Steve Gibbs, vice-president of the National Hot Rod Association, in October 1992, as a one-time event to gather some of the old drag racers together.

title: California Hot Rod Reunion
text: It has since become an annual event in early October at Auto Club Famoso Raceway outside Bakersfield.

title: California Hot Rod Reunion
text: It has also spawned the National Hot Rod Reunion, held each year in Bowling Green KY.

title: California Hot Rod Reunion
text: Honorees are named at each year's reunion.

title: California Hot Rod Reunion
text: The Honorees are pioneers in the sport of drag racing and hot rodding.

title: California Hot Rod Reunion
text: The 25th annual event, presented by AAA and associate sponsor Good Vibrations Motorsports, will be held Oct 21-23, 2016.

title: Ala Kart (custom car)
text: Ala Kart is a custom car, a customized 1929 Ford Model A roadster pickup, built by George Barris, Richard Peters, and Mike "Blackie" Gejeian in 1957.

title: Ala Kart (custom car)
text: Originally owned by Peters, it is a two-time winner of the Grand National Roadster Show "America's Most Beautiful Roadster" (AMBR) trophy (1958 and 1959) and "Hot Rod" cover car in October 1958.

title: Ala Kart (custom car)
text: Featured in hundreds of car shows, Ala Kart has won more than 200 trophies.

title: Ala Kart (custom car)
text: It has also made numerous appearances in movies, usually in the background of drive-in shots,<ref name="Hot Rod, 12/86, p.29 sidebar">"Hot Rod", 12/86, p.29 sidebar.

title: Ala Kart (custom car)
text: </ref> and dozens of magazine articles since.

title: Ala Kart (custom car)
text: It is considered "one of the most iconic hot rods ever built."

title: National Hot Rod Reunion
text: The National Hot Rod Reunion is a gathering of nostalgia drag racers, street rodders and automotive enthusiasts based on the California Hot Rod Reunion.

title: National Hot Rod Reunion
text: The first four years of the National Hot Rod Reunion were held in Bowling Green, Kentucky.

title: National Hot Rod Reunion
text: The fifth National Hot Rod Reunion is set for Columbus, Ohio on June 15–17, 2007.

title: National Hot Rod Reunion
text: The event returned to Bowling Green, KY in 2008 and has been held there ever since.

title: Fender Hot Rod DeVille
text: The Fender Hot Rod DeVille is a combo tube guitar amplifier manufactured and sold by Fender.

title: Fender Hot Rod DeVille
text: It was introduced in 1996 as part of Fender's Hot Rod line of amplifiers, and since then has been in continuous production.

title: Fender Hot Rod DeVille
text: The Hot Rod DeVille is a modified version of the earlier Fender Blues DeVille from the Blues amplifier line, and has a higher level of gain in its preamplification signal.

title: Fender Hot Rod DeVille
text: The DeVille incorporates a 60 watt amplifier, and is available in two different models: a 212, which includes a pair of 12" speakers, and the 410, which includes four 10" speakers.

title: Fender Hot Rod DeVille
text: The DeVille is the sister amplifier of the Fender Hot Rod Deluxe.

title: Fender Hot Rod Deluxe
text: The Fender Hot Rod Deluxe is a guitar amplifier manufactured and sold by the Fender Musical Instruments Corporation.

title: Fender Hot Rod Deluxe
text: It was introduced in 1995 as part of the "Hot Rod" line of guitar amplifiers and has been in continuous production since.

title: Fender Hot Rod Deluxe
text: The Hot Rod Deluxe is a modified version of the Fender Blues Deluxe from the earlier Blues line of amplifiers, and has a higher level of gain in its preamplification signal.

title: Fender Hot Rod Deluxe
text: This model, along with the Hot Rod Deville, were originally designated as F.A.T. ('Fender American Tube') amplifiers but this moniker was dropped in 2002 when production of this series of amps was moved from Corona, CA to Fender's Baja-Ensenada, Mexico manufacturing facility.

title: Hot Rod Lincoln
text: "Hot Rod Lincoln" is a song by American singer-songwriter Charlie Ryan, first released in 1955.

title: Hot Rod Lincoln
text: It was written as an answer song to Arkie Shibley's 1951 hit "Hot Rod Race" which describes a race in San Pedro, Los Angeles between two hot rod cars, a Ford and a Mercury, which stay neck-and-neck until both are overtaken by "a kid in a hopped-up Model A".

title: Hot Rod Lincoln
text: "Hot Rod Lincoln" is sung from the perspective of this third driver, whose own hot rod is a Ford Model A body with a Lincoln-Zephyr V12 engine, overdrive, a four-barrel carburetor, 4:11 gear ratio, and safety tubes.

title: James A. Winnefeld Jr.
text: James Alexander "Sandy" Winnefeld Jr. (born April 24, 1956) is a retired(On Special Mission in Afghanistan).

title: James A. Winnefeld Jr.
text: United States Navy admiral who served as the ninth Vice Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff from August 4, 2011 to July 31, 2015.

title: James A. Winnefeld Jr.
text: He previously served as the fourth Commander, U.S. Northern Command (USNORTHCOM) and the 21st Commander, North American Aerospace Defense Command (NORAD) from May 19, 2010 to August 3, 2011.

title: James A. Winnefeld Jr.
text: Prior to that, Winnefeld served as Director for Strategic Plans and Policy, The Joint Staff which he concurrently served as the Senior Member, U.S. Delegation to the U.N. Military Staff Committee.

title: James A. Winnefeld Jr.
text: His other operational commands include serving as the Commander, U.S. Sixth Fleet and Commander, Allied Joint Command Lisbon.

title: James A. Winnefeld Jr.
text: As the Vice Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, Winnefeld was the second highest-ranking officer in the United States Armed Forces, second only to the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff.

title: James A. Winnefeld Jr.
text: In 2015, he retired from the Navy after over 37 years of service.

title: George W. Macfarlane
text: George Walter Hunter Macfarlane (March 1, 1849 – February 20, 1921) was a British businessman, courtier and politician of the Kingdom of Hawaii.

title: George W. Macfarlane
text: He served Colonel of the military staff of King Kalākaua, traveling with the monarch on his 1881 world tour.

title: George W. Macfarlane
text: He also served as his final chamberlain of king and was at his deathbed in 1891.

title: Muumuu
text: The muumuu or muʻ umuʻ u (] ) is a loose dress of Hawaiian origin that hangs from the shoulder.

title: Muumuu
text: Like the aloha shirt, muumuu exports are often brilliantly colored with floral patterns of generic Polynesian motifs.

title: Muumuu
text: Muumuus for local Hawaiian residents are more subdued in tone.

title: Muumuu
text: Muumuus are no longer as widely worn at work as the aloha shirt, but continue to be the preferred formal dress for weddings and festivals such as the Merrie Monarch hula competition.

title: Muumuu
text: Muumuus are also popular as maternity wear because they do not restrict the waist.

title: Corps of Military Staff Clerks
text: The Corps of Military Staff Clerks was an administrative corps of the Canadian Army.

title: Corps of Military Staff Clerks
text: The Headquarters Corps of Military Staff Clerks was established in 1905.

title: Aloha Dalire
text: Fabianne Pomaialoha Wong Dalire, known professionally as Aloha Dalire, (June 22, 1950 – August 6, 2014) was an American Hawaiian kumu hula, or master hula teacher.

title: Aloha Dalire
text: She won the first Miss Aloha Hula as Aloha Wong, in 1971, the same year that the Merrie Monarch Festival was established.

title: Aloha Dalire
text: The Miss Aloha Hula title is hula's top solo wahine (women's) honor.

title: Merrie Monarch Festival
text: The Merrie Monarch Festival is a week-long cultural festival that takes place annually in Hilo, Hawaii during the week after Easter.

title: Merrie Monarch Festival
text: It honors King David Kalākaua, who was called the "Merrie Monarch" for his patronage of the arts and is credited with restoring many Hawaiian cultural traditions during his reign, including the hula.

title: Merrie Monarch Festival
text: Many "hālau hula" (schools), including some from the U.S. mainland and some international performers, attend the festival each year to participate in exhibitions and competitions.

title: Merrie Monarch Festival
text: The festival has received worldwide attention and is considered the most prestigious of all hula contests.

title: Charles Hastings Judd
text: Colonel Charles Hastings Judd (September 8, 1835 – April 18, 1890) was an American businessman, rancher, courtier and politician of the Kingdom of Hawaii.

title: Charles Hastings Judd
text: He served as Chamberlain and Colonel of the military staff of King Kalākaua and traveled with the monarch on his 1881 world tour.

title: Staff (military)
text: A military staff (often referred to as general staff, army staff, navy staff, or air staff within the individual services) is a group of officers, enlisted and civilian personnel that are responsible for the administrative, operational and logistical needs of its unit.

title: Staff (military)
text: It provides bi-directional flow of information between a commanding officer and subordinate military units.

title: Staff (military)
text: A staff also provides an executive function where it filters information needed by the commander or shunts unnecessary information.

title: Ottoman Military College
text: The Ottoman Military College or Imperial Military Staff College or Ottoman Army War College (Ottoman Turkish: "Mekteb-i Erkân-ı Harbiyye-i Şâhâne"‎ or "Erkân-ı Harbiye Mektebi"), was a two-year military staff college of the Ottoman Empire.

title: Ottoman Military College
text: It was located in Istanbul.

title: Ottoman Military College
text: Its mission was to educate staff officers for the Ottoman Army.

title: Kalākaua
text: Kalākaua (November 16, 1836 – January 20, 1891), born David Laʻ amea Kamananakapu Mahinulani Naloiaehuokalani Lumialani Kalākaua and sometimes called The Merrie Monarch, was the last king (and second to last monarch) of the Kingdom of Hawaiʻ i.

title: Kalākaua
text: He reigned from February 12, 1874 until his death in San Francisco, California, on January 20, 1891.

title: Kalākaua
text: Kalākaua had a convivial personality and enjoyed entertaining guests with his singing and ukulele playing.

title: Kalākaua
text: At his coronation and his birthday jubilee, the hula that had been banned from public in the kingdom became a celebration of Hawaiian culture.

title: Patrick Corrigan (writer)
text: Patrick Corrigan is a US-based author and advocate for people with a mental illness, particularly in relation to the issue of stigma.

title: Patrick Corrigan (writer)
text: He has written more than ten books and more than 300 papers specialising in issues related to mental illness.

title: Patrick Corrigan (writer)
text: In 1998, Corrigan was added to the Who's Who of the World.

title: Patrick Corrigan (writer)
text: Corrigan resides in Northern Illinois.

title: Semyon Aranovich
text: Semyon Davidovich Aranovich (Ukrainian: Семён Аранович, 23 July 1934, Derazhnya, Ukraine, Soviet Union – 8 September 1996, Hamburg, Germany) was a Soviet and Russian film director.

title: Semyon Aranovich Gershgorin
text: Semyon Aronovich Gershgorin (August 24, 1901 – May 30, 1933) was a Soviet (born in Pruzhany, Belarus, Russian Empire) mathematician.

title: Semyon Aranovich Gershgorin
text: He began as a student at the Petrograd Technological Institute in 1923, became a Professor in 1930, and was given an appointment at the Leningrad Mechanical Engineering Institute in the same year.

title: Semyon Aranovich Gershgorin
text: His contributions include the Gershgorin circle theorem.

title: The Year of the Dog (film)
text: The Year of the Dog (Russian: Год собаки , "God sobaki " ) is a 1994 Russian drama film directed by Semyon Aranovich.

title: The Year of the Dog (film)
text: It was entered into the 44th Berlin International Film Festival where it won the Silver Bear for an outstanding artistic contribution.

title: Nerve of a covering
text: In topology, the nerve of an open covering is a construction of an abstract simplicial complex from an open covering of a topological space "X" that captures many of the interesting topological properties in an algorithmic or combinatorial way.

title: Nerve of a covering
text: It was introduced by Pavel Alexandrov.

title: Nerve of a covering
text: and now has many variants and generalisations, among them the Čech nerve of a cover, which in turn is generalised by hypercoverings.

title: Confrontation (TV series)
text: Confrontation or (Russian: Противостояние , "Protivostoyanie " ) is a 1985 Soviet six-part television film directed by Semyon Aranovich based on the novel by Yulian Semyonov.

title: Rafferty (1980 TV series)
text: Rafferty or (Russian: Рафферти , "Rafferty " ) is a Soviet 1980 drama television film directed by Semyon Aranovich and based on the novel by American writer Lionel White.

title: Pavel Urysohn
text: Pavel Samuilovich Urysohn (Па́вел Самуи́лович Урысо́н ) (February 3, 1898 – August 17, 1924) was a Soviet mathematician of Jewish origin who is best known for his contributions in dimension theory, and for developing Urysohn's Metrization Theorem and Urysohn's Lemma, both of which are fundamental results in topology.

title: Pavel Urysohn
text: His name is also commemorated in the terms Urysohn universal space, Fréchet–Urysohn space, Menger–Urysohn dimension and Urysohn integral equation.

title: Pavel Urysohn
text: He and Pavel Alexandrov formulated the modern definition of compactness in 1923.

title: Alexandroff extension
text: In the mathematical field of topology, the Alexandroff extension is a way to extend a noncompact topological space by adjoining a single point in such a way that the resulting space is compact.

title: Alexandroff extension
text: It is named for the Russian mathematician Pavel Alexandrov.

title: Gershgorin circle theorem
text: In mathematics, the Gershgorin circle theorem may be used to bound the spectrum of a square matrix.

title: Gershgorin circle theorem
text: It was first published by the Soviet mathematician Semyon Aronovich Gershgorin in 1931.

title: Gershgorin circle theorem
text: The spelling of S. A. Gershgorin's name has been transliterated in several different ways, including Geršgorin, Gerschgorin, Gershgorin, Hershhorn, and Hirschhorn.

title: Suicide Squad (film)
text: Pictures.

text: It is the third installment in the DC Extended Universe (DCEU).

text: In "Suicide Squad", a secret government agency led by Amanda Waller recruits imprisoned supervillains to execute dangerous black ops missions and save the world from a powerful threat, in exchange for reduced sentences.

title: Wonder Woman (2017 film)
text: "Wonder Woman" is the second live action theatrical film featuring the titular character, following her debut in 2016's "".

text: Jenkins's role as director makes her the first female director of a studio superhero comic book live-action theatrical release film.

title: Wonder Woman (2017 film)
text: The film tells the story of Princess Diana, who grows up on the Amazon island of Themyscira.

title: Wonder Woman (2017 film)
text: After American pilot Steve Trevor crashes offshore of the island and is rescued by her, he tells the Amazons about the ongoing World War.

title: Wonder Woman (2017 film)
text: Diana then leaves her home in order to end the conflict, becoming Wonder Woman in the process.

title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
text: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice is a 2016 American superhero film featuring the DC Comics characters Batman and Superman.

title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
text: Directed by Zack Snyder and distributed by Warner Bros.

title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
text: Pictures, the film is the second installment in the DC Extended Universe (DCEU) following 2013's "Man of Steel".
