text: It was written by Chris Terrio and David S. Goyer, and features an ensemble cast that includes Ben Affleck, Henry Cavill, Amy Adams, Jesse Eisenberg, Diane Lane, Laurence Fishburne, Jeremy Irons, Holly Hunter and Gal Gadot.

title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
text: "Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice" is the first live-action film to feature Batman and Superman together, as well as the first live-action cinematic portrayal of Wonder Woman, Aquaman, Flash and Cyborg.

title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
text: In the film, criminal mastermind Lex Luthor manipulates Batman into a preemptive battle with Superman, whom Luthor is obsessed with defeating.

title: Jared Leto
text: Jared Joseph Leto ( ; born December 26, 1971) is an American actor, singer, songwriter, and director.

title: Jared Leto
text: After starting his career with television appearances in the early 1990s, Leto achieved recognition for his role as Jordan Catalano on the television series "My So-Called Life" (1994).

title: Jared Leto
text: He made his film debut in "How to Make an American Quilt" (1995) and received critical praise for his performance in "Prefontaine" (1997).

title: Jared Leto
text: Leto played supporting roles in "The Thin Red Line" (1998), "Fight Club" (1999) and "American Psycho" (2000), as well as the lead role in "Urban Legend" (1998), and earned critical acclaim after portraying heroin addict Harry Goldfarb in "Requiem for a Dream" (2000).

title: Jared Leto
text: He later began focusing increasingly on his music career, returning to acting with "Panic Room" (2002), "Alexander" (2004), "Lord of War" (2005), "Lonely Hearts" (2006), "Chapter 27" (2007), and "Mr. Nobody" (2009).

title: Jared Leto
text: In 2012, he directed the documentary film "Artifact".

title: Jared Leto
text: In 2016, he played the DC Comics supervillain Joker in the DC Extended Universe film "Suicide Squad".

title: Arrowverse
text: The Arrowverse is a shared fictional universe that is centered on television series airing on The CW, developed by Greg Berlanti, Marc Guggenheim, Andrew Kreisberg, Phil Klemmer, and Geoff Johns, based on characters appearing in publications by DC Comics.

title: Arrowverse
text: The shared universe, much like the DC Universe in comic books or the cinematic DC Extended Universe, was established by crossing over common plot elements, settings, cast, and characters.

title: Arrowverse
text: The Arrowverse stars Stephen Amell as Oliver Queen / Green Arrow, Grant Gustin as Barry Allen / Flash, Megalyn Echikunwoke as Mari Jiwe McCabe / Vixen, with an ensemble cast leading "Legends of Tomorrow", including Arthur Darvill as Rip Hunter, Caity Lotz as Sara Lance / White Canary, Brandon Routh as Ray Palmer / Atom, Dominic Purcell as Mick Rory / Heat Wave, with Victor Garber and Franz Drameh as Martin Stein & Jefferson "Jax" Jackson / Firestorm.

title: Arrowverse
text: Russell Tovey stars as Ray Terrill / The Ray.

title: List of DC Extended Universe cast members
text: The DC Extended Universe is a media franchise and shared fictional universe that is the setting of superhero films independently produced by Warner Bros., based on characters that appear in DC Comics publications.

title: DC Extended Universe
text: The Justice League Universe (JLUDCEUUJLDCE), more commonly known by its unofficial name as the DC Extended Universe (DCEU), is an American media franchise and shared universe, centered on a series of superhero films distributed by Warner Bros.

title: DC Extended Universe
text: Pictures, based on characters that appear in publications by DC Comics.

title: DC Extended Universe
text: The shared universe, much like the original DC Universe in comic books, was established by crossing over common plot elements, settings, cast, and characters.

title: DC Extended Universe
text: The films have been in production since 2011 and in that time Warner Bros. has distributed four films with more than ten in various stages of production.

title: DC Extended Universe
text: The series has grossed over $3.1 billion at the global box office, currently making it the seventeenth highest-grossing film franchise.

K. Simmons.

text: In "Justice League", Batman and Wonder Woman assemble a team consisting of Flash, Aquaman, and Cyborg to face the catastrophic threat of Steppenwolf and his army of Parademons.

text: Man of Steel is a 2013 superhero film featuring the DC Comics character Superman.

text: It is a British-American venture produced by Legendary Pictures, DC Entertainment, Syncopy Inc., and Cruel and Unusual Films, and distributed by Warner Bros.

title: Man of Steel (film)
text: Pictures.

title: Man of Steel (film)
text: It is the first installment in the DC Extended Universe (DCEU).

text: The film is directed by Zack Snyder, written by David S. Goyer, and stars Henry Cavill, Amy Adams, Michael Shannon, Kevin Costner, Diane Lane, Laurence Fishburne, Antje Traue, Ayelet Zurer, Christopher Meloni, and Russell Crowe.

title: Man of Steel (film)
text: "Man of Steel" is a reboot of the "Superman" film series that retells the character's origin story.

title: Man of Steel (film)
text: In the film, Clark Kent learns that he is a superpowered alien from the planet Krypton and assumes the role of mankind's protector as Superman, but finds himself having to prevent General Zod from destroying humanity.

title: French battleship Paris
text: Paris was the third ship of the "Courbet"-class battleship s, the first dreadnoughts built for the French Navy.

title: French battleship Paris
text: She was completed before World War I as part of the 1911 naval building programme.

title: French battleship Paris
text: She spent the war in the Mediterranean, spending most of 1914 providing gunfire support for the Montenegrin Army until her sister ship "Jean Bart" was torpedoed by the submarine "U-12" on 21 December.

title: French battleship Paris
text: She spent the rest of the war providing cover for the Otranto Barrage that blockaded the Austro-Hungarian Navy in the Adriatic Sea.

title: USS New Jersey (BB-62)
text: USS "New Jersey" (BB-62) ("Big J" or "Black Dragon") is an "Iowa"-class battleship , and was the second ship of the United States Navy to be named after the US state of New Jersey.

title: USS New Jersey (BB-62)
text: "New Jersey" earned more battle stars for combat actions than the other three completed "Iowa"-class battleships, and was the only US battleship providing gunfire support during the Vietnam War.

title: Tonkin Gulf Yacht Club
text: Tonkin Gulf Yacht Club was a tongue-in-cheek nickname for the United States Seventh Fleet during the Vietnam War.

title: Tonkin Gulf Yacht Club
text: All through the war in Vietnam, the Seventh Fleet engaged in combat operations against enemy forces through attack carrier air strikes, naval gunfire support, amphibious operations, patrol and reconnaissance operations and mine warfare.

title: Operation Market Time
text: Operation Market Time was the United States Navy and South Vietnam’s successful effort begun in 1965 to stop the flow of troops, war material, and supplies by sea, coast, and rivers, from North Vietnam into parts of South Vietnam during the Vietnam War.

title: Operation Market Time
text: Also participating in Operation Market Time were United States Coast Guard Squadron One and Squadron Three.

title: Operation Market Time
text: The Coast Guard provided heavily armed 82 ft patrol boats and large cutters that included 5" cannons used in battle and gunfire support.

title: French battleship Jean Bart (1911)
text: Jean Bart was the second ship of the "Courbet"-class battleship s, the first dreadnoughts built for the French Navy.

title: French battleship Jean Bart (1911)
text: She was completed before World War I as part of the 1910 naval building programme.

title: French battleship Jean Bart (1911)
text: She spent the war in the Mediterranean and helped to sink the Austro-Hungarian protected cruiser "Zenta" on 16 August 1914.

title: French battleship Jean Bart (1911)
text: She spent most of the rest of 1914 providing gunfire support for the Montenegrin Army until she was torpedoed by the submarine "U-12" on 21 December.

title: French battleship Jean Bart (1911)
text: Even with three compartments flooded, she was able to steam to Malta on her own for repairs that required three and a half months.

title: French battleship Jean Bart (1911)
text: Upon her return she spent the remainder of the war participating in the Otranto Barrage, in the Adriatic.

title: Naval gunfire support
text: Naval gunfire support (NGFS) (also known as shore bombardment) is the use of naval artillery to provide fire support for amphibious assault and other troops operating within their range.

title: Naval gunfire support
text: NGFS is one of a number of disciplines encompassed by the term "Naval Fires".

title: Naval gunfire support
text: Modern naval gunfire support is one of the three main components of amphibious warfare assault operations support, along with aircraft and ship-launched land-attack missiles. Shipborne guns have been used against shore defences since the early days of naval warfare.

title: List of battleships of Italy
text: Starting in the 1890s, the Italian "Regia Marina" (Royal Navy) began building a series of modern battleships.

title: List of battleships of Italy
text: Early designs were marked by their small size, light armor, and high speed compared to contemporary foreign counterparts.

title: List of battleships of Italy
text: The first pre-dreadnought battleship design, the "Ammiraglio di Saint Bon" class , was constrained by budgetary limits imposed by the legislature.

title: List of battleships of Italy
text: Two ships were ordered by the class's namesake, Admiral Simone de Pacoret Saint Bon, though the design was also influenced by Benedetto Brin, who replaced di Saint Bon as naval minister after his death.

title: List of battleships of Italy
text: Brin designed the next pair of battleships, the "Regina Margherita" class .

title: List of battleships of Italy
text: These ships were larger than the preceding class, and were intended to challenge the Austro-Hungarian "Habsburg"-class battleship s then under construction.

title: List of battleships of Italy
text: Brin himself died during the construction process.

title: List of battleships of Italy
text: Vittorio Cuniberti designed the next class of small pre-dreadnoughts, the "Regina Elena" class , which were the fastest battleships in the world at the time of their completion.

title: List of battleships of Italy
text: These ships all served in the Italo-Turkish War of 1911–12, where they were primarily used to provide naval gunfire support for the Italian ground troops, as the Ottoman Navy largely confined itself to port.

title: Soviet cruiser Kirov
text: Kirov (Russian: Киров ; ] ) was a Project 26 "Kirov"-class cruiser of the Soviet Navy that served during the Winter War, World War II and into the Cold War.

title: Soviet cruiser Kirov
text: She attempted to bombard Finnish coast defense guns during action in the Winter War, but was driven off by a number of near misses that damaged her.

title: Soviet cruiser Kirov
text: She led the Evacuation of Tallinn at the end of August 1941, before being blockaded in Leningrad where she could only provide gunfire support during the Siege of Leningrad.

title: Soviet cruiser Kirov
text: She bombarded Finnish positions during the Vyborg–Petrozavodsk Offensive in mid-1944, but played no further part in the war.

title: Soviet cruiser Kirov
text: "Kirov" was reclassified as a training cruiser on 2 August 1961 and sold for scrap on 22 February 1974.

title: United States naval gunfire support debate
text: The United States naval gunfire support debate is an ongoing debate among the United States Navy, Marine Corps, Congress, and independent groups like the "United States Naval Gunfire Support Association" over what role naval gunfire support and naval surface fire support (NSFS) should play within the navy and how such a role can best be provided.

title: United States naval gunfire support debate
text: At the heart of the issue is the role that naval gunfire support—the use of naval artillery to provide fire support for amphibious assault and other troops operating within their range—should play in the U.S. Navy of the 21st century.

title: USS Trippe (FF-1075)
text: USS "Trippe" (FF-1075) was a "Knox"-class frigate of the US Navy, built at Westwego, Louisiana, was commissioned in mid-September 1970.

title: USS Trippe (FF-1075)
text: In July 1971, following shakedown training in the Caribbean area and a surveillance mission off Haiti, she entered the Boston Naval Shipyard for overhaul and installation of the Basic Point Defense Missile System, which featured short-range "Sea Sparrow" guided missiles in an eight-round launcher on her afterdeck.

title: USS Trippe (FF-1075)
text: "Trippe" was the Navy's first destroyer-type ship to receive this later-widespread contribution to shipboard protection against air and missile attack.

title: USS Trippe (FF-1075)
text: The first months of 1972 were spent testing her new weapons and participating in exercises.

title: USS Trippe (FF-1075)
text: In June the ship passed through the Panama Canal en route to Southeast Asian waters, where she provided Vietnam War aircraft carrier escort and naval gunfire support services during July and August.

title: USS Trippe (FF-1075)
text: "Trippe" then went to the Indian Ocean and Persian Gulf areas, visiting many ports in a region that would see increasing U.S. Navy activity in the coming decades.

title: USS Trippe (FF-1075)
text: She returned to the U.S. East Coast in December 1972, after a deployment that had taken her completely around the World.

title: Nagesh Bhonsle
text: Nagesh Bhosle (also Nagesh Bhonsle or Nagesh Bhosale) is an award-winning Indian film, television and theatre actor.

title: Nagesh Bhonsle
text: He has recently worked on a Hollywood film called 'Hotel Mumbai' alongside Jason Isaacs, Armie Hammer and Dev Patel.

title: Nagesh Bhonsle
text: Nagesh has acted in more than a hundred Indian films and thousands of episodes in Television shows.

title: Nagesh Bhonsle
text: After completing endless projects in the Hindi, Marathi and Telugu language fraternity as an actor, he ventured into Directing and Producing.

title: Nagesh Bhonsle
text: He has successfully made 6 films so far, as a Director.

title: Nagesh Bhonsle
text: In 2009, his debut film 'Goshta Choti Dongraevadhi' (English title: A story as small as a mountain) was highly appreciated by the critics and audiences at the time.

title: Nagesh Bhonsle
text: Nagesh's films are enthralling and speak of the contemporary issues in India.

title: Nagesh Bhonsle
text: Ajna Motion Picture's first film "Panhala" (2015), directed and produced by Nagesh, is critically acclaimed, won many awards and featured at domestic and foreign film festivals including the 25th Golden Rooster in China.

title: Nagesh Bhonsle
text: His current film "Nati Khel" which is to release in cinemas in 2017 was invited to be screened at the PAMLA conference in Los Angeles, California and open for dialogue between the filmmakers and the scholarly patrons of PAMLA.

title: Nagesh Bhonsle
text: It has also won a special award at the Wuhan International Art Film Festival, in China, December 2016.

title: Nagesh Bhonsle
text: in 2017, it has been an official selection at Pune International Film Festival, Bodhisattva International Film Festival and Orange City International Film Festival.

title: The Polar Bears
text: The Polar Bears is a 2012 3D computer animated short film presented by The Coca-Cola Company, produced by Ridley Scott, written by David Reynolds, and directed by John Stevenson.

title: The Polar Bears
text: The film features the voices of Lin-Manuel Miranda, Armie Hammer, Jonathan Adams, and Megyn Price.

title: The Polar Bears
text: The film is based on Coca-Cola's iconic polar bears and was released on the company's website and YouTube channel on December 31, 2012.

title: Ian Stirling (biologist)
text: Ian Grote Stirling {'1': ", '2': ", '3': ", '4': "} (born September 26, 1941) is a research scientist emeritus with Environment and Climate Change Canada and an adjunct professor in the University of Alberta Department of Biological Sciences.

title: Ian Stirling (biologist)
text: His research has focused mostly on Arctic and Antarctic zoology and ecology, and he is one of the world's top authorities on polar bears. Stirling has written five books and more than 150 articles published in peer-reviewed scientific journals.

title: Ian Stirling (biologist)
text: He has written and spoken extensively about the danger posed to polar bears by global warming.

title: Cheech Marin
text: Richard Anthony "Cheech" Marin (born July 13, 1946) is an American stand-up comedian, actor, voice actor, writer and activist who gained recognition as part of the comedy act Cheech & Chong during the 1970s and early 1980s with Tommy Chong and as Don Johnson's partner, Insp. Joe Dominguez, on "Nash Bridges".

title: Cheech Marin
text: He has also voiced characters in several Disney productions, including "Oliver & Company", "The Lion King", "Cars", "Cars 2", "Cars 3" and "Beverly Hills Chihuahua".

title: Cars 3
text: Cars 3 is a 2017 American 3D computer-animated auto racing sports comedy adventure film produced by Pixar and released by Walt Disney Pictures.

title: Cars 3
text: Directed by Brian Fee, the screenplay was written by Kiel Murray, Bob Peterson and Mike Rich.

title: Cars 3
text: The film is a sequel to "Cars" and a stand-alone sequel to "Cars 2".

title: Cars 3
text: The returning voices of Owen Wilson, Bonnie Hunt and Larry the Cable Guy are joined by Cristela Alonzo, Chris Cooper, Armie Hammer, Nathan Fillion, Kerry Washington and Lea DeLaria, in addition to a dozen NASCAR personalities.

title: Cars 3
text: In the film, Lightning McQueen sets out to prove to a new generation of high tech race cars that he is still the best race car in the world.

title: Armie Hammer
text: Armand Douglas "Armie" Hammer (born August 28, 1986) is an American actor.

title: Armie Hammer
text: He is known for his portrayal of the Winklevoss twins in the film "The Social Network" (2010), Prince Andrew Alcott in "Mirror Mirror" (2012), the title character in the adventure film "The Lone Ranger" (2013), Mike in "Mine" (2016), and the voice role of Jackson Storm in 2017's Disney-Pixar Film "Cars 3".

title: Armie Hammer
text: He played the role of Illya Kuryakin in "The Man from U.N.C.L.E." (2015), and stars as Oliver in the 2017 romance drama "Call Me by Your Name".

title: Armie Hammer
text: For his portrayal of Clyde Tolson in "J. Edgar" (2011), he was nominated for a Screen Actors Guild Award.

title: Wapusk National Park
text: Wapusk National Park is Canada's 37th national park, established in 1996.

title: Wapusk National Park
text: The park is located in the Hudson Plains ecozone, 45 km south of Churchill in north-east Manitoba, Canada, on the shores of Hudson Bay.

title: Wapusk National Park
text: Access to the park is limited due to its remote location and an effort to preserve the park.

title: Wapusk National Park
text: The name comes from the Cree word for polar bear ("wâpask").

title: Wapusk National Park
text: The Park is also home to Cape Churchill, which is renowned as the best location in the world to view and photograph wild polar bears.

title: Wapusk National Park
text: The only way people can access Cape Churchill is by helicopter or Tundra Buggy.

title: Kermode bear
text: The Kermode bear ("Ursus americanus kermodei"), also known as the "spirit bear" (particularly in British Columbia), is a rare subspecies of the American black bear living in the Central and North Coast regions of British Columbia, Canada.

title: Kermode bear
text: It is the official provincial mammal of British Columbia.

title: Kermode bear
text: It is noted for about one-tenth of its population having white or cream-coloured coats like polar bears.

title: Kermode bear
text: This colour is due to a double recessive gene unique in the subspecies.

title: Kermode bear
text: They are not albinos and not any more related to polar bears or the "blonde" brown bears of Alaska's "ABC Islands" than other members of their species.

title: Kermode bear
text: Sometimes, a mother black bear can have a white cub.

title: The Lone Ranger (2013 film)
text: The Lone Ranger is a 2013 American western action film directed by Gore Verbinski from a screenplay written by Justin Haythe, Ted Elliott and Terry Rossio.

title: The Lone Ranger (2013 film)
text: Based on the radio series of the same name, the film stars Johnny Depp as Tonto, the narrator of the events, and Armie Hammer as John Reid, the Lone Ranger.

title: The Lone Ranger (2013 film)
text: It relates Tonto's memories of the duo's earliest efforts to subdue local villainy and bring justice to the American Old West.

title: The Lone Ranger (2013 film)
text: William Fichtner, Barry Pepper, Ruth Wilson, James Badge Dale, Tom Wilkinson and Helena Bonham Carter also are featured in supporting roles.

title: The Lone Ranger (2013 film)
text: It is the first theatrical film featuring the Lone Ranger and Tonto characters in more than 32 years.

title: Beatitude (album)
text: Beatitude is the debut album released by Ric Ocasek, lead singer and principal songwriter of The Cars.

title: Beatitude (album)
text: It was released by Geffen Records in 1982.

title: Beatitude (album)
text: It features Greg Hawkes of The Cars on keyboards, as well as Jules Shear and Stephen Hague from Jules and the Polar Bears.

title: Francis H. Kimball
text: Francis Hatch Kimball (1845–1919) was an American architect practicing in New York City, best known for his work on skyscrapers in lower Manhattan and terra-cotta ornamentation.

title: Francis H. Kimball
text: He was an associate with the firm Kimball & Thompson.

title: Francis H. Kimball
text: His work includes the Empire Building, Manhattan Life Insurance Building, and Casino Theatre (Broadway).

title: Francis H. Kimball
text: All but one of Kimball's work was in the United States.

title: New York Life Building
text: The New York Life Insurance Building, New York, located at 51 Madison Avenue, Manhattan, New York City, across from Madison Square Park, is the headquarters of the New York Life Insurance Company.

title: Manhattan Life Insurance Building
text: The Manhattan Life Insurance Building was a 348 ft tower at 64-66 Broadway in New York City completed in 1894 to the designs of the architects of Kimball & Thompson and slightly extended north in 1904 making its new address 64-70 Broadway.

title: Manhattan Life Insurance Building
text: It was the first skyscraper to pass 100 m in Manhattan.

title: Physicians Mutual
text: Physicians Mutual is a privately held insurance company headquartered in Omaha, Nebraska, United States, that consists of Physicians Mutual Insurance Company and Physicians Life Insurance Company.

title: Physicians Mutual
text: Founded as Physicians Mutual Insurance Company in 1902 by Edwin E. Elliott, Physicians Mutual began by selling health insurance to medical professionals.

title: Physicians Mutual
text: Policies were offered to the general public starting in 1962, and by 1970 the company expanded into life insurance when it founded Physicians Life Insurance Company.

title: Physicians Mutual
text: Today the company offers a variety of insurance products, annuities, Medicare, Medigap, Medicare Supplement, Term Life Insurance, Whole Life Insurance, Cancer and funeral pre-planning services.

title: Physicians Mutual
text: It holds over US$3 billion in assets and employs over one thousand people.

title: Physicians Mutual
text: Robert A. Reed is chief executive officer and president.

title: Flatiron Building
text: The Flatiron Building, originally the Fuller Building, is a triangular 22-story steel-framed landmarked building located at 175 Fifth Avenue in the borough of Manhattan, New York City, and is considered to be a groundbreaking skyscraper.

title: Flatiron Building
text: Upon completion in 1902, it was one of the tallest buildings in the city at 20 floors high and one of only two skyscrapers north of 14th Street – the other being the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company Tower, one block east.

title: Flatiron Building
text: The building sits on a triangular block formed by Fifth Avenue, Broadway, and East 22nd Street, with 23rd Street grazing the triangle's northern (uptown) peak.

title: Flatiron Building
text: As with numerous other wedge-shaped buildings, the name "Flatiron" derives from its resemblance to a cast-iron clothes iron.

title: Manhattan Life Insurance Company
text: Manhattan Life Insurance Company, incorporated on May 29, 1850, is a life insurance company domiciled in New York but operates as a subsidiary of Manhattan Life Group in Houston, Texas.

title: Whole life insurance
text: Whole life insurance, or whole of life assurance (in the Commonwealth of Nations), sometimes called "straight life" or "ordinary life," is a life insurance policy which is guaranteed to remain in force for the insured's entire lifetime, provided required premiums are paid, or to the maturity date.

title: Whole life insurance
text: As a life insurance policy it represents a contract between the insured and insurer that as long as the contract terms are met, the insurer will pay the death benefit of the policy to the policy's beneficiaries when the insured dies.

title: Whole life insurance
text: Because whole life policies are guaranteed to remain in force as long as the required premiums are paid, the premiums are typically much higher than those of term life insurance where the premium is fixed only for a limited term.

title: Whole life insurance
text: Whole life premiums are fixed, based on the age of issue, and usually do not increase with age.

title: Whole life insurance
text: The insured party normally pays premiums until death, except for limited pay policies which may be paid-up in 10 years, 20 years, or at age 65.

title: Whole life insurance
text: Whole life insurance belongs to the cash value category of life insurance, which also includes universal life, variable life, and endowment policies.

title: Supreme Life Building
text: The Supreme Life Building is a historic insurance building located at 3501 S. Dr. Martin Luther King Drive in the Douglas community area of Chicago, Illinois.

title: Supreme Life Building
text: Built in 1921, the building served as the headquarters of the Supreme Life Insurance Company, which was founded two years earlier.

title: Supreme Life Building
text: The company, originally known as the Liberty Life Insurance Company, was the first African-American owned insurance company in the northern United States.

title: Supreme Life Building
text: Since white-owned insurance firms regularly denied black customers life insurance when the firm was founded, the firm played an important role in providing life insurance to Chicago's African-American community.

title: Supreme Life Building
text: The company ultimately became the largest African-American owned business in the northern states and became a symbol of the predominantly black Bronzeville neighborhood's economic success from the 1920s to the 1950s.

title: 712 Fifth Avenue
text: 712 5th Avenue is a 650 ft skyscraper at 56th Street and Fifth Avenue in the Midtown neighborhood of Manhattan, New York City.

title: 712 Fifth Avenue
text: It was constructed from 1990 to 1991 and is the 53rd tallest building in New York City.

title: 712 Fifth Avenue
text: The tower's design had to accommodate the landmarked facades of the Coty and Rizzoli Buildings at the base of the tower.

title: 712 Fifth Avenue
text: It was purchased by the Bannister Trust in 2007 in a "Private Treaty", and placed in "Property Fund #1" managed by JP Morgan.

title: 712 Fifth Avenue
text: The building is sometimes referred to as the Henri Bendel building.

title: New York Life Insurance Building (Montreal)
text: Montreal's New York Life Insurance Building (also known as the Quebec Bank Building) is an office building at Place d'Armes in what is now known as Old Montreal, erected in 1887-1889.

title: New York Life Insurance Building (Montreal)
text: At the time of its completion, it was the tallest commercial building in Montreal with the first eight floors were designed for retail office space, that quickly filled with the city's best lawyers and financiers.

title: New York Life Insurance Building (Montreal)
text: When the clock tower was completed, the owner filled the ninth and tenth floors with the largest legal library in the entire country as a gift to tenants.

title: New York Life Insurance Building (Montreal)
text: The building is next to another historic office tower, Aldred Building.

title: Tom Caplen
text: Tom Caplen (23 November 1879 – 17 April 1945) was an English cricketer who played for Kent County Cricket Club and Cornwall County Cricket Club.

title: Tom Caplen
text: He was a right-handed batsman and a right-arm fast bowler.

title: Doug Bollinger
text: Douglas Erwin Bollinger (born 24 July 1981) is a professional Australian cricketer.

title: Doug Bollinger
text: He has played first-class cricket for the New South Wales cricket team and international cricket for Australia.

title: Doug Bollinger
text: He is a left-handed batsman and a left-arm fast bowler.

title: Doug Bollinger
text: Bollinger has played for Worcestershire County Cricket Club and Kent County Cricket Club in England, for the Chennai Super Kings in the Indian Premier League and for Hobart Hurricanes, Sydney Thunder and Sydney Sixers in domestic T20 competition.

title: Kent County Cricket Club in 2013
text: In 2013, Kent County Cricket Club competed in Division Two of the County Championship, Group A of the 40-over Yorkshire Bank 40 and the South Group of the Friends Life t20.

title: Kent County Cricket Club in 2013
text: Kent also hosted a first-class match at the St Lawrence Ground against Cardiff MCCU at the start of the season and a T20 match against the touring New Zealanders in June.

title: Kent County Cricket Club in 2013
text: It was the second season in charge for head coach Jimmy Adams.

title: Kent County Cricket Club in 2013
text: The club captain was England spinner James Tredwell, taking over from Rob Key who had been club captain since 2006.

title: Kent County Cricket Club in 2013
text: Brendan Nash registered as a Kolpak player, ending his West Indies international career, which allowed Kent to sign another overseas player.

title: Kent County Cricket Club in 2013
text: South African fast bowler Vernon Philander filled this role, although he was only with the club for a short spell in July.

title: Kent County Cricket Club in 2013
text: Another new addition to the squad was 22-year-old Calum Haggett from Somerset.

title: Kent County Cricket Club in 2013
text: Shortly before the end of the season, Kent signed two young fast bowlers: Charlie Hartley and Matt Hunn (Matt Hunn made his debut in the final county championship match of 2013).

title: Kent County Cricket Club in 2013
text: In addition, Mitchell Claydon joined on loan from Durham on 11 June initially for one month, but this was extended for a second month (he later signed on a permanent basis for 2014).

title: David Griffiths (cricketer)
text: David Andrew Griffiths (born 10 September 1985) is an English professional cricketer who most recently played for Kent County Cricket Club.

title: David Griffiths (cricketer)
text: He is a right arm fast bowler who bats left-handed.

title: David Griffiths (cricketer)
text: Before signing for Kent in 2014, Griffiths had previously played for Hampshire and represented England at under-19 level.

title: David Griffiths (cricketer)
text: Griffiths' contract with Kent expired at the end of the 2016 and was not renewed by the county.

title: List of Kent County Cricket Club captains
text: This is a list of Kent County Cricket Club captains.

title: List of Kent County Cricket Club captains
text: Kent County Cricket Club was formed in 1842 and has played in the County Championship since its inception in 1890 and in List A cricket and Twenty20 cricket.

title: List of Kent County Cricket Club captains
text: The first match in which Kent have a named captain indicated on scorecards available occurred on 26–27 June 1856 when the county played MCC at Gravesend.

title: List of Kent County Cricket Club captains
text: South Norton captained the county on that occasion and throughout the period until 1870.

title: List of Kent County Cricket Club captains
text: The first official captain of the club was Lord Harris, an influential figure in the development of Kent and English cricket, who was appointed to the role in 1875.

title: List of Kent County Cricket Club captains
text: As of 2017 the current club captain is batsman Sam Northeast who was appointed at the end of September 2015.

title: Kent County Cricket Club in 2010
text: Kent also hosted three-day first-class matches at the St Lawrence Ground against Loughborough MCCU and the touring Pakistanis.

title: Kent County Cricket Club in 2010
text: Kent's overseas players were South African fast bowler Makhaya Ntini until late May, and Sri Lankan leg-spinner Malinga Bandara for the rest of the season.

title: Arthur Fielder
text: Arthur Fielder (19 July 1877 – 30 August 1949) was an English professional cricketer who played as a fast bowler for Kent County Cricket Club and the England cricket team between 1900 and 1914.

title: Arthur Fielder
text: He played a major role in Kent's four County Championship wins in the years before World War I and toured Australia twice with the England team making six Test match appearances.

title: Arthur Fielder
text: He was chosen as one of Wisden's Cricketers of the Year in 1907.

title: Jack Mason
text: John Richard Mason (26 March 1874 – 15 October 1958), known as Jack Mason, was an English amateur cricketer who played for England in five Test matches on A.E. Stoddart's 1897–98 tour of Australia.

title: Jack Mason
text: A right-hand bat and right-arm fast-medium pace bowler, Mason played county cricket for Kent County Cricket Club between 1893 and 1914, captaining the side between 1898 and 1902.

title: Jack Mason
text: With a height over six feet, and an attractive, elegantly straight play with the bat, Mason was considered "one of the finest amateur allrounders to play for Kent".

title: Jack Mason
text: Mason was chosen as one of Wisden's five Cricketers of the Year in 1898.

title: Wayne Parnell
text: Wayne Dillon Parnell (born 30 July 1989) is a South African cricketer who plays Test cricket, One Day International cricket and Twenty20 matches for South Africa.

title: Wayne Parnell
text: At the domestic level he plays for Cape Cobras, having previously played for the Warriors and Eastern Province.

title: Wayne Parnell
text: He has also played county cricket for Kent County Cricket Club, Sussex County Cricket Club and Glamorgan County Cricket Club in English county cricket, for the Delhi Daredevils and Pune Warriors in the Indian Premier League and for Barbados Tridents in the Caribbean Premier League.

title: Kent County Cricket Club in 2011
text: In 2011, Kent County Cricket Club competed in Division Two of the County Championship, Group A of the 40-over Clydesdale Bank 40 and the South Group of the Friends Life t20.

text: Kent also hosted a Twenty20 match at the St Lawrence Ground against the touring Indians, and a three-day first-class MCC Universities match against Loughborough MCCU, also at the St Lawrence Ground.

title: Kent County Cricket Club in 2011
text: It was the second and final season in charge for Director of Cricket Paul Farbrace.
