text: In 2008, THANS supported Bill 81, which they hoped would become the Domestic Violence Elimination Act, but Minister of Justice Cecil Clarke chose not to call the bill for a third reading.

title: Transition House Association of Nova Scotia
text: In 2009, Darrell Dexter of the New Democratic Party identified THANS in his promise to increase government funding of halfway houses in Nova Scotia.

title: Transition House Association of Nova Scotia
text: In 2012, THANS partnered with the World YWCA, Family SOS, Silent Witness Nova Scotia, and Leave Out Violence to host the Atlantic Ballet Theatre of Canada's "Ghosts of Violence", a ballet about domestic violence, in Halifax.

title: List of magazines in Portugal
text: Magazines in Portugal are mostly women's magazines, society magazines and TV magazines.

title: List of magazines in Portugal
text: In 1994 there were nearly 984 magazines in the country.

title: Customer magazine
text: A customer magazine is a magazine produced by a business as a means of communicating to its customers.

title: Customer magazine
text: It is a branch of custom media, a product that broadly shares the look and feel of a newsstand or consumer magazine but is paid for in part or whole by a business.

title: Customer magazine
text: Rather than copy sales and advertising, the primary goal of a customer magazine is to achieve a particular business objective.

title: Customer magazine
text: This could be for a firm to cross- or up-sell, change brand perception or engender loyalty.

title: Customer magazine
text: In-flight magazines, sponsored by airlines, were among the first customer magazines, and remain typical of the genre.

title: Customer magazine
text: In the UK, every supermarket chain now provides a customer magazine to promote its products through recipes and other food editorial.

title: Customer magazine
text: Many prominent digitally-native companies, like WebMD and Net-À-Portér, have released customer magazines of their own.

title: Customer magazine
text: Some customer magazines carry advertising; this is often seen as a useful way to offset the cost but equally can have some benefit in making the product look more like a regular magazine.

title: Eugène Minkowski
text: Eugène (Eugeniusz) Minkowski (] ; 17 April 1885 – 17 November 1972) was a French psychiatrist of Jewish Polish origin, known for his incorporation of phenomenology into psychopathology and for exploring the notion of "lived time".

title: Eugène Minkowski
text: A student of Eugen Bleuler, he was also associated with the work of Ludwig Binswanger and Henri Ey.

title: Eugène Minkowski
text: He was influenced by the philosophy of Henri Bergson and by the phenomenologists Edmund Husserl and Max Scheler.

title: Eugène Minkowski
text: He was a prolific author in several languages and regarded as a great humanitarian.

title: Time and Free Will
text: Time and Free Will: An Essay on the Immediate Data of Consciousness (French: "Essai sur les données immédiates de la conscience") is Henri Bergson's doctoral thesis, first published in 1889.

title: Time and Free Will
text: The essay deals with the problem of free will, which Bergson contends is merely a common confusion among philosophers caused by an illegitimate translation of the unextended into the extended, as a means of introducing his theory of duration, which would become highly influential among continental philosophers in the following century.

title: Moina Mathers
text: Moina Mathers, born Mina Bergson (28 February 1865 – 25 July 1928), was an artist and occultist at the turn of the 20th century.

title: Moina Mathers
text: She was the sister of French philosopher Henri Bergson, the first man of Jewish descent to be awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1927.

title: Moina Mathers
text: She is, however, more known for her marriage to the English occultist, Samuel Liddell MacGregor Mathers, one of the founders of the organisation Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn and, after his death in 1918, for being the head of a successor organisation, called the Rosicrucian Order of the Alpha et Omega.

title: 2011 Pulitzer Prize
text: The 2011 Pulitzer Prizes were announced on Monday, April 18, 2011. "

title: 2011 Pulitzer Prize
text: The Los Angeles Times" won two prizes, including the highest honor for Public Service. "

title: 2011 Pulitzer Prize
text: The New York Times" also won two awards.

title: 2011 Pulitzer Prize
text: No prize was handed out in the Breaking News category. "

title: 2011 Pulitzer Prize
text: The Wall Street Journal" won an award for the first time since 2007.

title: 2011 Pulitzer Prize
text: Jennifer Egan's "A Visit From the Goon Squad" picked up the Fiction prize after already winning the 2010 National Book Critics Circle Award.

title: 2011 Pulitzer Prize
text: Photographer Carol Guzy of "The Washington Post" became the first journalist to win four Pulitzer Prizes.

title: Livingston Award
text: The Livingston Awards at the University of Michigan are American journalism awards issued to media professionals under the age of 35 for local, national, and international reporting.

title: Livingston Award
text: They are the largest, all-media, general reporting prizes in America.

title: Livingston Award
text: Popularly referred to as the "Pulitzer for the Young", the awards have recognized the early talent of journalists, including Michele Norris, Christiane Amanpour, David Remnick, Ira Glass, J. R. Moehringer, Thomas Friedman, Rick Atkinson, David Isay, Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy, Tom Ashbrook, Nicholas Confessore, C. J. Chivers and Charles Sennot.

title: Introduction to Metaphysics (Bergson)
text: "Introduction to Metaphysics" (French: ""Introduction à la Métaphysique"") is a 1903 essay about the concept of reality by Henri Bergson.

title: Introduction to Metaphysics (Bergson)
text: For Bergson, reality occurs not in a series of discrete states but as a process similar to that described by process philosophy or the Greek philosopher Heraclitus.

title: Introduction to Metaphysics (Bergson)
text: Reality is fluid and cannot be completely understood through reductionistic analysis, which he said "implies that we go around an object", gaining knowledge from various perspectives which are relative.

title: Introduction to Metaphysics (Bergson)
text: Instead, reality can be grasped absolutely only through intuition, which Bergson expressed as "entering into" the object.

title: Duration (philosophy)
text: Duration (French: "la durée") is a theory of time and consciousness posited by the French philosopher Henri Bergson.

title: Duration (philosophy)
text: Bergson sought to improve upon inadequacies he perceived in the philosophy of Herbert Spencer, due, he believed, to Spencer's lack of comprehension of mechanics, which led Bergson to the conclusion that time eluded mathematics and science.

title: Duration (philosophy)
text: Bergson became aware that the moment one attempted to measure a moment, it would be gone: one measures an immobile, complete line, whereas time is mobile and incomplete.

title: Duration (philosophy)
text: For the individual, time may speed up or slow down, whereas, for science, it would remain the same.

title: Duration (philosophy)
text: Hence Bergson decided to explore the inner life of man, which is a kind of duration, neither a unity nor a quantitative multiplicity.

title: Duration (philosophy)
text: Duration is ineffable and can only be shown indirectly through images that can never reveal a complete picture.

title: Duration (philosophy)
text: It can only be grasped through a simple intuition of the imagination.

title: Samuel Eliot Morison
text: Samuel Eliot Morison, (July 9, 1887 – May 15, 1976) was an American historian noted for his works of maritime history and American history that were both authoritative and popular.

title: Samuel Eliot Morison
text: He received his Ph.D. from Harvard University in 1912, and taught history at the university for 40 years.

title: Samuel Eliot Morison
text: He won Pulitzer Prizes for "Admiral of the Ocean Sea" (1942), a biography of Christopher Columbus, and "John Paul Jones: A Sailor's Biography" (1959).

title: Samuel Eliot Morison
text: In 1942, he was commissioned to write a history of United States naval operations in World War II, which was published in 15 volumes between 1947 and 1962.

title: Samuel Eliot Morison
text: Morison wrote the popular "Oxford History of the American People" (1965), and co-authored the classic textbook "The Growth of the American Republic" (1930) with Henry Steele Commager.

title: Samuel Eliot Morison
text: Over the course of his distinguished career, Morison received eleven honorary doctoral degrees, and garnered numerous literary prizes, military honors, and national awards from both foreign countries and the United States, including two Pulitzer Prizes, two Bancroft Prizes, the Balzan Prize, the Legion of Merit, and the Presidential Medal of Freedom.

title: Matter and Memory
text: Matter and Memory (French: "Matière et mémoire", 1896) is a book by the French philosopher Henri Bergson.

title: Matter and Memory
text: Its subtitle is "Essay on the relation of body and spirit" ("Essai sur la relation du corps à l’esprit"), and the work presents an analysis of the classical philosophical problems concerning this relation.

title: Matter and Memory
text: Within that frame the analysis of memory serves the purpose of clarifying the problem.

title: Matter and Memory
text: "Matter and Memory" was written in reaction to the book "The Maladies of Memory" by Théodule Ribot, which appeared in 1881.

title: Matter and Memory
text: Ribot claimed that the findings of brain science proved that memory is lodged within a particular part of the nervous system; localized within the brain and thus being of a material nature.

title: Matter and Memory
text: Bergson was opposed to this reduction of spirit to matter.

title: Matter and Memory
text: Defending a clear anti-reductionist position, he considered memory to be of a deeply spiritual nature, the brain serving the need of orienting present action by inserting relevant memories.

title: Matter and Memory
text: The brain thus being of a practical nature, certain lesions tend to perturb this practical function, but without erasing memory as such.

title: Matter and Memory
text: The memories are, instead, simply not 'incarnated', and cannot serve their purpose.

title: Élan vital
text: Élan vital (] ) is a term coined by French philosopher Henri Bergson in his 1907 book "Creative Evolution", in which he addresses the question of self-organisation and spontaneous morphogenesis of things in an increasingly complex manner.

title: Élan vital
text: "Elan vital" was translated in the English edition as "vital impetus", but is usually translated by his detractors as "vital force".

title: Élan vital
text: It is a hypothetical explanation for evolution and development of organisms, which Bergson linked closely with consciousness – with the intuitive perception of experience and the flow of inner time.

title: Kill Kill (song)
text: "Kill Kill" is a song written by American singer-songwriter Elizabeth Grant released originally under the stage name "Lizzy Grant" in 2008 and "Lana Del Ray in 2010.

title: Kill Kill (song)
text: Grant is widely known now as Lana Del Rey.

title: Kill Kill (song)
text: Kill Kill was first released on October 21, 2008, on Grant's three-track extended play of the same name.

title: Kill Kill (song)
text: It was then later included on her first album under the name Lana Del Ray, ""Lana Del Ray A.K.A. Lizzy Grant"" also alternatively titled simply ""Lana Del Rey"".

title: Lana Del Ray (album)
text: Lana Del Ray (alternatively written as Lana Del Ray a.k.a. Lizzy Grant) is the debut studio album by American singer and songwriter Lana Del Rey.

title: Lana Del Ray (album)
text: The album was released digitally via the iTunes Store by 5 Points Records on January 4, 2010 when she was known as Lana Del "Ray".

title: Lana Del Ray (album)
text: However, the record was eventually pulled from retailers soon afterwards because, according to Del Rey, the label was unable to fund it.

title: Lana Del Ray (album)
text: Del Rey ultimately bought back the rights to the album, whose title uses an alternate spelling of the singer's stage name, "Del Rey" being spelled "Del Ray" instead.

title: Lana Del Ray (album)
text: After releasing "Born to Die" (2012) under her stage name Lana Del Rey, she expressed her wish to re-release the album.

title: Yayo (Lana Del Rey song)
text: "Yayo" is a song by American singer and songwriter Lana Del Rey.

title: Yayo (Lana Del Rey song)
text: It appears on her first extended play, "Kill Kill", her debut album, "Lana Del Ray", and her third EP, "Paradise".

title: Yayo (Lana Del Rey song)
text: After the release of her third EP, the song charted in France.

title: Yayo (Lana Del Rey song)
text: Before signing to a major record label, Del Rey released a self-produced music video for "Yayo".

title: Yayo (Lana Del Rey song)
text: Ubiquitously, the song garnered acclaim, many reviewers saying the song was one of the best songs Del Rey has ever written and praising Del Rey's voice.

title: Yayo (Lana Del Rey song)
text: Appearing on three of Del Rey's albums to date, the song is one of few that was authored solely by her.

title: Yayo (Lana Del Rey song)
text: The original version of the song was released through 5 Point Records and produced by David Kahne, later being remastered by Emile Haynie and Dan Heath.

title: Yoann Lemoine
text: Yoann Lemoine (born 16 March 1983) is a French music video director, graphic designer and singer-songwriter.

title: Yoann Lemoine
text: His most notable works include his music video direction for Katy Perry's "Teenage Dream", Taylor Swift's single "Back to December", Lana Del Rey's "Born to Die" and Mystery Jets' "Dreaming of Another World".

title: High by the Beach
text: "High by the Beach" is a song recorded by American singer Lana Del Rey and the first single from her fourth studio album, "Honeymoon" (2015).

title: High by the Beach
text: Written by Lana Del Rey, Rick Nowels and Kieron Menzies.

title: High by the Beach
text: A synth-led trap-pop ballad, it is more uptempo and pop-indebted than Del Rey's previous releases, but prominently recalls the hip hop and trip hop influences of her 2012 album, "Born to Die".

title: High by the Beach
text: The song is based around electronic production, a trap beat and an orchestral organ arrangement.

title: Lana Del Rey discography
text: American singer and songwriter Lana Del Rey has released five studio albums, four extended plays, 20 singles, and 16 music videos. Lana Del Rey signed a record deal with 5 Points Records in 2007 and the following year, she released her debut EP, "Kill Kill", under the stage name Lizzy Grant.

title: Lana Del Rey discography
text: Her debut studio album, "Lana Del Ray", was shelved initially and was released in January 2010 under the name Lana Del Ray.

title: Lana Del Rey discography
text: However, the record was pulled three months later.

title: Lana Del Rey videography
text: American singer and occasional actress Lana Del Rey has appeared in three films as an actress, eighteen television shows, and three commercials, along with offering her talents to five films as singer.

title: Lana Del Rey videography
text: Del Rey's first appearance was in the independent film "Poolside" (2010), which features Del Rey playing Lisa, a rich girl who spends her days smoking cigarettes by the pool.

title: Lana Del Rey videography
text: She received top billing for the project.

title: Lana Del Rey videography
text: Del Rey's next appearance was in a less-than-one-minute long short art film titled "Lana Del Rey" which was produced by Interview magazine and features noir-ish style and cinematic themes.

title: Lana Del Rey videography
text: Del Rey's breakout appearance was in an Anthony Mandler directed film, which Del Rey wrote, titled "Tropico" (2013).

title: Lana Del Rey videography
text: The film features Del Rey as a fictionalized version of Eve while also playing the Virgin Mary.

title: Lana Del Rey videography
text: "Tropico" received positive reviews and was Del Rey's second film that gave her top billing.

title: Lana Del Rey videography
text: Along with appearing in a handful of short films, Del Rey has appeared in 18 television shows and specials as herself along with appearing in campaign commercials for companies including Keds and H&M.

title: Video Games (song)
text: "Video Games" is a song recorded by American singer and songwriter Lana Del Rey for her second studio album and major label debut, "Born to Die" (2012).

title: Video Games (song)
text: It was first released to the Internet on June 29, 2011, was later released on her extended play, "Lana Del Rey", and re-released as the lead single from her second studio album, "Born to Die" on October 10, 2011, through Interscope Records.

title: Video Games (song)
text: The song was produced by Robopop while the lyrics were written by Del Rey and Justin Parker.

title: Video Games (song)
text: "Video Games" is a baroque pop ballad that speaks of the protagonist who, despite being ignored by her significant other, resolves to love him regardless.

title: Lana Del Rey (EP)
text: Lana Del Rey is the second EP by American singer and songwriter Lana Del Rey.

title: Lana Del Rey (EP)
text: It was released on January 10, 2012 in the United States and Canada through Interscope Records.

title: Lana Del Rey (EP)
text: After publishing two unsuccessful works, an EP, "Kill Kill" (2008) and a studio album, "Lana Del Ray" (2010), the four-track EP was released in anticipation of Del Rey's major label debut "Born to Die" (2012).

title: Lana Del Rey (EP)
text: The tracks are influenced by several genres, including indie pop, hip hop, and alternative music.

title: Lana Del Rey (EP)
text: The lyrics and melody were written primarily by Del Rey, Patrik Berger, and Justin Parker.

title: Lana Del Rey (EP)
text: Production of the album was led by Emile Haynie, who also co-wrote "Blue Jeans".

title: Blue Jeans (Lana Del Rey song)
text: "Blue Jeans" is a song by American singer-songwriter Lana Del Rey for her second studio album "Born to Die" (2012).
